5qzoc3RIS8Pkyx-Xs4DJdQ.text: The food here is so good it's a must do... The cashier is beautiful and the guy dre  that comes and check on you was the best he was on top of everything and made sure everything was good the spot is a go to thanks Yelp.......

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rkoBwAzn3HolA3UP_b42Hg.text: Simply amazing! My husband and I were in chicken and waffle heaven! It was the perfect hangover meal. I would eat this all day if I could.

d_rqNviedc28cFjFlj0u_A.text: There are no words to sum up the experience. The food was amazing and the employees are very friendly. Best waffles I've eaten

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ra13yPMX-oPJDW54-TdeXA.text: I'm not really a fan of anything with waffles for dinner, but this was entirely different than I expected! I ordered the Carolina BBQ Pulled Pork waffle sandwich and it was delicious! The waffle itself was soft and "bready", and the BBQ sauce mixed with cheese and their cider slaw was so flavorful. I also ordered the fried chicken poutine fries which used waffle fries. I have to say, the fried chicken itself, is great. Juicy, with the breading not overpowering the actual chicken at all. I can't wait to come back and try the other options on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken Poutine Fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture doesn&#39;t do it justice lol. Carolina BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich is delicious.

0IOmmL-LSYQAJUpVF5whig.text: This is a must do in Vegas! We went for brunch on a weekday. It wasn't too crowded, and the wait was fairly short.   We Ordered: I ordered the Bacon, Egg & Cheddar Sandwich with Fresh Fruit & Strawberry Lemonade. The bf ordered the Original Fried Chicken & Waffle, Waffle Fries & Strawberry Lemonade  Food: Everything is made from scratch here, and it's obvious from first bite. My breakfast sandwich was perfect in every way-- the waffle was fluffy yet crispy, the bacon flavorful and the egg cooked perfectly. I added maple syrup about half way through and was glad I did-- it accented the flavors perfectly.   I had a bite of the bf's chicken & waffle and it was very tasty! Slightly spicy, with the perfect crunch. The chicken was tender and the waffle was delicious .   The fruit was fresh (strawberries, bananas and pineapple) and the waffle fries were perfect.   Drinks: We both ordered the strawberry lemonade, and it was the perfect balance of sweet and sour. It was clearly fresh & made from real ingredients. They had ice water available for free.   Value: Moderately priced, great value.   Thanks Bruxie, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle with Waffle Fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheddar Breakfast Sandwich with fresh fruit and strawberry lemonade.

tfWHEwzG6NNKafmEdUsPLQ.text: The waffle and chicken are perfectly crunch just the way I like it. It's great that they don't over do it on the waffle syrup. The price is a bit high, $11 for one, sandwich. Didn't try the desserts waffle but the kids seem to like them.

j4FqxG9_axJQHUSDm8pB_g.text: Absolutely amazing. The fried chicken with its honey sauce was perfectly cooked and so crisp. The fried pickles were mouthwatering. Honestly the best chicken I've ever had, and their in house made soda was tasty as well

zQHar2ZzKSJQirf35xXHlw.text: Walked about 20 min to get to this place and was worth it every bit! Ordered the original waffle chicken sandwich and it was delicious!  I am pretty hard to please when it comes to finding decent American food, but this place definitely did it for me.

wnqibvhyA8V1zZ3GCGtqkw.text: Holy Chicken! Now that's a tasty sandwich. Waffle fries were awesome too. If they had one of these near me, I'd be dead in a year from a heart attack.

r4YzoH_o0T2R_-rn7d4e5w.text: Delicious food as advertised.  I had the Chicken and waffle skillet. The waffle has bacon chunks cooked into but remains sweet. It also comes with 3 chicken tenders and a whole chicken breast. All of the meat is seasoned  cooked well.  A nice trip after walking the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle Skillet @ Bruxie

v1KKG86fUFA0fbEkoPN9OQ.text: Fried chicken and waffles, best in Las Vegas if you are into this.  No further review needed.

eMZjGWQB6kXWVvnM8sE0Gg.text: I had their original waffle chicken sandwich. It was a good portion. The chicken was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Not sure exactly what the sauce was but it reminded me of a honey chipotle, sweet and spicy. I liked it and thought it goes well with the waffle buns. I would love to come back and try their dessert waffles.

rIvOwUTZXny1yOxeIDBk0Q.text: Yelp brought me here. Good location right off the strip in The Park. Doesn't open until 9 am which is weird to me on a city that never sleeps. Moderately priced for $3.95 you can add fries and a drink to your waffle sandwich. The sodas are their own house brands of cola, diet cola, orange, and lemon lime. For $13 I got full and it was tasty so I definitely recommend .

cSN-rrOpG7fhKS8e60kvCg.text: Opening day here at Bruxie. Menu looks the same as Orange, CA location. Food is about the same too. Being opening day, food was cold and salty for the burger, but guessing they are getting the bugs out. Green, eggs and ham were a hit. Breakfast is available all day. Cane sodas on the menu from their soda fountain.  Seating inside and ample outdoor seating in the "Park" area. Will come back once they are fully up and running.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NJKq6Kf1HEhTBJLNf9QvFA.text: Nice place to chill and get your second wind while out and about on the Las Vegas Strip. It's the perfect little snack shop tucked away in The Park, right next to the Shake Shack. I ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken 'n Waffle and it was truly a welcome and flavorful nosh after a long day taking in The Strip. Just the right amount of heat, perfectly crispy chicken in-between a light and airy waffle. So good! I also enjoyed a side of waffle fries.

4yZk4Kjaw-efvjIEIO9bhQ.text: Came here on a Thursday afternoon, not too crowded so it was a good time to go. Ordered the original sandwich. It was ok I guess. Nothing special, not much flavor other than the chili honey. Pretty one note, even when I took it apart and ate is separately it still all tasted the same. The waffle fries and soda is what made this a 3 star review rather than 2. I do not see myself coming back here.

I4rZE5n917YkNMZD8WVbuw.text: I am a huge fan of the Chick Fil-A chicken sandwich and I got the Kickin' Chicken here and it was the best chicken sandwich I've ever had! Highly recommend it!!

rNkKv0VseJV77VDDO9ekCA.text: Love this place! Wish we had them back home.  Great choices! Gets 5 stars as a "fast food"! Top choice !

RJW-gL5DRyFGQrPG0tHueA.text: The thick waffles and 2 pieces of chicken are GREAT! Wednesday 5 dollar specials view on Instagram so worth the hassle of parking the food is great been there 3 or 4 times with kiddos. Even the spicy chicken has so much flavor you forget its hot.

jE21qW6sxYCaSDTQygckfg.text: Nice take on chicken and waffles--a really delicious sandwich. Pour on the syrup and you're ready to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view eating outside the restaurant --

zGV4uA65MHmOfIRefI6UUQ.text: Came here for lunch for the first time and it wasn't bad! A bit hyped up and slow service but the food was decent. I ended up getting the Nashville Hot while my boyfriend got the Barbecue Bleu and a side of fries!   Not a fan of the waffle texture - seems a bit undercooked and flimsy. The fries didn't come out hot so wasn't impressed. However, the meat was soft and the perfect crunch on the outside.  Drizzle some syrup on top and it's yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville and BBQ

-O3q8h0_1FTs0QMxEGyLAg.text: Terrible!  Was so excited to come and get what we usually know as fantastic food.  The locations in Southern California are dynamite.  We went in for a to go lunch.  I specifically asked what was on the sandwich (I ordered the BBQ bun).  I was told slaw, fried onion, pickles, Bruxie sauce.  Asked for sauce on the side, no pickles.  I got an over cooked hockey puck that was fried in burnt grease, no slaw, all kinds of spicy bbq sauce all over the sandwich.  Took one bite and spit it out as I am extremely sensitive to spicy foods.  I still cannot feel my tongue.  Due to the fact that I am as sensitive as I am to foods, I always always ask what is on and in my order.  I am specific.  Never once was bbq mentioned.  Total flop and a huge disappointment.    ** consider having you employees who are running the register fully trained and ready to give accurate information.  I now get to skip lunch and pay for it.  So we went back after I called (months later) and it was ok.  The waffle fries we got were cold and it just isn't like the one in California.  Sorry guys I was hoping for a better experience.  I will improve the star rating but it wasn't over the top.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QPQXb3Q5-OhY1ElcVJFBKg.text: This was the second time going to Bruxie with my boyfriend & we literally won't go to any other chicken and waffles place besides here. The chicken is fresh along with the waffles. I'm not usually a waffle person either but my taste buds tells me to go for it each time I'm craving. The sandwiches are HUGE which is also a great impression. Totally think it's worth any wait, the munchies, the drive since it is on the strip. I might also add the B.A.M.F sandwich is not updated on Yelp it was the first sandwich I tried at Bruxie; if you want to try another unique yummy sandwich try the B.A.M.F! It has mac n cheese in it

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xacek-RXeOfw_VzJHVRCXQ.text: The gang was hungry and went walking around NYNY....some did SmashBurger and then we glanced next door to BRUXIE - a chicken and waffles place.   Yum, great texture on both the waffle and the fried chicken.   Perfect savory and sweet and salty.... Next stop -   SmashBurger. Next time will try the Pastrami waffle sandwich - looked hearty!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles.

0UGp7MffQ-WGbGmdj8Rs_Q.text: This place is absolutely amazing. We usually have to force the kids to eat but voluntarily asked For seconds. Very friendly staff

czBN5u2cGbGWYgx1jCmpAw.text: Went today for brunch amazing food ! I had the waffles and chicken with a side over easy egg ! The food did not disappoint I am not one for waffles anywhere but I would eat a waffle here any day ! Sooo delicious must try if you are near the strip !

vquWzuwowOLB-grJMhQk8g.text: Came here to Bruxie's for a quick bite.   We have been to the original location in orange ca and wanted to check this out since it's next to our hotel (Monte Carlo).  Soon as we came in we were ignored by the lady at the cash register because she was too busy counting the tip jar money.   After about a minute, she finally acknowledged us.    I got the original fried chicken waffle sandwich.   After about 10 minutes our sandwiches came out.   The waffle was fluffy but a little soggy from the sauces.   The chicken was crispy and really juicy.   I would definitely come back.   The only thing I would change is the front workers to greet everyone that comes in, instead of ignoring them.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken sandwich

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemonade

gbv_ASDpjl7Frmz5WQCOjA.text: I can only describe it as heart attack in the best way! Crispy waffle and juicy fried chicken! The waffle cut fries is amazing. But the real bomb is the Irish nacho. The dressing, bacon bits and fries is so good I poured my normal fries into the pan to mix it up. Seriously loved everything they served. Do get an unsweetened tea from them, coz it can balance out the flavor. May not be too hungover friendly, but who cares. I'll definitely revisit next time when I'm in Vegas.

NcJ8AQVWymY9O2YDWLYp3A.text: I think this was the best thing I ate during my latest Vegas trip.    We got the original waffle sandwich and the chicken and waffles (with bacon and cheese cooked in!  You could actually taste it also).  Taste reminded me of amped up Chik-fil-a (aka delicious).    It was a little pricey for chicken and waffles though.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 4/14/17

C_jQKDTT9bC9n4ltx-iVWQ.text: The food here is amazing! The Holy Chicken breakfast sandwich was the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The variety of flavors make for one incredible experience! It's a messy one, but man is it good!  The bacon egg and cheese was good too! Ask for the vanilla late iced--it's life changing on a hot day!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a9otQOvCMZIxiLpdzWtP_Q.text: This is such a unique place! The food was fantastic and staff were awesome! I opted for a waffle sandwich since that's what they're known for. Everything was so good from the chicken to the waffle itself. The only downside is that sauce comes on a lot of them which can make the waffle soggy and messy. I think I'll ask for the sauce on the side next time as the sauce was very good as well! Parking: if you love free parking (which is few and far between at LV hotels these days), I recommend parking at the Tropicana, taking the walking bridges over to NYNY, following the signs to "the park", and Bruxie is literally right out that door. It really wasn't too bad of a walk.  Then you can just walk right across the street to Tix4Tonight and get discount tix for shows!  Will definitely be coming here again to try more things off their menu.  Side note: you can get fried chicken and waffle fries with a waffle on the side too if waffle sandwiches aren't your thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tito&#39;s strawberry lemonade
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken waffle sandwich

YQZ5_CgAm0OKpqpvgkslaQ.text: This place is so good! The waffles are amazing! I got the original and was skeptical about the chicken but it was amazing! Highly recommend this place for breakfast! There may be a line when you get there but it's well worth the wait.

YrqTYUdNYF7hB4-z1TeyWw.text: 2.11.17: Say what??? I had an upset stomach, didn't really eat all day and of course we just had to try this place. Why not? I wasn't sure if I should eat it but then what the hey? I only live once, my stomach will survive I think...  Odd hour already after dinner time so there were hardly anyone there. So lucky us we got to take our time to decide what we wanted although the menu wasn't huge or anything but as a newbie we were enticed to get everything or want everything. The food coming from the side looks so good. So the concept is you order at the cashier and they bring the food to you.   Tried the following  Nashville Style Hot Chicken & Waffle Sandwich: This was the hubbies favorite because of spice. I liked it too.  Original Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich: It was good, just original. I really like the extra flavors instead, but dang they cooked the chicken just right.  For both the Chicken was nice and crispy and tender at the same time. The Waffles were not what I expect it to be. I thought it was going to be like Roscoe's but it's not. These are different. Bread-like but crispy and thin. It taste light and not to carby.   It was the perfect bites I have had in awhile. Not oily at all. How do they do it? Perfect just perfect.   I want to come back and try the breakfast sandwiches and the desserts one day. Will need to come back and see if it's consistent to give it a 5 stars. YUMMY!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kbqk768x_lR5zX7mB8VYNg.text: Chicken and waffle sandwich was good but soggy.  I ordered the spicy option which wasn't too spicy (I like it hot).  Kids had waffles with whipped cream and strawberries and chocolate milk, price was reasonable.     Definitely go at an off time, they tend to be very busy.  Not sure I'm a huge waffle and chicken fan after this but I didn't hate it either.  Very soggy, I was anticipating having a sandwich, not a fork and knife meal.  Overall a good experience but I'd eat elsewhere the next time in Vegas, this wasn't overly memorable.

T_EToE42xIK2X-3yOPxefw.text: Bruxie is a great place to grab some chicken and waffles on the strip. The service is fast. I found their coffee to be strong. I order a bacon egg and cheddar waffle for breakfast.  Give this place a try. It's located on the side of the NY Hotel at The Park.  It was my first time here so I can't honestly say too much about the rest of the menu. But I like the idea they serve breakfast all day.

ZGpGjetNCnQiwhoETBZE7w.text: My buddy and I walked over here our first morning in Vegas. We were staying in a hotel on Tropicana and had a pleasant 17-minute walk. The line was out the door, groups of teenagers satisfying their morning waffle cravings but the line moved pretty quickly. We were also able to find a table immediately and noticed that while the place was packed, people were still moving in and out and there was plenty of room for the incoming teenagers.   Food came fast, delivered right to our table, and when I asked where I can get some syrup, the waitress brought it over for us. We both ordered Holy Chickens and man what a combo! I've had chicken and waffles but never with an egg and bacon. My buddy described it as "breathtaking". This might be a new favorite. We are walking the same direction this morning as well, maybe we will pop in and grab another meal. If not today, I know we will be back soon!

jRr04RDPQ3mgMebsvq080w.text: I came here off a recommendation of a friend and was not disappointed at all! There was a line out the door when I first pulled up. By the way if your confused about parking your best bet might be at the New York New York parking lot cut that's the closest parking lot, and you do have to pay for anything more than an hour. But back to the food, the line went by really fast, there was two cashiers. I ordered the Holy chicken. It was a waffle sandwich with a chicken in the middle with bacon an over easy egg and siracha sauce. Since it was my first time there I signed up for their loyalty program and got a free strawberry lemonade with my first purchase. The food didn't take long at all maybe 15-20 minutes. I grabbed syrup on the side and poured it on top. It was amazingggggg! I literally finished it in 5 minutes and the flavors went amazing together. Salty and sweet exactly how I like it. Their strawberry lemonade was A+ as well. My friend ordered their Irish nachos which was waffle fries with cheese and bacon bites and sour cream I think? And they were really good as well! I will definitely be back! And I loved the waffle irons on the wall in the dining area it was super interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WkRgzO84nwvpIfzpgYS96Q.text: This place is great.  We ate here 4 times during the week we were in Las Vegas.  The portions are large, taste is great, in-house soda is awesome, and staff fast and friendly.  We will be back for more next time we visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

20ngBzi8gRQmGtJD7Qvi4g.text: One of the best food places we got to try in Vegas! It is located near New York New York!  Ordering was quick and easy. Just go up to the counter and they'll bring your food by the numbers you were given. I ended up getting the holy chicken. It was delicious ... the chicken was huge lol. Pretty crispy, & juicy ...and it had an egg on it! I love eggs :). My bf had the original chicken. Haha he thought his was alright but he still enjoyed it. I'll def try the kickin chicken next time! I mean what else can go wrong when you have chicken and wafflesss! Oh and their fries are a small portion... so everyone should order their own fries :)   Make sure you visit this place if you're in the area! I totally told all my friends about it since they're visiting Vegas soon!

3GjUnezegl9MEUkDcqulVg.text: The thing that sets this place apart from your typical "chicken and waffles" joint is the sandwich aspect. The waffles are thinner than normal (there isn't extra batter beside the crispy outside), allowing you to actually eat it with your hands like a sandwich--no utensils required. They use chicken breasts, but they're nice and moist.  The Original had the perfect balance of sweet and savory. You can add seasoned fries and a drink for $3.95. The strawberry lemonade was refreshing, and they have a bunch of other house-made sodas. I'll be back the next time I'm in town!

fppAksWxrK66oyxt_CRT3A.text: Best hangover food in the area in Vegas. Cheap food for the Strip, fast service, and plenty of options for a large group. Food is pretty heavy, but totally worth it. If looking for a lighter option, someone in our group got the salad which actually looked great as well. I, however, got the waffle sandwich with BBQ chicken and crispy onions.... Un.Real.

99pmA0qwS7KOij7t6gPKSg.text: Delicious chicken waffles on Las Vegas strip!  It is located inside The Park, which is between New York New York and Monte Carlos. Parking situation sucks anywhere on the strip but if you are going to visit The Park,  I personally recommend parking at Monte Carlos parking garage.  There are ample seating inside. Limited outdoor seating available...but all of us Vegasians know the weather here. There's only about few weeks in a year that we get to comfortably be outdoor. Otherwise it's too cold or burning hot.   It's nice to have a casual eating spots like Bruxie on the strip, which serves fried chicken on a freshly made waffles. I got the original chicken and waffle which came out to be exactly $10 with tax. I personally think it's overpriced for such a small portion but just about everything is overpriced on the strip so what can I say.   I would say my chicken waffle was decent. Waffle was fresh and airy with little bit of sweetness. Chicken was crispy and went well with waffle. Had little bit of coleslaw which didn't do much in my opinion. Simple and good, but underwhelming in terms of portion. I would recommend ordering fries or other side dish if you are hungry.   Clean dining area, friendly staffs and good chicken waffles. I am a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Chicken Waffle ($10 with tax)

CWPIF0YkBe2YDhTq9iBSYQ.text: Walking down the strip near the new T-Mobile Arena the words "Chicken and Waffle Sandwich" caught my eye.  I decided to try the Nashville Hot Chicken and Waffle Sandwich, waffle fries and a "Palmer" (lemonade w/ iced tea).    The food arrived quick and looked impressive.  Not sure whose idea it was to make a waffle sandwich, but it's really hard to eat.  I'm not sure how you're supposed to eat this with your hands.  I ended up using a fork and knife cutting the pieces of chicken and waffle and dipping it in the maple syrup.  The waffle is light and crispy, similar to an Eggo.  The boneless chicken breast was crispy and juicy, though I was expecting it to be spicier and more heavily seasoned. The sandwich has pickles, lettuce and some kind of mayo, which I think is weird as I want to eat chicken and waffles with syrup.  Kind of wish there was an option to get just the chicken and waffle, not as a sandwich, though I'm sure you could request it.  The waffle fries were awesome and super crispy.  Even thought it was fast food style, the guy still came around to ask me how the food was and refilled my beverage.    The restaurant was spotless with tons of seating and TV's all around.  Came at dinner time and there was only one other family there.  Maybe people aren't hungry for hot chicken and waffles when it's 105 degrees out.  For the strip, I think Bruxie offers a pretty good value @ $14 for my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Irons
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville fried chicken waffle sandwich.

tk8mZZloKHJgjSI3fULotA.text: ROASTED MUSHROOM & GOAT CHEESE Waffles and chicken, you can never go wrong if you stop by Bruxie's for breakfast, lunch or dinner. This place has amazing waffle sandwiches for everyones taste.   I had the Roasted Mushroom and Goat cheese, it's Crimini Mushrooms, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Herb Goat Cheese, Arugula, Lemon Vinaigrette & Balsamic-Reduction.  It's very hard not to stop by when walking through The Park. So many amazing places to choose from Bruxie is by fast one of the best waffle breakfast places in Las Vegas.

YO9E4Oujv7vrvw3tyov-Yg.text: Are the chicken and waffles good, yes, service, NO.  Standing in line an employee knocked a counter sign off the counter and into my leg.  Bruised my leg.  No sorry.  Asked to speak to a manager, Sabrina looked at me, rolled her eyes and said not a word.  I asked her if she cared, she said, "do you want me to call security?".   Left a message on the corporate site, called and left a message for the manager, no response.  We make it a habit to visit, will NEVER go to Bruxie AGAIN!!!  Check out blue ribbon chicken las vegas!

2egw-qRvt_M7bIow7FJ1SQ.text: Super DELICIOUS food, My husband and I were very satisfied with our meal and it was super friendly service.  And it didn't take too long for the food to come out at all. Will be back here again!

rkFquFuJI41UFGAzWpp4LA.text: Naked waffle combo with a strawberry lemonade and side of fruit / chicken tenders and fries. All for $20.   Pros - food was sooooo good. Waffle is very light and tasty. Chicken was fast and seasoned perfectly. Drink was good (free refills too).   Cons - no close parking. We used the valet at New York New York.   So with the valet tip , the experience for 2 is $23 . Not bad for being right on the strip.

Kh5gpK9xWkb2FHzEqyYl9Q.text: This was my first visit to Bruxie....and it was not the last. I'm not going to lie, we ate there 2x in one day! The Fried Chicken and Waffle sandwich is what dreams are made of! It is SO tasty.  The Chili Honey on the Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich is the BEST!   Can't wait to get back to Vegas to eat there again!!!

KOyT6JaIFyRVgs85QL5-Rg.text: This place was pretty good. I wasn't blown away but the food and service were good.  I will say they did seem vegetarian friendly allowing subs of bacon for other veggie friendly ingredients.  i ordered chicken tenders and fries and my love ordered a sandwich with fries  The fries weren't that great... and the tenders were good, maybe a little dry leaning.  The pricing here isn't cheap so with their prices I'd expect something a bit better.  My husband ordered a sandwich with fries.  The sandwich was good, again nothing to write home about.  i didn't like that if I wanted a refill of tea, i had to go to the counter and wait.  I'd of preferred to refill myself as the place gets busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YvOgaBKDXodB8zPxFre3xQ.text: One of the best fried chicken joints! We went for brunch and had the Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar breakfast sandwiches. 10/10 highly recommend with siracha and maple syrup. I also ordered the golden mule, which was very good. Overall, great experience!

MToiPgfZS69m5Btd6fhMKA.text: I had really high hopes for this place - I mean who doesn't love chicken n waffles? I ordered the regular chicken and waffles and felt like it was a bit dry and the chicken was a bit cold...   The waffle fries and shake was excellent

rVYPoOV3ZJx2535vM3mQ3A.text: I'm a fan of waffles and you should be too!  Back in the day, The Strip lacked a lot of things, specifically good casual eating spots. Slowly, but surely the times are a changin' and Bruxie is the newest of the new when it comes to casual comfort food eating. I came to Bruxie and went hard, I ordered the Nashville Waffle Chicken Sandwich and the Bacon Mac n' Cheese bake.   The Nashville Waffle Sandwich, which by the way is a Vegas only option, mimics the Buffalo Bleu Sandwich, minus the gross Bleu cheese crumbles. I'm sorry if you like bleu cheese, but it's pretty much the devil in cheese form. The sandwich is a spicy fried chicken breast tossed in Buffalo Sauce, topped with a veggie slaw and two huge pickles on top. The hotness level was perfect, the sour dill mixed with the spice and light sweetness of the waffle really worked. Stoner Food. Level, Expert.   The Mac N' Cheese, was stellar; crunchy cheese on top with a gooey warm cheese center and big chunks of bacon. My only gripe about this is the portion size, for six dollars I felt like the dish it was served in could have been deeper. I mean this cost about as much as the sandwich itself.   Bruxie is a fun option while at the Park and just different enough to be worth your ever valuable dollar. The price point is set to Strip Prices, so be ready for sticker shock when you get the total, my meal alone was $25 with tip. Still, I would go back and try another, which my I'm leaving a four-star here.   Chicken + Waffles + Cheese + Bacon = I die.

I decided to get the original chicken and waffle sandwich. There was nothing spectacular about it. It literally just tastes how it sounds. I was hoping there was a little more taste to the waffle or something different atleast.   In the end I ended up taking the chicken out and just eating the waffle and that was only because I was still hungry and the chicken just tasted like absolutely nothing.  It's a nice quick eat if you're around the area and just walking around, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

VeDQUH3MsvMU2V3FzqdAiQ.text: I'm not a chicken and waffles fan, I've always wondered who was the first to come up with the concept. My friend and I discovered Bruxie after leaving the NY NY hotel: None of the restaurants around the casino area really stood out to us. While walking towards the strip, we decided to give it a shot. I scanned the menu and was happy to see there was a burger available for me to enjoy. I chose the Mac and cheese instead of fries.  We sat down by one of the huge open windows facing the busy strip. When the server brought out my burger, immediately I was confused because I didn't order a waffle. Suddenly it hit me that even the burger was served atop waffles. I gave it a bite, and was very happy we chose Bruxie to have our last Vegas meal. The Mac could have been cheesier, which is my preference, but I was relieved it wasn't bland. I've noticed that happens at restaurants so often.  The cheese to patty ratio was on point and the waffle was crisp on the outside yet airy. It was a good balance for the beef. Definitely a win!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NF-BxhfF5-Qs_rAcu_YABQ.text: In a city like Vegas where nobody is short on ideas these guys managed to innovate and come up with one of the best ideas ever. Serving chicken in a waffle seems scary at first because I always associated them with sweet 'toppings'. Decided to go with the Nashville Chicken. It was absolutely delicious. Fried to perfection featuring an extra crunchy exterior and a tender juicy interior. Another really nice detail are the waffle shaped fries. Make sure you check them out while in Vegas.  I've already been 3 times in 1 week and I can't get enough. The second time I went I ordered the classic chicken skillet. It was good, I can't complain but my absolute favorite is the Nashville chicken. 3rd time I had it as strips with the waffle cut fries - absolutely mouthwatering. Have a meal here, seriously, you won't regret it!  Please open a restaurant in SF - I'll be your #1 client - that's a promise!

jcYed5WL4vlx48cdy8Q-Jg.text: The next coolest thing to the newest entertainment attraction are the restaurants that open with the development. Take the Park for example. Inside the month-new Park at NY-NY, there is a hot new restaurant that opened up there called Bruxie. This past Saturday when my brother and I were hanging out in the Park, we decided on dining in Bruxie. My brother who dined in Bruxie once before recommended the chicken tenders. His convincing words to get me into Bruxie were,  "The chicken fingers are better than Raisin Cane's." That was enough convincing.       Despite how delicious their chicken fingers are, Bruxie built it's reputation on waffles. The two founders Dean Simon and Kelly Mullarney turned the Belgian waffle into a grand slam ingredient featured in place of bread on sandwiches, as breakfast, and numerous items. When it comes to chicken tenders, the waffle fries are a home run that takes the taste out of the park.      Bruxie is one of the few restaurants to be located under the Empire State Building. When I stand a few feet from the Strip at the entrance to the Park, I see the NY-NY Empire State Building rising above the storefront. With the Empire State Building as a landmark there is little difficulty finding the first Bruxie outside of California.       As soon as I entered the two room eatery, I ordered at the counter. I decided on the chicken fingers with waffle fries, and sugar cane cola. I'd exchange close to $13 with the enthusiastic cashier for a buzzer. I'd wait in the patio room for a few minutes until the buzzer activated. No need to leave a table overlooking the spacious room that reminded me of a park lounge because an employee delivered the food to the table. I did have to inform him that I ordered a sugar cane cola which he soon delivered to the spacious table. This leads to the tip that the staff fills the cup in lieu of a self service beverage fountain.       I put Bruxie distant from the price gouging category to the "You get your money worth on the Strip." The four chicken fingers were Big Foot size. These chicken fingers were giant and delicious just like Raisin Cane's. Sharing the tray with chicken fingers and waffle fries were Ranch and Carolina sauces. Missing was my favorite chicken side: cole slaw. The delicious cane sugar based cola complimented the food.      In conclusion, I enjoyed Bruxie. As far as comparing it to Raisin Cane's Chicken fingers they are tied. Bruxie left me with the lasting impression that they served me a tasty meal at an acceptable price for the Las Vegas Strip in the newest Las Vegas Strip attraction: The Park.

Went for the Berries and Creme with the waffle cut cheese fries. Both were excellent! The portion of the cheese fries were a little small for the price but we're tasty.   Process of ordering at the counter receive a pager and they will bring you the food when ready.  When busy I am sure you might have to go and pick up your order hence the pager.   Great beers on tap! I cannot wait to make a return visit and explore the menu more.

kUC7D1YaiIbRZf8CZyr9qg.text: Okay, anywhere that allows me to alcoholize my drink gets a good rating for me, but luckily Bruxie also has delicious food to match. Their fried chicken is a tad salty, but it's tender meat and the breading stays so crunchy, even in my dressed salad. My fiance ate his sandwich so quickly, I barely got a bite.  It was definitely one of the less expensive meals we had in Vegas and made a great lunch. I would love to go back and try those creme brulee waffles...

GwqqruALPNJ_kCcw6U-n2A.text: Not a fan.  Coming from Houston, I've had chicken and waffles many times and it is one of my favorite meals.  The idea of a chicken and waffle sandwich was intriguing.  Unfortunately, it was a big disappointment.  The chicken, although piping hot, was not that flavorful or juicy. I had the Original so maybe I should have had the BBQ which sounded good.  The Waffle "bread" was also pretty bland and was extremely crunchy, which I thought I would like but didn't work on the sandwich.    On the flip side, I ordered a chocolate shake and fries and they were both really good.

BUhkAtTbOj4g1IuW8gwSMA.text: Wow! The Holy Chicken was great. Waffles, Chicken, Bacon, and Egg. You place your order at the counter and the staff brings the meal to you vey quickly. Definitely worth the stop if you're hungry.

Jb-vuso9Fy-7N4KzcYzOCw.text: A breath of fresh air away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We enjoyed the light, fresh menu options at Bruxie's. The waffle paired with the fresh berries worked perfectly together.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lemon creame was the star of this dish.

7DTnwCp_JNZVzVPknkKp6Q.text: If you're not a waffle fan then stop reading!!! Just joking, but Bruxie is known for their chicken and waffles. Located on the Strip behind Shake Shack, this little shop offers their own spin on some classic American dishes. Of course, you can look up the menu yourself and see the specifics, but I'm here to give a review!   Be warned, this restaurant gets busy fast so be mindful of when you decide to visit. I came with a small group at around 7 p.m. and it was pretty busy. Then again, this is the Strip we're talking about so it's expected. This restaurant is self serve so the only service you receive is when you order and are given your food. My service wasn't good. The cashier that rang us up actually spent fifteen minutes talking to their friend who was ordering food in front of me. It was rude for not only me, but the customers behind us. The server that gave us our food also got our orders wrong. At least the restaurant has substantial seating space, so finding a seat shouldn't be hard especially if you're with a small group. My party and I used the tables with high chairs because it was next to a wall outlet. On a side note, thank God for restaurants that have wall outlets near the tables because when you're walking around all day on the strip, it really kills your battery.   Back to the review, the food took a while but it was a busy day so I don't hold them against that. When we did receive our food I was pretty excited. I ordered the Chicken Poutine which was their famous waffle fries topped with their home made chicken, cheese, white gravy and chives. If you haven't had poutine before, GO GET SOME RIGHT NOW! I'm a huge fan of poutine and their version was delicious. The cheese and gravy was ooey gooey good while their fries and chicken still maintained a small crunch to it. We also ordered the Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken & Waffles Sandwich,  the Original Fried Chicken & Waffles, and Chicken Tenders. They also offer syrup to go with the waffles and I recommend you try it. Their waffles are LEGIT. It's so soft and has a great flavor to it. The sweetness from the waffles and syrup really compliment the savory chicken. Their chicken isn't exceptional, but it still has good flavor. Really, their waffles are the star of this restaurant so you have to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tenders, Buffalo Blue Chicken &amp; Waffle, the Original and Chicken Poutine

TtmTKE5eK3C49CCcf6-CLQ.text: Omggggggggggg! I found this place while researching places to eat on the Strip before I flew to Vegas and I'm sure glad I did!  I got the chicken and waffle sandwich. Once I took my first bite, I thought I'd died and gone to chicken and waffle heaven. The chicken was moist and flavorful and the waffle was light and fluffy. It has slaw on it and I almost requested that it be left off because I'm usually not a fan. However, the slaw was tasty and doesn't take away from the deliciousness of the sandwich.   I ordered the vanilla cream soda to go with it and it was also delicious.  The bf thought it was too sweet but I thought it was perfect.   The only thing negative about Bruxie is that there's not one close to me! I could eat it every day!

We will come back for sure. Maybe tomorrow lol

8ecC4I17XHBAsDz9xNxMXQ.text: Never heard of Bruxie before. We were staying at New York New York in Vegas and decided to try it for brunch before heading back home. It was one of the best fried chicken I have had out. I had the chicken with chipotle honey sauce. It came with a bacon cheese waffle. The chicken was so crispy and moist. The waffle was to die for.  My boyfriend had the original chicken sandwich. The waffle for the sandwich was thinner than my waffle. He didn't really care for the slaw on it. I tasted it and thought it was good. Just a matter of taste I guess. There is no denying how good the actual chicken is though. We also had the mac and cheese. It was really good. Wish there was a Bruxie near our home. I've been craving that chicken since leaving Vegas.

096znKj7cXFjY-az_tP3cA.text: Great sandwiches. Tried the original and Nashville.  Definitely worth going if you are in the area looking for a filling and unique sandwich.

C2N4amE3bP_Hu9iQ5Lr2EQ.text: Did someone say chicken and waffles?   I was walking outside New York New York one night and I passed by this place. I didn't have time to stop there at that moment, but in the back of my mind I thought "I wan't to go there, but if I don't it wouldn't be the end of the world." Let me tell you that if I didn't go there, it would have been the end of the world... Dude! I ate at a lot of places in Vegas, but would you kill me if I said a chicken and waffles restaurant was at the top of my list of places I tried? This place was the s**t!!   I had the Nashville Style Hot Chicken sandwich and my taste buds literally went flying out of my mouth. The light and crispy waffle paired with the bangin' flavor of the crispy chicken were out of this world.   "It was that good?" Yes, it was that good. So good that I went a second time and had the Original!   Since leaving, I've been having dreams about this sandwich... I want to go back so bad, but unfortunately it will have to wait until next time. Vegas... I'll be back... for Bruxie.

vZG360T5PTP_CETjAwX89A.text: Great food at a cool venue. Bruxie is located at The Park, the promenade connecting the Strip next to New York New York Hotel Casino with the T-Mobile Arena, home of the NHL Las Vegas Golden Knights. the Park is spacious, comfortable, great vibe, local artists painting everywhere, interesting sculptures and piped music. Bruxie is a fun, modern place with a very friendly staff. Lots of indoor seating with limited outdoor seating. The line can be very intimidating but then you realize its not a line to be seated but an ordering line. It takes a while, but once you order, the food comes pretty quick. We had the Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich, waffle fries, slaw and a chocolate custard shake. Came to about $27. I never thought much of the whole chicken and waffle thing, having it only once before and not being impressed. This, however, blew.me.away. Crispy maple glazed chicken, smoked applewood bacon, cheddar cheese, sriracha sauce and a sunny side up egg, wedged between a soft and airy on the inside and crispy on the outside waffle. It was perfect. I was making noises with every bite, the noises you make when its so damn good. It's been six hours and I can't stop thinking about it. The waffle fries were crisp and lightly seasoned. The slaw was crisp and creamy. The shake was rich and thick. There was everything right and nothing wrong with this meal.

f6GadKPQ_uW4OBRIeCrfNw.text: Absolutely love this places. The chicken is perfectly seasoned, moist and flavorful. Great portions! Wish there was we one in Sacramento

KiH3jK9PdpRGWoGttZVUNQ.text: When we got to this restaurant we were excited to try it because the group we went with talked so highly. We got our food and they missed one person. We waited for a little since it was busy but then after people after us got their order, we mentioned we were missing an order. They made him stand in line again and reorder. We still waited after the order and he was left waiting again. He went up a second time and the worker looked like he didn't know what to do and looked back and grabbed his plate that was sitting to the side. His order was missing coleslaw but we didn't want to wait any longer. His plate was cold and soggy from sitting. We wanted to like this place but were disappointed with the overall experience.

UTLHNNmYFrca_4X1OmLkLA.text: welcome to Bruxie. This is a casual dining chicken and waffle joint just a short walk to T-mobile arena and just off the strip by NYNY and Monte Carlo. It is a good pre or after concert dinner spot that is fast and food is good. We stopped in on the way to a concert and wanted something fast and filling. We ordered the southern style tenders. There was a good portion and they were crisp and juicy. he sauce was good and added to the taste of the chicken. Only 3 stars due to how slow we got our food.   Thank you for dining at Bruxie. We may go again, Food was reasonable it's fast casual so no real service to speak of. Give it a try if you are in area or goin to a concert or need to have something after. It's quick and casual

Pjvp_Uga1c_Xa0mWAUjtEg.text: Very cool idea. Food is fresh and very good. Did not think I would like this at all. Friendly staff and great customer service.

kFfcb9c6AaKXnt2vmDDdFQ.text: Love Love Love Bruxie! I'm so glad I stumbled on this place, THANKS YELP! Located at the lobby level, outside "The Park" entrance part of the New York New York hotel and across the MGM, nestles this little place. I did not expect it to be take-out, but not take-out. So you walk-in and order it like a regular take-out place. You sit anywhere you'd like and your server will deliver your food to your table. So helpful and like regular dining service, they checks on us if we'd like more water (even tho self served) if we were okay (which we were) and to take our empty plates (which went full to empty real fast.)  Interior is pretty divey and hip with their brick walls and gorgeous view of the strip/terrace area. You can choose either high tops, benches, or lower shared tables.   We were served our food so beautifully crafted and definitely worthy of pictures.   -BUTTERMILK FRIED CHICKEN & WAFFLES: WOW, an original-tender and crispy chicken in a waffle sandwich topped with some good honey chilli sauce and slaw. I wanted to eat the whole thing, but needed to save room for the...  -CHEESE WAFFLE FRIES: What you would expecet, waffles fries with cheese on top served in a mini skillet. So cute! And yes, it was great!  -BUTTERMILK FRIED CHICKEN COB: THIS. The next time I would go back to Vegas, I would definitely come back for this. It's regular cobb salad with avocado, egg, greens, and tomato BUT topped with their fried chicken specialty. Kind of healthy, but certainly flavorful! My anti-salad boyfriend even enjoyed it.  and for dessert....  -LEMON CREAM & BERRIES: The waffle was so good and so was the cream! Maybe to tarte and sweet for me.  -STRAWBERRY PALMER: Flavor is more lemonade and less tea.  I would love to come back and try their other fried chicken entrees!

OmDE0NtiJB2jfksovUKutg.text: Food was amazing! We had the "Holy Chicken"&     " Country Sausage Breakfast Sandwich". Neither of them disappointed.  They were delicious & affordable! Staff was friendly & courteous.  Food did not take long to arrive. They definitely have 2 new fans!! You gotta try this place!

FrbVvNVf_NatT34QkpNgaw.text: The waffles are so light and fluffy and crispy. It is amazing. Great place for lunch. Loved the Nashville chicken.   The chicken was fried well and very crispy and moist.   Definitely recommend.

C3p2__d5WPF_vmy8gEzDVw.text: I didn't even want to try this place... my brother in law insisted we give it a try, so I got the chicken tenders and waffle fries. our whole plate was 16.xx and the serving size was perfect for me and my husband to share. My brother in law got the original and my other brother in law got the holy chicken. I took one bite of his sandwich and holy chicken was it delicious! the waffle was nice and crispy, the egg was runny and creamy, the chicken had a crispy crunch... I wish I had gotten that sandwich, but I was still happy with my chicken tenders. sauce was a little runny, but still tasted great... definitely give this place a go!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oRkxqDyFE0WZkLRFnhPZfw.text: Talk about spot that been meaning to get in for years. The biggest thing keep me away is not fan of hitting the strip between parking and more so enjoy little places off the strip more. Bruxie the concept of waffles with everything and anything imagine on top or between. Hell yay! Waffles by far one of my favorite breakfast foods. There was lot of hype about this place back when it open sometime ago. I excited to get my Bruxie on.......  Since I was going to check out the Armory nearby get some birthday gifts figure perfect time try Bruxie. First time wanted to try few things but only so much food one person can throw down. Lol! I ended up ordering the Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar Sandwich. Also the Nutella & Banana Waffle. The Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar was perfect the breakfast sandwich to kick start the day. The egg was cooked perfect, bacon was nice crispy nice cut not super thin (worst if it to thin curls up and bacon should be nice strip of bacon), and the cheddar perfect compliment brings it all together. The Waffle.....The Waffle not only is the reason Bruxie made name for itself. Waffles are by far the best ever had in my lifetime. Not only appearance spot SPOT on. It beautiful golden color, looks nice light not heavy dense waffle, and first bite crispy outside then hot moist fluffy inside. I literally could eat just waffles by itself all day. I think there that good! The Nutella & Banana make sure have enough room for one more waffle. The combination in dessert waffle nirvana. Start not many places think of great dessert waffle. Nutella and Banana winnah. The waffle being hot out of the press melts the Nutella then throw in the cream spread and fresh slice banana. The powder sugar on the outside of the waffle. The first bite made complete mess out of my mouth. The powder sugar went all over my shirt. It worth it!!!! They have one more dessert waffle on the menu and no doubt going go back to try plus the stable chicken and waffles.  It like the fact that can sit outside or inside being that in park place. It great spot chill people watch. I mention earlier if fan of waffles Bruxie is must stop while in Vegas. The only thing that was bummed about that the sodas are only sugar cane based ones. Not fan of. They do sell other drinks out of bottles can get.   The service was five stars. Everyone from the person took my order to the person drops off your food. All smiles, friendly, and made my first time great time.

yJRJ42gI0OdjH03E81oH0w.text: This place officially became my family's must-go while in Vegas. Everything is perfectly crispy on the outside and tender inside, and a perfect balance of varying flavors.  This year we ordered a variety: 4-piece chicken tender (OG seasoned w/ all three sauces; fries included), 2-piece fried chicken (1 original, 1 kickin'; bacon-cheddar waffle), and creme brulee dessert waffle. They were a perfect combo to try a little bit of everything and definitely worth the money.  Personal insight: To me, I favored the bacon-cheddar waffle over creme brulee since it tasted both savory and sweet (my sis on the other hand preferred creme brulee bc she wanted all sweet). Also prefer kickin' seasoning - love the spice and caramelized sauce.  TIP: Sign up for their rewards program to get free drink during first visit!

DMso3biOMuIsDGlOKoZxgg.text: Ordered Holy Chicken and Buttermilk Fried Chicken salad. Since my husband doesnt like ranch dressing, we asked for the dressing on the side. It didnt come out as requested. The line is super long and every staff busy, so we didnt even bother to get it changed. Holy Chicken was really good and the sauce has a little spice to it, which I really liked.   We went at around 11am and the line was at the door. By the time we finished around 12, the line was out the door. Of course, finding a seat became more difficult for those who came later.

3MlB2tzbG-jQV-l7HMBlOw.text: Solid performance.  This was my first time in Vegas and unlike most people, gambling is not the first thing on my list. The good life demands food and so, when the plane came to a halt, food was on my mind lol!  I tried a number of very popular restaurants during my week in Vegas and I would have to say that this place is at the top of my list.   I will not go into explicit detail around my food selection but, I will say we tried a large number of items and had no disappointments what so ever..  OK, I lied, I will mention one item in particular. The chicken and waffles! I thought it was amazing.

s18Z6cPPpbbcwm7-0txD1A.text: FK JMT!!! Korean not supported! Crazy Crispy Tasty Waffle & Desert! Normally I don't leave review but this is must to go place for breakfast or lunch!

9EcrAGk9G-SPg7bJbZsDxA.text: Cheap, simple and yet so satisfying. I guess I'm a sucker but you put anything on a waffle and I'm automatically game. The combination of a slightly sweet waffle with a fluffy interior and s light crunch to the outside followed by an egg and a fatty piece if bacon is heaven to me. I have the waffle fries as well. The service was fast and I left satisfied. Stop in while in Sin City and I promise you won't be disappointed.

uqClyjlUe8LB6QAvnV-WeA.text: Holy moly these waffles are fantastic.  The hardest decision at Bruxie is whether to go sweet or savory. But you really can't go wrong with anything that you order.  I took the sweet route and ordered a waffle sandwich stuffed with nutella, sweet cream and bananas. I also asked to add strawberries on... so like relatively healthy? Here's to hoping. The waffle was perfectly crunchy and sweet and came topped with a generous sprinkling of powdered sugar. Although I'd love to try some of their other menu items it'd be tough not to order this on a future trip. To drink I went with house made strawberry lemonade. You can also add champagne to this if you are feeling crazy... did not do this, and regret not doing this.   My fiance absolutely loves chicken and waffles and he was a big fan of Bruxie's take on it. This is a cheddar jalepeno waffle served with either two or three plump and crispy chicken strips with sides of honey and butter for dipping. So decadent and so delicious.   If it's a nice day take your waffles to go and eat them at one of the many tables in T-Mobile park. There aren't that many 'fast casual' options on the strip that aren't complete garbage, and food in the casinos is of course way overpriced. Bruxie was a nice happy medium, and a great option for snagging a quality breakfast on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nobMdOIKkQXrDfXT5coiUg.text: Whatever you do get the chicken and waffles... The right amount of sweetness and savory.

ntqc3ksCflq3Vl1RASW1GA.text: Came here for brunch the last day I was in town...not really a big chicken guy but given so much southern fried chicken and waffles on the menu thought why not ? Would day this isn't a fancy type of brunch place, more a slow food kind of joint with family style seating...no real brunch type drinks but overall if you're in the mood for a quick and good breakfast it hits the spot...ordered the chicken and waffles with the sriracha sauce and maple syrup and found it to be solid. Waffles were crispy and maple syrup balanced well with the saltiness of the chicken...opted to also try the vegetarian option of the mushrooms and arugula which was decent and ordered a side of Mac n cheese with bacon which was good...most definitely would recommend this spot just wish they had more of a sit down brunch kinda menu ( bloody Mary's anyone???)...but hey, totally hit the spot and I'll happily come back next time I'm in Vegas!

The chicken waffle (I think it's the holy chicken) was super good. Chicken was moist and delicious! I will be going back every time I'm in Las Vegas!!

DfpVqzv9g2l2MFVx8APYjg.text: I bookmarked this place in California and was pleasantly surprised to find out they have a Bruxie in Vegas now! This one is located at The Park next to Shake Shack. It's super close to the T-Mobile Arena. I came on a Thursday evening with my sisters! We ordered different things. The chicken tenders, the original and the Bruxie burger! All the sandwiches comes on waffle bread! Tasty! We also had a large order of the angry Mac n cheese! The tenders were okay but the sandwiches were way better! Definitely get a sandwich! The Mac n cheese was different, the buffalo sauce stands out for sure! We ordered strawberry lemonades for drinks. They were kind of small! But they had a water cup station. I was actually shocked that this place wasn't a sit down restaurant but you actually order first at the counter! Definitely worth trying!

6n6cN0XIxppv2E0sMrg6Hw.text: Holy Chicken! - This is a fantastic waffle sandwich! The waffle and chicken were both quite crispy. The chicken was very tender and not the least bit dry. The egg and sriracha mayo added a welcomed creamy texture as well. There is a decent amount of sweetness to this dish though.

FukYurkuEUvsUFj3F2vt8Q.text: I can't even begin to describe how amazing this place is. You walk in and meet a wonderful woman at the counter who takes your order and gives you a tracker to put on your table. While you may be overwhelmed with the abundance of amazing options on the menu I have faith you will eventually choose one and regardless of what it is you won't be disappointed. I chose the green eggs and ham with a side of draft beer. In my opinion my choices couldn't have been better. The atmosphere is relaxed, happy, and inviting. I'm more upset Over the fact I didn't know this place existed until today after my many trips to Vegas. Eat brunch here. I promise you won't be disappointed.

_MiSXw1viPXNrfICJkTlRQ.text: Bruxie gets 2 stars for the following reasons: the location is pretty and conveniently located. Also, the staff here was SUPERRRR friendly. I stopped in for brunch on a Thursday.   For starters, $17 for a combo seemed like a bit much to me for this type of place. So it's expensive. Also, the food was regular and dare I even say not very yummy per se. Don't think the chicken was seasoned. The waffles seemed to be made from a strange batter (didn't taste like regular waffles.) My strawberry lemonade was an artificial sugar bomb. Fries were SUPER basic. The food alone gets 1 star, I was not impressed at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just weird. Egg was TOOOO runny (I know they&#39;re sunny side up but damn ...) fries weren&#39;t very good.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside/Front view

szb9Ygbr8D-PhX3UsKAdRg.text: The idea of chicken and waffles never really enticed me...until I had the opportunity to sample this combo at Parlay Gastropub (LI spot for those reading this who happen to live in Vegas). Just understand it became a concept I was open to...and then there was Bruxie which took things to another level.  Like, when I say another level I mean the top of the Stratosphere kind of level. Why not take thin, crispy waffles and fold them over to make chicken sandwiches? Why not fill them with crazy ingredients? Why didn't I think of this? Well I'm glad somebody did!  Bruxie, located in The Park on the side of New York New York, is something contemporary and cool enough to easily be found in the actual NYC (I wouldn't be surprised if it ends up there soon). I needed breakfast so what do I do? Yelp! Waffles? Chicken? Okay, that'll do.  But when I get there I don't just get chicken and waffles, no no no. At Bruxie things get interesting (in a good way). Holy chicken! That's the name of my breakfast-ish choice and it lived up to that name. Maple glazed chicken, applewood smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, Sriracha mayo, and a sunny side up egg.   Honestly, words can't describe this thing. Okay, I'll try to use words: Sweet. Savory. Spicy. Sexy (wait, maybe not that last one....or maybe.....). Anyway, it's just everything you want when you think of chicken and waffles. Add in some waffle fries (clever) and their own brewed coffee and you'll end up with a meal that'll do you in for the day.  Overall, I'll be thinking (dreaming?) about Bruxie for quite some time. The creative and amazing tastes they concoct (and their employees were a class act too) make this place a must. Yeah, I know there are 5-star restaurants and gourmet chefs aplenty, but go to Bruxie. Just do it and be ready for something you won't soon forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where they make your masterpiece.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited syrup.

ryNyiKMQizXEwyWz-H0UXw.text: Not super impressed with this place. Somehow when I walked in, the credit card machines are broken so it was cash only. I got the Holy Moly waffle and I believe it was a bit heavy on the syrup, the chick was thick and juicy, the waffle was soft, it was alright, but not for the price~ $15. This is nothing special, anyone and everyone cane make this at home... this place ran out of water and the restaurant was not busy, so it took them awhile to refill the water. It took awhile for my friends food to come through (this place was not busy) and they had to ask what they had ordered again.  I don't know, I just think this place is overpriced and nothing special.

vzSjgejSp8dgxTDOijZG0Q.text: Here is the 3-1-1:   Food: If you need a Chicken & Waffles fix, this is a great and quick stop. The waffles are Belgium style and are light, airy and with cinnamon sugar sprinkle you don't need a lot of syrup. The other option is the bacon infused version. The chicken is fried nicely that the oil residual is minimal as the skin is lightly battered and the inside is hot & tender.  Service: Walk up counter but they bring the food to your table, and the wait is minimal so if you are hungry or hungover you don't have to wait long.  Ambiance: No frills, clean but the music is a little loud for an early morning meal.

axeR0KFCqqqyVHClzdiw2w.text: This place is seriously so yummy! Its right on the strip so I walked from my hotel (park mgm) and for breakfast for a great price! I ordered a plain waffle (which is super delicious on its own) with Nutella and bananas on the side (which were free with my purchase!). I would definitely not hesitate to come here again for brunch!

woNe4XDyds22hOGZOQdrFw.text: I'm glad that i stopped here and tried a different spin on chicken and waffles. I had the holy chicken sandwich with waffle fries and a strawberry lemonade. It was so good and left me full practically the entire day. I liked the mix of flavors between the maple glazed fried chicken, sriracha sauce, bacon, and egg. Dip it in some waffle syrup and you get this tasty sweet and salty mix with a little kick from the sriracha. I originally thought the waffle would be more fluffy and that the sandwich would break apart immediately as soon as I bit into it. It held together great and it's likely because of the waffle was a little crunchy on the outside and thinner than i'd expected. Overall the service was great, food was yummy, and you know it's not a bad choice when the line is out the door. Definitely a must eat if you're a fan of chicken and waffles.

KDsAxndXeyg_fRSlpQxDJQ.text: The service here is great. I love the chicken and waffle varieties that they have to offer. The portions are large as they should b, being at there price points. YGx7OjkRolli9bQAgXhGlg.text: Great food and it's a must visit for us every time we are in Vegas.  The waffles are crunchy and flavorful. The chicken- crisp, juicy, delicious. x6NdXxQ-BMxuTTbrJIEjqA.text: I had the breakfast sandwich and it was absolutely delicious! I personally would have preferred the waffle a little bit more soft but regardless it was delicious!   I tried the buffalo mac and cheese and it was good! Next time I have to try the cheddar bacon waffle  I'm glad they have some locations here in So Cal. uxL4m4pkyvH7xUs-mkN9ZQ.text: OMG, this place should be in every town in America. The chicken, Bacon, waffle sandwich with an egg Sunnyside up is off the chain!! So many options, good thing the line was out the door, gave me more time to decide!!

VbDoboxuFbfhv_Kusbbecg.text: Went to Bruxie for brunch!  Me and my GF shared an Original chicken sandwich and an order of the Irish fries. The chicken sandwich was fantastic! The chicken was tender, juicy, and very well seasoned. It did not have that typical oily finish as you would think from a fried item. Biting into it there was an amazing bounce to the waffle and the chicken. The maple syrup sauce blended perfectly with the sandwich and gave it a nice sweet flavor without taking away from the crisp of the chicken and the waffle. The coleslaw worked very well in the sandwich by adding some extra crunch and tanginess. My only complaint is that my bottom waffle was a little thin, making the bottom fall apart as I was eating.  The Irish fries were good.. But they could have been better. The cheese on the fries tasted natural, but it was a little grainy and salty. This kind of overpowered the rest of the dish.  The service was impeccable! A few times I got out of my chair to get something (it's more of a order up front and get utensils and water yourself place) and a server stopped me and said he would get it for me). They took very good care of our every need! Servers also reminded me that there were free refills on my strawberry lemonade and not once did they let my cup go empty. Overall well worth a try and I will come back when I go back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original chicken sandwich! So good!

1BxaMYnAe3Whj4lH3xPV8w.text: A Great find in Vegas.  After a Short walk from our hotel, we found "The Park" between New York, NY and Monte Carlo near the T-Mobile arena, this is not to be confused with the Beer Park in front of Paris Hotel.  When we arrived there was a short line, we ordered at the counter and our food was delivered.  I ordered the Hot Nashville Chicken Waffel sandwich and I added an egg to it.  I was very pleased with the quality and taste of the food.
