ZQYeaNlXCd7gySS57XR3cw.text: We shared the original chicken waffle for $9.95.  It was a big disappointment.  The chicken was on the dry side, very little coleslaw, and it was just a normal tasting waffle.  Overpriced for what u get... probably wouldn't go back.

7mCQds91nRFCLFXNFfQknA.text: The food here is absolutely delicious, I'm definitely going to be a frequent visitor since I'm a local. The guy that was helping me and my friend was friendly, his name was Derick. You guys made a great choice hiring that positive and happy soul!

gIt05Pezxef5AepelFWk5g.text: Delicious!!! The buffalo fried chicken was perfect. The pastrami sandwich was so flavorful. The flavor of the waffle was light & yummy. The place was clean, the workers we're friendly. Definitely going back! Hoping they open one off the strip for locals to get to easier (:

jegLlZtdvR8XRhURC_FBzg.text: I had the grilled chicken and waffles and loved it, my friend had the fried chicken and waffles and also loved it. Awesome service, good price, and fast. It's not a fancy restaurant but it has a nice atmosphere with large windows to look out of. We will be back at our next visit to Vegas, which should be next month!

7yUIAaXZNkm2rGHpxWO7WQ.text: This is the second time I've eaten at Bruxie's. The chicken & waffles are absolutely amazing! The service was great, too. I'll definitely eat there again when I visit Las Vegas

BnTGBYwJTRNfhu_ziejRvQ.text: You can't go wrong with chicken and waffles. The original sandwich is the way to go here. Great food.

3XTdg1RDLPYOzKYbOMT0rg.text: Awesome food. Great service. The waffle chicken sandwitch is great! Gotta try their yummy custard!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie, so happy you&#39;re in Las Vegas.

KJ43Lk9F57kWyD4isKoKJg.text: I have to start by saying that Andre made this experience the best we've had in Vegas. His personality truly makes you feel welcome in the establishment.  He was so friendly and very attentive. Thanks Andre!  We showed up early and I'm glad we did since there was already a line, but the wait was not bad at all. The Original Chicken n waffle sandwich was amazing. The waffle is perfectly made and not too thick.  You must try the waffle fries with your meal. They are perfectly crispy.

Q31hVZ4haDAAL1dY5OsICA.text: So good! My boyfriend visited Bruxie a month ago, and hadn't stopped badgering me to try it myself. We went this past weekend and my tastebuds were pleasantly satisfied! I went with the chicken and waffles, which is topped with cabbage and some sort of spicy-syrup deliciousness. The waffle and chicken were equally crunchy and yummy. The waffle fries were cooked to perfection, although someone may have gotten a little carried away with the salt, but it didn't deter me from finishing the entire thing. The strawberry lemonade was also amazing. Definitely not fast food preparation or pricing, but the quality is well worth the extra bucks! I'll definitely be visiting again.

XixLUGXbq_q6R-4SPHDWHg.text: My husband told me I needed to try this place so on my next business trip, it was our first stop. We arrived for lunch and just ordered traditional chicken and waffles. The chicken was delicious however the waffles were cold for both of us. Not sure if this is by design but it cost two stars in my rating. I'm sure my husband will bring me back on our next visit but unless the waffles are served fresh and hot, I may not be eating with him

Mw_K3ccUpNBPN211wnTnYg.text: This place is legit. Got the buffalo chicken waffle sammy with their own signature spiced cola. Win! There were a lot of other items I want to try so will have to come back soon.

R9r8xmBuPPCqy7E31AzZqg.text: The food was insanely good! Everything was flavored perfectly. The staff was so attentive! Usually when you order from a counter, you don't get attention after the order. The staff always made sure we were doing great. Must visit for Vegas brunch!

hdZfUnV_kgyxXw61niapxw.text: UGHHHHH THE Creme brulee WAFFLE IS THE BEST! That's what makes me keep coming back here. The service is not the best at times (kinda slow and snobbish), but the food is too good to pass up. If you are staying at the strip, you must stop by this place.

6XNKUDI20fVoaFe5KIufbw.text: Service was good, Fried Chicken and Waffle sandwich was great with honey chili sauce ( messy but delicious) and Grilled Mushroom and Chicken Salad had a nice blend of flavors with goat cheese and sundried tomatoes.  Tasty lunch!

vl3JW0Zwub6IqAx8ZMrHAg.text: This restaurant is excellent. I will greatly recommend it to everybody. #1 reason is that the meat for the chicken is smooth, not rough. and the table tracker is a good idea. It is not like a buzzer so it does not make noise and the staff brings the food to the table. ok, everything is just so good that i will definitely come again.

vOpWhHUnao92LZJXUMI8ww.text: We loved this place when we stayed in Vegas. I am a vegetarian but my friends who are not vegetarian said this was the best fried chicken they ever had! The service was great and everything tasted so fresh and homemade. This place i highly recommend!

0x9Xs2q2vyQ9YlmssV46_w.text: poor customer service. They forget the dressing on a salad and then seemed really put out when I had to ask them to get it. We ordered waffle fries with some sort of cheese on it- nothing special. It was lukewarm and got cold very quickly. I had the Cobb salad and the eggs were overdone. I didn't have their waffles so I don't know about those.

CdyaJ2ofFFyD7dIByOfmpA.text: The Nashville style skillet is amazing! Chicken is juicy and the waffle biscuit with the butter is sweet. Then end the meal with the creme brulee waffle to top it off!

aP1iPF5DJHzHkughneSVdQ.text: We went during slower hours and ordered the  Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders to split with the "Holy Chicken!" Waffle Sandwich. If your thinking about trying the place during rush hours -- call in the order!!  Nashville Tenders (5/5) seasoning was on point! Spicy with a great crisp! I'm definitely a chili-addict and tend to find most Nashville seasonings quite mild but this has a great kick and the heat builds after each tender.    Holy Chicken! (4.5/5) loved this sandwich and the portion is very generous! The flavors are all great, bacon is crispy, egg was perfectly sunny side -- just make sure to eat it fast because it starts to become a soggy mess once the syrup is introduced.  I would imagine this would taste the best 'dining in'.  I shared this with my boyfriend and glad I did, although the flavors are AMAZING it just gets a bit heavy after a few more bites~   Atmosphere is great and staff is friendly (did I mention the waffle fries were great too?) -- but like many places in Vegas there is limited seating, you may have to share a table with strangers but I'm all for an organic conversation!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kOT6D7w9-dp47qamArkk5A.text: I don't know how long this place has been here, but I can't believe ever going to Vegas and not eating here.  Southern BBQ: Filling and worth every calorie, even if you go over your diet and need to dance extra ratchet at the club.  Holy Chicken!: Heaven on a plate.  They really need to expand because the only thing that sucks is eating in the hot dry heat since it's always crowded. I haven't had the dessert, but I don't think you can ever order the wrong thing here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern BBQ and waffle fries - the waffle sandwich itself was filling so not sure you need the fries, but 10/10
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken! Holy cow...

BXYpymytbQRgrHHA93rVkQ.text: The food here is amazing! It's so good! I shaved a star off only because it was a wait to get our food but the wait was worthwhile! Will definitely be back!

0ITK1aht8TUrL0vqMNbneQ.text: Fantastic food, very original spin on traditional ingredients! The Bruxie burger was one of the tastiest & simplest craft burgers I've had & the wife loved the seasoned chicken & waffles (better than Lolo's). Definitely worth a walk, stumble, or Lyft to eat here!

hYeZKlefQjVozbedY_R5ng.text: EDC week requires you to have at least one epic meal a day in order to survive a wild night of non-stop dancing. Since we needed a massive caloric intake, the homies suggest we get ourselves some fried chicken goodness. We ended up getting the Holy chicken waffle sandwich, which is a maple glazed piece of fried chicken breast with apple wood smoke bacon, cheese, a sunny side up egg and comes with a side of waffle fries. The flavors of this concoction were out of this world! Overall, if you're in the area and want to experience a gourmet chicken and waffle orgasm then definitely make it a point to come to Bruxie!

uAVs61zfvx2FdueUJTgUZg.text: Oops! Started eating before the photo... but look at it... so Irresistible and taste so Devine..another treat and not an illusion like the David Copperfield show..

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3MXuh44UH6XEbcIKyk9Ukw.text: I came here twice during my visit! Soo amazing and the staff was really helpful and friendly! The food came out pretty quickly as well. Can't wait to go back next time I visit!

RqdWP-AJ9ChWmRfzHIcIaw.text: Pretty cool place to check out, if you are in the mood for chicken and waffles. I ordered one of the original chicken and waffle sandwich with waffle fries. It was pretty delicious. They also sell 100% cane sugar soda:)

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QKkNII6VClcXL3n2_szFOQ.text: 3 stars.. Chicken and waffles is a concept I can't get enough of, so I was in when my wife recommended it. We started out with the traditional...warm crispy chicken wrapped in waffle and complimented by the vinegar slaw and syrup combo. The flavor was good, but the texture of the waffle was too soft. $9.25 is too steep for this product, but add in a soda and fries I would pay $10... I was ready to give this place a 2 star rating until we got our Nutella banana dessert waffle. Crispy waffle, chocolatey Nutella, and sweet custard and bananas...it all just worked!(and for $5.25 this is a good deal!) Ambiance is urban garage picnic and prices are above expectation. I will return for dessert, but until prices are corrected for the sandwiches I'll keep my distance. This joint for dessert makes the list!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella banana...get it in your mouth!!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional

JZAwHjdS-w5Bh7-rg-dt-g.text: Bruxie is great for a quick chicken and waffles. They are absolutely delicious. Originally thought it was an actual restaurant for brunch. I had the Nashville Sandwich and it was the best. I usually have a hard time finishing my food but, I was the first to finish my plate. The portion sizes are great, if they gave you a whole waffle it would be too much. The pricing is about $11-$12 just for the sandwich alone. It is definitely worth checking out and grabbing a quick bite. I couldn't wait to eat my sandwich as you can see I took a bite before I could take a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kHRfUEo7SNoTi1v6khcsWA.text: Meh. The chicken is good, the waffles are...unique. the cost was sky high but hey, welcome to the strip. Not much else to say, it's a pretty run of the mill restaurant. One good thing is that the place is very clean.

aCXHHy7nfWtHEONtiwxDYQ.text: It's so good! I had Bruxie before in SoCal but this is just as delicious. Idk if the menu is a little smaller but that's plenty for customers to pick from. I ordered the original waffle sandwich and boy was it so juicy. The chicken is cooked perfectly and has his honey sauce on it with the slaw. I loved it. Good portion. Give it a go, you won't be disappointed.

IjVjn2fwbRrvCoYIT4mOxg.text: BRUXIE - VEGAS - @THE PARK - (South of Monte Carlo, North of NY NY and just East of the T-Mobile arena) Casual dining. Good price point for a quality, hot meal. Great for breakfast, lunch, brunch, dinner or late night. Fun dining experience. Accommodating staff.  This is one of those restaurants where you place your order at the register, grab your flatware and condiments, and they run drinks and food to your table with one of those buzzers. If seating is limited, take your order to go and sit outside on the orange chairs. (PS: Those vibrating buzzer don't reach the orange chairs. We asked.)  Drumroll please, now for the FOOD! Hubs had the Classic Chicken and Waffle sandwich with homemade slaw on it. I had the Buffalo Blue Chicken and Waffle sandwich with a celery and carrot slaw. WE LOVED IT! The waffles were light, airy and just buttery enough without being greasy. A little thinner than a Belgian waffle and better! Chicken was seasoned nice. Great taste. Crisp and still juicy. As for the waffles fries, wished we asked for them crispy. But no big deal. Just a little soft but we were really there for the Chix & Waffs, right?    We will be back. Maybe we'll order two sandwiches each. We enjoyed them that much!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. His- The Classic. He said it was delicious and wanted seconds.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s do shots, man!  Waffle syrup that is.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do it!  Just do it!  You know you want to!  We wish we had seconds! Enjoy!

6tClyLfimoArA2uM_1cKOg.text: The mushroom goat cheese waffle was wonderful! The service was prompt. Definitely worth the long trek to get there from Vdara.

yZzHlNSNvTRjDIcZAD14Mw.text: Came here for lunch and ordered the buffalo style tenders. I can never pass up an opportunity for good tenders and I was not disappointed. The sauce was very flavorful and the tenders were crispy. The waffle fries were somewhat soft, but I tried one from a friend and they were fine so that may have just been a one off event. Next time definitely going to try something with waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0SdPMVUOpQDBwlZdAVOyyA.text: I'm glad that I found this place, and there wasn't a line when I came here around 2pm. I ordered the Holy Chicken since it was the most popular one, and the cashier recommended it. The chicken was amazing, and it was crisp! The food was very filling! Highly recommend the Holy Chicken!

I8HEztoJp_8aPETTYcA8Rg.text: While in Las Vegas, I happened to find this restaurant on Yelp and decided to give it a chance due to its high ratings. As a southerner, I was truly impressed with the delicious waffles. I opted for the "Holy Grail" and it truly did not disappoint. The waffles were light and delicious. I also had their strawberry lemonade which also was a hit! I highly recommend Bruxie if you like sweet, savory, and filling dishes!

RXX8aUx8AwqFERAFCb4NFA.text: OMG! VERY good chicken and walffle sandwich with an egg and bacon! Shakes were very good good. VERY good music and seating was plentiful.

TTKup-DqGoN70rQwJvQCOw.text: Did someone say chicken and waffles? We came here the last morning we were in Vegas and grabbed some brunch. We all ordered one of their chicken and waffle sandwiches and they were amazing. When you get it, it may seem like it won't fill you up, but you'd be surprised with how dense everything is. However, it's not oily or over heavy as you'd expect from chicken and waffles. The waffle was perfectly made and the chicken was so well cooked with a nice fried skin on the outside with very juicy meat on the inside!  The service there was phenomenal! One of the workers refused to let me get up to get my own free refill and insisted to get it for me (note that at this place you just order at the front and they'll bring you the food so it's not exactly like a restaurant).   Be careful of the syrup because it is delicious, but it is prettttyyyy sticky and got a bit of it on my clothes xD

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e4zc1L4y2GmB0uOsflP5JQ.text: The food was incredible everything from the angry mac & cheese as well as the holy waffle. I highly recommend no matter your taste preferences

t6tMsVlFni1qe_c0Z6MrkA.text: The chicken is so well done.  It's tender, juicy, and flavorful. It's almost unbelievable how well they do it.  I had the buffalo bleu and my wife had the original. We almost ordered another set because they were that good.  The only thing that kept us from ordering more is our vow to visit as many places as possible to expand our horizons. Love this place.

pp9brIzrOm7OfYZbrl2xVg.text: This place is off the hook. A definite must! Bacon cheddar and egg sandwich was life changing. Would probably give up my first born for another

ULmAxDWNDSRIniGOdzofiQ.text: Delicious, Inventive, Gobble-icious.....did I mention absolutely delicious? I first went to Bruxie's in Huntington Beach, CA and became totally addicted!!! The place is fun and friendly, two musts for an enjoyable experience, and I just looooove waffles, so of course Bruxie's is my go-to waffle joint.  My fave picks are the Bacon, Egg and Cheddar and the Lemon Cream with Berries... I have been known to go totally bonkers and have BOTH on the same visit (and then not eat for the next 48 hours)!!  Of course the Fried Chicken Waffle is a classic, and equally scrumptious, and so are the other waffle sandwiches, but I always seem to order the Bacon or the Lemon waffle and they are always, always the BEST part of my day. Waffles and cappuccino and a cold lemonade   The B.E.C has crispy, smoked bacon, a just-right runny egg, and the right amount of melted cheese to combine with the waffle in every bite and make you want to keep eating all day long.....  On the other hand, the silky slightly tart lemon creme with berries is a dance party in your mouth, hitting all the right notes and putting a Chesire-cat-like smile on your face. Words to the wise: Go to Bruxie's .

GJK2Qx5kajpaH-B9BjKsHg.text: Pretty good. We went for breakfast but it was more like brunch. The waffles were delicious, as well as the chicken. We were the first to be served and got in and out real quick.

CFOxcgif3T0_KaT-SPdbrg.text: The food here is sooo good! Sorry I don't have any pictures to show, we were so hungry and the 1st bite was too good. Lol We ordered the chicken tenders and waffle fries, Nashville hot flavor.  Also, we had the B.A.M.F sandwich, which has fried chicken & mac & cheese, all between waffles. We also ordered a very yummy strawberry lemonade. They also have sodas that have pure cane sugar. We tried our family members vanilla cream soda, which was really good as well! The inside isn't very big, but there's plenty seating right outside, which is where we sat.

xqBMqg0wsB6Tm-fL4QJpSA.text: We stayed at NY NY and decided to try this place for dinner one night. The girl at the register was not helpful when asked questions and seemed like she didn't want to be there. The other two staff members that brought out our food were opposite of that and very friendly. The food was good but all 3 of us had cold waffle fries. The chicken fingers were good and my friends enjoyed their crispy chicken sandwiches. None of us cared for the cold waffle fries.

puw8TS26PGvwUKpxRoovQA.text: The issues with this place is the staff.  We went there in the afternoon when there was not many customers. Ordered the chicken strips with waffle cut fries to go. Tasted alright, nothing special. The order taker didn't seem that enthused to be there for starters. We waited a long time for the food to be prepared although I could see several workers in the kitchen area. When the food was ready it sat on the counter for a long time while the two girls whose job is to take it to the customers talked to each other about who knows what...Finally, one of them started bagging the order for me to take out. That process seemed to take longer then it should have. The girl couldn't figure out what bag to put it in, or she was just confused about something with take out orders. When we got the meals, the food had cooled down from the wait. Fried food is not that appetizing cold. The Strawberry Ice Tea was flavorless...The staff all look like high school kids that weren't into it. I didn't see anyone who looked like a manager supervising anyone. I can't imagine what it would be like if the place was busy. I'll give it another try to see if things change.

F5J8iflEG2umfRJUbVY6YA.text: Original chicken sandwich and Irish nachos were good but didn't like the temperature . Their Mac and cheese has potential but HATED the Buffalo cheese sauce . Really Buffalo sauce on Mac ? -Jasmar

Qj8YqLgSrVPEzspphKd-Qg.text: If you have a bad experience at this place you're probably a communist. I love everything about this place. Breakfast lunch or dinner it doesn't matter it never disappoints.

manwrFGQDDdiUkNDPWoEIg.text: Had a fantastic lunch here... the original was awesome and the staff was very attentive throughout our time there. Definite recommend...

INL3ntvM7M5jIH3CF1rIbw.text: So this was the first time my girlfriend and I have ever eaten at this place, and I have to say it was decent. The prices were okay, keeping in mind that this is food being served on the strip. The customer service was very good given the fact that their drinks are refillable only if a worker gets it for you, which We never had to ask a worker once because they were attentive enough to always ask us for a refill before our drinks were empty. The one thing that everyone needs to do when coming to this place is get some of the free syrup that they offer , which is next to the ketchup, and eat that with their waffles. The syrup was definitely one of the bigger reasons we liked the place. One big down side was the fact that our French fries were pretty cold. They weren't stale, but they did feel like they were waiting to be served for awhile. Overall however the place was very unique and a great place to eat at The Park.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mID2x3yiZAuYhy73KOeNFg.text: Bruxie did not meet my expectations. My boyfriend and I ordered the original fried chicken waffle and the bleu cheese buffalo waffle and both disappointed us. I expected a warm waffle with a juicy piece of chicken but instead got a hard, crispy, cold waffle and a thin and tough breaded piece of chicken. The food presentation was nice and the servers were pleasant but the food was lame and made us sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle was hard and cold. Chicken was tough

rHo7nDMMPkGS9RoEHT-nkg.text: First off....service here is impeccable.  The staff are super friendly and food comes out in a timely manner.  I had the chicken tenders with waffle fries with the BBQ sauce and ranch.  My husband had the original chicken and waffle.  They were both good.  I would however, highly recommend the strawberry lemonade.  The great thing is that they give free refills!  That's awesome in this insane Las Vegas heat!  The waffle fries are way better than chik fila!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oixs7xRMo1OoXhwdMaiatA.text: Best chicken and waffles. I had the Nashville spicy chicken with the bacon maple syrup waffles. Really awesome. The regular waffles with berries and whipped cream we're delicious too. Free refills on strawberry lemonade and Palmer iced teas.

Ek_3I2rlfazJQ7eoJn2aVQ.text: Very very good! Perfect for brunch. Highly recommend the original chicken and Carolina pulled pork. Not too much of a fan of the bruxie burger..and I usually like burgers. Definitely finish it off with a Creme Brulee waffle!!

5M1YZS_jIjzOZThUalfF3w.text: Food was delicious! I had the original chicken and waffles with the waffle fries. It was my first time having chicken & waffles together, and I was very pleased. I didn't give it 5 stars b/c my beverage was terrible. I ordered the "lemon-lime sofa" hoping it would resemble the flavor of Sprite or Sierra Mist, but it was awful. There were also no fresh cut lemons or limes available.

X5KBJoGPPXhS2WVfPpEqSg.text: I always went to Bruxies in LA, but the one here in Vegas was actually pretty awesome. I don't remember the chicken being well seasoned like the one in LA, but the one here was AMAZING.

CXBQBXKa-JgyGKGc95c8kQ.text: Very nice atmosphere and super friendly/efficient service! The food was good, but definitely not worth the price. I tried their dessert sundae, (that was huge), the original chicken finger meal, and the chicken and waffle sandwich. The syrup has a very unique taste. The chicken fingers are quality; it's not all fatty. Another plus side is the location is in a nice area on the strip which is nice to walk around at after your meal.

jD7YPnlS-z-0RC3nQlj8Ow.text: Chicken is on point, now if we could only get hot waffles and warm syrup, we'd be 5 star!

sP-D3ogHBCT9TBr2CzNJQw.text: I wish more of the meals came with fries/weren't an additional charge, but the food was satisfying for brunch after a long night out! Living in LA, I've surprisingly never tried chicken and waffles. Was it super great quality? Not exceptionally, but what made me give it 4 stars is that the people working there were super friendly & attentive. It was really refreshing and unique to see such good service at an order-at-the-counter type restaurant. They deserve some recognition, I wish I got their names! Thank you though :)

3YD7F2DAN_hDWkAhiE0DRw.text: Great breakfast choice - I'm glad our friend wanted to go there. They have so many waffle options - savory and sweet. I had a breakfast sandwich on a waffle, since I'd never had something like that before and it was surprisingly good! Others had chicken & waffles and just plain waffles. Very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. breakfast sandwich waffle

NMEdEhy9dZ2-iW0JQOXYXQ.text: I had an incredible dining experience here. The Meat Your Maker sandwich was a perfect ten. So much flavor and juiciness, just take a look at my photos. I can't say anything bad about this place, even my root beer float was amazing. I had no idea what to expect and this place is definitely on my radar forever. Do yourself a favor and eat here today!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat your maker
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat your maker sandwich

lm0V_QdOPAgKgPOQr9CV8Q.text: Fabulous! I got the basic chicken and waffle, no frills. Husband got the BAMF (Chicken, mac n cheese, pepperoncinis, and an angry cheese sauce) sandwich. Total was $32 with a shared drink.  Chicken was PERFECTLY cooked!!! My waffle was cold in comparison to the chicken, but it didn't detract from the meal by any means. The syrup wasn't too sweet and was served on the side it their own signature bottle.   Order at the counter, sit, they bring food to you. Soda was their own house made; it was good.   Definitely recommend.

GKwCAeZ_NNaG--oxIEammA.text: Found this place on yelp. There was a little line outside but it moved quickly. The food came pretty quick but my egg was cold. This was changed and a new one brought out quickly too.  The sandwich was very tasty and filling. I would not recommend sides unless your famished.  This is the perfect place for a hangover cure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg and cheese waffle from their breakfast menu.

NSbeCt8_uKpGXjWBY7CCTg.text: I only had the Holy Mary (Bloody Mary) here, but that alone gives this place 5 stars! Comes with celery, a pickle, pepperoncini (I asked for extra in mine), and a piece of bacon. I ordered one and drank it in the restaurant, looking out at the square so I could people watch and then ordered another for my walk back to the room. Definitely one of my favorite Bloody Mary's and will be going back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Mary

hsFKj9xwL45yWYIkb22dtQ.text: HOLY MOLY... This place is LEGIT!!  My aunt went recently and highly recommended it for the chicken and waffles. Everyone knows I love my shake shack so it was tough for me to walk by shake shack and wait in line at Bruxie's. Probably the best decision of my recent trip though lol  Lines are always out the door, regardless of time, but they flow very well. I got "the original" that consisted of the chicken, waffle, syrup and some coleslaw. HOLY CRAP that was the best dang chicken and waffles I've ever tasted. Chicken was fresh and nicely cooked, waffle was warm and crispy and everything was just on point. Literally had a foodgasm in my mouth.. and that's not a bad thing!! Be prepared to use alot of napkins though due to the syrup lol  Also ordered my girls the kids meal and wow I was impressed at the portion size for the pricing. Plus they come with a drink.. yay.  This place was sooo good, I came back again. Walking 2 miles round trip was super worth it!  Anyway, I must add that I love the fact that they bring the food to you! I thought it would be one of those establishments where you come up to pick up the food when your buzzer goes off but I didn't notice that it's sensored and they know where you're at. BEST SERVICE YOU CAN GIVE! Also, they offered to help take some trash away when they notice you're almost done. OMG, I feel so spoiled!   Regardless of the time, this place is freakin awesome. Always has seating (unlike next door) and outside to lounge around in perfect weather is probably the best way to eat your meal. Love it! Can't wait to be back and I've been highly recommending it to anyone going to Vegas!!

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kickin Chicken

n0ytAYwkGIed3ObfsPfN2A.text: Loved our breakfast here! It's in a nice area for walking, and even though there is a line, it goes quite quickly. Order at the counter, then they bring the food out to you.   I got the holy chicken - delicious! The egg was quite runny (the white was runny as well), but the sandwich was delicious. The waffle is very crispy, and the fried chicken coating takes a step past crispy into crunchy! I really enjoyed it.   The waffle fries were just okay, I would skip them and get tots instead if you want some potatoes on the side.   The strawberry lemonade was super delicious as well! It seems like they blend real strawberries into the lemonade and it is wonderful! Recommend.

RFoCCEaT79lCSSAdYOg_tw.text: This was such a good spot! The waffles were crispy and the chicken was super tender! I definitely recommend coming here. We got the El Jefe and it hit the spot! The coleslaw and jalapenos were refreshing and it wasn't too spicy. The star of the show though was the waffle chicken sandwich. It was crispy and the egg dripping down was delicious! Flavoring of the chicken was amazing. It was slightly sweet with a little kick to it. Pro tip: check in to get one of their homemade sodas!!

IUZ_KuS7UqVr632aI294sw.text: Chicken's juicy and well seasoned. Waffles are super tasty. Mac and cheese is decent - I like the spice, but needs more bacon. Coleslaw needs improvement (it's pretty plain and tasteless).

v7y0-TpYgPFgSDMMIX-gDA.text: If you're in Vegas, make time to come by here! It's at the end of the strip , near the park MGM...parking available in the garages across.  I got the holy chicken waffle sandwich...  fried chicken, bacon, sunny side up egg sandwiches between waffles:: so so good!! Highly recommended! I also got the side of Mac and cheese which was also good!   They have a couple of locations in California, whenever you're near one, try it out!

I am a fan now and will frequent again!!!

FrMfJF6AMqQrxS5gngfbPA.text: I went to Bruxie based on the recommendation of a friend. I was staying at the Excalibur and Bruxie was just a short walk over. It's attached to New York New York. The waffle was nice and crisp and the syrup was good and hot. I also had a mimosa which was really good. I'd definitely go back. They have a birthday special too. I definitely recommend their waffle sandwiches.

Ty_we1UrGiD65uU4hn4Y8w.text: I have known about Bruxie for a long time but never actually been in any location between the Vegas strip and the locations in California.  Finally got the chance to come in for a quick bite before heading to Caesars Palace for a wedding.   I kept it simple and ordered the bacon, egg, & cheddar waffle which was great. It's the only thing I got so I can't speak much to the menu but this was a solid dish. A bit smaller than I thought but I enjoyed it none the less and loved how they melted all the cheddar onto the waffle first. Will definitely give them another try in the future. Staff interactions were minimal but the few encounters hd were fine, not too packed the morning that we went either so we were able to eat inside and people watch a bit. Everyone who ate in my group seemed to enjoy there food. Recommended!

xBfbaDRsKMXOUMHQh39jSw.text: This is our first time trying Bruxie. I heard so much about it and have wanted to try the one in LA, but never got the chance. Here we are in Vegas and was able to finally try it. We ordered the B.A.M.F, with a side of waffle fries and their dessert waffle. It is pretty pricey, but it's worth sharing it with someone. Taking the first bite, the chicken was juicy and tender. It was not at all hard to chew. The only down fall I really have is that it was a bit salty as you continue to eat. Maybe a bit less on the seasoning? But overall it was really good. Hubby love chicken and waffles, so once he heard he was so excited. We will be back if we're ever in the Vegas area again or we'll try the one in LA. Very good and half of it is already filling enough for one person! Can't wait to be back again soon!

IgN_67Ds23sokOk1MYHHhg.text: Chicken n waffles is my husbands favorite food so we were so excited to find this place during our stay in Las Vegas. The chicken n waffles sandwich (more like a taco) is genius! Who doesn't like handheld food? You can sit and eat or take it on the go! But I wouldn't recommend that because once you add the syrup it can get a little sticky. But I preferred the loaded waffle fries!! I'll eat potato anything and these were amazing!   Not to mention the prices are very reasonable for the Las Vegas area when all the nice restaurants are $40+ per person. We will definitely visit here again next time we're in the area. Delicious!

Vj3iG9p5xQ4KVdchO0LkXA.text: This is Israel chapa the third and I just want to share for a brief minute how amazing Bruxie's is. The greatest part about Bruxies isn't just the food but the people who work there. They connect with their customers in ways that are unmatched by any other restaurant. The food is better than Gordon Ramsey's cooking. Ces is one of the employees and has got the most beautiful smile anyone could have. Kevin will make you laugh and feel like you're at home  And Eva can make you feel like the most important person in the world. If I had all the money in the world I would eat at Bruxies every single day for the rest of my life. If I could bring one thing with me to a deserted island, it would be Bruxies. If your in Vegas go try it out !!!!

o_I0BnFV8rN9jRNvUH_JJg.text: Had lunch at Bruxie I had the Kickin' Chicken Sandwich & my partner had The Original Sandwich with Waffle Fries both were really nice but I have to say that I prefer the Kickin' as it's got more flavour to it.

eDNdcXpuGRRqUziIyGPiBw.text: The concept here is great - simple waffle and fried chicken delicacies. And they deliver, the chicken is cooked perfectly and same with the waffle. Delicious! I personally had The Classic sandwich and like I said everything was cooked perfectly. I found it to be a bit dry so I added a decent amount of syrup and hot sauce. The fries were also so good! Reminds me of chick fil-a. Food came in ten minutes, and the sandwiches are large and filling for roughly $11-$12. There's a party in my tummy - so yummy so yummy :D  Now as for the management I felt there is some definite room for improvement. The young lady who took my order was less than pleasant. She had lip piercings and super dark eye makeup, which is all good  but she genuinely just seemed like she was pissed off and hated everyone. She never smiled or recommended anything good to try. Just stood there as if I was doing her an inconvenience. I don't understand why she was the first person we saw when we entered the place, when they have amazing employees such an Vanessa (she brought out our food) who are happy, smiley and bring a good aura.   The tables were all dirty, we had to clean our own! Which is totally BS cause I could see a manager ( I assume) in a burgundy sweater just standing around in the back. There was one girl (I didn't get her name, but she was a young African American lady w/ her hair in a bun ) who was working her ass off! She never stopped moving the whole time I was there! Whenever she got a free moment she would wipe down a few tables and then go back to fulfilling milkshake/drink orders. I also saw her keeping up the restrooms. My point being, she was working 2x while manager stood around. I can't stand that.  The condiment area was lacking. Only one of the ketchup pumps worked and it was incredibly messy.  Although they did keep two water jugs out with cups - super awesome especially in summer time heat.   I probably won't make the trip here again as it was fun but not unforgettable. If I was a guest at New York New York I would 100% say check it out cause it's fun but for locals, just hit chick fil a.

K9kW6-rCdzyphutkX4pumA.text: I would have liked to eat here but Icouldn't. Seating was horrible and cut throat. There is no assigned seating and you better send someone to save a seat while you order. Customers are selfish and sit 2 at a 6 chair table. Staff doesnt say anything at all and will take your money and leave you to yourself for a seat. Also a lot of staff was wandering around but there was no clear guidance. I might be back but only to grab and go....some day  Update: They messaged me asking to explain and respond to an email? I did and no one responded lol. Really don't care because doesn't change my review. It was early opening and everything should have been right. It's close to T-MOBILE arena and should have their stuff together. Also there needs to be a sign giving clear direction of what to do. Order here, then take a seat. Or send a party member to save a seat because you will get cut off and order the food to dine in only to eat it in your car.

wauLSIxhLgT9u5VDh69Y_A.text: The spicy chicken waffle sandwich wasn't very spicy. So that was a bummer but the flavor was good.  I think I'm being picky because I've had better fried chicken. Buuut, I will say that the waffle was pretty delicious. Perfect crispy texture on the outside while having that thin light fluffy interior you expect from waffles on the inside.  They have their waffles DOWN. The fried chicken is just not the best that I've had.  I will say though, I love the concept of the restaurant. Waffle sandwiches stuffed with fried chicken? What's not to love?  This place isn't perfect. It's not the best sandwich I've ever hand. It's not a sandwich that I couldn't dare to dream without. But you can't really go wrong with a fried chicken/waffle pairing and this place does it pretty well.  3 stars because I wouldn't really go out of my way to come here. But if you were in the area, it wouldn't be a bad choice for a meal.

Oyx60zGGvEB9nJV2qa7Q1A.text: Saw pics of Bruxie's food on Instagram and couldn't wait to get to Vegas to try it out!!!! Got there and the food was amazing! Fresh and the service was amazing. The lemonade was amazing as well. I believe it was called the strawberry Palmer. My cousin was a little upset because she saw a picture of a sandwich with Mac & cheese, but it was only available at the California location! Was a bummer, but she loved the food that she ordered!!!

We usually get there around brunch time, so the line tends to be long and out the door but it moves quickly. You order at the counter, and the food is brought out to you once it's ready. My favorite is the crispy chicken waffle sandwich! The waffles are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, and the chicken is well seasoned and crispy without losing any of the juiciness. The spiced tots are a yummy add on too!

The chicken and waffle was flavorful throughout my meal. The waffle was thin like almost the size of bread. Compared to other waffles I have tasted in the past, this waffle maintained its crunch. I'm not a fan of fluffy foods unless it is dessert so eating a crunchy waffle really makes me smile.   If you are with people who do not like chicken, they do offer a plain waffle option as well.

245fA2qRuEgksBiBjySxPg.text: One of the better spots to get brunch on the strip. I got the 2 pieces + 1 waffle. It's two reasonable sized chicken breasts with half of a waffle. The food came out fresh and hot. Chicken was breaded wonderful and tasted great with the help of the hot sauce they provide. Waffle was probably one of the best waffles I've ever had! It was a little crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy in the inside. I also got an order of fried pickles because who doesn't love fried pickles?! They also came out really hot and tasted so fresh! The only thing about them was that they were a little big but that wasn't even a problem because the taste definitely made up for that. Most definitely coming back and encourage everyone to at least try this place 1 time!

nEGwZXp9O54agOUIdGatEg.text: The fifth star is missing for the fried pickles: THICK, chunky pickle segments; not what we were expecting. Prefer thin sliced pickles. Everything else was excellent. Mac n cheese, kickin chicken waffle sandwich and naked waffle were all good. The fry on everything is good. Crispy/crunchy. Asked for extra ranch which was never received; but it was busy. Not crazy about the artisan sodas, they were good, but give me a Dr. Pepper.  Will be back to try more items.

xDyyckXv9vTkLpiyUu3Mog.text: I've heard so many good things about this California import that I was a little skeptical going in. It couldn't be that good, could it? But after taking a bite of their original chicken and waffle sandwich I was hooked. It's everything I look for in fried chicken and waffles (in a sandwich form) -- crunchy texture, well seasoned, a little heat, crispy waffle. I'm a fan and can't wait to go back for more.  My kid on the other hand, didn't like it as much as I did. His young palate wasn't crazy about the peppery coating on the kid's chicken tenders and couldn't eat more than one bite. I thought it was great, but I can understand why he didn't like it. If I go back, I'll just have to do so without him.

JklmqonXwDV9bbQqWBwTDw.text: BEST CHICKEN AND WAFFLES I HAVE EVER HAD. Defiantly try the cheddar waffle with the 2 piece chicken. I came back to this place already to try the original waffle and it did not disappoint. Will be returning soon! Great for bfast/ lunch and dinner

zDnZ2uPhdhYxaVcBSekt7A.text: Ok . I have travelled to New Orleans and Texas and London and Africa and Thailand and India and down under . The Hawaii chicken here was sooooo good it was a top 10 all time for me .. great service too . Enjoy and remember once you have kids everything changes

24mKDO_wflQUKViE0i8XXA.text: Was in the area exploring and my friend chose this spot, which I am grateful for. Chicken and waffles never appealed to me cause I imagine the dish to be greasy af and bland (at least here in CA). Bruxie's chicken and waffle definitely changed my mind.   The chicken was crunchy and flavorful, and the waffle was sweet but not cloyingly sweet, so it paired well with the poultry. We also tried a dessert waffle, and it was lightly sweet as well. Would come back again!

qxn9J4GVjBstDCNwQ-8Q6w.text: Having always been a fan of Bruxie, I was excited to see that Vegas now has one located right next to Shake Shack! It's been a while since I've had a delicious chicken and waffle sandwich and Bruxie sure did deliver. I ordered the Nashville Style Hot waffle sandwich which included a nice and juicy fried chicken thigh with shredded lettuce, pickles, and a nice tangy sauce to top it off. I opted out of the pickles since I'm not a fan, but everything else about the sandwich was just so delightful, I loved it. The waffle was soft, fluffy, and not too thick so you wouldn't get tired of it easily.  The chicken was fried to perfection and since it was dark meat, it wasn't dry at all. A couple days late on this review, I'm definitely starting to drool as I'm trying to remember every bite I had.   As if the chicken sandwich alone wasn't enough, I tempted myself to get a kids meal with a small order of waffle cut fries and mac n cheese. I wanted to get both as sides but fearing that the side orders would be too much, I ordered the kids meal thinking the portions would be smaller. Not sure if this is the case, but it definitely was the right amount for me! You also get a kids cup of either lemonade, soda, or milk with it. Both the fries and mac n cheese were bomb, if you happen to be on the fence like me - I say just do it!   Having ordered way too much food already, I had to mentally stop myself from getting one of their sweet waffles. The Creme Brulee waffle looked so heavenly and luscious, I definitely died a little inside... But it's okay, this just gives me another reason to be back next time!   Service was good, not great. After you order they give you what looks like a pager or buzzer, but it actually doesn't buzz. It has a number on it and once your order is ready, the workers call out your number and after spotting you, they walk over to hand you your order. This might be more efficient inside, but since we sat outside, it was a little unorganized. I think having an actual buzzer and just having customers walk up to pick up their order would be much easier. They forgot my fries and drink and I had to walk back to the counter to ask for it. It's no big deal, but I think it's easier to just pick everything up all at once at the counter than having the workers struggle with bringing everything out to you. But regardless, the workers were really friendly and got me my fries and drink right away!  Overall, I totally recommend if you're a waffle lover!

mdDuUGRT9onk7-Tlq0S6FQ.text: Im from Las Vegas and it was the first time i have experienced this place. My friends said that it was a must go. I was along for the ride. My order was the Nashville Hot and that was a really good pick. Idk what kind of sauce that was but it was a really good mix of flaver and spicyness. Along with it was the pickle in it which made a really big difference. A thin slice of the pickle was all it needed. This a by far the beat waffle sandwich i have had personally. I also tried my friends order which was the original. It was good as well but for my personal taste it was a bit sweet. We hinestly thought if they added a pickle it would have upped the flavor.  It was a really good place having a patio. If you wanted to stay inside and look outside you have that option.  The people who worked there seemed very nice a d bring your order promptly. I have no complaints abkit Bruxie at all and i cant wait to go again. I really like that in our day and age that a chicke. Waffle sandwich is an option. Greag job and thank you Bruxie!

WNATWf-xgvVeI_4dGrnq-Q.text: Pretty cool place - lots of choices & being from out of town I wasn't too familiar with the menu selection so needed some time deciding between a couple choices that both sounded good! Staff were really friendly and helpful.

dIjmpNiIYNf3mwQaSlOI5A.text: So close to the T-Mobile arena that it is a shame if you don't eat here after your concert! I got the holy chicken! (Yes the exclamation point is supposed to be there) The holy chicken! consists of chicken (of course), egg, bacon, cheese, and a huge waffle that covers all of it. Cracking the egg yolk made my mouth water even more and I was so excited to eat it! The holy chicken! was amazing. Even though it is a little pricey I think the quality you get is worth it!

V13zDo4gRFk-SOaUYz-1Gg.text: This has been on my list for about a year and they are located outside of the New York New York Casino. We don't normally go on the strip is why it's taken so long to try! We arrived around lunch time and the line was going out the door, we thought we were going to wait a while. The place was packed with people. It took us only 5-10 minutes to order and we ordered the "Holy Chicken" it came with cheese, applewood bacon, an egg and the thick juicy flavorful chicken. Every flavor complemented each other no extra sauce needed. The sandwich itself is very filling and the chicken was extremely thick. We will definitely be coming back if we are on the strip.

nGnmA5CSMci_SsffyDWHKw.text: So happy they opened one here in Vegas! Came here on a Thursday night, just before the grand opening concert at the T-Mobile Arena. The Park was extremely busy, and Bruxie's line was pretty long. We waited for about 20 minutes and ordered. The cashier only put in one order of the original fried chicken and waffle instead of two. So we had to go through a whole process of putting in a second order. First order came pretty quickly but the second order didn't come until someone checked on us if we were waiting on anything else. However, they were all really helpful and constantly checked on us. Even though the ordering process was a little out of order, their excellent customer service had completely sold me. The sandwich was really fresh, chicken was super tender and juicy, and the vanilla cream soda was to die for. Bruxie, I'll be back for you!

xQHa4GPtzlW5-ZrDOEX_wg.text: This place is awesome!! I had the sausage, egg, and cheese waffle sandwich. The waffle was crispy and delicious it enhanced the sandwich, sausage was flavorful, with scrambled eggs and cheddar cheese. Any place that has waffle fries I have to order and they were also crispy and delicious. The sandwich was a good size I was definitely full when I left. This place was really busy for a Monday afternoon but food came out quickly and delicious. I wish they had one near me in Texas.

qQkEGbevlC_B6LxxNjDYwA.text: This place was absolutely delicious! A very clean establishment that specializes in waffle sandwiches. I'm not sure where to begin but let's start with the amazing concept! Of course chicken and waffles is not a new concept but the spin Bruxie puts on its creates a whole different experience. The waffles themselves are crisp and freshly baked. Initially I wasn't sure how I would like it but they were crisp and light not crisp and stiff! It made for a great waffle sandwich. The chicken was delicious and very nicely fried. I got the original chicken and waffle combo and my date got the Nashville Hot chicken combo. The original waffle sandwich comes with a chicken breast dressed with chili honey, slaw and I added pickle. The Nashville comes with a chicken thigh dressed in a tangy sauce and slaw. Both were amazingly good! The combos come with fries which were also good. We spilt an order of fried green pickles, yes our eyes were bigger than our mouths! More than enough food and wasn't able to finish them. The combo is a little pricey but worth every penny for this killer combo and you may even have a little to take home!

The kimchi was like not the best but honestly, you can't have powerful kimchi with this delicious waffle. The waffle itself was mediocre but again, it's all about stacking the flavors. The fried chicken itself was sooooo bomb!!!!! I would absolutely come back again. Actually I just may have to!!

iAq2yQ6FBD_WrLZXkF83Mg.text: We have been to a couple bruxies in SoCal. So once the one in Vegas opened we had to visit. The Lv location is by far the nicest.   I always ask employees what's their favorite one. I've tried plenty. My fav so far is the bruxie burger with BBQ sauce. An employee recommended the pastrami and Swiss. I loved it too. I've tried plenty and nothing is not good. Next time I want to try the Nashville hot.  The crisscut fries and excellent as well. I didn't like the buffalo fries but my brother loved it. I really enjoy the cheese fries with added sriracha.   Serivce is excellent as always and btw if your reading this order the strawberry lemonade! It's free refills are a plus but the drink is AMAZING!   The location is perfect. I will back to visit real soon.

hjzRxFIt1DDLqiIh7q1C8g.text: Not really sure what they hype is with this place.  I guess it's the concept of chicken & waffles in a sandwich form.  The chicken was moist and had a nice crunch to it.  The waffles was light and thin.  I guess I'm not a big fan of it being in a sandwich form.  I would rather it be in the traditional form where I can slab the waffle with butter and just pour on the syrup myself.  The chicken didn't really have that much flavor to it.  I guess it got overshadowed by the syrup and coleslaw.  I am also not a big fan of their cane sodas.  It gives the soda a different taste than I am used to with the Coke products.

0wQ43H9yo4FNjE8SItDz0Q.text: I'm normally not a fan of Chicken and Waffles only because other places I have tried such as (Roscoes Chicken & Waffles) were over pried and greasy or just was too salty and not crispy. Staff was friendly and although it was pretty busy we only waited about 10 min for our order .  The Chicken was very tasty and not as great as I was expecting which is a plus.   Waffles were so moist and yummy . I just wish the Savory Waffle that came with my chicken and waffle skillet order was bigger or they could have given 2 pieces rather than 1 for the amount of chicken it had.   Over all , prices are decent or what you expect for food on the strip . I would defiantly eat here here again. I got back to my moms house wishing I had placed a to-go order.   Wished they had this place in the Bay Area where I'm from but I guess it's a good thing they don't or else I'll be broke and obese if I ate this everyday.. Lol   Try it , you won't be disappointed!!

qTnTPixosfeuGLxUHtxPjQ.text: I was so excited about this place, after having lunch at shake shack. I've decided to come back at night to get some midnight snack, I bought 4 chicken strips with waffle fries.......it come with buffalo sauce and ranch. However the chicken was dry, so disappointed. Sadly to say chick-fil-a taste better than them.

4LGmlkeQRlxCvEGlkn2ZEg.text: The Park itself outside T-Mobile arena has this "legit city" feel to it. I almost forgot what city I was when I was walking down the park. It's tucked in away from the Blvd, there's lots of greenery and the architecture of the arena and the nearby structures was gorgeous.  I was late to the Chicken and Waffles party. I never had them much before. I opted for that Nashville Hot chicken waffle sandwich. I was sold on the heat of it plus a tangy sauce with pickles seemed to make a more complete sandwich than their original Chicken Waffle Sandwich (which seems to only include slaw).   The waffle held up pretty well for the chicken sandwich. It was only near the end where the tangy sauce and the chicken proved too much for the waffle. Waffle could have been cooked a little more to prevent sogginess. The tangy sauce was fantastic touch to the heat of the chicken. Chicken was juicy and rich. The waffle sandwich runs you about $12 by itself but I was very pleased with the sandwich, plus it's still cheaper than getting a good beer in T-Mobile arena. I did eat some chicken tenders from my buddy, that was a little more of a miss. The breading fell off the tender too easily, although the chicken itself was still juicy and delicious.  It was a great pre-wrasslin food. Definitely worth a shot for that delicious delicious chicken and waffles sandwich.

so_391KK48GZcuOFPhD8kg.text: Yummy guilty food pleasure. Their signature dish, The Original Fried Chicken & Waffle was the perfect combination of spice seasoning and sweetness.   I would imagine that this place would be great for large families. The whole family can have a wholesome brunch at a reasonable price before hitting the strip.

BCZwSNu44WvbgCDANDIVKA.text: The food was decent. Nothing mind-blowing, but definitely not disappointing. The food took a long time to come out and the dining room was so loud we could barely hear each other talk. It didn't help that an employee came to clear tables and decided that throwing around the metal trays was acceptable.
