xCA9qMcja1LrcX6nHozNJQ.text: First time at this place...sooooo good!  Love that I can sit and look out at the new Park at NYNY.   Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mushroom and chicken salad is awesome...don&#39;t forget the strawberry palmer!=)

aHL6jzKjEdhL2SFKemnLbg.text: Wow. Just WOW.  I've had a lot. But this one, this glorious place, has the BEST chicken and waffle combos. Make a sandwich of it and I'm YOURS. I love this place, I really do.  It's a bit of a trek to get there, you have to park in the casinos, but I can promise you-it is truly worth it!   I have tried many a chicken and waffle places and this one takes the cake. The waffle is perfectly crispy and the right thickness, the chicken is delicious and juicy with a golden crust. I got the original which has honey chili on it with slaw-Im obsessed! I think I could have this sandwich daily. Their sweet waffles are also super and worth trying. I try to tell as many people as possible about this place, it's a gem and the prices won't break your budget.

SvrOpKu_Lso4LScNFAgiuw.text: This was my Vegas revelation: Bruxie's waffle sandwiches! I did not expect to like it when I first walked in - I am more of a savory and salty kind of person, rather than being inclined to sweet stuff. And naturally, waffles were sweet in my mind. Until Bruxie's!   The waffle was puffy and crunchy in just the right amount. Paired with a Nashville Crispy Chicken and waffle shaped (real) potato fries, the waffle suddenly became a savory food. One I went back to, not just once but twice in the next two days. What was a potentially disastrous experiment for me, became an amazing experience!  I even tried the sugary waffle. Mouth-watering. You need to try both types - sweet and savory - when going there. Oh, and going with the combo is for sure the best choice!   Don't miss it out when in Vegas! The Park is a must-see on The Strip, and Bruxie's is just there in-between New York - New York and Monte Carlo. Just stop and have a seat inside or outside and enjoy the view and more than anything the food. It's like nothing you've tasted before.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie&#39;s waffle shaped potato fries. Made out of real potatoes.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The first Nashville Chicken Waffle Sandwich. Don&#39;t think about the words, just take a bite! It tastes better than it sounds!

qIleiWV5eHStUDWo18fbtQ.text: Delicious breakfast - green eggs and ham!  My only suggestion for improvement - the coffee could have been brought out before the breakfast.

awyIhV3AjPjjdkVF0ZK_Vw.text: It's a bomb waffle and chicken sandwich. The angry mac && cheese is really good. The kickin' chicken and the mac have a little kick. Definitely will come back when in town.

KTVBTYhp_w3beuoiVribVQ.text: Everything was just about okay, not great just okay. Great concepts on food 5stars on that but the either it was an off day or something else it wasn't great of a finished product. So over all just an average 3stars

vN2LWYQ4Pnsdx7BpRyzshg.text: First time and not the last! Food is just really good for the price ! Who doesn't like perfected chicken and waffles !

i5QFc6iq8ri-n81TESV_GQ.text: Huge portions and so good! We had the standard chicken and waffles and they were fantastic. My hubs had been to the Huntington Beach location before and I'm happy he suggested the Vegas spot while we were in town.  They have the pure cane sugar sodas (which I don't need to drink but love them anyways). Service was quick and the staff were friendly.

P9btkLXb-9f_D5pTQumptg.text: This Bruxie location is straight trash! Cold food horrible service manager that doesn't take care of anything! Just a horrible experience! If this is your first time trying Bruxie I'm sorry you had to go to this location the ones in California are way better way more hospitable sand HOT FOOD! SMH! Eat at your own risk! Pretty sure every other place on the strip literally has the basics which is HOT FOOD and better customer service! Terrible establishment! Called prior about allergic options was told everything is good and they had options for all. Soon as we get there and ask it's a different story no options they basically laughed in our face! When telling the manager he said he would take care of it I go sit down I look up and the manager is gone disappeared into thin air! Didn't know they did magic at Bruxie as well!! Smh just horrible man! Gotta get y'all selves together here! Never will I be back at this trash establishment!!

T5FNEH5CMfhtY6WSiYu0Hg.text: This is not your typical chicken and waffle restaurant that are now fairly common. It's a utterly modern update on a concept I thought was complete.  Location: Bruxie is located in the NYNY hotel side of the NYNY, TMOBILE arena, Monte Carlo trifecta. It has indoor modern tech style seating as well as a small outdoor bar type seating area. The outdoor seating  can accommodate up to 10 people with 5 seats on each side with a heating/cooling mechanism above the seating.  Menu: chicken, chicken, more chicken, and a waffle. You can your chicken however you like, to many options to name. I was with a fairly picky eater who opted to have his sandwich "deconstructed" which allows everything to be presented separately so you can decide what to add or take away. Your items are brought to the table when ready. I had the tenders/fries. The tenders were fried to a crisp perfection as were the waffle fries. They were seasoned enough to be tasteful but not over bearing. They offered plenty of accompaniments to add as well.  Price: reasonable and fair averaging $9 per item.  Drinks: the had a selection of beers I wasn't familiar with. I'm not a fan, but for those that are in sure this is exciting. They hand craft all of their sodas. I had the root beer which was absolutely delicious.  Overview: I'm come back any time. The service was excellent, the location perfect, and the food delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chix tenders and waffle fries.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Nachos
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bVXopdUaILWrW8srfcZD3w.text: I wanted to love Bruxie.  My wife and I went on a Sunday morning and the line was out the door.  We expected this so we weren't in a crazy rush.  For whatever reason, they have 2 cash registers but only chose to operate one that day.  I don't understand this at all.  I would assume that Sunday mornings were a normally busy time so why were they not prepared to handle the crowd?  Anyway - on to the food.  Just ok.  I LOVE Nashville hot chicken, so I was super excited to try out the hot chicken and waffles sandwich.  The waffle - very good.  Hot chicken...not so good.  It was super sweet and not what I was really looking for, although I thought the slaw was tasty.  The quality of the chicken was great, very moist, I just didn't love the hot chicken flavor.  My wife got the original and basically gave the same review.  Super super sweet but good waffle and good quality chicken.  Oh yeah - the coffee - DO NOT GET IT.  -3 out of 5 stars.  Burnt, bitter, worst gas station coffee we've ever had.  There was not enough cream/sugar in the building that could have made it taste remotely good.  We may or may not try it again, possibly at a different time of the day to see if anything changed.

1sxbcbtOHsR1_nilxiJhog.text: To begin, I've never had chicken and waffles before, so I didn't know what to expect. We stopped at this place, located at the New York New York Hotel and line was already building, so we thought "why not!". I ordered the Holy Chicken sandwich which had a poached egg, chicken breast, sriracha mayo and of course a waffle as the buns.   When I took my first bite, I was absolutely amazed at how perfect the chicken was. It wasn't undercooked, overcooked, NOTHING! The meat and seasoning was ridiculously good, and the combination of that with the egg and Sriracha mayo made it one hell of a breakfast sandwich.  My only flaw was I paid 20 dollars for a sandwich, small coke and a side of fruit (that came with the sandwich). Seems overpriced as hell, but It was good.

HX3Vxq-z1PBxDZc3xSDCuw.text: Fried chicken and waffle sandwich??  Totally caught my eye as this complex by NYNY is new to me since I was last in Vegas. Came in for lunch and had to try their original chicken and waffle sandwich. Hubby had their hot pastrami and Swiss. We also tried their strawberry lemonade, waffle fries, and mac and cheese.  Maybe I have a giant stomach but I didn't find the sandwich that big. I had plenty of room for sides after eating the sandwich.  Both sandwiches were great - messy but super tasty. Waffles were nice and light and the meats were nicely done. Crispy but not too greasy. Waffle fries were average. Mac and cheese was below average - kind of reminded me of a cheese whiz. Would skip that for sure. Loved the strawberry lemonade! Nice balance against the saltiness of the rest of the meal.  Priced at $10/sandwich and about $3-4/side. Casual option where you order at the counter and take your food once it's ready. Items are made fresh to order.

jPes0CUD2RZxIleAzE67xw.text: I've been to Bruxie in So Cal and was excited to finally get one here.  Stopped in for a bite before a concert at the arena.  They were slammed but kept the line moving.  I ordered the Nashville Style Hot Chicken Sandwich, Lemon Cream & Berries and Strawberry Lemonade.  Food was delicious and good size portions.  I couldn't even finish half and was pretty hungry.  What really put it over the top for me was the customer service.  They were genuinely friendly and nice.  I was asked several times if I wanted a refill on my lemonade, asked how my food was, they took my food and tray for me when I was done, even after I insisted I would do it myself and it was all done in a friendly sincere way.  That kind of service is rare for me for quick service/casual places in Vegas and what gives them 5 stars instead of 4 from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Cream &amp; Berries and Nashville Hot Chicken

0QCCn9P1xTukAjRzmXNM1g.text: I have had my share of chicken waffles in America because I love the sweet and salty mix. But I have to admit this is the best cihicken and waffle I have ever had!!!!  Have to try this place if your here!!!!

tjAnSWwVfg9FxPDvq0KS7A.text: I've had the original, the Nashville, and a nutella dessert waffle. All were delicious. I've gone here twice already and I will probably keep returning. The waffles are the perfect texture and consistency, just the right weight to hold your chicken. The chicken is so crispy and juicy and surprisingly packed with flavor. I dumped syrup all over the sandwiches each time I went and it just adds such a unique flavor. I get the Arnold Palmer, (can't remember if they had a different name for it over there?).. and it's delicious. It has strawberries in it and it just tastes super fresh. If you are staying at one of the nearby casinos or just at an event at Tmobile arena, definitely stop by here!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville

s1NljcAsan2eSOx6zPWVOw.text: Ordered  the El Jefe sandwich with a side mimosa and at first thought i would be disappointed because it came with no fries but trust me when I say that it was one the best chicken Sandwiches I've ever had. The jalapeno slaw was made to perfection and the chicken was spiced and breaded by the God's ! A must try if you're looking for somewhere to brunch

eIUYOdfdyA6IiYYLneOWZA.text: Stopped in for lunch. We ordered the fried chicken salad- kind of a chopped salad with a breaded chicken tender cut into pieces across the top and the Holy Chicken sandwich: A large waffle folded in half as the "bread" and filled with a spicy breaded chicken breast, egg over hard (you can order it any way you'd like), and bacon. My husband said there was a slight hint of syrup but wasn't sure if was baked into the waffle or added as a drizzle. It came with waffle cut fries.   Both items were very large servings with fresh ingredients. The chicken was crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside, and the fries were crispy and hot.   Very enjoyable. Would like to try more items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. what is a Bruxie?
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the Holy cow
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salad with fried chicken

x95mKXnT72KVjuj_w4ipJg.text: So I decided to try Bruxie and let me tell you, it was the best decision I ever made. The food was delicious, friendly service. Although the line was long to order food , it was worth the wait. I definitely will be back next time I visit Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VmsGvQOdLgX0xkVmbP8XrA.text: The waffles were on the perfect side of Belgium: Light and fluffy with right amount of crisp!   The chicken was so juicy with their signature sauce as a compliment: not overwhelming!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UOvAiodKCSrB67WHumdagQ.text: Glad we found this place. Interesting idea that goes very well. Been to this one many times and once to the one in Brea. Nice go to spot wether we're starving or just want something quick.

G_KVawWrXSm7t-WWF5yraw.text: Been here a couple of times now! Sucks that the Chicken Pesto Waffle thingy is off the menu but you can never go wrong with the Classic Chicken Waffle. It's tender, the sauce is incredible and the waffle is crisp.  Their maple syrup is on the light side so be sure to ask for extra bottles! And by bottles I mean the syrup comes in a tiny containers, so yeah, grab some if you need some.  Will be back for more! But lessen the butter smudge on the Naked Waffle

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_XhCW3jbO7LpQr-Y4pSABw.text: Everything is delicious! I love the waffle sandwich! The chicken is very tasty and the waffle is crisp and thin, making for a perfect sandwich. The coffee was strong and bold! If you love dark and heavy coffee then this place is the best place for you! The employees had a great attitude and good advice in the meals and the place is small and gets packed but soooooo worth the wait! When in Vegas this is a must stop!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0IWyPNe1Z-jaDCbDUGO5ig.text: Our breakfast was so yummy and very affordable, especially for Vegas. I will definitely return. We had the waffle sandwich with egg, bacon, and cheese. The waffle fries were good too. I ordered the cranberry lemonade and it was very sweet, but still delicious.

HFJJXkrsR9KvnS-qkEPFAg.text: Must stop for a quick affordable lunch in Vegas.  After that long night before and feel like breakfast/lunch at the same time, this is your place.  So good!

SD7hl1xbxgaikqo7oCTUSw.text: I wish they had more choices for non meat eaters but the green eggs n ham was a hit. i opted out of the ham, and was in love with the pesto and waffle. i wish it were even bigger because it was very tasty. i could eat 3 of them. they have beer too which is great but at $7 for basic beer, i would just wait.

jrOeOAnrHLyS21pJimUkgw.text: Ordered the fried chicken salad to go and was dissapointed to get home and see that the avocado was black throughout. Couldn't believe that someone actually put that on the salad and thought it was okay to serve it to a customer. Won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m4yt8wdR41VbXDgB9OhO4Q.text: My husband and I stayed and the newly remodeled Monte Carlo (now Park MGM) and saw this place when we were walking around. It was the night of the Stanley Cup so every place was packed. We made a mental note to try it sometime. We decided to go there for a late breakfast the next day and are so happy we did! We both got the breakfast sandwich and loved them. The waffles are so light and yummy with just enough crunch. I was disappointed because I had looked at the menu online and was so excited because I wanted to try the Pastrami sandwich and they don't have it at the Las Vegas location. Also I read about the secret dessert and I was too full to order it. Next time for sure!! Service was fast, seating is plenty and the atmosphere is nice. Huge fans to cool you inside and misters outside. Good music playing. We will definitely go back!

bevnsJBZGahsD4H0_AtKKA.text: Not your average chicken and waffles! Bring on the food belly!! Generous portions with so much flavor. Can't wait to tell you how yummy the waffles where they had bits of bacon in the waffle dough along with these itty bitty sweet crunchy pieces whatever they where it was friggen delicious!! The fried chicken had SO much flavor! I did get an added egg on top. I ordered the chicken & waffle plate. Will definitely recommend to anyone visiting Vegas!  Oh and customer service was great too. Well there was this buss boy kid he was super quick on his feet cleaning every table & very attentive in asking everyone if they had needed anything.. Don't remember his name but kudos to him

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the waffles. Bits of bacon and green onion and bits of these sugary pieces? Whatever it is BOMB
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle plate w/ added egg on top

5cs-KfqQZipYcpO3bVFKtQ.text: For the insatiable appetite for chicken and waffles, come to Bruxie. The Original consisted of a big fried chicken breast with a crispy crust, side of cider slaw sandwiches by a waffle. This came with a sweet and hot syrup that married well with the chicken. These were large portions so if you want something small, I recommend sharing. The strawberry lemonade tastes fresh and refreshing in the Las Vegas heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original with side of waffle fries

NDc8DH97MlR4iRVCstMUDw.text: Food was amazing! Tasty chicken for sure!! And the chocolate peanut butter shake was bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk Fried Chicken Cobb Crispy Chicken Tenders Shakes and the holy chicken waffle sandwich!

ZaotQhbhxKIDzfRNzKEMog.text: 4.5 Chicken waffle was delicious! Wasn't sure what to expect but definitely going back.. the eggs were good and the sauce was good!

7351njGWWAUbAqqCKiL35Q.text: Bruxie was definitely a great place to visit and have some amazing food. It is located in "The Park," right next to New York, New York. Park at the Tropicana for free parking! The line stretched outside and we waited our turn to order, which proved to be fairly quickly. We ordered the Holy Chicken and the Angry Tots. The Holy Chicken sandwich was really good, however I felt it somewhat lacked in value for the price tag of $13.50. The angry tots were pretty good as well, although next time I might have to try a different side. Definitely a place to check out if you have the chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry Tots
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Holy Chicken

T1rmTmrUr0savddZF6NVCw.text: The morning after our previous night's wining and dining splurge, we were feeling the serious need to take a down several notches.  We went to Bruxie to grab some breakfast.  I had the Bacon, Egg & Cheddar and my wife had the Green Eggs & Ham (both breakfast sandwiches were $8.25).  Was the sandwich and Bruxie a game-changer?  No.  However, my sandwich was tasty.  It was goodly-sized and filled with a nice amount of bacon, egg, and cheese, while remaining reasonably-priced especially given its center Strip location in the brand-new Park. Service was fast and friendly.  I felt we received outstanding value.  In the "bang for the buck" breakfast comparison with Eggslut (I like Eggslut a lot), for me, Bruxie wins hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar Breakfast Waffle Sandwich

IjBSAPiBC6-ulWvU3foLAg.text: A friend told me about Bruxie just before our trip to Vegas. We were anticipating this meal like it was on our bucket list (ok, maybe for her it was). We arrived around 11am on Saturday which apparently is one of their busiest times of the day, but thankfully once we got there the line was short. Seating is very limited but since it is fast casual, most of the seats clear up after patrons are done with their meals. We were able to secure a table of four after a 3-5 min wait. I ordered their new Holy Cow waffle sandwich. Although I wasn't too sure about having it with egg, I'm glad I did. This gives it a good sweet to savory ratio. I also ordered a side of Angry Mac and Cheese. This is a must. It is cheesy, with a zesty buffalo taste. My friend ordered their bacon waffle and this was amazing! It melts right in your mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IZvYp3qXeJCQk6ZBVZcjjQ.text: This was my first time going to a chicken waffle sandwich place. I decided to order the Crispy Chicken Waffle Sandwich ($11.75).  The waffle was super crunchy and reminded me of eating toast instead of waffles. The waffle was not sweet at all and a little larger than the frozen waffles I see at a grocery store.  It broke very easily when I took a bite.  The chicken was super crispy, but very salty. I felt like drinking a lot of water after eating the whole sandwich.  I liked how there was a lot of lettuce and tomato slices.   The sandwich was very messy and a lot of the sauce would come out.   This place was decent, but I have been to better chicken sandwich places.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Waffle Sandwich ($11.75) (5.5 inches sunglasses for scale)

2uS0BHy5_fO23wPWXbJ0PQ.text: Had a chicken and waffle sandwich here after a victory by the Knights so it made it extra sweet! Had the original based on a recommendation from the person at the counter. Not the chicken and waffle we're nice and crisp with a very savory salt and syrup flavor. Wasn't there for very long but I definitely want to hit it up again when I have the chance. Location, service, food all top notch. Five stars until otherwise experienced.

8YILqtBAc7rec7DS2lb6Mw.text: My girlfriend and I came in for a late morning breakfast prior to heading out of town. Found after a quick search on yelp. Casual counter service with order first and then sit down. I had the breakfast egg bacon and cheddar sandwich, very good. The girlfriend had just a waffle which was perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside. Definitely will check out the other locations when we pass through the LA area on future travels.

lRQreZKxeQsdwAQ4z5b9Dg.text: What's better than chicken and waffles? CHICKEN AND WAFFLES SANDWICH!! I've been wanting to try Bruxie after walking past it while strolling around the strip. There was a poster of their "Holy Chicken!" sandwich outside of the restaurant and I was tempted to try it out for my first time. This sandwich consists of the fried chicken (maple glazed), bacon, cheese, Sriracha sauce, with Sunny-Side Up egg along with the waffles. Bruxie does an amazing job making the waffle crispy thin and not too heavy to go along with the chicken. If you're more of a waffle person than a chicken person, I probably wouldn't recommend it because the waffles are crispier and thin rather than fluffy and sweet!  Their servings are pretty huge but you also get what you paid for as this sandwich was around $13 (YIKES)! I also tried their "Palmer" drink and it was perfect since it was not too sweet.   I came around 11:30-ish am and it wasn't that packed but by the time I left, there was a line out the door around 12pm so I would try to go before noon. There are plenty of seats outside and inside but I can definitely see this place getting packed throughout the day when it would be hard to find a seat.   The process to order and eat is pretty fast and easy. You receive a buzzer while acts like a tracker for the servers to find the table and deliver the food to you! I love this concept because you don't actually have to get up and pick-up your food.   I gave this place a 4/5 because I felt that this place was a boujee way of incorporating soul food for hipsters to like, it wasn't anything too special that "wow'd" me. Overall, I'm a big fan! I definitely will want to come back and try out all their other sandwiches!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken! Sandwich

IcCGOrv2kG6aJeRvv_sLWg.text: Very delicious! We went about 9am not busy. You order when you walk in then they bring to table. Large portions, the waffles are fabulous. Definitely a place will return! We ate before I remembered to take a picture!

TxFrsndEGmeYO5KBXjnoqQ.text: Hubby and I stopped by before our show to grab a quick bite and we both agreed on the Holy! chicken to share.  It is a huge, hearty portion and so delicious and flavorful that we regret not getting our own (well, we could've, but our plan was to share a burger at shake shack right after.  Gotta try everything while you're in Vegas right??).  The waffle is crispy on the outside and light and fluffy in texture.  Chicken was perfectly seasoned, moist and not overly fried.  Bacon had the right thickness and well, nothing can ever be bad about it! The surprise was the sriracha mayo - I personally don't eat spicy but the sriracha mayo was lightly sweetened with a kick and went really well with this sandwich! Two thumbs up - I will have it again next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy! chicken sandwich
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hmmmm glorious!

V9TQ435FcvHv2rf5FkdqUw.text: This was some of the best fried chicken I have had. Every bite was full of flavor. Especially the breading on the chicken. I had the original. Chicken was crunchy, waffle was perfectly done. The sauce and slaw were perfect. My girlfriend had a specialty limited time sandwich. Wish I could remember the name. Had like a Mexican flavor with it. Different type of sandwich but just as good. Service time and friendliness were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot the name. It was a limited time item that was sooo tasty
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original

LNyEQakRl-P_K-JsEmnvPA.text: Bruxie is really good food at a very decent price considering where it is located (the strip).  The food was in my opinion better than some/much of the buffet food I had while I visited.  It's a very nice touch on chicken and waffles with it having a bit more spice than I remember any other place having.  The pure maple syrup in the middle of the desert is kind of funny but of great quality.  I had the chicken strips, one of them was slightly over cooked but the rest were super tender.  The tots were very very good as well.  The only super minor draw back I saw was the tables are bolted on and there is only table for a party of more than 4 being on the same table (you can sit kind of together with gaps).

PN-rHnTfoEgXVqzNX1Rk6w.text: Pretty good chicken and waffle. The waffle was crusty! Different kind of sandwich :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheddar

9YBFFfdpbOFH4fSRBj-7pQ.text: Everything in the world is right with this chicken and waffle joint.  Explosions of savory fried chicken with perfectly cooked waffles dripping with maple syrup.  This place has nailed it and you can't really go wrong.  Add some fries and life is complete.  Find a Bruxie shop and go

IkSBylBPOhacqh5SMXIsYA.text: Great chicken tenders and waffles!  Waffle was very light and did not leave you feeling stuffed.  Very friendly and helpful staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders and waffle

mQsAVXW1iJNruEzm1M21qQ.text: This might be the BEST FOOD I've ever had in my life. If you want a late night snack, or feast... come here! Amazing!!!

IJI8CwU29bw_sk3yYMT2hw.text: Love Bruxie - need to beat the crowds and get here early.  Green eggs and ham for breakfast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZzGlnDfogLsjLp1f70k_zA.text: Some people steer away from places like these because of the "hype" but I think Bruxie lives up to its name. Living in the Bay Area, the closest one would be LA. I frequently visit Las Vegas, and I always find myself at Bruxie at least once on my vacation.  Everything I've ordered so far has been delicious - the original chicken sandwich, Irish nachos, chicken tenders, etc. So many different options! The waffles are perfect substitutes from your typical bun or bread. Chicken comes out piping hot and crispy. Sauces and slaw add flavor and an extra depth of texture.  I'm a huge fan or Chick-Fil-A, but Bruxie wins with their waffle fries. Always crispy and fresh. If you like them loaded, try the Irish nachos! Cheese, sour cream, bacon. Yum.  A typical order of one sandwich and an order of Irish nachos is perfect to share between two people. Depending on when you come, the lines could be out the door or nonexistent. It's typically more busy around brunch.  Decent portions. Crispy waffle fries. Real cane sugar sodas. Free refills (just ask). Bruxie, please open one closer to home.

fslTAFDnAX-mevUXzIwfUg.text: My first ever visit to a Bruxie ever. I liked the atmosphere a lot. Lots of seating available. We showed up early for breakfast and beat the rush.  I loved the iced coffee and my sandwich was great! After seeing what others had ordered I knew I'd have to go back and try other things. Very good and I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cbkaN3VjmXeLdDAZrXUnRg.text: I can't think of a single reason to give Bruxie less than perfect Yelp stars.  Delicious Cluckin BBQ Chicken Sandwich($12.95); a lot going on between two sauces, slaw, pickles, crispy onion strings, & a substantial Portuguese bun, but not overwhelmingly so.   I didn't try her Holy Chicken! Chicken & Waffle Sandwich ($14.50) but the combination of a cheese-covered waffle, runny egg, & applewood smoked bacon cradling maple glazed fried chicken got my breakfast companions' approval.   He ordered Chicken & Waffles ($11.25) & best believe I stole bites of his side of tots, sips of his extra buttery (I don't know how else to describe it) Strawberry Shorty Shake, & damn-near half of his butter & maple syrup-topped waffle. I'm clearly not one of those girlfriends whose scared to eat in front of her boo.   Casual breakfast spot outside of New York New York. Order at the counter; grab your own water, utensils, & condiments; food is brought to your table. Friendly staff, reasonable prices. Thx for a decadent first meal, Bruxie!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sxeY7HpDXE_puNUC2tXJgw.text: Wow. Get the holy chicken and enjoy the best breakfast sandwich you'll ever eat.   Lines develop early and seating is limited. Expect to drop $16 per person if you want a meal. But well Worth it. Everything is mouth watering.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prepare to wait.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken... very possibly the best breakfast sandwich I&#39;ve ever eaten!

_WZtkjiQDqwzGh_P01H-QQ.text: The sandwich was bomb. I got the holy chicken waffle sandwich and would definitely recommend it. Only thing stopping the 5 star review was the tater tots and fries we added to the meal were not that good. Tots didn't even seem spiced and idk the waffle fries tasted kind of funny.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy chicken waffle sandwich with added 2 sides (waffle fries and spiced tots)

H7J07BoTxV4KIXi-0q50UQ.text: Holy chicken! I love chicken and waffles, but this takes it to a whole new level. Probbaly the best waffle sandwhich I've ever had-- and they do have syrup available if you like the savory/sweet combo.   I got the holy chicken which had fried chicken, bruxie sauce, bacon and a runny egg [gotta love the runny egg] and topped it off with syrup. Also had a shorty strawberry milkshake on the side. The shake didn't taste like all sugar, they made it with real strawberries which was a nice side to balance out the salty taste from the bacon.   I loved that there was also outdoor seating as the weather in Vegas was perfect in May.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy chicken! Topped with Syrup and served with a side of shorty strawberry milkshake! ^_^ so good

vms5olwA8Xg0pfXL2H-lbQ.text: Bruxie was banging!  I went with the jalapeno coleslaw fried chicken sandwich.   Bun was light and fluffy, golden crispy on the outside, fried chicken was juicy, tender and super crispy. I liked how they weren't stingy on the coleslaw. *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED IF YOU LOVE COLESLAW*  Also had chicken and waffles. Again, crispy tender juicy chicken, and crispy fluffy waffles that are soft on the inside. I left Bruxie satisfied, perfect serving sizes.   Waited in line for about 10 mins, food came out within 5. Nice staff.

hcE2yxpCjR6Wipq5OEDfYg.text: Usually when I'm traveling near or far I try to make an effort to seek out new and unusual food offerings.  This is why I never eat at Bruxie in LV. Until yesterday.   I have like 3 Bruxies near my house, so I can pretty much get my fill whenever I want to.   We were staying at a Hotel across the street and were cutting it kinda close to check out time.  No worries, we ran across the street and got a quick bite to eat.  I LOVED this breakfast Sammy.  I got the Egg, cheddar and bacon on a waffle, and my husband got the chicken, egg, cheese and bacon on a waffle.  His had a sirracha mayo on it, and he said it was a plenty spicy sandwich.   The waffles were really crispy, and delicious.  I may have to re-think my view of LV Bruxie, because I will most certainly be back.

a9YBn-lFFStt2VP3TdogxQ.text: Came here for breakfast and I must say, it was a little too heavy for breakfast but it was good.  There were 3 of us and we shared Irish nacho waffle fries and BAMF (fried chicken waffle sandwich).  The server was so nice they were able to cut into 3 pieces for us, it was actually good size for all of us to share and we were full for a while too.    I like the fried chicken waffle sandwich, the chicken was very tender and the flavor was just right.  Never had mac & cheese inside of a sandwich, and their mac & cheese was on point.  I think if we have one more person I would have just got the mac & cheese on the side to share. next time.   This is the type where you pay first and find your own table spot.  we got lucky and we found this long table for the 3 of us.  As we were leaving, there was a long line waiting for tables, come early, so you can get a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish nacho waffle cut fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BAMF: fried chicken, Mac and cheese waffle sandwich

zOdpfsgrEjpPB9tcCbWMRg.text: We went to Bruxie the day we were leaving Vegas. We wanted to have a last meal in Vegas before we flew out so we literally arrived at Bruxie at exactly 8:30am to go eat chicken and waffles. There were other people waiting outside then too so it's definitely a popular place!   I ordered the Holy Chicken sandwich with waffle fries as a side and a coffee. The sandwich looked amazing!!! It also tasted amazing! The chicken was cooked really well and the waffle and chicken and bacon was the perfect combination of sweet and salty. The waffle fries were great and the coffee was also (surprisingly) very good! This is a must stop-by place on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken!

2k7qEDDpxmbPvxDpjZ3eEw.text: We went here right after landing in Vegas and checking into our hotel in order to fill our growling stomachs and get ready for our first day of vacation. The food was overall pretty good, but I wasn't overly impressed with anything. When you have all the other delicious options in Las Vegas, Bruxie probably doesn't make the cut for me as something to write home about.   The chicken was really crunchy and well seasoned, which I really liked. I found the waffle to be overly moist to the point of sogginess. My sandwich, however, did have pretty good balance of flavors and textures. I will say this-- get their vanilla latte!!! Seriously. It's the best vanilla latte I've ever had. I would go back over and over, but solely for the vanilla latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J5aETi-uoor8q-0l6Y3KWw.text: I wasn't overly impressed with the fried chicken. I had the Hatch killer cheesy tots which were amazing! I also ordered the hatch chicken sandwich. The sandwich was extremely messy and had too much of some kind of sauce on it to be able to taste anything else. I would return for the tots, but not for the sandwich.

NtEZ2sXZVZ6QN8PmDmFktg.text: This place is bomb!!! Was waiting for the hello kitty cafe to open and decided to have breakfast here. We had the holy shit chicken and waffles with a side of tots! Came out to be $20 but I shared with a friend and it was perfect! The waffle is light, flakey and buttery the bacon was bomb and the chicken was alright. I really like the spicy ketchup too!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy shit with a side of tots!!!

0U9JYN5DO3hM5SXgJWa8fg.text: Overall, I really enjoyed my Bruxie sandwich. My husband and I went halvsies in a holy chicken and a green eggs me ham. The holy chicks  was by far the better of the two. Green eggs was a bit cold which was disappointing, but flavor was there. I do feel like the restaurant was disheveled and bathrooms messy - sandwiches are messy so I'm sure that doesn't help with the madness. However having to wipe your own table from other people to sit there sucks. Otherwise, service was quick and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken

Jm1vBO6JlA-D_-To2vN-HQ.text: Located near Park MGM.    I came here for one thing and one thing only....Strawberry Creme Brulee Waffle!!  It's the best thing there.  The waffle is made to order.  It came out hot, crisp and filled with custard and strawberries...Mmm Good!

hX47gyMlAWy_D-cW3kbmeQ.text: All the rave is totally accurate! This place is awesome and I would highly recommend it if you're in the mood for some chicken and/or waffles!   We had the chicken tenders with fries (the original seasoning) and their strawberry creme brulee waffle and OMG everything was so delicious! Plus the prices were reasonable and our food arrived relatively quickly upon ordering even though the place was busy, so nothing to complain about really.  The tenders were perfectly cooked, the seasoning was tasty, but the best part was definitely the waffle. Even though I'm a huge Nutella fan we wanted to try something different so went with the strawberry creme brulee and were not disappointed! Definitely could be shared between 2 people. I guess the one downside is our waffle got a bit cold as we were eating our chicken, but I can't imagine how much better it would've been if it were warmer since it was still fantastic while cold! It had plenty of strawberries in it, all bite sized, and the amount of creme brulee to waffle ratio was perfect.   So anyway, highly recommended for a quick lunch, especially if you're craving some delicious fried chicken and waffles that are filling and also one that won't destroy your wallet like a majority of places in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original seasoning 4 chicken tenders and fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry creme brulee waffle! Enough for 2 to share

XiIBJrLMWpSI6jgEgwrW3Q.text: I was looking at the reviews looking for a quick place for brunch. I am sooo glad I came here, really delicious food, perfect after a night out! I tried my cousins margarita and it was perfect, strong and tasty. Good place to people watch too!

wyUkquw3LedtHcZw97esnA.text: This is a fast food joint with amazing Chicken and Waffles. My friend and I were walking down the strip just to get some fresh air. We found a long line outside of this food establishment. I quickly checked Yelp to see what others were saying about this place. I read mostly good reviews. As I finished reading some reviews, my friend and I noticed that the line was moving quite quickly.   We decided to get in the line and order something to share to see what the hype was about. As we had previously just had a meal an hour before coming here, we figure we would get something simple. We ordered the plain chicken and waffles without any sides.   We walked back to the hotel and divided our chicken and waffle in half. One bit in and I knew I had a winner in my mouth. The waffle was so crispy. The chicken was crispy on the outside and extremely tender and moist on the inside. The chicken batter had some spice and something a little sweet in the batter, giving it this amazing taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside sign
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

mtHdwjWnxL5HpQyK_BFxlA.text: If I could order everything on their menu, I totally would! Just the thought of chicken & waffles puts a smile on my face!  It's a pretty chill place with great food! I ordered the Holy Chicken Sandwich & holy moly was it AH-mazing!  Definitely check this place out if you can =)

Pc3UJkoARUzk9M4u3Kw96g.text: Good god what a wonderful hangover cure or indulgence. My buddies and I managed to make it here after a rough night (probably didn't have to state that as it is Las Vegas).  I went all out and ordered the B.A.M.F. which consisted of Fried Chicken, Angry Mac & Cheese, Cheddar, Pepperoncini, and Angry Cheese Sauce all on a delicious waffle. I also had a side of tater tots and coleslaw which wasn't really necessary but nonetheless delicious.   For sure recommend this place. I'd like to try out several other things on their menu. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll probably be stopping in here for a quick meal.

GYUcnHoHME_43C_s9OPHQg.text: I needed something filling in stomach after a night of drinking in Vegas.. we arrived at Bruxie around noon on Sunday, wasn't too packed and the line was short. I ordered the original fried chicken and waffle sandwich and a strawberry lemonade to drink. If you sign up for their rewards you can get a free drink, so my lemonade was free! I loved that there was a syrup dispenser along with the ketchup dispenser! They also had a self-serve water jug.  The sandwich was just what I needed.... juicy dark meat chicken, perfectly fried and crisp on the outside. It also came with chili honey and cider slaw. The slaw was well dressed and came with the perfect amount, but I wish the chili honey had more chili in it! I added a bit of cholula hot sauce throughout the sandwich which made it perfect. I also wished the waffle wasn't as crispy and maybe thicker or fluffy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

axd7nW1J27Wr0nvqbdH8TA.text: The best chicken waffle ever! It is a bit pricey but super worth it.  The chicken was juicy and tender and the waffles were crispy. Also ordered Fried tender chicken which was good.  The line is always long to wait but service is pretty quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jd1wuuAmc_WG9n30_vNTxQ.text: This was a great place! Service was friendly and the food was delicious.. exactly what we needed after a long day of traveling. You can listen to live music while eating your meal. I definitely suggest this place if you're around New York New York or Monte Carlo.

Bvvjfi1MNOhiUWL-utthSQ.text: Great place for a quick, relatively cheap and above average breakfast on the Strip.  Go before 10 on Saturday for virtually no wait. By 10:30 a line was forming.    Added bonus: their coffee was pretty damn good.

mfCkVaxOr1mD5AyJAXb2WA.text: Great stop!  Located in the park, indoor and outdoor seating.  Staff very polite, attentive and ready to offer menu suggestions.  Original chicken and waffles was great.  Crisp and freshly made.  I might have enjoyed the spicy versiin more...next time.  Also had the creme brulee...with fresh strawberries in september.  Was just right amount of custard so the waffle wasn't dry without syrup, bit wasn't soggy either.  Fresh squeezed oj?!?  Who does that?  It was delicious!  Coffee is BOLD, as it says.  Free ice water, so you can fill up your water bottle if you are like me.  Would return for sure.

CVBmwjFkAoWa7uwDrFlfMw.text: the food was awesome! The service at that location was impeccable. Enjoyed the food since it was my 1st time. Would go back again, and again..

G05RuqXCLxNO6sTz65i2ng.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast waffle sandwiches and dessert waffle sandwiches. Incredibly delighted and fast service. The only thing I'd say is the coffee is atrocious so just don't order coffee but I enjoyed everything else so much I needed to give 5 stars

pjF4ZBJeSsZ3RXzWuIK_OQ.text: Good place to go after a night full of drinking. I got the breakfast sandwich that had pesto and was tasty

5qyK45fCB1kdJ1aMnUKz4A.text: We were staying in the Las Vegas strip for 8 days and stumbled across this amazing find, it was so good that we ate lunch here twice while in town. The specialty here is chicken and waffles sandwiches. The waffles they use are nice and thin and crispy, and the chicken is fried to perfection. We split the crispy chicken sandwich is battered and fried twice. It's moist with a perfectly fried outside with a little hint of heat. We also got fries and a drink with our sandwich. All the soda is made in house with real sugar and it's absolutely delicious. We also split a side of bacon Mac and cheese which was deliciously cheesy. For dessert we shared a Nutella and banana dessert waffle which was a perfect sweet treat and dusted with powdered sugar. The staff here is also super friendly and helpful. You order at the counter and then they bring the food out to you table and will check on you. If you are on the strip and wish to have chicken and waffles you must check this place out. If you're not into chicken and waffles they have other sandwiches served on waffles like a turkey club or even just chicken tenders. This place opens at 9am and serve till midnight or later.

yiSgrqRo4lE0wCKMUlMt7w.text: Good food! Decent price! Chicken is awesome! We came as a large party and they reserved tables for us.  They even treated the birthday guy to dessert.

zLgguw6rQXxPKRmlhtWeAg.text: the line was quick. The menu straight forward. Chicken and waffle sandwiches. Meals individually prepared were hot and fresh. Tables service consisted of placing order and meal brought to table.  Good enough for lunchtime fare

onBuQpTmeXGYFdD77W-cIw.text: This establishment offers a very nice change of pace from the rest of the food around here. And what I mean is the feeling of "hipster food" coupled with not so hipster prices. I never had anything like this before, and I'm not even much of a waffle fan, however it was quite tasty and super fairly priced. Tried the fried chicken, pulled pork, sundae, and some other sweet object I can't quite remember, and it was fantastic. Only thing I'd humorously complain about though is the strength of your overhead fan. My bbq stained tissues were flying all over haha.

K68NAJuQLO07awWsEOJPsg.text: Always wanted to try Bruxie's especially not having the chance to go in California! Found out there was one in Las Vegas so definitely had to try it. Went on a Friday morning and waited about 15 minutes. Ordered the original chicken and waffles, green eggs and ham and the chicken fried poutine waffle fries! For all three the total came out to be $28 dollars. For myself and my two brothers we had a hard time finishing it all and they're big boys. I recommend trying the original chicken and waffle sandwich! The waffle was spectacular especially when fresh, so crispy!!!! On the green eggs and ham there was wayyyyy too much pesto and had to scrape it off but it was a good try! For the poutine fries,I felt that there was not a good chicken ratio to the fries, like having too much rice with meat it's just bleh. But overall the cheese curds were pretty good and the gravy itself! Waffle fries = plus one! Their dessert waffles looked amazing too but decided not to get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green eggs and ham, original chicken and waffle sandwich and fried chicken poutine fries

du8LJvBeh0gkxg9jpSxC9A.text: Casual and very reasonable for the LV strip. I had the 2 piece fried chicken and waffles which were awesome and my hubby had a sausage, egg and cheese on waffle sandwich. We both had fresh squeezed OJ which was yummy. Staff was very friendly, even the gentleman bussing the tables.

Ew3pA3v4LoaKeIGH3jhOTQ.text: Great food! I had the original chicken waffle sandwich and it was amazing. My wife had the bacon and egg waffle sandwich, she really enjoyed it as well.

a2EVZYt5uHTEhp4vaHunWg.text: I am so sorry that I forgot the picture before we started eating!!  But this was such an unexpected pleasure and I am so glad that we came here.  We ordered 2 sandwiches, the Original and the Southern BBQ sandwiches, and one order of fries to split.  Food portion was generous and so so FRESH!!  Also, the team here was so pleasant and exhibited high customer service skills.  I am so impressed. One of the better deals on the strip for sure.  Good atmosphere for all clientele....the party goers and the family crowd.   Just come HUNGRY

GANu0oiF7Nane3I0gdwv_Q.text: I ordered the orignal waffle sandwich which had the the fried chicked, it was quickly served and so crispy inside out. The price was reasonable consider the restaurant is located right on the Strip

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SCoRvcY91YrP-konoOII-A.text: It's been years since my fist several visits to the original location in Orange County since it is quite a drive from me (just under 100 miles). My finacee and I were hungry after walking around the strip and I was happy to find out that they had a location in Las Vegas. There was line that was out the door when we arrived, but it moved quickly and our orders were taken and we were sat before we knew it. Now, since the only other Bruxie I've been to was the original location, I wasn't used to the servers having to get your drinks for refills. I understand why because of the way the setup is for this particular location, just wondering if the other locations in CA do this as well? We ordered "The Original" and added an egg to it, the "Nashville Hot", a Strawberry Palmer, and a ginger soda. I'm glad to say that the food was just as tasty and just as enjoyable as the original location. My finacee enjoyed the Original very much. The chicken filet still had that nice crunch to it and the nice flavor of the herbs and spices. My Nashville Hot had a nice kick to it, but I don't think people from Nashville would call this "hot" at all. I enjoyed it because I was able to still taste the chicken, the kick of the spice, and the rest of the seasoning, without overpowering my palate. The Strawberry Palmer was flavorful enough to get the strawberry flavor without being overly sweet. The Ginger soda was a bit strong on the ginger flavor. Also, unfortunately the waffle fries were a bit tough and luke warm. I prefer my fries, crisp and hot. Those were the only small bumps on the road and still an overall great experience for the both of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville Hot
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original + egg

0TLHGd3Wie0FM_SUiQFXpQ.text: After being curious about this place for a while and having spent many hours staring at their waffle and chicken sandwich, we decided to check this place out!  It is fantastic!  I was surprised how much I enjoyed everything we ordered.  We wanted to try a couple things so we got The Original Chicken and Waffle sandwich - it was excellent and I loved the fact I could actually hold the entire sandwich in my hand and eat it.  It made the experience and flavor much better to me than the huge plates at some of the other chicken and waffle spots.  We also ordered the Chicken Tenders plate and Waffle Fries.  Also incredible~ . This is a new favorite spot.  And the price is very reasonable.  So, if you are in the mood for some delicious comfort food - Bruxie is it!!!

gheaSGt2RqbghEIOO2srCQ.text: Great spot in the new Park area by T-Mobile arena. Lots of seats, both outside and inside. There is someone out front too who can guide you through their menu when walking by.  Never had a waffle sandwich before, so I ordered the pulled pork sandwich. It came on a tray, with the sandwich propped up on a piece of cardboard. It came with a pickle and some extra sauce. Wasn't sure how to eat it - hold it like a sandwich or knife/fork? When I picked it up, unfortunately all the pork fell out because the fold in the waffle was all soggy. Not appetizing. It was like the waffle wasn't cooked long enough to develop that light crunch on the outside. My friend's waffle sandwich fared a little better but I could see it was also not crisp enough.  If they cooked the waffle a little longer, it would have been perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork

PzPhqgzkF__DQelxUgiW2A.text: This place was amazing! I'd never had chicken and waffles before and this was the perfect place to try it. I got the simple two piece chicken and waffles. The chicken was crispy and had a maple glaze on it. The waffle had melting butter and the two combined very well, I was afraid it might be too dry but it was extremely juicy. My wife and friends got the sandwiches which is their specialty and they enjoyed them. I didn't get one because I don't like eggs. The employees were very nice and answered all our questions and cleaned our plates as we finished but we didn't feel rushed out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UFyEnyGA07CZN-P2Dy64qQ.text: Stopped in around 3 on Friday, there was no line. I ordered the 3 piece chicken (2 boneless breasts and 1 boneless thigh) plus a waffle to share with my kids. Total came to about $16. Took about 15 min to come out but man it was worth the small wait! The chicken was so crispy and piping hot. The butter was melting into the waffle. I drizzled syrup on the waffle and started cutting into bite size pieces. My kids loved the chicken, they said the waffle was just ok but I thought the waffle was outstanding! My order was way more than enough to share and we all left full and happy! Will definitely be back to try some other items on the menu.

agjVMpFxRd1Q0EaRae5T0g.text: I wanted to check out this place due to the reviews but honestly, I've had better chicken and waffles. I had the original because how else can you compare anything if you didn't have the original. I went around noon because I didn't have breakfast that day. The line was short and you order and pay at the register. You hold onto a buzzer and they bring out the food when ready. You grab the utensils you need, extra syrup if you want and water is dispensed near there as well. I don't think they have people cleaning after you all the time, so the table we sat at was dirty from the customers before us. It's a big portion but I think it's doable to finish the meal by yourself. There wasn't really anything special about the chicken or the waffle. I felt like the waffle was similar to an Eggo waffle and the chicken was small. The cole slaw wasn't anything special and there's a lot of hype to this place but maybe I ordered the wrong thing. I wouldn't recommend ordering the original because I have had better plain chicken and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original chicken and waffle

WS6xn7FL0bY1Us8xWbqAHg.text: Bruxie is a good place to visit on the Strip! It's a little more than just a chicken samndwich place. Your chicken comes on a waffle! And you can get a combo with waffle fries! The Original chicken sandwich was really good-I definitely ate all of it, along with my waffle fries! The service was nice and fast. I enjoyed my strawberry lemonade as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original

hkKUZaJBAGMr8aK9x9bFng.text: The flavors were fantastic, but the execution was below par. I got the B. A. M. F. that comes with waffle, chicken, Mac and cheese. My noodles were cold.

AjsGrdUglo4kVKXI_g5xVA.text: Saw this place when we were coming back to the  hotel from exploring the strip.  Chicken and waffles!!! So we tried it and was sooo goood!! Holy chicken waffle was amazing and so as the plain waffles... very tasteful and crispy waffles... we coming back here next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yItzNKRUs9KJ59_6Gp5-xQ.text: While on the prowl for dinner walking down the strip, our group was on our way towards Shake Shack for some burgers and custard. Before lining up we noticed something new and decided to check out Bruxie.  While everyone in our group ordered chicken and waffles, for some reason I thought to myself that a salad would be good. I know, I know, who in their mind would go to Bruxie and think...gee I've eaten so much fatty food while in Vegas, maybe I'll just get a salad :/ Surprisingly enough, the Roasted Mushroom & Grilled Chicken salad was more than I could have ever hoped for. The tasty chicken was balanced balanced out with Crimini Mushrooms, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Herb Goat Cheese, Romaine & Arugula, Lemon Vinaigrette and a Balsamic Reduction. The portion itself was huge and probably should have fed at least 2 people but I was hungry and ate it all.  The girl at the counter was friendly, there was ample seating at 9pm on a Friday, and our food was brought out to our table with a smile. I'll be back Bruxie!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Crimini Mushroom and Grilled Chicken Salad w/ Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Goat Cheese, Romaine &amp; Arugula, Lemon Vinaigrette &amp; Balsamic

Ji41vdo2HikBFmF7QdeFiw.text: Excellent for and service. As previous yelpers have said, this place is located on the strip and it is definetly a place to eat at when on the strip.  I walked in a few minutes before they closed and still had excellent service. This location is clean and staff is very friendly. I've only been to bruxie a few times before my yelp days and i have to admit that this location is so far the best one i have been to.   Service : 10/10 They patiently waited for me to order and presented the food to us in a timely matter. Polite and gave recommendation based on whay we we were craving.  Cleanliness : 10/10 Staff was constantly cleaning, even the restrooms were tidy. Little no mess in the eating room.   Food: 10/10 Both of our orders were hot and fresh. Our food consisted of a breakfast waffle sandwich and a waffle chicken sandwich. Our fries were still hot when the food arrived.   Overall 10/10. I definetly recommend going if you want some grest food on the strip!

bm61juTaY7KmNW6nHHj2Ag.text: If you want a good bang for your buck, this is the place to come!  Went here with a group of friends and we all loved what we got.  - Chicken tenders - Fried pickles - Sausage, egg, and cheese - Chicken and waffle sandwich - Nutella banana waffle  Everything was cooked perfectly. The waitress running the food out was so kind. Just be cautious of when you eat here. The line can get extremely long, so allow plenty of time if you are going at peak hours.

XCFacYtnIDo_WgUdZkghxw.text: It's chicken and waffles place.. I had so much better. Eating the waffles sandwich was not easy, once you pick it up don't put it down again.   It's a order and sit down joint. No table service. Why the wait to place your order. No friendly greetings, music to is loud.... Maybe I'm old.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAbaP5GGlscfINa9VjGJmA.text: It's good but not great.  The food is not very exciting.  It's fresh and good just boring.  I got the "kickin" waffle sandwich, the ketchup I added shouldn't be the star of the dish.  It's gourmet food for the masses.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zk0XTob_S8v3nb9uXehvvQ.text: Oh wow this place is awesome! I walked over a half hour through the hordes on The Strip to get to Bruxies then did the exact same thing the very next day...YES it's That Good!! I had the two pieces of breaded boneless chicken with half waffle, sooo bloody good! Moist, delicious chicken with perfect crunch and seasoning paired with a waffle which had a crunchy crust with a soft chewy interior all the above smothered in real maple syrup! I also had the cream brulee waffle stuffed with strawberries- OMG! Worth going back for more. These people know how to do delicious. Just Go There!!

6yvFFJ8YvSusZ9UBCfIlcA.text: God damn what a disappointment.  I ordered the chicken tenders w/ waffle fries, fried pickles, and the mac n cheese. Sounds like I'll have a solid meal, but my tenders came out cold as fuck. It must have been sitting out while the other stuff was getting made, but that's not my fault when I'm paying them for a good meal. The fried pickles were also underwhelming. The only decent thing was the mac n cheese and the green eggs and ham sandwich (took a bite of my friends).  There are so many places to try in Vegas that I don't think I'll be going back.

12D-NiEqoTR_G-r3E81sOQ.text: Meal #6 of Vegas 2017 Trip  I kept wanting to call it Brexit. And really I wanted to take a Brexit from Bruxie because the place was super cold. They kept the door propped open during the lunch hour and we all wanted to wear our coats. Plus the music was way too loud.  It didn't improve that much with the food. The husband and I got the classic fried chicken waffle sando. If I was blindfolded I would have just guessed I was eating sauce on crispy bread. Any subtlety of flavor was lost with the sweet chile sauce which overwhelmed everything. I had hoped the slaw could have cut the spicy sweetness (and for the record I can handle spiciness) but there wasn't enough of it. I did request pickles which helped a little.  The waffle fries were good at least.  Our Las Vegas 2017 Trip  5 Stars Border Grill, Mandalay Bay (brunch) Grimaldi's, The Palazzo Bouchon Bakery, The Venetian (snack) Eggslut, Cosmopolitan (snack)  4 Stars Payard, Caesars Palace Border Grill, Caesars Palace Shake Shack, New York New York  3 Stars  Tournament of Kings, Excalibur BRUXIE, NEW YORK NEW YORK Therapy, Downtown

2Wz7gIfWusHApy0jKZL67Q.text: Nice deviation from the usual breakfast buffets.  We were staying at The Luxor hotel and did not know that this place was within walking distance (more than 5 and less than 10 minutes walk).  It was busy, with people lining up all the way to the door, but the line moved fairly quickly.  I ordered the Green Eggs and Ham waffle and my husband ordered The Original (chicken and waffles, with chilli honey).  OMG!  It was delish!  The waffle is fluffy but not overwhelming, and the eggs and pesto were a great match!  My husband really enjoyed The Original and said it was one of the best he's had.  The chilli honey was a nice addition!  I had iced tea, which was not only refreshing, but you can actually taste it.  My husband had an iced coffee with had a surprising kick and it was refreshing as well.  We wanted a sweet treat, but the waffles were enough to satisfy our hanger pangs (yes, we were almost hangry -angry hungry).  I got a refill of their delicious tea, which they graciously offer.  The service was fast and friendly, but the place tends to be loud and busy (although we walked by at around 2ish and it was not as busy).  Even though I do not want to go back to Las Vegas, I hope to try this gem of a place in maybe California!  :)

WVPVpQQ31UNAdpz97GqS4w.text: Bruxie has the only damn affordable and delicious food on the strip. I was so happy with my breakfast creme brulee waffle (only $6.50!) and the bite of my wife's original, that I returned for dinner that night. The crispy waffle and perfectly fried and seasoned chicken, the fresh slaw, and jizz-your-pants amazing syrup sauce all rocked my world. And that was just the "original!" Don't waste your money on crap buffet food if you're anywhere near this place.

CwLbQOlcr45wQarRiUaAUg.text: Food and service were great! I got the original friend chicken sandwich on a waffle! Amazing!! Chicken is made to order, hot and fresh! Great taste! Great location you can sit inside or outside. The service was great. The manager kept busy keeping drinks full and making sure food was good and noting was needed.

GXvFjFODk2j5DjPUoBc5NA.text: Awesome staff! I can't begin to describe how great the staff is at this location. The line goes by quickly and your food comes at fresh every time. The chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned and the waffle was crispy. We are here 3 days in a row while in vacation and were never disappointed.

sFaerm7q4Z0evivJfhlBeA.text: Oh my heck!!!! This place was AMAZING! Came for breakfast and got the Nashville hot chicken, the holy chicken sandwich, and the bacon Mac and cheese! All of it was so yummy! Definitely coming here on every Vegas trip from here on out!

fmwzGyG3iJ-pOyglkcFgzA.text: We had such a great time at Bruxie, with great ambiance and customer service, and the food was delicious. The waffles are so light, and amazing - not what you'd expect from a waffle. The hot pastrami was great and their famous chicken waffle was incredible...and the ice cream was perfect!

mbq5pYYGwmJ_bj_yGgrV1g.text: The food was incredible, but we were given the same wrong order twice, it took 30+ minutes after placing our order to get our food, and the two parties next to us were given wrong orders multiple times as well. There was a ton of food cooked and ready to be served but despite several (6? 8?) food runners and managers, they just couldn't get it together. Hence four vs. five stars.   That being said, it would get five stars if they got their act together in the service front. The waffles were crispy and buttery tasting without being too greasy, and the flavor combinations were creative and delicious. We ordered the sausage and egg waffle, the pesto and egg waffle, and the lemon berry waffle (side notes: the pesto is what elevated the already good flavor of that waffle sandwich, and the lemon berry waffle needs more berries). All were incredible and we would go back here in a heartbeat if we came back to Vegas.

4CIBGydtR8vII2ZkDt2sfQ.text: Simply the must have in Vegas! I have tried many chicken and waffles but their ones are too notch, I went there nearly everyday while I was in Vegas.

RSzDDaYBXya-t_Xy7rXizQ.text: The food was bomb!!  The people that work there were super friendly.  For self service they asked offered and brought is everything we needed.  Then they were right there to collect our plates and trash when we were finished.  Little pricey..$7.00 for a smart water but it's on the stop and people were paying it so I guess why not!!.

a4jyscMN5Sze23D0jF7yVg.text: My boyfriend and I were on vacation staying at the Aria and not a day went by without fitting in a Bruxie meal (sometimes twice). I even snuck out while he napped and got the skillet waffle with pork (my boyfriend is anti pork) but I had to! Boy, oh boy am I glad. It was phenomenal! And the honey hot sauce just makes your mouth water. The staff is super friendly and they even honored an expired online special, which was great. I can't wait to get back to Vegas for this place. It's so dangerously close to the Aria. You'll be addicted.

TVi4OTJm0dNgrR11Pz3Asg.text: LIBERO IN LAS VEGAS: In town for a volleyball (vball) tournament and Las Vegas is a destination for many things, including an interesting dining experience. Back in November we tried chicken and waffles (C&W; someone in our trio's first time) and I was directed to try Bruxie, a restaurant with locations here as well as in Southern California.  A 'libero' in vball is responsible for defense and to foster rallies and digs to make the game more fun to watch. I give you this definition because Bruxie reminds me of this role. A re-imagined take on what is now an epidemic of C&W spots all claiming to be authentic, Bruxie's twist is presenting the dish as a sandwich with the waffle's role creating the excitement.  Used as the bread, now C&W is a sandwich to be picked up, held and savored. Some have lettuce, arugula pesto, tomato and various preparations of chicken - Nashville hot, original seasoned, crispy and buffalo-style. Lot of choices including dessert waffles, custards  and sundaes so there's something for everyone who wants decadence with skosh of guilt. Don't expect any healthy options here!  The chicken was the star for me. Served hot (although not too busy, it took a little longer than we thought), golden brown w/a kick of heat on the backside and extremely flavorful with an crunchy crust drizzled in chili honey my two piece original was moist white meat which I'd recommend. Now I understand what the few extra minutes were for - fresh preparation.  For me though, the waffle wasn't as successful. With the two piece you get a bacon cheddar waffle. Thick in height, light with a savory batter the waffle missed in one way - the bit of bacon seemed caramelized and we crunchy like candy. if intentional, this wasn't a pleasant bite for me as the bacon flavor was non-existent. Crunch, no munch.  Overall though, a great chicken outweighs the waffle and holds the team together and you should put Bruxie in your lineup.

j7X6VgYYkSxqP5vHgxWosQ.text: Comfort Food, waffles, fried chicken, great breakfast, ice cream, sweets and even a salad ;)  PROS: food quality, originality, fast efficient service, very tasty, they go out of their way to help. You get the feeling they r glad u came.  CONS: not many vegitarian choices, if on a diet, just have a protein drink, n apple n keep walking. Don't even stop

s2lN5YziCtMABjlj4XwtDw.text: I've never been to a chicken and Waffle House and let me tell you, I'm glad Bruxie was the first. The chicken is extremely good and the waffles were the perfect amount of dough. They even give you a little syrup in the bottle, it was a really cute touch. Honest to say, this food was beyond amazing!

ewBkv5se9fX-AtaDINRUyg.text: The fried chicken was the best part. The crispy flaky skin made me want to keep eating it and eating it. I was a bit disappointed with my waffle. There are two different types of waffles that get served here. The fluffy style, Belgian I presume, and the crispy style, like an Eggo? that they use for their sandwiches. The whole premise is the Bruxie, which is like a sandwich, so the waffle is made to support the contents, but they are so big you can't pick them up like a sandwich. My preference would have been the fluffy waffle, and to eat it with a fork. But the taste was great all around. The custard shake was epic. A perfect treat for a hot day, I got the salted caramel one and loved everything about it.

ipJr36A63CshyNlAUgUQxQ.text: THE BEST!! We had the holy chicken, Bacon Egg & Cheddar and the Nutella & Banana. We should have ate all 3 breakfasts there. The waffles were perfect. My mouth is watering just thinking about the food. I wish there was something like this closer to home. We will definitely be going back just to go here again.

E3ZVAC4g3E69bhl-6VzpXg.text: After going hard on EDC the first day, needed a meal replenisher to last me for the next 12 hrs I'll be up moving and dancing. The chicken and waffles here definitely hit the spot. A solid 5 is worthy of a score as it hit all the elements of a great yelp restaurant: fair prices, clean restaurant, delivery to table short, and of course the most important the food here is delicious. The chicken has enough flavor, seasoning/spices and never dry only juicy tenders of meat. Not to mention the umami taste of the waffles was up to par as well. Definitely will pay this place a visit again if in the Vegas metro area!

MCJYAmyrkI4CczrDliLmrQ.text: After a night in Las Vegas, this was definitely the brunch spot to hit. There's a waffle for all kinds of moods from super sweet to super savory. All delicious with a perfectly fluffy and crisp waffle. Our group got a variety and we split them up. Each one was more delicious than the next. Highly recommend going with a good group to try them all!

FCvIranhK81tdjbyYq-oAg.text: This place is very good. They batter their chicken and fry it. They have a maple syrup dispenser where you can add more to your waffle sandwich. Sign up on the bruxie website and get $5 off on your first order. I got the original waffle sandwich and it comes with cider slaw. I like slaw in general and it was a good combo to me. My friend got the holy chicken waffle sandwich and that one is a beast. More like a heart attack. It has bacon, sunny side up egg, and Sriracha sauce. Whoa. We were so hungry that we killed it both and it was so satisfying. I wish they had this in Chicago.

dzBBPmLfhJ7ZSl1WKemwdA.text: Hands-down this is the best chicken and waffles sandwiches I've ever had. I got the Nashville spicy chicken waffle which has a kick but so good that you'll eat it all up no matter how spicy the seasoning is because the chicken is cooked to perfection. Perfectly moist on the inside and crispy on the outside. As for my dessert I'm not huge on super sweet so I got the berries lemon waffle dessert and it was PERFECT. Just the right amount of sweet and tart. As for the service it was great they came around and asked if we needed anything and cleaned our area up nice before and after we ate.

eldwYUAAM16xysOUzgdSPw.text: Food: excellent (green eggs & ham) Drink: n/a Serv: average speed Music: average Price: average Other: cool seating

y44pZaB4qYQbAgZDISN1QA.text: So yummy! We all got something different and no one was disappointed! I highly recommend. Casual atmosphere and group friendly. Chicken and waffles. What more could you want?! Waffles are crispy but fluffy and chewy. The chicken was battered to perfection.

MaZE7zB8fRNBo5RiDpSmHw.text: If you're not into the whole fried chicken and waffle thing, let me recommend the mushroom and chicken salad. It. Is. DELICIOUS. Scattered on a bed of fresh cut romaine is juicy chunks of chicken breasts tossed with very aromatic sun dried tomato (gives the salad a nice sweet and tart flavor, very summery) and yummy cut crimini mushroom. The portion of the salad is generous and it will leave you full. It's one of my go-tos on the menu every time I'm at Bruxies. :)  They have a large area for seating so finding somewhere to sit wasn't hard and it seems less busy than Shake Shack, good for us.  It's one of the cheap eats you can get around Vegas on the Strip (as more is sprouting around) next to Shake Shack near NY, NY.

eoFc30qTefyFdXu3rynVTw.text: Originally a restaurant from Orange, CA that has expanded greatly and now hit the strip - this is a great faster stop to get fried chicken and waffles in a fun and new location and building. Although I came in the winter cold, I suspect in the summer this place will be even more amazing once they open the garage-door style windows.  Food is wonderful, and on par with the LA location at which I've eaten.  I split the following:  Lemon Creme and Berries (Dessert) Waffle -- this is great, but tart so prepare yourself for that. It's an adorable waffle sandwich filled with lemon creme and... raspberries(!).    Original Seasoned Crispy Chicken Tenders (comes with Waffle Fries) -- A classic fried chicken tender.  We asked for a side of the chili honey sauce to pour over as if our chicken was the original with bones... but had instead opted for the one that would be easier to eat.  The skin is crispy, the chicken juice, and finger-licking good.  Strawberry Lemonade -- Sugary, oh my.  But great to drink with the rest of the salty and sweet food we'd ordered. Also FREE REFILLS. Insert love eye emoji here.  An easy stop located on the outside of NYNY (more North from the standard entrance). Go on, you know you want to go.

gm0bUxKn59FXPoT6gOy59Q.text: Bruxie was awesome! I had the original and it was freaking delicious. The waffles were perfect - light and crispy but not hard. The syrup was not overly sweet so it was a perfect balance of sweet and savory. My husband had the Nashville skillet and the chicken was super crispy and spicy, and the portion big enough for two meals. We sat outside and with the fan and the shade it was cool, even on a hundred degree Vegas day. Definitely will return if I get a chance. And the price is downright cheap considering it's on the strip where it's almost impossible to get away with less than $20 per person for even mediocre food.

K55d6VpvqVIZS-1s540C5Q.text: Best chicken and waffles I have ever had. The fried chicken had amazing crunch, drizzled with chili honey and the waffle was light and fluffy with bacon bits baked in. The mac and cheese with bacon bits and a buffalo sauce was also legit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Axbyve-aX__IBpGW7jBQlg.text: I love this place! Great food and great service! The manager Ann was amazing we have never been here and she explained everything and made our visit that much better! This is a great kid friendly place as well! I will definitely be back for more chicken and friendly service!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oiaiolf37SWU_bDpgSpZIQ.text: What an awesome finding in Las Vegas. We had the breakfast waffles and they were delicious!  The fresh orange juice was very delicious. The people at the counter were very friendly. The establishment is extremely clean and inviting. The last plus, the bathroom was very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cheddar, egg and bacon waffle was delicious.

iCKwQMbTrEdQlILwbttkZQ.text: I've NEVER had a waffle like this one. The texture is crispy but quizzically airy and perfectly paired with tender crispy salty chicken tenders or sweet Nutella and banana dessert. Must try.
