E7_h-uC5TE-XGKJsa4XVbQ.text: This place's chicken and waffles is served in a new and tasty manner. The waffle is presented openface and can be made to a sandwich that drips with yummy goodness! I didn't think I'd like Mayo on my breakfast sandwich (New Yorker), but I trusted Bruxie and wasn't mad at it, it was great ! Gonna come back here for the BAMF. Highly recommend for breakfast ! Don't miss it !

r-x67O8Axab0ESBYCV4kAQ.text: My wife and I had a breakfast craving around 11pm and had the misfortune at ending up here and this low level yelp trap. A perfect lure to trap tourists into faux hipster gourmet.   We each got three piece chicken meals with what they sell as a "waffle". Having eaten c+w all over this country I figured I had a good idea what Im eating when i order c+w....   Wrong.   This place doesnt even serve real waffles. They serve a rock hard and dense brick of biscuit dough that has been subjected to abuse in a waffle press.   Fake ass waffle and SERIOUSLY OVER SALTED batter for the fried chicken. To salvage the meal i had to pick the breading off (no saving the disgusting waffles, they went into the trash).   God help you if you are dumb enough to think this food is worth paying for.

Vv80f501SDxyVnLII31-zw.text: Had the original chicken and waffle sandwich and it was excellent. The honey sauce is probably the best part. There are a couple of beers to choose from too.

PkgkLGw0gFXQBxBh0Z6jtA.text: Went to Vegas for a quick getaway and I'm a foodie so trying this place after seeing the reviews was definitely on my list! It's not a sit and talk and stay for awhile however it's definitely a good quick bite to eat. The chicken and waffles are different but good! I will be back to eat here again.

qMg2PuIxhnBwjHJYv-g8_A.text: I haven't tried the other locations, but this one was DAAANNNK. Friendly staff and finger lickin good food! Avg price within the $10 range. I've tried the Nashville and original chicken and waffle. If you like a little kick to dem thangs get Nashville! Both were really good... I liked the original a bit more. Don't forget the waffle sauce, but it can get stickyyyy aaaayeeee. Only downside is that if you go during the day it's hot and you're gonna get a swampy booty. All good.. Worth it for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AuKiquVUlkZTCw2tZeps0Q.text: Great prices for Vegas.  The Waffle Sandwiches were surprisingly big and have lots of flavor. We had the chicken waffle sandwich as well as the pork. The chicken skillet was a lot of food, so easy to split.

WAg0CyL8VeV5kdUzH87ypQ.text: If you like Chicken n Waffles well this is your joint. They have a spicy and sweet sauce they drizzle on their original recipe that is something I'd take a bath in. The bacon cheddar Waffles will cause religious experiences. It's a limited menu but it is GOOD.  Great quick breakfast or lunch and pretty convenient if you are staying on that end of.the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 pc Chicken w/ Cheddar-Bacon Waffle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2pc Chicken and Cheddar-Bacon Waffle

_ptS4TYpd8TafLlCT5Zb6w.text: I like hashtags because they look like waffles.  Ah, Bruxie.  Straight out of California and livin' the life in Las Vegas. Who doesn't love chicken and waffles? We came here twice in one day and it was great. We had ordered a side of the Angry Mac & Cheese, a side of Fried Pickles, a Southern BBQ Waffle Sandwich, a side of the Bacon-Cheddar Waffle, and an order of the Irish Nachos. I loved it all! Like honestly, I don't think there was a bad bite. Everything was also tasty as leftovers. I especially went crazy over the angry mac & cheese and the Irish Nacho. Waffle fries, Bruxie Cheese Sauce, applewood smoked bacon, sour cream, and chives... it's a no brainer. Get in me!  If I have to say one bad thing, I think there were too many pearl sugars in my bacon-cheddar waffle because it became unbearably sweet after a few bites. No need for syrup. I just used the maple butter they supplied on top while trying to remove all the globs of pearl sugars I saw in the waffle. Decadence!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Nachos. So good!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spread.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Pickles.

hkBU3rBZmgtJp-ERBDH4KA.text: Food was delicious. I got the Nutella and banana waffle and my husband got the fried chicken and waffles. Both were very good. Coffee was also strong which I appreciated after an early flight from the Midwest. Highly recommend.

toTFfPPJJAL8xTdB6Lh8LQ.text: We stopped here for a late night snack after a concert at T-Mobile Arena.    It's a short walk from the arena, close to California Pizza Kitchen and a variety of restaurants in the area.  Parking is horrid (as you can imagine) on the strip.  We just Uber'd it to the arena.  Nice that it's open late (til midnight), as our concert let out at 11pm.    Ordering is done at the counter entrance and you get a beeper to take to your table.   Food was delivered to us pretty quickly especially as they were pretty busy.   The 3 of us ordered the original chicken waffle sandwich, chicken tenders, and the goat cheese/mushroom waffle sandwich.  Food was really good except the goat cheese/mushroom wasn't my favorite.  I still gave it 4stars for the other food.  Stick with the fried chicken and you can't go wrong!

l_tVzdmXvLzBliHsDC64LA.text: Had to visit this place since I was in Vegas ( and since Shake Shack was still closed)! Visited their location in LA and thought their chicken and waffle sandwich was pretty good.   I'll be honest, I was pretty hungover when I came so I just ordered the chicken strips. They were pretty flavorful but I would probably just stick with the waffle sandwich next time.   Not too crazy about waffle fries, but they could've been crispier.

We added a little maple syrup and ate it in about 1 minute.  I guess I should be happy that I live across country from this gem or I would weigh 200 pounds!!!

You order at the counter and then they bring your order to you. Would never have guessed it was a chain! Wish we had one back home.

mNJHe1rvmruOpSC7W9Pu8w.text: Very tasty  well seasoned chicken and the waffle fries has spice to them also ate to fast and forgot to take a pic food is fresh and hot fast friendly service will return and is recommended

TdxlEYCIb12-MzJcjsKfxw.text: Strictly chicken and waffles!  My husband wanted to try something different in Las Vegas so he found Bruxie.  It was pretty good, so good the place was packed! If you want something other than buffet food, check this place out!

jNz2Q8Nc-LUETIX0iQOQJg.text: Heyyyyy waffle sandwiches! Who doesn't love a sweet and savory combo that hits the spot on first bite? Fried chicken, drizzled in syrup, topped with bacon, and then a sunny side up egg? What?  For the um... waffle haters? Their chicken fingers and their mac n cheese were prettttttty good too!

yIvYaiA-a_su8FPkm1MyFw.text: The service delivered was much better than what you'd expect from fast casual on the strip. They were all friendly and attentive with offering help above the standard. Despite how busy it was, the feeling was never rushed and service was quick. The food was better than I remember. Waffles we're flavorful and crisp, same for the chicken. Fries and tots could have been fresher and hotter, but still were still enjoyable. Desserts we're pretty great too.

LcEMxZIyXTCUK8cK8gp9Ug.text: I am a fried chicken lover so anytime I see chicken and waffles I have to try it. You placed your order then they give you a buzzer. It lets the server know where to bring the food. It was pretty cool. I ordered the fried chicken and waffle it came with 2 pieces and a waffle. Omg it was so GOOD! Like a small piece of heaven. The chicken was seasoned very well and it was perfectly cooked. It was not greasy at all. The waffle was crisp and fluffy at the same time. The small bottle of maple syrup that came it is such a charming touch. It stole my heart. It was the perfect amount for the waffle. I also had the strawberry lemonade it was delicious. Perfect contrast of sweet and sour. My daughter ordered a milkshake it was so creamy and delicious. She also ordered the Irish nachos with were really good too. The staff was really friendly.  Great atmosphere.   The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it was pretty warm inside and I had to clean my own table. I will definitely be back.

Free refills. Nice service. You order and they bring you your food. It's right on the strip behind Shake Shack. They have indoor and out door seating. A real bargain for Vegas.

I got the bacon cheddar waffle with two chicken breast. I was way impressed by how good they were! A little pricy but it's on the strip so get used to expensive food. Will come back.

3nzaBQMEAyoAk-i1CIUajg.text: Stopped here after work yesterday and their micheladas were super good!!! Would recommend to anybody. I also ordered chicken fingers @ their sauces were bomb too. Cute little place

BKJKEv4IciEOjxyTYGJcTQ.text: I got the chicken and waffle original sandwich and it was delicious. The chicken was crispy but juicy and tender inside. My husband got a bacon egg and cheese waffle sandwich. He liked it although it didn't seem unique in any way. They have cocktails to order as well. I got us Tito's strawberry lemonade and they were tasty and strong. Service was prompt and friendly. Food delivery was quick. Great place to stop in for a quick bite.

202Z8e-qtrlM8khJ5FKEoA.text: Hype. Hype. Hype. Lots of people, and long lines - although fairly quick service.  If you're like me, gluten sensitive/GF, don't bother - there's nothing here for you. Keep going... The other 5 ppl in my group really enjoyed the grub in the moment, but then, 3 out of 5 had tummy issues (Ha!!). One person, quite severe. Sooo... you're on your own here.

GCIzsfnhEggDFB1bkDKMIQ.text: Oh the waffle.  Oh the chicken! Oh the post hockey debauchery! I can't think of a better late night snack than a chicken and waffle sandwich.    The waffles here are excellent.  The perfect thickness.  Not too thick like a Belgian style,  but just thick enough to stand up to the chicken and other toppings.  Honestly,  I would come here and JUST get a waffle with butter,  that's how good they are.  Light and crispy,  fluffy on the inside,  and oh so tasty.   I can't wait to come back and try some of the other things on the menu!!

ZX22qX9KwTLwOLSXIa6LRQ.text: I've had Bruxie before (in California) and this location is pretty much the same. It's a decent quick meal that's a little more interesting because #WaffleSandwiches.   I actually like sticking to The Original (basically a fried chicken sandwich using a waffle instead of bread) and then getting some fries. This time we also tried the kickin' strips (not spicy, but had good flavor) and the angry mac n cheese (which wasn't really cheesy, but I still enjoyed the flavor).   Overall a good place if you're in the mood for fried chicken, but it's not necessarily going to wow you.  Stay Cheerful ;)

2fXElEb9givIl_ay4_0kSw.text: I got the Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. The chicken was too small for the waffle. The waffle was just ok. The chicken wasn't seasoned to my liking. I won't be in a rush to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is The Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle.

GT0rvETzU4yF7_RFul5k5g.text: Got the Holy chicken and it was indeed holy. Chicken was cooked perfectly.  So was the egg. Sauce had a slight heat to it but not overpowering.  Waffle was good but actually a side act to the chicken.  Will definitely come back when in town again.

BsmHxjm8wUWwSEhmuoQMRw.text: I have wanted to try this resturant for a while now, as it has been on my foodie list for sometime now.  I can honestly say that this place will be removed from my list!!   To begin, I was thoroughly disappointed in the cleanlines of the ketchup, water, syrup station and friendliness of their staff members upon arrival.  After receiving my meal, I went to the front for the ketchup and they were out at both stations.   When,  I asked if ketchup stations could be refilled I was told to hold on, however I waited for over 10 minutes for that to take place.  However once I received my Ketchup from the waiter she threw it on the table at me in an fit.  Our drinks never arrived with our meal so we had to get them ourselves.   Next, for the price of the food  we could have stayed home.  This place truly does not exemplify the standard of chicken and waffles.  Therefore,  my review of this establishment is a no bueno!!

ugZ1Cn6wbkE9bi23ioQrGA.text: I know I know. . .chicken and waffles is a big thing but I've never had them. . .together.  Millions of people aren't wrong and this place was very good!  If you're here, make it a point to come here for breakfast. . .after you've had a Bloody Mary, of course. . .

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken with bacon cheddar waffle. . .

d-lMwBAeMjSIwPsc1aFRJg.text: Three stars because, to be fair, fried food isn't exactly my first choice of cuisine but I do have to credit it for delicious finger-licking comfort food after a long night of clubbing in Vegas.  Very casual ambiance where people order at the front and then find seats in the back- luckily we were able to beat the lunch crowd 11am on Sunday and so we could get a seat inside.    I went with the Original Fried Chicken and Waffle (my friends ordered another original sandwich and the Original Seasoned Fried Chicken and Waffle Skillet) and we decided to order Fried Chicken Poutine to share.  The sandwich is rather filling already, especially for one who tends to avoid food with a lot of grease.  I usually don't like spicy foods, but the chicken and waffle had a great sweet-and-spicy balance.  Chicken was crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside (thank god) and the waffle was nice and crunchy!  The only complaint I had was that I literally took one bite of the sandwich and the waffle broke apart immediately and splattered sauce all over me... definitely a 5-napkin meal in my case.  First time trying poutine- absolutely delicious though it kinda was an overkill on top of everything else we ordered (three girls had a hard time finishing half of it)!  I know poutine is supposed to be very rich, and it was very hearty- just be prepared to completely pass out afterwards!    If you are someone who loves fried food, has a hangover, or is completely willing to enter a food coma for the whole day, this is a good place to check out- not sure if it's necessarily the place for someone who is completely sober and prefers lighter meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Fried Chicken and Waffle Sandwiches, Seasoned Skillet, and Fried Chicken Poutine

V8FkSK1fm6gV_hnij0_lUw.text: Disclaimer: This review may be skewed because I'm pregnant at the moment of writing this.  My husband so graciously brought some dinner back to the hotel room (I was that lazy) and I ended up getting the fried chicken cobb salad and I'm already craving it again just typing it out.  I craved it for a week after we got back too. Is it that special?? I don't know. I enjoyed it.  We also got a creme brulee waffle for dessert to share and that shit was good too.  Just eat here, you won't regret it HAHA

due6xgMbYfMK6az0atjfVw.text: This place is located in a great location, right next to New York New York casino. Faces a park like setting with Corn Hole and other games included.   They are basically a fast food type of restaurant that serves really good food. Be prepared to wait in line though but was worth it. I had a chicken waffle sandwich. The waffle was crispy (used as the bread of the sandwich) and the chicken was warm and moist. Also included in it was shredded lettuce and their sauce. It was delicious, but I'm sure it was high in calories. Oh well...  I found this place by using my Yelp app on my phone. It came highly recommended and we weren't disappointed at all. We'll be back there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zM30ZO4aK-W0xkFRFRam5A.text: Holy fried chicken and waffles! I'm in love and I wish we had a Bruxie in NY *sadface*. It's such a simple idea. Fried chicken and waffle sammiches, but it's done so perfectly. I went with 4 girlfriends on a trip to Vegas and wanted to grab a quick bite before a pool party. This was exactly what we were looking for. You order at the counter, get a number and a waiter brings you your food. Quick and efficient. Light and fluffy waffles with a slight crisp to the outer layer acted as the bread for perfectly fried, juicy chicken breasts that weren't too oily. We each tried a different sandwich and ALL of them were amazing. The fries were decent and the drinks refreshing. My gf's and I joked that we should look into opening one in NY. My inner fatgirl would be an issue though.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z1OsOlBinn_-rwqaTCjmSg.text: Great chicken and waffles.   2nd time here.   Chicken inside waffle pretty good but waffle just a bit dry.   I enjoyed my husband's plate more - chicken with a waffle on the side.   These waffles are fluffy and soft and oh my I couldn't stop eating it.  I would definitely return here.   So much more to try on the menu.

wWI3osZMJPo9aQ23y4zF_Q.text: Food 3 stars, plus one for really good service. They are providing semi-table service so tip accordingly!  Free refills, plus you can change drinks if you want. I tried the strawberry lemonade. It wasn't too sweet or too tart. Not powerfully strawberry-ish, though.  Only 50cents to add cheese sauce to their side and drink combo. This place isn't price gouging at all and I respect that a lot in sin city.  Chicken waffle sandwich was intriguing. The chicken "breast" appeared to be a conglomerate of mixed chicken breast pieces, tenderized and breaded in a patty shape, rather than a single breast. It was nice quality meat mostly so I didn't mind. Just wasn't expecting it. Asked for my slaw on the side and it was probably less than 1 big forkful. Not upset I'm not that into slaw.  Waffle fries with cheese sauce on the side was good.  The waffle it's self was okay. Light airy and crispy. I was expecting a bit more tenderness, TBH.  The food I would rate 3 stars. Good not great. A nice easy lunch. The customer service pushed it up to 4 stars. The kid running around helping people and clearing tables was super zippy and cheerful.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp;waffle w/fries &amp;cheese sauce plus slaw. Needed a little more flavor so I got BBQ sauce. It was more Carolina style tho:/
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of waffle. A little dry and airy. Crispy and pleasant flavor. Not sure I&#39;d return. I was hoping for crispy but tender waffle.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry lemonade, not too sweet, free refills on any drinks plus you can switch beverage choice when you refill!

NtNwOrvnX__wWj4P4_0r5g.text: I really have no complaints about our experience at Bruxie- we came in on a Sunday morning at around 10:30 expecting to wait in line for a long time. Fortunately, there were only a couple people in front of us so we got to order quickly. The first thing I noticed was the very reasonable pricing. I ended up getting two of the liege waffles ($3.95 for the regular and $4.95 for the chocolate filled- though the regular comes with chocolate to dip so maybe skip the chocolate filled?) with a coffee ($2.50) and my friends all got waffle sandwiches.   We sat down with our buzzers and the food was brought to us quickly. Service was great, food/coffee was GREAT, and I never felt crammed even though it isn't a huge space. Definitely a must-eat breakfast (or lunch or dinner) on the strip!!

U4CRfIQro6WhXKZqbTgxsA.text: First time here, line was short and got the waffle chicken breakfast sandwich! It was pure deliciousness, of course I added more syrup to it and I asked for the mayo siracha on the side but I'm sure it tastes great with that anyways. I recommend this ! Next time I'm going to try the waffle burger they have ! Yum yum yum! Ice vanilla latte was good but lot sweet enough.. but if you don't have much of s sweet tooth you'll love it!

dWTYI9trKLJ0DXa9sFcYiQ.text: This place is amazingg!! My group and I found this place while strolling on the strip right after where we had landed in Vegas!  A friend of mine recommended anything with the chicken so I got the buffalo bleu fried chicken on the first day and it was delicious! That first bite totally sold me. The chicken waffle combos are seasoned and tasty! Food arrived quickly as well. The second time I went I got the turkey avocado sandwich and it was simply the tasty and cooked to perfection.   Some friends of mine tried the dessert waffles and even the poutine. Those also looked both social media worthy and equally delicious!   Super excited to have found this place after seeing these pictures on social media.  If you LOVE waffles, you will love this place. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken Waffle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Club Waffle sandwich

R6iAXN9h33ag1P5DreUy1w.text: Bruxie is amazing! I love their chicken sandwiches, really delicious and their waffle cut fries are a must. Their lemonades are also really good. I've come to Bruxie a couple times but not this location until about a month ago and you could say I'm impressed. Definitely try this place out, I love it!

_GcULBrik9_Essn3vsVe-g.text: I can never say no to chicken and waffle so when we found this place near the strip, I was more than happy to try it out. You go up to the counter and order first. They will give you a number and will bring out the food afterwards. I was a little overwhelmed by what waffles I wanted to be honest because I couldn't pick between savory or sweets. In the end, I went with savory.  I ordered the Nashville Hot while my boyfriend ordered the Holy. I preferred mine over his since I like my food spicier and no cheese. It was a good amount of food and I was getting full after the first half of the waffle. The chicken was so soft and juicy. I can see why there are so many reviews to this place!   Definitely check out this place if you're in the area!

JIgozcCB55gshKKUEsPOvA.text: I had the Holy chicken waffle sandwich today! It was absolutely delicious I would definitely recommend if you are in the area. Bruxie has cheerful and courteous staff. The establishment was really clean with lots of seating. The most important is that the bathroom was also super clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YpzCU0HNz7hmeXWAK65YIA.text: Delicious! I can see why people line up.   The bacon cheddar waffle with fried chicken (got Nashville hot) was enormous and the waffle very unique-caramelized with cheese pockets yet retained fluffiness.   The chicken was seasoned perfectly-well spiced and not salty or too oily. There is self-serve maple syrup and generous portions of butter served on the side.   The Belgium mocha was also very richly chocolate and creamy, I was surprised at the quality!    I would love to try one of the waffle sandwiches next time which were also massive and full of interesting toppings. Food is brought to your table with a buzzer and service was quick and organized. The only thing I didn't like were the waffle fries as I assumed they'd be soft but they were really crispy- some people might like that.

kWhJ9R82Qpd-Fmhtidrn6g.text: Food was pretty tasty but expensive even considering the city. They forgot our coffees and I had to go remind them and found them sitting on a counter at the cash register. Tables were dirty and the staff didn't seem motivated to clean them.

PnI8EKvVag6NplIk1_KFww.text: Holy Chicken and Strawberry Lemonade Mimosa. Perfection. Have eaten here twice and have not been disappointed.

T7r9v2AIalgPf-r-lybBUw.text: Pretty solid place. The chicken is crispy but also pretty soft which I think complements the waffle. Tried the Holy Chicken which is a bit spicy but really good. Recommend you add syrup because it just tastes that much better! All in all really good! Would definitely recommend!!

cZSwuApvHGgNHs9TVHsVHw.text: First time in Las Vegas on vacation we found this chicken and waffles spot on yelp, turned out to be super delicious and good vibes right in the park. The waffle sandwich was on point  so good that we came back again for seconds before our vacation was over. Look forward to going back again in the near future.

DRFO9EfRiH4PNPsR7tf84Q.text: This food was booomb! Chicken and waffle were amazing! We had there pink lemonade also very good.

XMhZHHM-lC09H2AiFao6qA.text: This was my first meal when I landed in Las Vegas and I'm glad it was. I got the Holy Chicken waffle sandwich and 'holy, was it delicious!'. The waffles were fluffy and paired very well with the crispy chicken and smoked bacon. The Sriracha sauce on this sandwich added a nice kick to the flavor. Waffle fries were standard waffle fries, in my opinion but I absolutely loved the waffle sandwich. We got here at 9am when it opened for breakfast and there was already a line out the door. Definitely recommend to come earlier to avoid standing in a longer line. I was very surprised by how crowded it got at 10am. However, it could be worth the wait!

4gV80RGccxwRxhGH7ooH0w.text: Deliciousness - 3.5/5 Happiness - 5/5  I went to Bruxies for breakfast in Vegas. There was a line out the door for it, always a good sign (and it was about 10:30 too). The attendants were very nice and quick (we got in in about 5 minutes). They were nice enough to offer free alcoholic drinks to those waiting in line (in little taster cups). The problem? The drinks were terrible (seriously, do not order their ginger based cocktail. It was harsh!).   The chicken was fantastic and the waffles tasty and freshly made. The only downside was that most of the other food was unexceptional (namely the fries). Stick just to the waffle and chicken and it will be a blissful experience.

LN2-wOrrhKCq4dukOHmm0w.text: it was okay... i begged my dad to try it w me and he was more excited about it than i was (i guess that's what i get) they make modifications w no issue but on my next visit it wouldn't be something i feel i have to do.

A7MS_KGW7sBQObCcNx-R2Q.text: Food is okay but not that great. They have friendly staff and good service. It can get pricey. You can share a meal if you're like me. I did not finished everything but was able to eat the left overs the next day.

gNiT4_YemU25BrEgprg5Eg.text: Excellent texture and flavors, and very kind service near closing time. We had the mushroom sun dried tomato, nutella, and strawberry cream.   We loved all of them. We weren't as excited about the yogurt? spread in the nutella but otherwise fantastic. Will come again.

NQrXQj9dY-KtJzv8WKApag.text: The photos and concept caught my attention so I waked the strip from Treasure Island to check them out. I ordered the Holy Chicken and it was worth every step in my solo journey. The chicken was juicy and perfectly crisp while the bacon and sunny side up egg were outstanding. If you want something that's sweet, spicy and savory I recommend the Holy Chicken for any meal. Possibly the best chicken and waffles I've had hands down.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

olUWqtEjMoPUlpcDlQDpyQ.text: Why is it I only go here when I'm literally flying out of town?  This has become one of our last stops when we leave Las Vegas because it's so easy to box their stuff and take home on the plane for dinner.  I really need to make the time to stop and just sit down and enjoy the chicken and waffles hot from the kitchen.    That being said, Bruxie's food is so good, it does taste great after being on a 2 hour flight. This is one of those places that has a pretty simple menu.  The chicken and waffle whether you eat it separately or get one of those sandwiches are definitely no joke.  I love getting my fried food fix here.   Next time you're looking for savory and sweet for lunch, just stop in here and you're done.  You're welcome.

DJH4FjLpDG9ashSuvvsG6Q.text: We had two chicken sandwiches and they were really good. We also ordered the waffle fries and drink and added a small chocolate shake. The fries were good but the shake was lacking. My only real issue is the price point. $38 was a bit much.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pw72GXtl_R8TA73V8KT64A.text: Our last night in Las Vegas we decided to eat at a restaurant near our hotel.  We chose to dine at a restaurant at The Park on The Strip.  For a second night in a row, my husband suggested eating fried chicken since he had previously seen a billboard at Bruxie early in our stay.    We have eaten at Bruxie's 2nd location at Santa Monica's Third Street Promenade and was happy to see a familiar California transplant here at The Park.  At this location, ordering typically easy as you walk in, you'll see the menu boards above the order counter.  First, order your food and beverage at the counter.  Next, you'll be given a small placard with a number that identifies your order.  Meanwhile, find seating that will accommodate your group and finally, a server will bring your food to you.  At this location, the service was friendly and efficient.  The food was tasty and served fresh and hot from the kitchen.  The fried chicken in our sandwiches had a crisp breading and the chicken breast meat was actually quite tasty and moist.  Waffles are used as the bun to the sandwiches.  The fresh baked waffles are light and crisp and hold their texture without getting soggy.  We enjoyed the food and flavors at this site.  The only surprises that we had were the higher prices of our draft beer ($8) and sandwiches.  Ah, but, this IS Las Vegas.

debqhHs4ZYWMLFF1IETeJQ.text: Fantastic, less expensive dinner on the strip. Better chicken and waffles than Yardbird for less than a 1/3 of the price. I will definitely be back the next time I am in Las Vegas!

DkSgXjWESmsZNpJtZNw-5Q.text: I am upset that I haven't tried this place sooner! Bruxie is SOOOO GOOD! Best meal I had in Vegas hands down. I got the Holy chicken. It was a waffle, chicken sandwich with bacon, sauce, and a fried egg. The chicken was nice and crispy, tender, and juicy. The waffle was light and airy. It was more of a savory waffle than a sweet waffle. Though they did put some maple syrup in it.  I also got a spiked milkshake. It cost an extra $5 to get it spiked. It was bomb! So worth it! It doesn't matter where you are on the strip. Go to Bruxie for an awesome meal! It is not that expensive either. The waffle sandwiches are pretty big and cost $12. It was definitely the cheapest meal I had in Vegas, but also my favorite!

hNWb-cYiqh0xMzYvsdnR1g.text: Delicious Chicken & waffle!  I wanted dark meat instead of chicken breast.  They allowed it.  Add the fries and soda, the cost is about $20.    I had ginger beer.  It was good.

J1j8sA6YZq39csfk5O3Ezw.text: Ok, so I grew up in the shadows of Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles-the ghetto gold standard of chicken and waffles for decades. Recently, I've seen so many white bread versions trying to copy Roscoe's. I even had one place serve me fried chicken with Eggo waffles lol. There was a Bruxie, (a SoCal-based eatery) across the street from SDSU in the College area of San Diego for years, but it went under last year. So when we took a weekend vaca to Las Vegas shortly thereafter, I was pumped when I saw they had a new location on the Strip, right across from the Monte Carlo and T-Mobile Center.  The food is BOMB. I had the buffalo chicken waffle sandwich with the buffalo cheese waffle fries and a pink lemonade; all in all ran me about $13. The wife had a buffalo chicken salad which was huge and delish ($9). My brother and his friend both ordered the Nashville hot strips and waffles with a spicy syrup. Pure culinary murder. The strips were tender, big, and juicy. For the portions, location, cleanliness, and price, you'd be very hard pressed to find better on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken waffle sandwich with buffalo cheese waffle-cut fries and a perfectly mixed pink lemonade, free refills. All cost about $13!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville Hot chicken and waffles with waffle-cut fries.

CyTUG-htxeGFFQDzVg-OuA.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place! Bruxie is amazing. I heard such good reviews from my friends in Cali but I never actually went so I was glad when they opened up a place here in Vegas! I just hate that it's on the strip lol.   I've tried a couple of things on their menu - the original waffle sandwich, the waffle sandwich with the Nashville hot chicken, and the Irish nachos (?). I gotta say I LOVE the Irish nachos; I think it's my favorite thing on the menu. It's waffle fries with some cheese sauce & bacon & just ooey gooey goodness! Between the two sandwiches that I tried, I would have to go with the Nashville one Cos I love spicy food! It has a really nice kick to it, but definitely not burn your mouth kick. Definitely try the Irish nachos tho (I really hope that's what it's called lol).

gmjruUS_ee1yHsvklCSAvA.text: Chicken and waffles is the gimmick and they don't disappoint. I wouldn't recommend their sandwich type meals. Stick to the original chicken and waffle type breakfast plates. It seems to be on the pricey side but it's Vegas and emptying pockets is the name of the game.

zSYbvl5TB850l85q7-nkXA.text: Yummiest place ever in Vegas, at the moment! If you love chicken and waffles. This is the place. We came for brunch. I shared the roasted mushroom and grilled chicken salad. That was the best salad and healthy! We also shared the buffalo style chicken tenders with waffle fries. Huge pieces of chicken. We also had the waffle sundae. All 6 of us shared it. Omg, so good after a night of drinking. Definitely hit up this spot. Its located at the Park in front of the Park MGM.

wq4-Ty0WIP8AgpZbqQUaKQ.text: Bruxie has some seriously delicious chicken! The waffles are pretty good too.  We stopped in at probably the worst time, shortly after the naming ceremony for the new hockey team. Holy cow, they had obviously been hit hard by the crowds and the restaurant looked like it! Totally understandable for the amount of people that were drawn in by the special event. It was obvious that the staff was trying to play catch up with busing tables and getting orders out to everyone. Since it was a special circumstance I can't really speak to what the normal cleanliness would be in the restaurant or how long it would normally take to receive an order.  I ordered the Nashville-Style Hot Chicken that is served with a Cheddar Bacon Waffle Biscuit topped with Maple Butter. Wow, so much flavor in this dish. The Nashville-Style Hot Chicken was hot as promised and will satisfy a craving for spicy food for sure. The waffle helped balance out the heat. I loved the flavor of the cheddar bacon waffle with the maple butter on top. So yummy. The only part I didn't love was the crunchy sugar crystal pieces that were fine at first, but started to overwhelm the flavor towards the end.   My husband ordered an Original Chicken & Waffle Sandwich. This was also very tasty. The sandwiches are larger than the dish I ordered so I'd suggest this for larger appetites.   For dessert we shared a Liege Waffle with Caramelized Pearl Sugar. I think next time I would try another dessert option. The waffle was pretty good, but it was not what I expect in flavor and texture from a liege waffle. The pearl sugar crystals were large and the texture became off-putting for me as I ate more of the waffle.  Overall, the chicken is amazing and the waffles are a close second. A delicious meal for sure if you are near the NYNY or Monte Carlo.

6dB-gP2m85eW03Y-QmNulQ.text: I went to Vegas to celebrate his birthday, I had a lot of fun but I didn't like all the restaurants that they chose. So my last day there I looked online for a breakfast spot and I saw the great reviews of this place. I decided to go by myself and try it. I wasn't disappointed, the chicken and waffles sandwich was delicious! The only downside was the Mac and cheese, it was bland, but the sandwich more then made up for it. The staff was friendly and attentive, noticing I didn't have utensils and bring me over some even though it was self service.

IcUyiZlqeF0Eq1Q9rB7uBg.text: A crisp, golden brown, airy, light waffle with just the right chew.  Be it dripping with warm maple syrup, topped with fruits, preserves, jams, and whipped cream, or as a bun for a perfectly seasoned boneless chicken breast, spicy BBQ Chicken, California club, pulled pork roasted turkey, pastrami and Swiss, roasted mushrooms and goat cheese.... wait, what were we talking about?  Bruxie, the Cali born waffle joint has made it to Vegas.  And yes, it is as good as expected.  Outstanding, with no sweetness.  Nothing get's in the way of making a great waffle.  The Naked with cinnamon sugar or maple syrup the perfect way to whet the palate.  In general, the consistency of the waffles hold up well to the "wet" fillings with their outer layer maintaining the crispness.    For breakfast, the prosciutto and Swiss, oozing with melted Swiss cheese and a fried egg, all kinds of good eats. A generous smear of whole grain mustard cuts the richness of the yolk perfectly.  Sub sage spiced breakfast sausage and cheddar and you get a solid country sausage and egg breakfast sandwich, equally tasty.  Of course, chicken and waffles.  Take an aggressively seasoned, not too heavily coated,  deep fried, crisp on the outside, juicy on the inside boneless chicken breast, give it some sweet heat (chili honey) and top it with some cider slaw.  Calories and fat aside, oh yeah!  For something that will make your head tilt like a confused dog, try the roasted mushroom and goat cheese.  Sun dried tomatoes, goat cheese, arugula, lemon vinaigrette and a balsamic reduction in a waffle?  It works and well.  Friendly service.  Prices are what they are.  Expect to pay $10 for any "sandwich".  A great fast food option for the frenetic Strip.

VjYxhAVcbM5OAVpbpEGnMg.text: Phenomenal breakfast. Quick counter service. Good prices compared to other Vegas restaurants. I had the green eggs and ham waffle sandwich with a Bloody Mary. Perfect hair of the dog brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ut_PUtiOsSUdSiISyF-GAA.text: I ordered the crispy chicken and the holy chicken. Holy chicken was a little to sweet for my liking. Kind of felt like I was eating dessert... and I typically like sweet. To me, the maple syrup was a bit much and made my waffles super soggy - resulting in my sandwich to fall apart. I recommend asking for the syrup on the side. Overall it was good though. The crispy chicken is delicious! I highly enjoyed that! It was a perfect little sandwich full of crispiness and flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy chicken - recommend getting syrup on side or it can be a tad to sweet

7dpTi902aH8i4xim_72g1A.text: Yummy yummy comfort food is what you'll find here! We both got the chicken tenders and each got a different sauce. The sauces were great and the food was high quality. The staff were friendly and it wasn't a long wait at all.

0EfrnD8nKwVtfSDInHCpfA.text: We ordered the waffle and egg and bacon, it was very very good. We also got waffles banana and Nutella and it was very good. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! The waffles are very light and very good

W2IW7uKZY8Wa3i_wJZyhOg.text: Had the Holy waffle sandwich. It was so delicious! Probably one of my favorite meals I've ever had! They also make a mean mimosa. The husband and I throughly enjoyed everything from the service to the drinks and food. They truly know what their doing here! Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W12uF83wTZzVBYnK_Pf2Fg.text: First time having chicken n waffles.  I had the original and YUM.  Just enough sweet and spice.  Very good!

1mMmKJ8CmKoiva0aDokNAQ.text: Classic Fried Chicken Sandwich  Waffle is super light and thin with a good crisp exterior (would have preferred a little more bite but satisfied)   Chicken is well seasoned and cooked just right - plenty of spices, crispy exterior and moist interior  Spicy maple syrup was a nice touch that helped to bring the sandwich together   Waffle fries lacked a crispy texture and interior was too airy   Overall Thoughts  Great snack spot for dinner or before hitting the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

buCDzKbyj5I4U0WmrKLa0g.text: The waffles were really good! My husband and I shared everything. The pickles are very thick but one I cut them in half they were okay. Actually I found myself eating the breading. Loved the ranch sauce too. The sandwich was fab. There's a sriracha sauce that was just spicy enough and not over the top.  My fave was the nutella. Almost got a second! The only reason for a 4 star was it was hot in there. Good news they have heaters when needed. Bad news I was so hot I needed to go out to cool off.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nutella, fried pickles, Holy Chicken

kx4no-WUo6EFOFtOSrejyw.text: Loved it! The wait was about 15-20 minutes but it well worth it. The food was hot and fresh and very tasty. I had the holy chicken sandwich. Soo good and got me full! Totally recommend while staying in Las Vegas!

hPol81Bs8K0WaILIwR0IfQ.text: Who knew that chicken goes so well with waffles? What appeared to me like a pregnant lady's craving turned out to be a surprisingly delicious combination.   My friend ordered the original Chicken Waffle Sandwich, while I got the Buffalo Bleu Chicken Waffle Sandwich. Both were delicious within their own right, with the Original a little more on the sweeter side and the Buffalo Bleu on the sour cheesy side.   We rounded up our meal with a liege waffle filled with chocolate and a huge portion of complimentary ice cream.  All around a great food experience.

M5zhspeUwVuGf-rdAccG0Q.text: I'll honestly say I wasn't impressed. There is such a hype about this place and I don't think they live up to it. I'm wondering if I expected too much that it wasn't satisfying. Regardless of my expectation, a good place is a good place and this is just not one of them. I ordered the green eggs and ham.  It was pretty good, but forgettable. I came with a pretty big group of people so I was able to try other items on the menu since we all shared. The rest of the orders that everyone else got were also just OK. I ordered the smores waffle for the kids, and they didn't even care too much for it. There was this lemon custard waffle dessert like dish with fruits... It was good but you can't eat too much of it because it gets too sweet. The strawberry lemonade was also disappointing; too sweet. The seasoned fries were hard and weren't very tasty. I most likely won't come back again and most likely won't recommend to friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not sure was this is called but it was pretty good. Gets too sweet after just a few bites though.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smores waffle on kids menu

5eyD0C2tboTy6-uH0LRf_Q.text: The Nashville Hot Chicken & Bacon Waffle skillet is why this place gets five stars from me. This is the best version of Chicken and Waffles compared to any other place in Vegas. The other stuff is good, but I don't see a reason to order them.   The sandwich waffle IS NOT the bacon waffle you get in the skillet. The bacon waffle is a different, tastier beast.  The Bacon Waffle is the best waffle I've had with or without chicken. The bacon fat doesn't hit you over the head with smoke or salt, the pork fat mixes in well with the sugar and rosemary. The outside is crisp and has a crunch from the crystalized sugar, the inside is flaky and soft.  The Chicken has a kick. Crisp and Juicy. Get a side of honey for a dip.

WDMpULEzRrmA0KMqIxFgqA.text: Chicken skillet or chicken sandwich. Both are delicious and super affordable. The customer service here is super! The girls are very knowledgable and nice. Get the real syrup, it's worth the extra dollar. The free syrup is the fake like aunt Jamima high fructose corn syrup shyt. So yeah pay the extra dollar and get real syrup.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GJTuJrOaJRqV4Kj6y4uHHA.text: My friend and I had to try Bruxie after hearing about the hype. All of the workers we encountered were very kind and made sure that we were doing okay, except for Paulina who took our order. I asked her if we can split the bill and she gave me an attitude right away. She should not be giving customers nasty looks and shaking her head while taking orders!!!  I ordered the Carolina BBQ Pulled Pork waffle sandwich & a strawberry lemonade, and my friend ordered the Bruxie Burger & the regular waffle fries (which we shared). We thought the portions looked small at first especially since the prices are not very cheap, but we were mistaken. We felt so full near the end of our meal. My pulled pork sandwich was okay; it was a little messy to eat since it started falling apart as soon as I took my first bite. I was not a fan of the strawberry lemonade. It tasted very bland like mushed strawberries and water.   I am giving this place three stars because of our rude server, mediocre food, and slightly high prices. The prices would be better if the sandwiches included fries. $2.95 for a separate order of waffle fries (which only included like 6 fries) was definitely not worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie Burger, Carolina Pulled Pork BBQ waffle sandwich, waffle fries, &amp; strawberry lemonade

pdu1KlOK0_d7Ee_wq8LM0Q.text: Chicken and waffles place, got the original...didn't think it was too special. I would get the Nashville one next time. It was pretty fast and cheap though. Not that much flavor in the chicken

GcK_B3Ze7dsKi9Otsqi9mQ.text: Not bad...different. I've never had chick/waffs before, but it's a pretty awesome blend of two different worlds. I would def revisit.

RYzlADWjBXIOVCZ_dgH1VQ.text: DELICIOUS!! I enjoyed the egg, bacon, and cheddar sandwich today.  Wish I would have found this place at the beginning of my trip rather than the end. I want it again, right  now!!! :-)

8hietos6vezN4UUXZy3QYw.text: Yep this place really  gets 5 1/2 stars from me. The place was clean and sorta of rustic looking. I had the Nashville with a side ceaser salad and strawberry lemonade.  The Nashville was DELICIOUS! I was not disappointed. It was a light flakey waffle topped with lettuce sauce and of course chucken. It was a bit spicy. Loved it! My ceaser salad was just ok. A bit too much dressing. Lemonade was good.   I would come back in a heartbeat. Cant wait to visit vegas again just to eat here! I love the big fans on the ceiling.

PaFl6kp6CHg7oPSC2yKHag.text: Love the chic Contemporary look of this place... Very Clean!!!!!! Atmosphere is very warm and inviting. The ketchup taste much better than regular ketchup and the maple syrup is to die for!!!! This was my first time going and I would give this a 10++ Star if I could. I recommend "The Original", The Bruxie Burger, Waffle fries are amazing, and the Blueberry Smoothie was a perfect combo of healthy and sweet!!! I will be back!!!!!! Manny the Barista was great and represented Bruxie in the most positive of light!!!! Thank you for bringing great food quality back to Vegas!!!

X1YzIkvFtgv48j6sJIveFQ.text: Waffle heaven! Who says you can't have waffles with everything? Bruxie makes an awesome case for it.   Original Fried Chicken and Waffle sandwich (4.5 stars) - Very tasty seasoned fried chicken with a dash of chili honey and slaw in a waffle to be eaten like a sandwich. Cool and so delicious. Only downer was that waffle was a bit cold, wish it was warm like the rest of the sandwich.  Carolina BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich (4 stars) - Carolina BBQ sauce was really good with a slight kick. Pulled pork itself was a bit mushy. But the BBQ sauce with the meat and the waffle worked nicely together. Again the waffle itself was a bit cold.  Atmosphere is modern and atmosphere was lively, a bit hectic on opening week. Managers and servers are super attentive and friendly to make sure you have a great first experience.  It's part of the new Park area in between NYNY and Monte Carlo. Part of a bunch of new hip  places to try around there.   Bottom line: A new Vegas must try, definitely hit the Fried Chix and waffle at least once. Was too full to try the frozen custard, coming back for that next time...

hD3HXUmbcYYwixNSgWUi5Q.text: Great place to grab lunch on the strip! Wanted something quick, inexpensive and not the same old hamburger and got exactly that. My original waffle sandwich was delicious.

e6bdHp-rJo1KKCUhYAvheQ.text: Great food. if you're tired of all the same old boring stuff I'd recommend this place. The one with the fried egg is great as well as the creme brulee one. Their cola is tasty too.

NS3nDPFQEofhvAGyVCCYfQ.text: Great service, pretty interior and adequate prices.  I ordered BBQ pulled pork waffle and it was amazing, a little bit on a spicy side. My friend didn't like his turkey club waffle but I guess it's up to personal preferences. Definitely coming back here!

9L4LBwN7t-KQ572MbAtekA.text: So good we came back 3 times on our trip.  Each dish is delicious and the coffee is on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7ubFMJo6tjSzZvYvx910ag.text: Best waffles I've ever had.    Chicken was good too, creme brulee waffle was also on points.  Great chicken fingers, waffle fries, and lemonade.  One of the highlights of my trip was eating here!

RB0z7I1Q--MmE9lW7egNtw.text: Great suggestion from other Yelpers! Get the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich - You won't be disappointed. Not only was the food great quality and tasty, it was not packed like other restaurants around 10am for breakfast/brunch, and the served our order quick.

-840oK0pjbOkAwXzIorycA.text: Thank you Yelp! Crispy, juicy, flavorful! I got the Holy Chicken minus the sunny-side up egg. So delicious! There was a line but it moved quick and the food was quickly delivered as well. Definitely recommend! The only reason I didn't give a full 5 stars was because the fries were overly salted. We want to come back for the dessert waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PCtdT1Mul4zenwZR-d9a5Q.text: So glad they opened up a Bruxie in LV. I've been a regular at their other locations in CA and I'm glad I can now get a tuna melt here! Make the melt a staple!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Melt

qxqjeuAiW1MrEP-sD_02MA.text: It takes FOREVER for your food to be served, After you receive your food you will know that you have been RIPPED OFF, The Waffle is a salty,  dried out piece of rubber served with a piece of chicken sitting under a HEAT LAMP for god knows how long. Thank goodness  for the syrup so it can actually add moisture to the mix.

5tv9d0mbzfoA8nFzGJ9UyA.text: Just ate here a moment ago and had some very awesome chicken strips ! They were so temder and moist with the perfect coating . Along with the strips came waffle fries and i ordered a strawberry lemonade that was perfect to quench the thirst ! The service was great too ... can't wait to come back .

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders with strawberry lemonade mmm

r39L4r9wlU5YAw0U5AzVxQ.text: Food was great, got the original and crispy chicken. However, prices don't match the menu; could've increased prices by roughly 2 dollars. The two sandwiches cost us 25 total. The sandwiches have changed since the first time I came here. They don't do the traditional waffle fold anymore. Instead, they just give you two large waffles with the chicken inside. Kind of miss the old one

A37BU-7FkXRb7P5ZFpmTzQ.text: What was going to be a 1-star review quickly became a 5 star review... we ordered an original (chicken and waffle sandwich). We watched others get their food and my husband was growing more and more grouchy at the fact we didn't have ours and those that ordered after us got theirs. He got up, inquired about his food, and came back. The next thing you know they arrived with a refund as an apology and not one, but two chicken sandwiches. The sandwiches were really good. The service became amazing. And I left with a happy husband.

bo5ka1GXqIKzUoQEUpObHQ.text: Fun place to grab breakfast and try something different. The spicy chicken waffle was very tasty. Wife had standard breakfast waffle sandwich and wished she tried something a little more edgy. Will be back for sure.

WKizRlLN7Y9H2YknUVQtZQ.text: I had chicken strips and waffle fries, my husband had the chicken waffle sandwiches. Both were delicious! He chicken was antibiotic and hormone free and you could definitely taste the difference. Excellent service and friendly staff

Ig7_hZ_9cbHr44r9_dOsZA.text: Went after the game, line was out the door-only about 20min wait. Food came out quickly and was still Good!!!! Not too many restaurants can do quick and good! KUDOS! We'll be back!!

xdXcqgUyT5lbjcWW_ID52g.text: Loved this place. After a couple beers and giving back to Vegas, my friends and I wanted a quick decent meal.  Bruxie was perfect, good food, cheap, quick and easy in a cool atmosphere.  Everyone enjoyed their meals from chicken fingers to the original to the chicken and waffle sandwich with a fried egg and saracha ( this is what I had and it was awesome )

hTPadexy_sVW3GxmQJF2ow.text: Yum!!! Waffles are perfection and staff is awesome! You have to park in the lot of walk out from New York New York to access this place. The fried chicken and waffles are on point as well as the banana Nutella waffles. Strawberry lemonade is a bit on the sweet side, but just add water! Also, you get free refills here. Waffles fries are crispy and not greasy. Sandwiches are good too. Had the turkey BLT and there was a hint of maple syrup in it. Makes total sense since the bread outside the sandwich was a waffle! Will definitely come back here. Meal was delish!

jf06om5x6CnN0aRkBKJffg.text: I'm a Chicken and Waffles fan and this place for the money is ranked in my all time top 5 list.  But the extra consideration and courtesy displayed by Bruxie employee Andre McDowell is nonparallel in this type of serving situation.  He could not do enough for my mother and I and I greatly appreciated it.

YU5zGljHzg4rExQEECv5Fw.text: This place is great! Never thought I'd be a fan of chicken and waffles! Coming into Vegas, I never heard of the place and was looking for a quick bite before heading off into nearby T-Mobile arena. Ordered the Nashville Style chicken sandwich and I was not disappointed! A lot of flavor, a lot of food, a lot of great service! Definitely coming by here again next time I give Las Vegas a visit

cbI_qyka6aenxiHY1sxz9Q.text: They got me back two days in a row. Goodness only knows what tomorrow holds. The original fried chicken is a delicious, tender treat that's ready quickly. Just beware the sugar baked into the waffle as the crystals took me by surprise at first. The sausage breakfast sandwich was delicious and very filling and pairs great with the crisp waffle fries. The service was fast, friendly, and thorough.

M64GtNSmT-1ogED6MQ08xQ.text: Best place to have breakfast in Las vegas, the prices are reasnable. Great service and the stuffs are great. food is tasty. I recommend this place for who ever visited LAS Vegas.

yVT8mN4OTCC4aaJBmj_Dbw.text: Never a disappointment. We have enjoyed everything we have ordered from here. The original chicken and waffle sandwich is amazing and we love the chicken strips. Not only is the food delicious, but the staff is great. Andre goes above and beyond to ensure every guest has an enjoyable experience. He is efficient, engaging and entertaining.

IkEa8spldkEwFeGwolN8dw.text: Righteous. Go eat a waffle there. You won't be disappointed. Definitely coming back on our next trip.

D3noDB1lThcIpNmLOntpNg.text: We live 230 miles away.  My husband asked where I wanted to go for my birthday, I said "Chicken and Waffles in Vegas!  We were there last April and I was looking for an excuse to return.  I was not disappointed.  There were six adults in our group and everyone loved their meal.   I had the Nashville sandwich.  Spicy and tangy great flavor combo.  Ordered a little spicy syrup on the side for the last few bites, tasted like dessert.  The waffle fries are lite and not greasy.   Park at the New York New York located just outside the North enterance.  Get it to go and sit at a table out by the strip.  You'll love it!

cEJLzNuAnFCWfiuvsjevMA.text: Had the original breaded chic breast w slaw and honey chili sauce. Staff very friendly and attentive.

WjpJkn0JLU-Q0uPC9XJmyQ.text: Really good! Parking is a little tough in that area if this is the only reason why you are heading down there. The food is a little pricey for what you are getting but overall it is very tasty. I had the Original, which was good not quite as good as I was hoping for based on other reviews but still good just slightly bland. I will definitely go back to try some of the sweeter options.

s94us3M2klyNb2vmv-Cx0A.text: Waffle, egg and bacon sandwich was good but the egg was wayyyy over salted. Good coffee

FfIYAPEeLnsCJ2qzA-UtfQ.text: Omg I have never had better waffle ever....got there first thing in morning and very fast yet made to order. Beautiful area and fun if you have kids too.

nv2aZhq3WMtNvZS6enMdZQ.text: HOLY YES!! I was staying at Bally's and was skeptical of the 20+ minute walk it would take to get over close to Park MGM but boy oh boy was it worth it!! I love me some chicken and waffles and Bruxie did not disappoint!! Fried chicken, crispy bacon and a runny egg?? It doesn't get more perfect than that! It was served with warm maple syrup and everything was so tasty. I saw people eating these "sandwiches" with their hands but this was definitely a "fork and knife" situation for me. The waffle was thinner than a normal belgium waffle but the carb to protein ratio works. The chicken is crispy and perfectly cooked through and seasoned. If you are in the area, you need to try this chicken and waffles place because it is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-rnJQwlBYC6g-ftYxp0GJg.text: First time here, a good late brunch option. Got the Holy Chicken Sandwich and it was quite delicious, fried chicken was crunchy and full of flavor, eggs were perfect sunny side up with just enough yolk. Bacon was crispy and huge. I don't like syrup on my chicken, next time I know to ask for it on the side. My husband got chicken and waffles and son got waffles with a side of scrambled eggs. Both enjoyed their meals, especially the fried chicken. Also got the Belgian mocha which I didn't really care for, my son's got chocolate was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naked waffles with side of scrambled eggs
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy chicken sandwich

TEoEezxWbtm5PSTUmDV13w.text: I was craving chicken and waffles and found this place. Order at the counter and they bring to your table. Food came pretty quick. The chicken was very flavorful. Husband got plan old chicken tenders.. boring! They have spicy ketchup. Try the waffle sandwiches. Soda is the cane soda which we are not a fan of. Overall great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P1zPiGjlPIKE42ISWdUhyQ.text: Very delicious!!! Friendly staff and surprisingly clean considering the line was very long. Staff kept it moving fairly quickly. It's self seating so it is difficult to find a seat but well worth it. They have an employee in the back that's constantly making fresh waffles. I've had chicken and waffles plenty of times, and let me tell you, these sandwiches were a  different experience.  Definitely a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DdnPh9iMPVwbc53zmFweNg.text: Bruxie is fantastic for what it is, a fast food chain that swapped savory waffles in place of bread.  I fondly recall the first Bruxie I had at the original location here in Orange County like yesterday and like some kind of new school In N Out they have stayed the course ever since.  The ingredients are all from well known and quality purveyors such as Tillamook, Chenel and Boar's Head. The soda is all made from pure sugar cane and the floats are hand mixed. Look to the Smoked Salmon Lox & Dill Cream Cheese and Hot Pastrami Bruxie sandwiches for a guaranteed win. The Root beer soda and Creamsicle Float also will not disappoint.   The lines can become outrageous at times, but that is expected with food of this quality at this price point located on the center of The Strip. The employees do a great job of mitigating frustration and keeping the lines moving. That is when they are not bending over backward to get ketchup or a drink refill for sitting customers.  Honestly, I think Yelpers at large take the fast and fast-casual categories way too seriously and therefore the baby gets thrown out with the bathwater in reviews. If you  do not find any value in their sub-$8.00 offerings Shake Shack literally next door.   A solid option for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Lox &amp; Dill Cream Cheese.

MqSULkHhhSvwb3mGa8ABMg.text: So I've recently tiptoed back into the world of carnivores and it wouldn't be complete without a meal at Bruxie. I should preface that I'm not an enjoyer of chicken but Bruxie's crack chicken is an exception. We had the strips and spicy tots and the sandwich on the bun with the slaw (don't remember the name) and both were tasty as always. I don't think I'll ever visit Vegas and not stop for a lunch bite at Bruxie, it's just something about the crispness and flavor of the chicken that make life complete. If your in town don't pass go just stop and yes the waffles are great as well that just wasn't my mood this go round

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El jefe sandwich
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Tenders and spicy tots
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 piece chicken

p6gq8EKYNJfC7I7Sd94ytA.text: Definitely didn't know what to think when craving breakfast and seeing all the sandwiches made with waffles, but it's totally not what you think!! The waffles were not overly sweet and were also very airy--not at all heavy like a regular waffle!   We ordered the bacon, egg, and cheddar and the green eggs & ham sandwiches, both of which were absolutely delicious! The spicy tots were a super fun alternative to traditional hash browns, and the orange cream alcoholic shake was such a delicious indulgence at an early hour.   I foresee myself coming here again and again when in Vegas! Thanks Bruxie!!

37rv9aECpbT90S4Z9QPW0Q.text: So it's has been awhile since my fiance and I have been to Bruxies. Since we were both craving chicken and some Irish nachos, we both decided to take a trip to the one in the strip. We originally tasted the one in Irvine, Ca. where they did not disappoint.  Located right in the area between Park MGM and T-Mobile Arena, we decided to give this place a try. Pricing was a bit on the pricey side from what we both recall as we were looking over the menu. So I decided to try the Buffaload w/ fries and my fiance got the El jefe with the Irish Nachos. Knowing that our tab came out to about $45 bucks we could not wait to eat.   So the stars keep rolling down due the experience. One star taken away because it was overly pricey for the taste. Or as they say you get what you pay for. As soon as our food came, Irish nachos was measly and did not barely have any bacon, sauce, or not even a handful of toppings to enjoy it. They bring the Buffaload along with my fries, cool it looked pretty appetizing at first. The size was big, however do not let the size fool you. The buffalo sauce they used was not even hot enough and it was already cold biting into five minutes later. It was so bad, I did not even finish it and gave it to my fiance. As for the El Jefe, and the girl at the register told my fiance it was supposed to taste like seasoned carnitas. No where near close to that taste.   Overall, for the price and for the taste, I would go somewhere else where it's not overly priced and get the quality you love. On to the next.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffaload (4/10) pass on this
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish fries with not much topping
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El jefe

46cYO4x0-4u42Jy9GUFPAg.text: Really great, really fast. Delicious chicken sandwich and fried pickles that are out of this world. And thank you for making spicy ketchup a first class citizen in the condiment lineup.

rH2vLIJBg0jyHNYcDYx1tQ.text: Delicious food! I had the Holy Chicken Waffle sandwich and a Holy Bloody Mary, Spicy of course. The chicken was fried perfectly and the waffle has just the right amount of sweetness. The Bloody Mary was also delicious and one of the garnishes is bacon. Yum! Try this place you will not be disappointed.

co490U_Ga_Bx1J8PosSp2g.text: My Vegas vacation ended with breakfast at Bruxie, and what a delicious way to go!  I got the fried chicken skillet, that came with a savory waffle and sausage gravy.  I think it could've been hotter, temperature wise, because the middle of the waffle was kind of cold, but the flavors were all there.  And the egg on top was the piece de resistance.  Everything on that skillet worked, from the crispy fried chicken, to the soft waffle, and bit of sausage in the gravy.    Seating was a bit hard to find.  It's communal seating, so after snagging a spot, we had to wait for someone to wipe the table from the previous diners.  Also, the floors were sticky, so they need to work on finding a way to clean the dining area as often as possible.  Prices were standard for a place on the strip, but I think it was worth it.  The other option was a sad croissant sandwich from a place in NY NY.. it was cheaper, but not worth it IMO.  Next time I would get my food to go.  There are a few tables outside near the entrance of the hotel, but I can't imagine sitting there during those hot Vegas summers.  I'd probably eat my meal back at the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New item! Fried chicken skillet with a savory waffle, egg, and sausage gravy

h6dS8HliSYS6Z36BLrOPkQ.text: Bruxie, one of the spots in the city to elevate comfort food in one of the most seamless pairings and equally indulgent on its own.   While on the search for something we don't comparatively have at home, we stumbled upon Bruxie. Located near New York New York Hotel and a host of other restaurants lining up the strip.   The venue is outfitted with exposed brick in a cafeteria-esque vibe punctuated with food served on metal trays churning up sweet and savory waffles along with soups, salads and other Southern staples.   Chicken and Waffle is a brilliant play on taste and texture. The chicken is well seasoned and tender while the waffle is crispy with a hint of sweetness. A great combination!   We opted for The Nashville- -smoky in flavor with just the right amount of heat while dressed in a tangy sauce, lettuce and pickles to balance out the kick and an over-medium egg to bring it all together. Washed it all down with a refreshing strawberry lemonade!  A meal worth trying if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Nashville-Style Hot Chicken and Strawberry Lemonade.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Nashville-Style Hot Chicken and Strawberry Lemonade.

Sbw9EjE-fRzAjMO35hFo4w.text: Delicious food!!! So good there's a line out the door, but they move pretty fast. Stood in line for about 5-7 mins.   The kickin Chicken is great! There's a spicy tangy sauce on the chicken. The waffle is good just long enough that it's not too crunch or too soggy. Chicken is juicy and flavorful. Not too spicy. Also ordered the spicy tots which were good! The Palmer (Lemonade and Tea) wasn't all that great. I don't think anyone can top chick fil a on the Lemonade and tea. Lol Overall great experience. There's a lot of seating in the establishment. But also a lot of people do may be hard to find seating inside with a large group. There's about three tables outside, but right in front is a promenade that has a ton of tables.   Great Chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie. Good Food. Line out the door at 9:30 am!!!

sS7crRIfjFg9VBWrS90D_Q.text: I'm going to keep this short and sweet. Even though this place is a chicken and waffle place I actually opted for the 'El Jefe' fried chicken sandwich, which is served with a bun and some delicious jalapeno slaw. The sandwich could have used a little more sauce but the taste was amazing - I tried the waffle sandwich from someone in my party but I still liked mine better. Strawberry lemonade was great especially after that Vegas heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Jefe

gLQMgv-xubaPVW-ZkoPoRQ.text: First time trying this place. Whole family loved it. We got the green eggs and ham, the Irish Nachos and I think it was called the Meatsa chicken and waffle sandwich. (Had chicken bacon beef eggs) The 3 meals fed the 4 of us just fine.  Staff here was really nice as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CHzQwSNT0UXqH8H9mF0dsQ.text: Who doesn't love waffles? I'm a waffle over pancake girl, cuz it's al about the crisp for me. I had a couple visitors who swore by this place, so had to try out their dessert waffle, and yeah, definitely amazing.  The batter is legit, the crunch is there, and it was overall one of the best waffles I've had. Prices are strip price so you're looking at $8 or something for a dessert waffle, and that's just for one really cute looking waffle.  Dare I say it's possibly one of the best waffles I've had, and better than the one I had on the streets of Brussels.   I'm definitely gonna come back to stuff my fave for more waffles but with the chicken next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla custard with waffle cone and chocolate fudge on top.

SRSXo_g3PSISPxdlbPtyBg.text: Bruxie is good, Bruxie is great. I've had surprisingly little chicken & waffles in my lifetime, and I decided to change that.  My main gripe with chicken & waffles is that it's difficult to eat. The waffle is too unwieldy. The chicken pieces are too big. Bones? All that syrup? Where does it all go? Bruxie solves that. The waffle they use is lighter and thinner, so you get the full waffle experience without the logistical difficulties. The chicken is in manageable pieces.   I got the Original. It was phenomenal. Sweet, spicy, crunchy. The spiced tots were a great addition. They would have been great with ranch, but I was too busy stuffing my face to get up and ask if they had it. My friend got the Irish Nachos, which were delicious, but a little overwhelming. Very heavy. I still think I got the best thing. In fact, I loved that it wasn't too heavy for a chicken & waffle sandwich. No food coma here.  My Original and tots came to $17, which is pretty good for breakfast on the strip. I want more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original with Spicy Tots

cOsx2Wt9nfkfAIbWuf84sg.text: What does a person do when it's 10pm, you can't decide what to eat, and you walk by a place that serves fried chicken sandwiches......well, you walk right into Bruxie and you eat, it's that simple. While wandering around Las Vegas around the New York, New York casino, you'll find Bruxie located on the edge of the building. This place pretty much offers all different kinds of chicken and chicken sandwiches and it's quite the place. I came here on Friday night and ordered the "Holy Chicken" consisting of Maple Glazed Chicken, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Cheddar Cheese, Sriracha Sauce, and a Sunny-Side Up Egg. In case you skipped over what was in this sandwich, it was perfection with a side of waffle fries. The food took a little while to make, but then again, perfection does take a little bit of time. Once finished and served this thing was almost overwhelming to look at. The waffle fries were fantastic in every possibly way, making them the perfect companion for the monstrous sandwich. The sandwich is actually hard to describe, and is definitely a little overwhelming on the taste buds. The chicken itself is crunchy but juicy, with oh so good breading. The egg, Sriracha sauce, cheese, bacon, and honey mixed together makes this thing so much more then just a chicken sandwich, this thing is definitely in my top 5 chicken sandwiches of all time, did I mention how good it was?   Bruxie is not a healthy place, but if you feel like living it up in Las Vegas, you should probably give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pray to the sandwich.

vinOizHxdfol9A29EcJ4kg.text: Yum!!! Awesome food and atmosphere! My favorite brunch place for when I'm in town!! The strawberry shake was delicious! The staff is always friendly, and the food comes out quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich

TCHCg2hBYFu0Sm5eX9r55g.text: Came here for lunch and it was amazing! I've become a huge fan of chicken and waffles within the past year and this is the place to come for that.  I ordered very quickly and took a seat at the window seating. The food came out fairly quickly too and it wasn't that busy. The food wasn't as hot as it could've been but overall it tasted amazing. Literally everything on the menu was drool worthy but I ordered the "Holy Chicken!" and a side of waffle fries because why not add more carbs?!  This is basically a self serve restaurant, where you order at the register and take a number. All condiments are available for you to get yourself.

jDHiylIV-vOqgk4vYPOstQ.text: As someone who currently lives in the South, I was underwhelmed by the fried chicken here. It was soggy and it really didn't have a great taste. I got the waffle fried chicken sandwich. Blah. Overpriced and definitely not the best waffles I've had. Maybe people like it so much because they're still drunk when they eat here, definitely a hangover breakfast place but I just wish the food tasted as good as it looks. Expensive for what you get.

6hqaYQfbiBgoL6Cij_7pyw.text: Was in Las Vegas last weekend and my friend and I decided to try this place because it was close to where the bus was going to drop us off. It was our last day there and we were both pretty tired and feeling hungover, but chicken and waffles sounded like something that would hit the spot and we were not disappointed.  First I love the location, it is right in New York, New York area, which honestly is my favorite.. and it is located to an area where on a nice day you can take it outside and eat at one of the tables. The area to eat is not very big, but it has room if you have a large group. Plus they prepare the food very quickly so people come eat and leave pretty quickly. It is good for family if you have a family to bring.  We decided to order a waffle sandwich that the guy at the front desk recommended and boy oh boy it was sooooooo good. We split one sandwich but honestly I almost had wished just just got my own because it was just that good. The ratio of sweet to savory was perfect, honestly it is some good hangover food.  The sandwiches are a little messy to eat, but I do not think it is worth getting upset about, I mean you are eating a waffle with syrup... and common it is Vegas loosen up . The prices are a little high though, so do not come if you are looking for something on the cheaper side.

dt61D21YPCZS0LgU-GXsbg.text: Man I'm not a big fan of waffles but this place blew me away! Great bacon egg and cheese on a waffle, yes on a waffle! I wanted to order a second one right away but practiced some self control lol.   Great spot for a quick breakfast break!

oY24PjL32dsMqPqHP-b4Bg.text: One of our favorite places to eat when we come to Las Vegas! Love the original sandwich and of course the chicken and waffles is one of our favorites! Will come back when ever we get to Las Vegas!

72zb46iNNVZ274jct9PBHg.text: Wen there this morning with my wife. Read the reviews and seems promising. Had the bacon egg and cheese and she had green eggs and ham. Place is clean, staff is nice but not sure what the big deal is. Waffle could have been more firm. There was not a lot of flavor.

tj-YoLqXawl2B9WdQ8-mJw.text: One word overhyped. I expected more when I have to pay 15$ for a very simple dish that I can make at home like chicken and waffle. The waffle was brittle, dried and over cooked, chicken was good but not spectacular, egg and bacon was good cause I mean it's egg and bacon. The name of the dish is chicken and waffle and you already messed up the waffle part. Make sure to inspect your waffle and see if it's dried cause we thought their quality is consistent until I look around. I'm sure you know what's a good waffle should look like.
