qQuHh4gJXqRUWNFV_wmMIA.text: Located in the newly renovated sidewalk just north of New York New York, across from the new hockey stadium. Sweet and savory make a perfect combo. We shared a breakfast sandwich because they were quite filling. The coffee is strooooooong.

MbqsOPTG0EFjf2gOJe8J8A.text: Found this place on Yelp, it was the last day in Vegas right before we headed off to the airport. Walked but and saw that the line was pretty long so got a little discouraged but it moved pretty quickly. Got our food in 10 mins and was in and out in less than 30. VERY attentive and polite staff, came over asking if we needed refills. Told them they were out of utensils and they immediately brought me one and restocked. Bathroom was clean, music and atmosphere was great. Just when we were walking out we were offered a free milkshake. Great experience I would recommend any come here. Loved it.

U71_BP7Z84urE0itS6dvLw.text: Went here on first day in Vegas. It was ok lol somewhere quick to sit and eat. Menu was a bit confusing but there was plenty options. I only ate half of my meal because i really wasn't feeling it lol. But that's just me. Don't knock it till you try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1G7t1k-IG_8sSkoqCgbBGA.text: Perhaps the best chicken sandwich I've ever devoured. Fairly big too, and I'm a big eater. I was a little hesitant I would be so satisfied considering that my waffle sandwich, Buffalo-style fries, and drink was worth the $19 pricetag, but it surprisingly was.  The Original chicken waffle sandwich is/was a culinary masterpiece. Took 10mins to get to my table, but worth the wait. The waffle was light and crisp. The chicken perfectly fried and lightly battered. The slaw and chili-honey sauce complemented each other nicely. TIP: order an extra side of the sauce for dipping/topping. Also, feel free to change soft drinks without extra charge.  The Buffalo style fries were great. Not too soupy or soggy, with ample blue cheese sprinkles. Just wish there were a few more fries per order.  I'll be back for this meal next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sandeich + fries + the Palmer. Great view from the patio!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original + Buffalo-Style waffle fries

NIWdAbe217ph3f_qPkWLQA.text: Had the nashville chicken waffle sandwich which was pretty damn good. Wish it was more spicy though. Also had the irish nachos which was pretty much waffle fries, melted cheese, and bacon. Definetly can't go wrong with that combo. Good place for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles so soft n tasty.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. did someone say cheeeeeese?

59mTbrdDpSHXX8AEiKUmzw.text: Visited Vegas & came across the restaurant & I must say, one of my best meals ever.I could of ordered one of everything on the menu. Best chicken & waffles I have ever had. Very tasty with lots of flavor. Chicken cooked perfectly. Waffle had bit of bacon in it.  I would definitely revisit this place when in Vegas again.

g_3xVs05AwePB_aLSnCJeQ.text: My husband and I were looking for a heavy snack to hold us over till a late dinner and Bruxie was convenient. The sandwiches looked great but went for chicken fingers and waffle fries. Probably the best chicken fingers I have ever had! The ranch (that I usually hate) was fantastic and my husband who doesn't like BBQ sauce loved theirs! The chicken was actual tender meat that looked hand battered. They had light spice to them but nothing over powering. The fries were just basic waffle fries nothing spectacular. The strawberry lemonade was tasty too! Not too sweet!   The reason for the 4 stars is the staff! They weren't overly helpful and almost seemed annoyed. It wasn't even busy...which maybe I could have understood. Also $15 for chicken fingers?!?! Yikes! They were good chicken fingers though!

e44l2RdiFQFZLwI0MgzLsA.text: This place was completely dead on a Saturday afternoon which was scary but we took a chance on the concept anyways.  The best food that I've found in Vegas that is not in Dallas, tx. This was absolutely amazing! Great concept!

iT09nbH25HAijTAQgebrbQ.text: Good food with a good looking menu. I ordered the Holy Chicken and it was good, however I was expecting it to have a little more flavor. Don't get me wrong, I will be coming back to try other things on the menu, I just wish that particular item wowed me as I was expecting it to. Definitely a place to check out if you are walking around The Park.

fN0yutk31SWcVGIt0s8QTA.text: Great chicken,waffles awesome Bruxie sauce makes waffle too mushy otherwise a great place

r-ScqMJrD-ayTGCGdPMQZw.text: A fabulous alternative to the behemoth breakfast buffets that abound on the Strip.  The location is convenient -- in the Park between NY NY and the Monte Carlo, with a street-facing facade that eliminates the need to hike through a smoky casino.  At 9am, Bruxie is busy but not overloaded.  It takes a few moments to place your order, grab a seat in the spacious and tidy dining room, and wait for your order to be delivered.    I had the original fried chicken and waffle, with a side of fruit.  I was familiar with Bruxie's style of chicken and waffles from an earlier to visit to one of the Orange County locations, and the Las Vegas location is True to the rest of the franchise.  The flavor is outstanding. My only complaint: not enough crispiness, both on the waffle and on the chicken.  In my world, fried chicken is all about that perfect crisp on the outside to contrast against the softness and juiciness on the inside.  Prices are surprisingly good -- consistent with other locations, and not obviously jacked up due to proximity to the Strip.  Odds of me returning are quite high!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle and a side of fruit

hnlfXhoQMiN1nRXTzCb1GQ.text: There are a few eateries that come along, that make the competition take notice and say "...daaayum, we better get our grind on, or get left behind". Bruxie is, one of those places.  New school flavors/combos, or keep it traditional. Chix n waffles so good, you will wanna slap yo whole family!

VU-V1_WSzI7Mvdz-Yfv4HA.text: The holy grail of waffles, the shangri-la of breakfast, the heavyweight champion of goodness, ladies and gentlemen unbuckle your belts and unhinge your jaws, because this a no hold barred flavor massacre.  If you can't handle absolute goodness, then cover your mouth because this is not for you.  Every mind blowing bite is going to change your life, so think twice before ordering.

dxTrQXpA-XMcQ8pCcujhOQ.text: Go there! Had the Holy Waffle. Fast service, reasonable prices. The waffle was crunchy and tender. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the Siracha sauce had just the right amount of heat without overwhelming the dish

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0YvaeYzKktAGhqv41GeR0A.text: Visited Bruxie back in March 2017 but so good that I should write this review 7 months later.   Had the Original Fried Chicken and Waffle, Mac and Cheese, and Seasoned Waffle Fries.   All of it was amazing. The Waffle was light and fluffy. Chicken was crispy and moist. The Mac and cheese had perfect cheese flavor. The Waffle fries amazing as the bacon really added flavor.   All of it was so good but as you get through about half of your meal, it starts to feel too heavy and you just can't continue eating anymore. I still had the room but tapped out. This is expected with how heavy the food is but Bruxie is definitely still significantly lighter if you were to order the same stuff at other places.  I hope to come here as I'm in town again!

YIprN4s1bj1H1Jif0nOUzA.text: Although their vegetarian menu is limited, their one dish is amazing!  Granted I was really hungry, but it was great.  I got the basil/goatcheese/tomato waffle sandwich, and it was great.  The waffle fries are also delicious.  Warning, it is super messy to eat, but 100% worth being a hot mess in Vegas.    There's plenty of seating and the service was decent, but quite slow for the dinner rush. There was only one person working the register, with a line out the door.  Finally they brought someone else in and the line was much smoother from then.  There wasn't wifi, and we walked here so I dont know what the parking situation is, but the food was delicious.  When I found out there were more locations in LA, I was super excited.  Cannot wait for my next Bruxie's dine-out.

-DGZ1pkebzTE4zqkkuofwg.text: My boyfriend and I have always wanted to try this place out but we never found the time to go when we go to the LA area.  We were in Las Vegas and I was so excited to see this place near our hotel. We made a point to try it before we left. It went way beyond our expectations.  I had the Holy Chicken my boyfriend had the Crispy Chicken.  Two thumbs up!

yVIiE9h93BSSe-3S5K0atg.text: I tried the 3 piece fried chicken (original seasoned) with the bacon cheddar waffle. I also got the Irish nachos. My favorite dish was definitely the fried chicken with waffle, especially the waffle. The bacon cheddar had a glaze on it and usually I don't like sweet and savory together but this was so good. The fried chicken weren't thighs or drumsticks (which I prefer), and sometimes it was a little dry but the outside was super crispy and yummy. For the Irish nachos, it's nice to snack on, but I probably wouldn't order it again. The waffle fries itself was really good!

F7dIKpXTLDxIeQgBbJKmAg.text: First time here and the food was fantastic. Great takes on chicken and waffles. Everything was fresh and dessert waffle was lights out (creme brulee).

kWXklNWmSMw27eBUuxjkLg.text: Staying in Vegas over 4th of July weekend meant all the breakfast buffets were doubled in price.  So we yelped Bruxie and I'm glad we did. The sandwiches deff hit the spot! I'm hoping one inL.A. opens soon.

cgeez3kBSrc23JunLbjbGg.text: Came in during my vacation after seeing a special on their FB page for $5 chicken strips and fries. The chicken needed more flavor to me. It was just okay and then I saw they had waffles so I ordered one with just powered sugar and it was disgusting! It was cooked on the outside but mushy on the inside. Boy, looks can be deceiving. I didn't see what all the hype was about. It was just overpriced okay food. The only cool thing is they make their own sodas.

eD6OhXUylidBAv4Cr2Jc4w.text: Holy Crap! Bruxie's new Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich is the highlight of my morning. First off, whoever thought of using a waffle as sandwich bread was brilliant. Sandwiched inside was a peppered fried chicken breast, two strips of bacon, cheese, some special sauce (I think chipotle or spicy mayo, I have no idea) and an over-easy egg. Sounds like a mess right? I thought so too until I saw the picture on the menu (I took a picture so you can see too). I was full when I was half way through my sandwich, but I knew if I stopped eating, I would regret it. This restaurant is new to me, and Las Vegas' arena Park area. Thank goodness they have locations throughout Southern California.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich...it&#39;s new! get it!

wEr172ZcX4HskdaNqMFdXQ.text: Finally tried Bruxie, I got the Nashville chicken waffle and wife got holy chicken waffle, she loves hers, as for mine, it's good but the concept of waffle holding my chicken is so unusual and weird, first I cut my waffle and chicken to smaller pieces because it was so big, after doing that for the first half, I finally said screw it, hold it and chow it down, the chicken is not extremely hot, just got a little kick to it, I'm not too crazy about the pickles, gave them to my wife, might go again and try something else tonight. Oh the orange drink is extremely good, not sure if it's a soda or what, my daughter got that, she usually doesn't like soda but she loves hers. Lines can be super long on the weekend, but as soon as you order, food will come fairly quick, so it really depends on how fast people order their food.

TrOWiBNmFtWFbVWtS_Qpfg.text: Best fried chicken I had in a while. Did not know what to expect with the waffle but was pleasantly surprised by how light and crispy the whole thing was did not even feel full. The waffle Fries are alone a reason to check the place. Now I want to try the rest of the menu starting with the desserts! Prices are a little steep but at least the food is good... Need to have a second register open when you have a long line though...

The waffles were light, fluffy, and crispy at the same time. VERY different compared to other places.There's a kick of spice in the Nashvile compared to the original chicken and waffles. iIVe1qUMlmPSc9q5lJQS-w.text: Visiting Vegas for a few days. Decided to top by based off the ratings. We ordered the traditional fried chicken sandwich. Sandwich was fresh but a little to sweet for me with the honey dressing. Coleslaw was good, the atmosphere is nice. We enjoyed the strawberry lemonade. Def not worth of the 4.5 star rating it has but a good option if you want something quick.

Clnhhlyu6pLKA9HTvEFimg.text: As an absolute lover of chicken and waffles I'm pretty picky about what I'll deem exceptional and Bruxie's is just that! I ordered the original chicken and waffle sandwich and requested the sauce on the side so I could try it individually with their signature sauce but also with the syrup. Note: syrup not needed cause their sauce is 100% on point! The chicken was cooked with just the right amount of crispiness and that right amount of good grease you need for this dish. Also the waffle was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside just as it should be. To drink I had their cherry cola which selling point here is that everything in their store is an in house production no 'name brands' all their own unique creations.  Everything paired extraordinarily well and the guest service was one of the best I have ever had!  I will most definitely be back at Bruxie's the next time I am in Vegas!

5VF8XjiX3e7JmMG0qn8brg.text: Had the 2 piece Nashville hot with the bacon cheddar waffle on our last day in Vegas. The flavor was on point, the meat was tender and juicy. I usually love my fried chicken with buffalo or Louisiana but the BBQ sauce here was spicy n' tangy, perfect sauce for this. It came with a side of pickles which compliments it well. Going to have to stop by this place in L.A.

4C1wviKx834cl_6Lf7l-Xw.text: Amazing service and great food!  Wishing we had one closer to us.  My daughter had the grilled California chicken pesto.  She said it's one of the best sandwiches she's had.  I had the fried chicken poutine.  I should have shared with someone.  It was very good.

vRTaN3GTTyA-YRN9IV51_g.text: I love a good lemonade and their strawberry lemonade is the bomb. I enjoyed the Irish nachos and the their waffle sandwich.

0tdaZjgva3-Qe7M8RJW77A.text: This is our first time here. We heard about that place since its in Southern California . We just had to try. It's located by shake shack in the new Park!  It's really loud inside! We ordered chicken tenders with waffles fries and chicken poutine. They were moist and tender! They also had many hot sauces on the side to get some! Prices are reasonable. Waited maybe about 15 minutes to get the food. We were some tables with chairs and bar stools. Must go back for our next Vegas trip

4h8YrfT9DIhQguLDiK1afQ.text: Freaking. Bomb. Like, best food I had in Vegas! I can't even. Just try it. You will never regret it. Absolutely delicious. We waited in a line around 11am on a Saturday. But absolutely worth it!

dx595bsEykHYDi5aueDARA.text: Highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. Hands down The best chicken and waffles I have ever had. I got the Nashvile chicken and waffles, if you like spicy food then get it!. The coffee is really good too

zKKBzcC6wRnZ7dPb_B8Pgw.text: The presentation was much better than the taste. Great concept needed more practice.. the food was given cold the waffle in the skillet was burnt to a crisp it broke my plastic fork. Had to change my pork sandwich. the employees were helpful though..

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork Sandwich

RTXeJO2-3P9u-FDCm0OPsQ.text: Mind blowing thin crispy slightly sweet & chewy waffles with savory and sweet fillings of choice! I've had Bruxie's in Orange County bookmarked for ages but never knew a location opened up right next to Shake Shack in Vegas! I tried the Original with fried chicken, chile honey, and cole slaw. One bite of that crispy waffle and I was hooked. Made to order fried chicken with the right amount of delicate crunch. I normally don't like sweet mixed with savory but the light smattering of chile honey distracted me from any excess sweetness. I love cole slaw on sandwiches!   The sausage & egg waffle sandwich looks underwhelming compared to the Original, but the combo is a breakfast staple.  Nutella & bananas! Sweet cream and sprinkles of powdered sugar  We ordered thinly sliced pastrami & Swiss, waffle on the side to take home. I popped the waffle in the oven, along with the pastrami topped with cheese a few hours later-- soo good!   Separated the lemon cream & raspberries so the waffle wouldn't get soggy. Dip waffle pieces into the tart lemon cream and add a berry-- refreshing and the berries aren't sour!   Order at the counter, receive a pager, and choose a table. Staff will bring your order out. Water, utensils, maple syrup and condiments are available at the counter next to the registers.   Can't wait to visit again!

Sds5vFJggZPcLSvvJu3C6Q.text: An inventive take on the classic fried chicken and waffles served as a sandwich. The menu has multiple options with different sauces and toppings including a nice and spicy syrup. The sandwich is good, though a tad pricey. The location is a little cramped but convenient for the main strip. It's a decent quick lunch meal stop.

3sd0yqxGb8uQxqew_DVv8w.text: Good little spot on the Strip in the Park. Used to visit the Chino location and was glad it made its way to Vegas! The Nashville Hot Chicken and the traditional burger are the best in my opinion but everything tastes better between waffles.   Most people usually just shoot for the desserts but I only go for the meals. Great easy value for the Strip and good location

S9RgAoBge3ukg6xu7xvNmQ.text: I need to get a new job! I work WAY too close! I have now tried their chicken strips...Better than any I have ever had and HOT? I mean temperature HOT? Yes. I have a half hour to enjoy 4 chicken strips and fries. I normally take one to finish during my next break. The chicken like I said is HOT and the chicken moist inside, crispy on the out, their bbq sauce is spicy good. Oh and of course I get the ginger beer. One of these days I will try one of the sandwiches, I just love the chicken, dill pickles and ginger beer. I don't even bother with Shake Shack, even though their burgers are amazing. If you are at the Park between the Park MGM and New York New York and in front of T-Mobile and don't try at least try a home made soda, (I suggest GINGER BEER! Lol) you have no one to whine to about boring food for lunch, SILLY you! If you visit you need to check it out, you are welcome! Lol! But in the past 3 years I have lost almost 75 pounds...I really do want it to stay off and to lose some more!

um7HWN2dKtj8aYjNBCiTQQ.text: This is always a stop while I'm in Vegas. Satisfies the drunchies. The waffle is thin and crispy, and the chicken is perfectly fried. Beer. Craft soda. Worth cheating on a diet for!

bpQBBrs40zx_78wtHojCBQ.text: I was ISO Chicken and Waffles while in Vegas and got my fix at Bruxie! I ordered the Chicken and wlWaffle sandwich with Maple Bacon and Fried Egg w/Sirrachi Sauce. Perfecto! The chicken was seasoned perfectly and the bacon was clutch...the whole combination was delicious. Will def visit Bruxie whenever I come to Vegas.

y9O3AXeITrIO9MlEOO3YIw.text: A STANDOUT AMONG THE MYRIAD STOREFRONTS The Las Vegas strip is a maze of colossal elevated casinos buoyed by countless restaurants and convenience stores littering the ground floors like names on the Stanley Cup. It's impossible to pick a gem among the dross without research. Bruxie rewarded my efforts.  EFFICIENT ORDERING, OUTSTANDING SERVICE Unlike Shake Shack the menu at Bruxie is fairly simple and quick for the unschooled to understand. The pleasant cashiers expedite deftly. I clocked a crowd of 60 processed in 11 minutes. And, in super friendly Las Vegas, the helpful attitude among the staff was by far the best out of my week long experiences.   STICK TO "THE ORIGINAL" A huge chicken and waffle (I opted for spicy) seasoned with tangy cider slaw, slathered in a unique chili honey: $12.   ...and free refills!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PRETTY DAMN PERFECT: great people watching, refillable drinks, and that delicious chili honey/cider slaw on their big golden fried breast.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MENU PHOTO: most everything under $12, but you are missing out if you don&#39;t order The Original.

na9ZBXs-F2hNH_bOGsxKyg.text: OMF-----ing G!  Bruxie has won my foodie heart.   One of the best FoodGasm I've ever had.    I tried two different types of chicken and waffles (sandwich).  Order your food at the counter and have a seat on a table of your choice.    Food:  The Original Fried Chicken & Waffles: Seasoned Breast, Chili Honey, Cider Slaw Nashville Style Hot: Spicy & Smoky Fried Chicken Thigh, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Lettuce, Pickles  Oh my gosh, the waffle was perfect and my favorite was the original.  The chili honey and slaw was such a great combination.    I will definitely stop by whenever there's a BRUXIE in town.

rBBCTgRCPtUHCgbhBG4gug.text: We tried the original chicken sandwich. The chicken was good, hot and not fried too hard. The waffle didnt get too soggy but it didn't really taste like anything. zl-fYfV_Zv6tg_pNXnTlRA.text: Came in on a Sunday morning. There was no wait at about 10:30 am. This is right on the strip and yummy!   Service and food was awesome. We passed several places with love waits and were really happy we came here.

AcBzWqRnuooSjGU7XSi6xQ.text: I loved everything we ordered!!! The chicken was juicy and extremely flavorful. The waffle was light, airy, and crispy. It had melted cheese on it which really added a salty, savory flavor. The angry Mac and cheese was a little spicy and cheesy. It had spicy bacon in it too! The golden mule was a great breakfast drink to have with this!! When we got there the line was really long and the place was PACKED. I was worried because we were so hungry, but they were so efficient with taking orders we only stood in line for a few minutes! We also were able to sit at the bar on the side and only waited about 5 minutes before they delivered our food! All the people working there were really helpful and friendly!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O4peKWVqGRL2CbGhotSwrQ.text: This was my second time just going to this restaurant chain in general, so I was excited to see this place here in Vegas.  My boyfriend and I decided to be adventurous and try out their limited time only Korean style burger that was supposed to be a bit spicy. We ended up getting a side of fries and a cream soda as well that apparently they make in house.  It didn't take too long for our order to come out and when it did, it looked really good. They were nice enough to cut the sandwich in half, but the slaw in it kept falling out. It was really salty cause of the soy sauce and it drowned out the flavors a lot from the sandwich in whole. But the chicken was nice and crispy and the waffles were soft and fluffy with some crunch too on the outside. The fries were of course good cause it's hard to do them wrong the sods was pretty good too.  I should've stuck with my gut instinct to just get their signature chicken and waffle sandwich. But glad I gave it a shot though.

C_n0Iwj520mUJ2hYHDyzBg.text: Absolutely amazing. People talked about "chicken n waffles" all the time, but like what's so special about waffles eaten with chicken? lol . . . . until I came here. I had no idea white meat can be so tender. It was also a savory chicken n waffles, not sweet. The food was just mind-blowing. I hope this place expands out of California and come to the east.  My friend and I ordered the Tenders, Kickin' Chicken and Holy Chicken!

HLjWcFXgmIbxR_eFcjyslg.text: Always stop by for breakfast at Bruxie when I'm in town! This place is a good quick on the go bite to eat, very clean inside and the employees are always extremely polite! Try the spicy chicken waffle sandwich, you cannot go wrong!!!!

xf2pXPQN8lS0em_YNhwKrQ.text: Amongst the best meals that I had in Vegas. We wanted chicken and waffles, this was the place to go. The chicken batter had a tinge of spice that was offset by the syrup. The crust was thick and crunchy, but no complaints here. I prefer a Belgium waffle. Theirs was a little harder and thinner than I like, but still tasty. Mine in particular was undercooked in some places. So was my chicken, which is why this is a 4 out of 5. On another positive note, the mango/strawberry (I don't remember) lemonade was fantastic. And they had it sitting out so you can get your own refill. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle sandwich

kIUxRtE5Yjy12m2S_PBAyw.text: I didn't know Bruxie started in Orange, CA. It's a chain, so if you're from Southern California, you have an opportunity to eat something else in Vegas. But if you're not from Southern California, Bruxie isn't bad!  My hard-to-please mother really enjoyed it. And if my mother thought Bruxie is delicious, 5 stars for everyone.  Let me put it out there, it's not cheap. It's not In-n-out or Chick-fi-la. It's like $13 for a burger without a drink or fries, but that's kinda normal in Vegas. We got the Original, which is a chicken sandwich. The combination of light airy waffle, crispy thick chicken patty, cole slaw and maple syrup was very satisfying. Just writing this review, makes my mouth water.  You can't eat this burger/sandwich without getting your hands in syrup. So please wash your hands before and after.  The restaurant is located in New York New York, towards the strip. It's right next Shake Shack which is more visible if you're driving on the strip.

KRbREXbHl1kiKixNxQRFzw.text: Just get the chicken and waffle.  Two fried chicken breasts and waffles. Simple and delicious.  Even with a long line it moves fast.  Reasonably priced.  Quick and easy breakfast on the strip.

xfyHSYSmX9-xIo9LmEm0WA.text: Just ate with the family, we ordered the " Original, Holy chicken, Green eggs and ham, nutella and banana, strawberry and cream, it was all awesome. Waffles were light and crispy, chicken was perfectly seasoned. Staff are very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5H3FAJE8GpF5HIMShP0vVg.text: First time I tried them was in Los Angeles, and loved it then, so when I found out they were coming to Vegas I was thrilled but hopped to not be disappointed and glad to say I am not.  In fact the food tastes just as great, the service here is amazing, and the location is perfect!     So far my favorite is their Buffalo Chicken waffle with Blue Cheese and Slaw, however on my next visit I am definitely going for the Pastrami Waffle sandwich.  Since I got to taste this sandwich on my last visit I was sold on the perfect taste of Pastrami and their Mustard sauce.I am sure everything served here is delicious and worth trying though.  I have yet to make it to the dessert waffles due to being overly full, but I will soon.  I will say I remember the waffle fries being a little more well done in the LA location, which they tend not to be so much here and also the portion is a little smaller.  They may be fresh waffle fries so like some other fry places, I'll just need to ask for them a little more on the well done side.  I will say that our last visits have been during our hot Summer months and for some reason the doors are always opened and only half of the room have fans, so expect warm eating conditions, this is unfortunately the only part I don't like   The service here is also amazing!  They stop by and check on you often, refilling your drink and removing your empty trays. Definitely a great place for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Irons

rK189-olJUfBktgBOKVtWQ.text: We ordered the original and waffle and chicken.  My kids said to give it 5 stars!  So here's 5 stars!!!

ig5zar8-Jp1ZU4MA3wd8tg.text: First time having chicken a waffles  and I will say it was pretty amazing. The chicken was crunchy on the outside and nice and moist on the inside. The waffle wasnt too sweet and complimented the chicken which  was all tied together with syrup. Would reccomend for anyone who has been wanting to try chicken and waffles for a while but hasn't.

spLY4-JOAm-GNbD09RszWg.text: PROS: Delicious, great value for your money (especially for it's location on the Strip) CONS: Can get busy  During our trip to Vegas a couple weeks ago, my sister-in-law, a Las Vegas local, recommended we try this place for their delicious waffles. She ended up taking my husband and daughter there and both were so pleased with the place that they convinced me to go try it the next day.   We went back on a Friday around 10:00 am and I could tell that the crowd was close on our tails. When we got in line, we were already near the door. (You order at the counter and then they bring the food out to you.) Our family of four ordered a Country Sausage & Egg Sandwich, The Original (Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich), a Holy Chicken, a Naked Bruxie Waffle, and a Mint Shake. The sandwiches were much larger and much more filling than I expected. And to top it off, all the food we had was absolutely delicious. The meals even come with a mini bottle of their maple syrup (which I took home with me). The Mint Shake even had REAL mint leaves in it, not just mint flavor added.   As a native of the Bay Area, chicken and waffle joints are commonplace for me. And I've never really cared too much for them. I mean, it's fried chicken. And a waffle. No biggie, right? Then why, after over a week am I still thinking about how Bruxie's waffles have perfectly married the two? Why can I still vividly recall that when I bit into the waffle it delightfully crunched then casually melted in my mouth?  So my sister-in-law had breakfast there today. She sent us photos. And now, I'm looking for an excuse to come back to Vegas to visit family, of course, and to have a waffle while I'm there.

6TzkX_Vu7zpKpkaYn6jx4g.text: I seriously wish Bruxie had locations in Chicago. Someone needs to make this happen!!   We had breakfast here twice during our five day stay in Vegas. And this place is stellar! The waffles are crisp & the sauce combinations on the sandwiches are amazing! I had the Nashville Hot. The sweet/spicy sauce mixes really well with the pickle/relish. My husband got The HOLY Chicken. He wanted the egg fully cooked & loved it. Their waffles fries are amazing too.   Their dessert waffles looked amazing, I regret not trying them! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Iqt9CoBqqFL2jQxXVLUI5w.text: Bruxie opened as a patio stand in Orange County, California in 2010 with one genius idea -- the Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich! The crunchiest, juiciest, most delicious fried chicken is served here. Given its perfect location, Bruxie is easily accessible from hotels at the west end of the strip (New York New York, MGM Grand, Excalibur, Tropicana).   I highly suggest you try the:  NASHVILLE HOT Spicy & Smoky, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Romaine, Pickles  HOLY CHICKEN! Maple Glazed Chicken, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Cheddar Cheese, Sriracha Sauce, Sunny-Side Up Egg

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1NEiVPFWJq4snegsLNApFw.text: I'm literally the last person to leave a review, it doesn't matter if I have a horrible experinece but this time it was completely the opposite. This is the best experience I've ever had and this is the story:  We ordered the original and the holy chicken sandwich (which by the way are really good) and the order took longer than expected maybe 30m or so, so I asked kindly if the order was on its way and she quickly apologized and proceeded to look for my order. I believe there where having a minor tech issue with the orders so I just went back to my seat and waited for my order. She not only came back with my order but with a full refund!!! I was perplexed as this is the first time something like this happens to me and it exceeded my expectations.   With this in mind I'm positive that not only they thrive to give the best customer service possible but truly emphasize it. Thanks guys for gifting us an awesome last meal in vegas, we will come back without hesitation next time and obviously recommend it as the food was better than I imagined.

qiBdvYSErcqXXW93UcJqlA.text: Chicken and waffles! Woohooo!!! I was kind of excited to try it...let's say that the children opted to eat it in an deconstructed way...waffle and chicken separately...I myself tried the chicken and found it a little dry for me as it was white meat but the batter was pretty good. The waffle I find a bit thin, I like the waffles thicker.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RtTZZkKvh0476B6B3BvQ6g.text: This place serves up some tasty, quality products while keeping fresh clean look and speedy service.  I went for a waffle chicken sandwich ( which is what they are known for); since I love barbecue sauce I chose the barbecue chicken sandwich that came with slaw and crispy onions. While all the ingredients were nice and tasty: chicken perfectly cooked, onion rings a very nice touch and great waffle that was perfectly crisp, the barbecue sauce was no good. It tasted like a slightly bitter tomato sauce with nothing else to it; I was highly disappointed and immediately regretted not getting one of the original chicken sandwiches (which was recommended Yelp). It tainted the taste of everything and I feel like this place deserves a five for taste, but I cannot give it that because of the barbecue sauce. I also ordered a side of their waffle fries which were good, I wish I would have ordered them loaded I am sure they would have been fantastic! The business had a simple yet appealing and clean set up. The whole place was very clean,  stocked with outlets for you to charge your phone and the sauce station was nice as well. The service was friendly and surprisingly fast.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone; please don't make the same mistake I did and stay away from the barbecue sauce, so you can truly taste the quality of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Southern Chicken Waffle Sandwich. Didn&#39;t like the bbq sauce, everything else was good.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Southern Chicken Waffle Sandwich. Did not like the bbq sauce, didn&#39;t taste like real bbq sauce.

SdXQwQ9R2jSfK5bgIlA30g.text: Go there. End of story. It's delicious.  Recommend the Holy Chicken and waffle fries. Also the hand crafted sodas are great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken

yxkQ5-4MB7PcUs7iMSgN0Q.text: Simple, comfort, fast food!  Only knowing about this place in Cali, I've always wanted to try it but never got to!  But how awesome that these little known places are starting to creep their way into Vegas!  Unfortunately have only been here twice since it's located on The Strip (where no local really likes to travel to, lol!), but well worth it!  Located in "The Park", a great new addition to the Strip, same area as T-Mobile Arena, New York New York, Shake Shack, Beerhaus, CPK, Sake Rok and the big, tall lady statue!   Casual spot. Lots of seating inside, a handful outside. Open kitchen view where you see them making waffles on the waffle makers. Cool decors, i.e. the waffle maker wall, garage like separator from the semi-outdoor seating to inside, chrome touches, etc.   I've tried "The Original" Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich ($9.25) and it is an extra $4 more to add Waffle Fries (aka side) and a drink!  Big, crispy, flavorful, juicy chicken breast in between a crunchy-on-the-outside-soft-on-the-inside, airy, light, Belgian waffle, topped with chili honey (salty & sweet goodness!) and cider slaw! I'm a sucker for fries so those were awesome too, but talk about carb-overload!  Service was fast and the workers were on top of everything!   Really trying to find a reason to come back to try the Prosciutto & Swiss Sandwich, like ASAP! :P

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0h3ACD4uNuLiYn4UxicJNg.text: The atmosphere in here is lively. It's an order at the counter joint, which I always like. I saw an ad on FB for the $5 Crispy Chicken Waffle Sandwich on Waffle Wednesday (7/26/17) and have had this place in my Yelp bookmarks since I first moved to Vegas! I knew it was time to try it.  I ordered the Crispy Chicken Sandwich but didn't know that I had to show the ad on my phone so she almost charged me full price but I mentioned the ad & she gave me the discount! Yay!   My boyfriend ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken Waffle Sandwich & it was just phenomenal. Especially dipped in syrup, which they have at your disposal along with water & ketchup! The chicken here is super juicy & meaty with an amazing crust that's crunchy & flavorful. The spicy-ness was just right. The waffle was slightly sweet, crisp on the outside, & fluffy in the middle. I'm telling you, it was THE absolute perfect bite!  The Crispy Chicken Sandwich was good but I'd prefer to not to have the sauce it comes with (the mayo of some sort) & no tomatoes next time. I couldn't taste the flavor of my waffle enough in this one. But of course, it was still delicious because that chicken is TO DIE FOR.  They bring you your food to your table, but we did clean up after ourselves. I will definitely come back to this place in the near future.

vNRZkplYPg5tL5u4lgkppQ.text: Service is great, employees are friendly, food is just okay. Wish the waffle had a better flavor. Allergic to bananas so I replaced it with strawberries on the nutella dessert which was delicious.

5jQXjt_37LM6HMeEDM3j7g.text: So yummy!! I've tried other Bruxie locations in SoCal and this location doesn't disappoint at all. Friendly staff, scrumptious food, and reasonable prices. My favorite is definitely their Irish Nachos and sundaes. A must visit on the strip, give this place a try!

qbmzKgU3aC5DqUSI4fcUGQ.text: What a treat I stumbled upon as I was walking toward the t-Mobile arena, between the New York New York & Monte Carlo casino I found this comfort food gem. Chicken sandwiches with a waffle replacing bread.  I got the Nashville sandwich, and the bacon Mac & cheese. The sandwich was fantastic, the Mac was ok. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm coming back here for sure.

FkXPW0vtRSlgHISSQjwc8w.text: This is by far the best place to the chicken and waffles from! I was very impressed with how quick the service was and the ambiance of the restaurant. I wish they had more locations in the US though. Overall, I loved the experience!

mjmXW8J8ydiOvO7-PCutMg.text: BRUXIE you beautiful sweet waffle chicken sandwich you!! If you are in Las Vegas and want to experience a different type of breakfast go to BRUXIE. She is short and sweet and will give you goose bumps coming in and walking out. 5 stars!

A6N-gP6YVAp04HcnEdtGnA.text: We stumbled upon this place as we were exploring the strip. Located next to the "Park," this place definitely had a presentable and inviting atmosphere. Apparently, it was a new hype that we never heard about until we got there.   We ordered the The Original Fried Chicken & Waffle, Chicken Tenders with Fries and two shakes.  First of all, I'd like to give the disclaimer that the chicken comes out boiling hot -- which, in my opinion, is a plus! If you burn yourself, well, then it's your fault for not being adult enough, haha. I wasn't really feeling the breading too much, which is why I'm knocking off half a star. It was lightly seasoned and was a bit thin for my liking. The meat though was white and delicious.   The waffle was delicious and was a perfect combination for the chicken; however, the waffle broke as soon as my boyfriend picked it up. He had to use a fork and knife to eat it afterwards. As for the waffle fries ... well, let's say I was very disappointed. They tasted super chewy and like rubber. I love criss-cut fries too, but these were a total let down.   I also thought the ranch was a little watered down, which didn't go too well when dipping our crunch chicken tenders.   Overall, this place is OK if you're looking for a quick bite. They have a cool tabling technology where you just place your beeper on your table and the staff will know where your table is. We spent about $30+ for two people.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Shake

vfnORSC6tx-Eb-BIG_Cw4Q.text: Stopped by here for lunch today and had the original fried chicken waffle sandwich. It was probably one of the best chicken and waffle combinations I've ever eaten... slightly spicy chicken with a sweet sauce and coleslaw. Might have to come back and try a sweet version before we leave town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original!

DeZro_JDM7qzSWTLsNh22A.text: The food was great and at a reasonable price. I got the original chicken and waffles sandwich, and when I took my first bite, the waffle was crisp but wholesome, much better than most waffles. There was a syrup dispenser at the bar and I didn't use it, but even without it, the sandwich had the right balance between savory and sweet. I hope to come here again and eat another of these delicious sandwiches.

ruqP2X6BAvM7LxtzPRa8HQ.text: Bruxie was recommended by a friend and fellow foodie and I couldn't wait to try it. I'm hoping they open another location off the strip so it's easier to get to but I will battle the traffic and parking mess of the strip to return to this place!  Items ordered.  -The Original Chicken and Waffle-Seasoned Fried Chicken Breast, Chili Honey, Cider Slaw between the light,airy yet flavorful waffle. The chicken was fried to perfection in a tasty batter and had an excellent flavor.  -Prosciutto and Swiss with arugula, whole grain mustard and a "runny egg". This was my favorite for sure! With you first bite breaking the egg it's yolk runs into every nook of the waffle getting a bit of each ingredient in every bite. So lite and simple yet satisfying!  -Nutella & Banana with a cream sauce. Looking for a sweet waffle to end this experience I had to go with this, Nutella being a favorite of mine. Not overly sweet but the warm waffle keeping the warm and gooey with the right amount of bananas and cream sauce this did not disappoint!  They have a counter with forks,knives,napkins, ketchup and of coarse waffle syrup. Most of the dishes we had didn't need syrup but just a little on the chicken and waffle wreaks took it over the top.

3iEsgCKEk_nP9hQ8ouOZww.text: I want to say i was not exoecting much but i have to admit this was a great breakfast choice service amazing and the food was pretty good as well.  The Chicken Sandwich is a great choice and the cheese fries where just as good.  Diffently i will be here again.  Great atmosphere

Sandwiches served with a cider slaw - The chicken was incredibly fresh and juicy. The mac & cheese had bacon & a hint of hot sauce and was to die for! They had two local  beers on tap and a variety of other non-alcoholic drinks available. For a chicken and waffle (fast-food) house there is a wide selection of food available.

We got home from Las Vegas and immediately look for the nearest Bruxie restaurant. Will go again and again.

abcRy0umYyYrp2T1gtSwdQ.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Came back time and time again despite all the offerings of Vegas. The delicious chicken and waffles sandwiches, the amazing staff, and the awesome location (right next to the Monte Carlo/Park MGM) kept me coming back for more. The big portions also keep you full longer so you don't overspend at the other restaurants on the strip!

_1ZlcKiYlvHFu6doGRAsfQ.text: One of the best places that we tried while in Vegas. We are here three different times and it was amazing every time! Wish they had one of these close by! Definitely a must try when in Las Vegas.

C_zF-r0a8w5tfjh5kKDqxA.text: Located on the outside of the New York New York hotel, this is a counter service restaurant. Their specialty is waffles. Waffles as sandwich parts (which they offer several types), waffles as dessert and waffles all alone. They carry more natural sodas, instead of the expected Coke or Pepsi products. A surprising change, from the average counter service restaurants. Worth checking out.

6zB0JRpl2nosQEraWI03CQ.text: First time having chicken and waffles and it was ridiculously good !!! Next time im in Vegas definitely going back.

aXw9cK6s3qTItll34UUdZg.text: One of the downsides of putting off writing a review for an awesome place is that when you are prompted to write said review, you are filled with a deep longing for the delicious waffle sandwiches that are offered by the restaurant. Bruxie was an awesome find. The waffle was light but crisp, and the chicken was tasty. I sure hope it sticks around on The Strip so I can visit again to get my waffle fix!

J3D1COiSt-mgFCKEHB6p6Q.text: A must every time we are in Vegas. The lines gets long early so plan on a line and wait. Everything I had in this place is great. The service is also great. Happy employees. Definitely recommend to anyone in Vegas.

cciguinOVBWNe92MTlbpFg.text: You know how Denny's tastes good when you're drunk? I can only imagine that's what this place is like and why it has such a high rating. My other half got The Whole Chicken sandwich. There aren't many vegetarian options but I got the mushroom and goat cheese salad sandwich, which would have been a pretty decent salad. I'm not entirely sure why they needed to put it in a waffle. And then we both shared the appetizer plate of cheese fries (without the bacon). Once we finished, we felt sick the rest of the night - similar to how you feel after eating White Castle. It's just greasy food that has the novelty of being in a waffle. So if you're drunk, have at it. Otherwise, I'm going to pass.

FM-DfPMztjuSEmquisAOpw.text: Delicious! I'm not a huge fried chicken fan, but the hubs loves it. He got the original chicken tenders and waffle fries. I originally planned on stealing just one bite. Boy, was I wrong! I ended up eating a whole piece of chicken and half of his fries. The breading is perfectly spicy, the chicken is incredibly moist, and the house dipping sauce is wicked yummy. Prices are good and they have big pitchers of ice water to quench your post-nosh thirst.  I wasn't a fan of the loud music in the main counter area, but we sat in the quieter side dining room. There are also plenty of tables outside. I definitely recommend this spot for a tasty affordable meal in the land of insanely overpriced grub.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken tenders and waffle fries. SO GOOD, and the dipping sauces are nice compliments to the zesty breading.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big windows looking out onto the Strip
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watch how they make them on the big screen while you wait!

vGQL4UswbER3XyXv75ZeKg.text: We walked 30 minutes for these chicken and waffle sandwiches and we'd gladly do it again.  The fries were perfect and the angry Mac n cheese was superb as well.  It you're a fan of chiken and waffles, do yourself a favor and stop by here while in town.

Sjps2JLkVLmULGDeiK-9_Q.text: Wonderful chicken and waffle spot near TMobile Arena.   Waffles were fluffy yet crisp to provide a good sandwich base.   Chicken was outstanding too.

_GelFiy7cifN-ZtPHHy0cQ.text: I never understood Chicken and Waffles until I went to Bruxie. I was looking for a "different" breakfast / brunch place and I found it!   Bruxie is next to New York New York. It's a semi small place, but perfect if you're by yourself or have a few friends. You walk in, order at the counter and find a seat. I'd never been there so I asked the manager what he recommended. I got the basic Chicken and Waffles and wow, it was AMAZING!   I highly recommend this place if you're not wanting Vegas Breakfast Buffet or something random from the food court!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

foRp9ItpW7jYtR4225jK3w.text: Awesome chicken waffles. The chicken cooked to perfect tenderness and maintaining a great crispy crust. The waffle was a 10/10. Cole slaw perfectly complemented the chicken waffle pairing giving the a good non sticky binding layer.  Reasonably priced for the location. Good ambiance and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic chicken and waffle with hot chocolate.

YAFuXjfXXYb-6oD49_7sgg.text: Everything about this place is delicious from their dessert waffles to their savory ones. I love the Original waffle sandwich. Don't expect a sweet waffle with that sandwich though. I was a big fan of the maple syrup dispensary by all the condiments. My dad ordered the naked waffle and got an adorable bottle of syrup on the side. They messed up my friend's order though. Ordered the original and got something spicier w/ tartar sauce. Luckily, she enjoyed it. If you have a small stomach or get full fast, split a sandwich with a friend!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Waffle Sandwich w/ slaw on the side!

T_ZhQmK99TXAU4u6l-Wd5Q.text: Chicken and waffles.. in sandwich form! I love it! It was definitely very filling and greasy. But if you are into thinner waffles with a fat juicy slab of fried chicken in the middle, then you must try Bruxies! Although I wish there was a little more flavor in the waffles.. at least they have a dispenser of syrup and ketchup there for ya.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original!

LSKXnWKkJGgoPMvTHihSSw.text: I used about 10 napkins during my lunch here! It was so bad, but sooooo good. I ordered the original and added Siracha sauce. I also had a side of regular fries and asked for ranch on the side. Even the ranch was amazing.

49mnkRBwjuBA5yAFGuB_3A.text: One of the benefits of living in Las Vegas is not having to travel too far to sample the best of food franchises from all over the country. Where else would you find In-N-Out, Shake Shack, Eggslut, and the soon to open, Momofuku and Halal Guys all in one town? Bruxie, a chicken and waffle favorite originating from Orange County, is now available in The Park.   Their waffle sandwich is made to perfectly pair with the chicken. The waffle is not sweet, somewhat thin, and stays crispy. It sandwiches a perfectly tender chicken breast. Most people try the original buttermilk chicken first, but I loved the Nashville-style hot chicken. The spicy and smoky flavor is not exactly that of the Nashville chicken I experienced at Hattie B's, but delicious nonetheless. I didn't see this item offered at any of the other Bruxie locations so this may be a Vegas exclusive.   If you're a fan of waffle cut fries, these are a must have.   I'll have to return to check out their sweet waffles including the Liege Belgian-style waffle. I'm also excited that they offer frozen custard, which hopefully does justice to the Wisconsin frozen custards I've tried.

WgQjXvQPUVsRGC7dL4diqA.text: "The original" chicken sandwich was good. Service was good too. People really worked hard to try keeping the place clean.

nnke5GhAIBp-w-Ny284VZQ.text: Excellent, crispy and delicious  I don't usually like waffles, but I decided to give Bruxie a try and felt like I could toss the waffle if I didn't like it. Was I surprised when I took my first bite, the chicken is excellent, boneless, tender and crispy, and the waffle is light and crispy. The waffle is finished with a lightly spiced syrup and some coleslaw. This sandwich is very memorable and I can't wait till I get have another one.  I was told the chicken and waffles are cooked fresh for each order. So while Bruxie operates like a fast food place, it's freshly made.

TBLsjZKO9Q3XHDEBgbh9vQ.text: This place was awesome, one of the first food places I visited on my trip to Vegas! Waffles, fried chicken, and their waffle fries were all fantastic. I definitely want to come back.   I got some variant of the spicy fried chicken and I definitely left satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the good stuff, waffle fries and spicy chicken

kzQp_czgc3SkXozI3zyifQ.text: Best Place for Chicken and Waffles hands down!!! Must try!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Nashville Sandwich was bomb!!!  Original Skillet is a must try!!  This place is so fucking good!! Better than Roscoes!!  A little tricky to find but its right around the Shake Shack.  Parking free for one hour at NY/NY.  One guy stands out in service. Always Checking to see if everything is okay. Very friendly. Attentive. Was there on this Sunday morning. Appreciate his hard work!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmmm Orgasmic Chicken and Waffle Heaven!!

qwXtO0WmVSFz8JbN5gWH7w.text: Amazing. Absolutely amazing! The friends I went with, including myself, were quiet the whole time, completely taking in the flavors and perfection of our sandwiches. We are a chatty bunch too so that speaks volumes.

cgGmHFEGQGrfZ6GuQYWAhA.text: Just saw this place in Vegas and wanted to give it a try! We had the original chicken and waffles with the spicy syrup. The hand crafted drinks are great!  The spiced cola reminds me of Dr Pepper. Very fast service!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle Sandwich!

HAPhReM_QOmiib5P3K-anA.text: Fast service and amazing food!  We went to Bruxie on a Thursday night with only 1 hour to spare before a big show. There were a few large groups of 5+ people but this was not an issue at all. service was fast and the restaurant was relatively quiet compared to pubs and other fast food places. Overall, we were in and out in about half an hour.  I had the green eggs and ham -- perfect for any breakfast lovers out there. Thinking that this breakfast item wasn't going to fill me up, I ordered two pc chicken tenders on the side ($1 each). The green eggs and ham was SO GOOD -- I also put one of the chicken tenders in there and it made it even better! By the end of my meal I was really full, so that was a bonus. My partner had the Nashville skillet with the spicy sauce on the side. He too was happy with his meal and he was really full as well (this is rare, to be honest). The servers were really friendly and chatted us up to ask where we were from, what our plans were, etc.  Overall, Bruxie was amazing. Wish it was in Toronto; I would definitely recommend, and I would definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green eggs and ham @ Bruxie Las Vegas. Strawberry lemonade to drink

exqbWmX_xzFXlLE-7ixVkA.text: My oh my!  Spent the weekend in Vegas and came across this gem of a place! !  I love me some chicken and waffles. This place did not disappoint. On our first visit, we chose to split the Holy Chicken. It was mighty delicious.  The flavors popped in my mouth; savoring every bite. I knew that we had to be back. And that we did!  We went back with our friends and we decided on chicken and waffles.  I had the cheddar and bacon waffle. WOW!! We also had the fried pickles. Our friends raved about it too. So if you are near one of their SoCal locations or Vegas, it is a must stop kinda place. It's kinda good we don't have one close to us...I would probably be there every weekend. Good for business,  but not for my figure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W7u2Yfz-sYYXjvcSD3NTAQ.text: Wow, a very solid chicken and waffle sandwich. Very satisfied. No complains. Would definitely come back to this place. Would highly recommend it for a simple and a fairly priced breakfast. I got the Holy Chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Holy Chicken!

3P2n3FO8KblpNyRUgVP1_g.text: Came here for breakfast and ordered the original and the Nashville.   Pros: fresh ingredients, atmosphere, well prepared food, coffee  Cons: strong flavor (sweet / spicy) may not be for everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville and the original

9aRULruWErYLLICFHgao0w.text: I always thought Chicken and Waffles was the dumbest idea that anyone had dreamed up.....Bruxie changed that.  I was drug kicking and screaming into the restaurant (not literally).  I saw the BAMF and thought well at least I'd have Mac & Cheese if nothing else.  OMG...this had to be the best sandwich I've ever had.  It was spicy mac & cheese, crispy (but not too) chicken and the waffle was cooked to perfection. Husband and son had ones with eggs on them and loved them equally as well...not sure of name....too busy savoring my sandwich.  I'm a local.....strip is reserved for visitors so.... PLEASE open one off strip preferably on Eastern, Sunset, Pecos, Green Valley or Silverado Ranch.

mKJD5CvBkqesniiQ_lD0WQ.text: Hands down the best brunch in Vegas! So good we went twice while staying in Vegas.  Drinks are good food and amazing and flavorful. Also it's very clean another plus for us! Can't wait to go back!

MxpG0z44enl-tqrDjMmS2w.text: This breakfast waffle sandwich place was really good! It is justifiable that there was a line out the door for the delicious food at reasonable prices. We had waffle breakfast sandwiches, fried pickles, and a shake. Everything was delish. I'd recommend this spot and would for sure come back next time in Vegas.

09B-icyTrGXBFvVmcK5fkQ.text: Fried chicken and waffle sandwich is where it's at.  Just delicious.  Also had the grilled chicken with sun-dried tomatoes, roasted crimini mushrooms, goat cheese and romaine with a balsamic dressing - which was decent.  I would have liked different toppings.  The strawberry lemonade was tasty but a little on the sweeter side.  Prices are about $11-$14 for sandwiches and the salad was $11-$12, so definitely reasonable.  Thanks Yelp!

GouGsJdW-MLW1-lLxIEhQQ.text: I used to go to the Rancho Santa Margarita location in CA before it closed and was waiting in anticipation for a Vegas trip to get an opportunity to come to this location. We stopped here on our way into Vegas since it was a mile or 2 before our hotel. My only complaint is the parking. It was terrible and being hungry already, the parking situation made me pretty hangry, but when we finally found a place to park the food was just as good as I remembered it if not better.   The last time I was there 2 years ago the charged you for a side of syrup, but this location has a syrup dispenser much like a ketchup dispenser so you don't have to hold back or waste $2 on a small thing of syrup. Our meal was delicious and I plan to make a habit out of stopping at Bruxie on my way into Vegas whenever I end up making the trip over there.

yTGmhDruIPMr-UpqcVUCDQ.text: Visited Bruxie yesterday with my girlfriend for breakfast, they open at 9am. It was actually really good!!  I ordered the green eggs and ham, that pesto sauce they put inside is delicious! Add sriracha sauce to it and it gives it a nice kick!! My girlfriend ordered the chicken and waffle sandwich combo with waddle fries and a strawberry lemonade! We wish the strawberry lemonade was bigger, but it was good, definitely fresh! I love how they have water by the condiments as well!!   The waffle fries were delicious, perfect salt and still soft, not too crunchy like it sat around the whole time. It's a nice place, quiet when they first open but starts getting busier around 10ish! It's a cute place!

V1chBH_szfxQj9yOllnj6g.text: Chicken and waffles like only the southeast knows how to do, but nestled right on the strip!

_siGJEaDR9CXMNDM3HNnPg.text: Foot was awesome!!!!! Great place to try and get your money's worth. Food is very filling and fresh!

xbjmccZ8JcdC8rJ1GJLB9g.text: While on vacation in Las Vegas I tried Bruxie and absolutely loved it. So much that my friends and I ate there two days in a row. My favorite is the holy chicken, it's amazing!!!! The staff was so accommodating and attentive! They have good knowledge of the food and provide great recommendations. If you're ever in Vegas in the strip, it is a must to try Bruxie! You won't regret it!

Q7C90_GNa_IelyH2xeN3BQ.text: This place was delicious with a beautiful view! I was surprised how filling the portion size was. The chicken was very most and flavorful. I don't know how I felt about the ginger drink I got, it was just a little to "gingery" for me. But, the strawberry Palmer I replace it with was amazing! To finish the meal off we had a chance to grab their pumpkin spice cheesecake waffle which i loved! All around great place. Not cheap but worth the price

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuuummmm

drNXYqeU583pmBeZdJGmdA.text: Wanted my chicken and waffles fix... Find the perfect spot for it!  You're going to end up wearing half of your meal but it's worth it! Even had two people from the East that were hesitant about the chicken and waffles concept to try it out and they loved it as well!  They have their own specialty sodas and all of the food was delicious. Highly recommend!

HaOY5TADa19mosc1V49nLg.text: I was very impressed! I got a sandwich with an over easy egg & chicken on it. Good service at the counter. We were waiting outside for them to open, so luckily we were one of the firsts in the building. Others waited for 20-30 minutes after us. Get there quick :)

pK5-5v-ySwyLVIL6Kvm7mw.text: I went again, and I absolutely love this place. Prices are awesome, and their portions and descent. This time I tried the new HOLY one which had an egg, bacon, and maple glazed friend chicken. So good. I wish we had one closer.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son had one that was supposed to be hot (spicy). He loved it, but he said it was still really good.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was their new Holy one with bacon, egg, cheddar, and the chicken has a maple flavor to it. So good.

2zeoxR_hoojU8YvQJI4BcQ.text: I love this place. Perfect spot to eat before and after and event at T-Mobile Arena. Favs are the Cobb salad and of course chicken and waffles. The Palmer is refreshing plus they have cups for water if needed. Prices are very reasonable compared to most restaurants on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad

HW5WIUdfLa5UYSRoK7BxuQ.text: Delicious! I drove about 20 minutes just to get to this place which is on the strip. I say that because as a local we do not like going to the strip, fighting traffic, parking, walking.. all to get something to eat lol. However parking was easy at the New York New York and we walked right down to the restaurant. I ordered the barbecue sandwich with the coke slaw on it which was amazing. I would have never thought waffles and barbecue sauce would go together but it does. The waffle fries are great too. Nice hit and fresh. I would recommend going here if you can.

ewS4m7ks8CaegvFoYPf6Lg.text: Bruh. Lemme tell you. If you are into heart attack food, this is the place. Best chicken and waffles I've ever had; the "Holy Chicken!" Was drenched in syrup and was sweet, salty, savory, and dosed every part of my brain that loves food. We ordered a side of Irish nachos and it was too much! Heavy and hearty. My gf and i shared a sandwich and the fries, and we couldn't finish the fries. We were full. That's the kind of portions they got going on here. I would recommend this place if you dgaf about cholesterol or calories and just want to have your inner fat kid satiated. It will do the job well!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish nachos. My girlfriend and I halved a sandwich and we couldn&#39;t finish the side of nachos. Too much food here!

0xm2obcHSmmrfN_YvqbJOw.text: How can I come to the states without having fried chicken and this place does waffles and chicken. They used the waffles as bread. These waffles are so light, its different to any waffles I ever have, I could eat a dozen of them in one seating. I chose the original chicken with waffles, so a pieces of chicken covered with waffles with sweet chilli sauce and slaw. I love love love my meal and I savour every bite of what was in front of me. If I had more time in vegas, I would try everything on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8fUAWbuhggEW521lXvk4OA.text: First off I want to thank the guy who was running around doing pretty much everything from clearing tables,  bussing tables, and bringing water,  napkins,  utensils and/or food. Awesome dude give the man a raise.   I ordered the Nashville Smokey and Spicy Chicken Waffle sandwich was ginormous and delicious.  Had enough kick paired with the slaw, dill pickles, and sweetness of the waffle and syrup was perfection made my taste buds dance.   I also ordered the Buffalo Style Waffle fries which were yum but they do get a bit soggy quick because of all the cheeses and sauces. We're tasty as well might be a bit heavy to eat all of this again at one time best to share the fries.   I have been to the many other Bruxies and once again they did not disappoint.  I am a fan and give the Bruxie in Vegas a repeat offender score.  Yummy in my tummy all day every day!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville smokey and spicy chicken waffle sandwich with Buffalo style waffle fries

lv1d2zerMzTz8Ql4LznpYA.text: Bruxie is exactly as good as the reviews said it would be. I had the Nashville spicy waffle sandwich. The waffles are crunchy and taste just slightly sweet. The chicken was juicy and tender with extra crispy breeding. The pickles were perfect, not to thick or thin, cold and crunchy. I'd ask for extra next time.  Their soft drinks are all a little bit special, they make natural sodas and lemonades that are good enough you won't regret your soft drink like I so often do at other restaurants.  Two slight complaints: They're not open for breakfast, and the fries are just your average quality waffle style. Still totally 5 stars.

XUOoduFaYsuW7bmMy0RSGw.text: Just okay... was totally mislead by all the high reviews. Food was okay, service was okay, atmosphere was okay. With all the food options in Vegas it's tough to understand why this place has such high ratings. If you really have a craving for chicken and waffles, then by all means hit it up, otherwise I'd move along.

TLiAkG0v5-bGmro3dJlAgQ.text: I went here for brunch and tried the Nashville hot chicken waffle sandwich. Perfect amount of spiciness the chicken was A+ but I thought the waffle could be better. My BF ordered a chicken plate with waffle and we shared waffle nachos which was way too much food! Haha. Large portions and definitely worth trying when in Vegas. Get the Nashville hot chicken and maybe try the spiked milkshake that I was unfortunately too full to try. Also they no longer have the poutine waffle fries. The location is great for people watching and right by the TMobile Arena.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside the restaurant right by New York New York and T- Mobile Arena

ZV0Mmpw2yPhxdsi03WqGOA.text: Today was demo day at the Bruxie place. We got the BAMF and the Holy Chicken and needless to say we tore them up like a hungry pack of hyenas! If you have a hankering for some CHX and Waffles, this is the spot in Vegas!

fT6pXExvXwvo-OBBGmYlFg.text: Recommend and will return. I'll just know to ask them to hold the sugar crystals in the waffle!

fsKx4-kb8lyzVTT7Y6WR-w.text: YUM!!!! this place is amazing! I came across this place while walking the strip and couldn't help but notice a sign that said "original chicken waffle sandwich" and I knew I had to try it! It was absolutely delicious! They also make their own sodas which is pretty cool. I had the regular Cola and my boyfriend had the root beer. Both were great! The service was also excellent! I'm looking for my next visit to Las Vegas so I can come here again

xilzmj9MO9LvJBew2RUtZg.text: Very impressed with the waffle sandwiches. Fries were meh, but enjoyed the experience overall!

NeAmVayQNqffMzRJaBoabw.text: Man, this is good! We had the egg, cheddar and bacon waffle sando, and even without a hangover, it was wonderful! Waffle is tender crisp, egg cooked perfectly, and the bacon was great. We couldn't handle the added fried chicken at 10:am, but it looked amazing. Definitely stop by this place!

7QhP8AxEkh1o-NU2dgKdzQ.text: We came here for brunch and ordered two breakfast sandwiches (one with bacon, one with sausage). Both were good. The waffles are not like waffles I've had in the past - these are thin and crispy, making them good "buns" for the sandwiches. The portion was too big for me, I could only eat half of my sandwich.  Good location on the strip in the park.

hgaKcYqdJBONSIXgL37RjA.text: Stopped in for a quick desert.  Got a Liege Waffle with Chocolate (of course).  I've had Liege Waffle's before and this was not my favorite.  Still worth a visit for a quick and easy late night desert.

k4iQ6_3XehdYnZy9BSDOxA.text: Amazingly great without a doubt, definitely recommend if you're in the area. All the way from Texas and will definitely be back to stop by!

VUVaNSsAZmaOMzZKf_RCLw.text: This place is not bad.  I came when it wasn't busy so we were able to sit anywhere and order immediately. The portions are not bad for the price.  The chicken was fresh. The only thing I didn't like was the cheese from the nachos that my bf got.  Overall a great place

wHpqhSjrlDgwK-zie1nc7g.text: Everything you expect.... and more delicious! Kicking' chicken is amazing... my new every time I come to Vegas spot

Cd9a8B-USMUFatBQiG6oNQ.text: Bruxie had my vote when I noticed the creme brulee waffle! Sooo good!   The staff was super friendly

7kjY0u0m5UquvR3YeWSvvQ.text: Dang, I don't even like waffles, and yet this place has converted me to becoming a waffle lover!  Best dang chicken and waffles you'll ever find. I had the 2 piece with bacon cheddar waffles. Try the bacon cheddar instead of the plain--its really good. The chicken is delicious, and the waffle is cooked perfectly; a bit of crunch on the outside and soft on the inside with layers of deliciousness. I can't wait to try them again!

9cuTL4VK0Yt8zouhkOBG4Q.text: The flavors and texture were unbelievable! Both the chicken and the waffles were soft and crispy at the same time. 3 of the 4 people at the table claimed this was a top 5 meal of our lives! Got the Holy Chicken 10/10 would eat there every meal in Vegas if it were my choice. Worth the 12 bucks, easily.

7LvnICHpZquBfIC3b_UaGA.text: We gave this a try in the later evening and it was really good. Their chicken and waffles was great - a good sized sandwich. We added on the drink and fries which was like $4 extra a little steep for small fries and drink but the fries were good. We also had kids and the kids meals were excellent- Mac and cheese good portion and very cheesy. My other kids also had the waffle with berries which was also excellent - their whipped cream looked freshly made and the enjoyed every bite. Would recommend!

ZV3JW5uXJ1ovmtfHOA8PVA.text: Outdoor seating is nice and cozy.  Food is delicious and they happily served us outside.  Don't miss out on the Hot Chicken Waffle. So good.

nt9nefZZsZAuVGQSu-WuGA.text: What s great place in the heart of The Park. The waffles didn't taste heavy or too bready, they were very light and crispy. I can't imagine them being better! Can't wait to go back and try the savory bites.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_hTMKAshZLCF_p7FWDjJuw.text: I needed a place that was convenient before a concert at the T Mobile arena and so we made a stop here. I got the original fried chicken and waffle. It was the perfect guilty pleasure. My friend got the nashville hot tenders and she enjoyed those very much. We stayed next door and both my friend and I loved Bruxie, we ended up returning 2 times during our stay it was so good! It's great for people watching which was entertaining to say the least.  There was a lot of seating although the line up is usually long, it goes very fast!

hgYh-35niTn0O0kxGbtXRQ.text: I am a fan of Bruxie and also stop here for a meal when I am in town.  Very good fast food fried chicken located right on the strip.  Quality is a level above other fast food places like Popeyes or Bojangles, which I both enjoy.

4JOiy40Tc3NV9wmHxCnCag.text: Chill place to hang out. Can't really speak for the afternoon. Was there for breakfast. The creme brulee waffle was pretty good.  Use one of our cheat days to come here. Well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QlmdySikoAxTPSn5-b-oyQ.text: Yum Yum Yum! This place was tasty! A bit pricey but what isn't on the strip. We will definitely be back... Even though they did not give us a discount for steal my hashtag... ( my dog is named Bruxie too)

h_2Aes6f8tGgCx2S5Uw6Mg.text: We decided to eat breakfast here back in March on our trip Vegas is a fairly new place and it is and experience The food wasn't bad but it's really not what I care for the place is really clean and neat try something once I would recommend trying this place
