js9SG-1uJ2nXUWd2dH3xjQ.text: This place is great from the original sandwich to the waffle sundae for dessert. Its a must place to stop when near one the aroma of the waffle the chicken , the establishment its good

xHiWsZBpJ_hdAuxhgKzaEA.text: If you like friend chicken and like waffles, this place is good for you. I went "no sauce" as usual to save the calories and keep the waffle from getting soggy, glad I did too.

VkmTTGb51EIGC166mHpMag.text: Visiting from NYC .... this is a mandatory stop best chicken & waffle sandwich spot in town

19OclvB3s9yJapN_wF82JA.text: I've been to multiple locations, and this one is just as good as the others. I had the bacon, egg, and cheese and a side of waffle fries on a recent trip to Vegas, and it was good, but the waffle was just sliiiightly dry. The bacon comes in chopped pieces, in case anyone cares about that. Their menu has really expanded since they first opened in CA so I think you are bound to find something that sounds appealing.

5F_1fZXEu_8C4rVaJyStsA.text: Take away the location, the view and the novelty of The Park, and all you are left with is an overpriced meal. I'll be honest, I had great hopes and expectations for this place, but my experience really took a turn to negative town, and then sped down that road, from the very beginning. Wanna hear more? Read on...  We got to the restaurant and the greeting was not much different than that I get at McDonalds. It was literally a "NEXT" cattle call to get to register. And that is when the fun started. I ordered a chicken finger meal with a strawberry lemonade and my girlfriend ordered a cobb salad with a Chardonnay. Sadly, what they call a Chardonnay on the menu, was actually a Pino Grigio (written right on the bottle), and the poorly-trained cashier kept insisting they were the same thing. I don't blame him for the mixup, I blame management.   Anyways, we were given a pager and told to sit anywhere we wanted to and the meal would come to us. We waited for what seemed like 10 minutes to receive my lemonade and then another 7 minutes for my food. Now, I do not mind waiting for good food to be served, but I did mind waiting that long to get an overlay sweetened strawberry lemonade and food that is very comparable to Jack-in-the-Box or Popeye's chicken. The fried chicken on both plates was half seasoned, borderline burned, and on the dry,  so it was nothing to write home about. In particular, the Cobb salad wasn't good nor visually appealing... tomato chucks were too big, the bacon had a stale taste and texture to it and the lettuce was straight out of a bag (I saw them refilling their salad station when we were leaving).  Like i said earlier, I really wanted the experience to be good. So, to make sure I left no proverbial stone unturned, I also ordered their Mac and Cheese which truly looked scrumptious. Unfortunately, that was yet another let down. They serve their Mac and Cheese in a cast iron skillet...but that is only for show. I thought they baked the dish in the oven (in the cast iron skillet) to melt the cheese, but they do not. In fact, the 'cheese' was gritty (a sure sign it was made with powered cheese), a bit on the cold side and under seasoned... not good.  Lastly, the appearance of the staff for it being such a new restaurant, left much to be desired. Uniforms are disheveled, and the staff is comprised of a bunch of teenagers who seem to be running the place. Want some delicious fried chicken? Keep walking because you will not find it here.

KLsgEPLNQ52Aaa5AIpoS3A.text: OMG!  Where do I begin?  We went to Las Vegas just before the Labor Day weekend for a short stay.  The morning we were set to leave we decided to wander around the strip and find a small joint to eat in.  Well we wandered into Bruxie and didn't want to leave.  The food was so so so so so good!   Who ever thought you could replace sandwich bread with waffles?   And why didn't they think of it sooner?   These guys don't just trade up, they get creative.   There are all kinds of sandwiches on the menu.  Best of all is the classic chicken and waffles which is amped up a notch with the tastiest burbon sauce.  Absolutely fab!  I enjoyed every bite and will definitely pop in agian when we go back.

B5CjgRQxxFOVHv0AOn3o_A.text: The waffle nachos were hands down the best thing on the menu. I would skip the Mac and cheese it was very mediocre at best. We barely touched it. The Cobb salad and original waffle sandwich were also fire. Bring back the Poutine!

GjxOFqH-fd73gbtWkFrYng.text: The Chicken and Waffles caught my eye.... I ordered the Nashville Hot and it was very good but I think it's just a little too pricey for what you get. Staff are awesome and the establishment was very clean. Not sure if I would come back, maybe if I hit a jackpot!

Oy7-Z4Uw0CeMj0THyni7rg.text: Just ok. I really don't know what the all hype is about this place. My husband's chicken was cold and my chicken and waffles was a little soggy in the middle. Waffle was just so so. This place was expensive for what it was. Probably would not eat here again and would not recommend.

4muMDqx1Of8YjMC8LUDSLw.text: Fried and waffles - if you like these two things this is the place for you.  Order at the counter and they deliver it to you. Variety of breakfast and lunch waffle sandwiches.  Get the strawberry lemonade!  Only thing I wouldn't order again was the fried pickles. I was hoping for a crispy fried pickles but these were about an inch thick and fried.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry lemonade

1dI0iWk-Vo7xy4AOeb6YWg.text: These waffle sandwiches were fantastic. I would not doubt it at all if you were told me that is because these waffles are fried in some way. They are just so perfectly crispy and delicious; I'm almost baffled by the perfection.  I had the roasted mushroom and goat cheese waffle sandwich combo with the dessert banana nutella waffle and unsweetened iced tea. I also tried my husband's spiced tots. Ugh delicious. Everything. So delicious.  Also plentiful portions, if that's your thing. A great deal for the quality + amount, and it's not usually crowded even though it's located on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie burger
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted mushroom &amp; goat cheese

lAScYJqbRMTYebWRutsGhw.text: Stopped by here around 9AM on a Friday the weekend of EDC. I love chicken and waffles so I was super excited to try Bruxie!  We waited in line 10-15 minutes to order and only waited a little over 5 minutes for the food to come out. It was so fast!   I got the Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich and LOVED it! The sandwich was salty, crunchy, and sweet! Exactly what I was looking for in my chicken and waffles. The egg, bacon, and fried chicken combined made the sandwich very filling and worth the bang for my buck ($15.70 all in). The waffle was amazing - crispy, light, and super fresh. The fried chicken was balanced and didn't have too much breading, which I loved too.  The only weird thing was the waffle didn't come with syrup. Luckily they have a self serve syrup station so I grabbed some myself and put it on.  My sandwich at Bruxie was quick and delicious. I'll DEFINITELY be back the next time I'm in Vegas :))

wQ8PuAbqGNMJRf4B7Jovxw.text: I don't get the hype over this place. It's only OK. It's certainly not the best fried chicken on the planet. The best fried chicken on the planet is at Willie Mae Scotch House in New Orleans. This was pretty good fried chicken. It's not like this place invented the idea of chicken and waffles together.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tenders
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signage
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich

zd2726D0wXX0ItFthtOiIQ.text: Bruxie does not owe me ANYTHING! NOT ONE SINGLE THING! This place lived up to the hype of its Yelp Reviews, pictures, and menu!  Although a little hard for me to find at first (I thought it was inside of Park MGM, then inside of New York, New York, only to be told it's on the outside between the two), my scavenger hunt was worth it!  The chicken and waffle are a great balance, where one doesn't overpower the other. Hot, crispy French Fries. Portions that you think may be small, but fills you up nicely. Price is definitely worth the money. It's been a couple of weeks since I've been and I keep telling people about it. This is now my "The Place" to eat on The Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken (a little heavy on the maple, but still delicious!)
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Your Maker: fried chicken, burger patty, bacon, cheddar, Swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickle, gunpowder spice, Bruxie sauce

cAxp26Fkl-jkOkwkIbhjaA.text: The chicken and waffles at Bruxie are out of this world; this is one of the few places I'd give 6 stars based solely on the food if I could. Actually, my friend and I ended up finishing our meals and ordering a third sandwich to split because it was that amazing.  Food: - Green eggs and ham ($8.25) blew my mind. I absolutely loved the pesto paired with the egg, and the waffle was so crispy. Would definitely recommend if you want something lighter than fried chicken! - The original ($11.95) was also incredible. I've never had more tender and flavorful fried chicken in my life. - Crispy chicken ($11.95) wasn't bad, but probably my least favorite of the three we ordered. It tasted a bit generic, but I also had much less of an appetite by the time we got this, so that probably contributed to me not liking it as much.  Price: Kind of pricey after tax + tip (almost $45 for three sandwiches and fries), but considering this is Vegas, I'm not too surprised.  Service: Workers behind the counter were friendly, and food came out pretty quickly!  Ambiance: Casual and pretty calm on a weekday, although I can see it getting super busy during peak hours/weekends. Restrooms were clean, and there were a decent number of seats inside the restaurant.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. green eggs and ham, 8.25
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the original, $11.95

jvcIUSrS4bKDK_rwxTJG_A.text: If you like chicken, and you like waffles, this place is for you! They're usually pretty busy but we lucked out when we went. The space is pretty big with both indoor and outdoor seating. It's counter ordering so the food comes to you when its ready!   Everything we ordered was fantastic! Flavorful and very filling. A little heavy for my taste in particular but I would def go back and recommend this to anyone in the area! Walking distance for anyone staying at the NYNY or any of the hotels in that area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Mushroom &amp; Goat Cheese

1_60LJY3xgxY4YTAq3FDTA.text: What stands out here is the great service and customer care. I like the idea of the place and it is ideal for children. Plenty of sweet and savory options, the chicken and waffles is delicious! Even if the lines are long, food is ready quickly after you have ordered. Portions are on the small side, making Bruxie an ideal breakfast or light lunch option.

qwx_argmTXfsBx6W-eVPOg.text: Just walked a half mile to get breakfast here that I imagine would have been awesome.... trouble is, when My husband went in to wash his hands one of the line cooks decided after he was done in the stall dropping the kids off at the pool that he didn't need to wash his own hands before going back to work. We decided to tell the manager who then confronted the dirty handed bandit and his defense? That he has gloves on..... as if they magically wrapped themselves around his hands instead of him grabbing them with his turd covered hands first. I'm sure the food here is great, I just don't want a side of crap with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front door

VctJ9aCLORST4E5BG1xWSg.text: I think the food and dessert here is very good. Everything is too sweet and outside my diet, but once in a while for a night out it's great. The holy chicken was delicious. My boyfriend and I shared a sandwich and a dessert. The strawberry creme brulee waffle was not too sweet. Had a delicious cream with fresh strawberries. There was a small crisp to it making it delicious. We devoured our meal because we didn't want to lose the freshness of the fried chicken and waffles. It's right outside New York New York next to Shake Shack. Definitely come here if you have a sweet tooth. :) I have had the custard at other locations before and I remember loving it. You can find something on the menu more affordable, but overall it's a bit pricey for me. :P

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good. Strawberry creme brulee waffle

rqN5oAPpu0N-bKdUnrYxNw.text: Honestly unexpected but this was probably my favourite breakfast/meal of the entire trip.   We went at opening (as usual, we always try to dine during non-peak hours when we travel to save stress) and there were only a few people waiting alongside with us.   They quickly took our orders and gave us one of those little buzzers to put on our table. This place is a very casual, family friendly, order and go kind of deal, lots of seating and a nice fan/ac inside though! There's also a bunch of outside, picnic table type seating outside.   I got the Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich (sriracha mayo, cheese, applewood smoked bacon, maple glazed fried chicken, sunny side up egg) my husband got the Sausage Egg and Cheese waffle sandwich.   This was SO good. The chicken was crisp with the lightest batter, it was well seasoned and flavourful, along with the maple glaze adding the perfect touch of sweetness. The sriracha mayo added some kick to cut through that richness, along with a perfectly cooked egg.   The thing that really made this great for me was that the waffle was light and thin enough for it to work in a sandwich. I've had some before where they're these hefty thick belgian waffles, but these made it perfect. The right balance and ratio for a good sandwich that doesn't make you feel sick afterward, even with fried chicken and bacon.   Add this to your list!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken and Sausage Egg and Cheese.

ohELHrugnMdiq3m1HGcbXg.text: We grabbed a bite here after the Janet Jackson show. My trip companions were intrigued by the waffle sandwich when walking on the strip earlier so we decided it would be a good post show meal stop. I didn't order the waffle sandwich. I ordered the chicken strips and fries. I read reviews that the chicken was well seasoned and very good. I decided to skip the sandwich and the chicken and waffle meal and go straight for the chicken. It didn't disappoint. Very good, very tender and well seasoned. Fries were delicious. Everything was served fresh and hot. I got the 4pc and I was so full I couldn't make room for a dessert waffle. Maybe next time. Only gripe? I don't think they give free refills on drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t remember the name but there was egg and bacon on it. She said it was delicious!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders and waffle fries

MT7Y_oz4di4NjyKBF0AdQQ.text: Bruxie in socal is one of my favorite go to spots for a quick brunch, but not this Vegas location.  We stayed at Park MGM and needed some quick food in the morning, so we stopped by Bruxie. The food is exactly the same as the socal locations, but there is some Vegas tax foolery! I guess if you're not from socal, the prices wouldn't be so outrageous, and this place would be worth a try. But I just can't bring myself to be okay with getting the same food at higher prices.  The food itself is just like how I remember it. Bonus this time was that I got a vanilla latte. It was very sweet, which is how I like it. So you might want to tell them to adjust (if they can) if you're not as much of a sugar fiend as me.

K566spAkr7z1hJJ9JBTORQ.text: I love a good chicken & waffle, and this place HAS IT! Their chicken is seasoned well and is nice and juicy. The waffle is on the thinner side, but holds well for the sandwich. I really really liked their mushroom and goat cheese waffle sandwich, which also had sun dried tomatoes, arugula, and a balsamic glaze (vegetarian friendly!). Their chicken tenders were awesome too. I'll be coming back to eat them for the last time before I go back home!  We came around 12P.M. on a Friday afternoon and there was a line and probably waited about 15 minutes in it to order. There's a good amount of seating inside, and even more outside. If you do sit outside though (in the orange chairs) their buzzers don't work that far so you'd have to wait for your food inside then take your food out there. They have 3 black tables right outside where the buzzers do work.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Nachos

TZqmfJanNrVUjDf4dvgVQA.text: Awesome. I honestly didn't think it was going to be as good as it was. I got the country sausage & egg waffle sandwich and with just a little syrup, it really hit the spot. You'd think the portions were small, but I was full.  The spicy tater tots weren't too spicy but well seasoned instead. Definitely would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country sausage &amp; egg with tater tots

QUq8OXgw6byXII7dmhYfpA.text: Surprised after tasting the chicken with waffle plate. The mild spicy chicken was eaten with the soft waffle and a touch of maple syrup.

hNsxniVsR0mlRY5paPlqDQ.text: Updates 7-25-19  I'm actually sad with the Vegas location because they took the skillet off the menu yet it is a staple item and still shows all over the company website. They replaced it with a Belgium waffle that is dry and has no flavor. The waffle skillet is why I've recommended so many to come to this place and now it's gone. Not impressed and definitely will think before visiting.  Service was still great and all, but that entree along was worth the wait in line.  Original post I had the Original Seasoned Chicken & Waffle Skillet. It has tenders and chicken breast and it's amazing!!! Well worth the price. It doesn't come with a side because it's a lot of food but I ordered the cheesy fries and they were good as well. I definitely recommend this meal with the Palmer drink. It's Strawberry lemonade with ice tea mixed in.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

91z8UtYVWbV64ah_M7j1EA.text: We're definitely a fan of Bruxie. Finally had a chance to try the Fried Chicken and Waffles and it was good. The chicken was tender and juicy and the waffle was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The waffle fries and strawberry shake was good as well.   The service was great. Friendly staff. They gave us a pager for when our order was ready but they brought it to our table instead. They weren't busy when we went.   The restaurant is kind of hidden. You can miss it if you're not looking for it but when you see Shake Shack, it's to the right of it.   We'll definitely return.

jyh1kZtQlX6J8I8d_BZH7A.text: Summary: perfect spot for post Canelo/Jacobs fight!   Ambiance: modern looking and charming... they could serve anything here and it'd look good... darn good.   Food: chicken strips off the hook! Everything else pretty darn good ...   Service: lots of employees with good service.   Restroom: clean  and neat  Conclusion: I might come back again but there are a lot of fried chicken  spots out these days.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area...

adyN7oValG-D_WhXe2AoBQ.text: Loved it!  I'd describe it as "Extra Tasty Crispy and greasy". And I mean that with affection. We really liked it but yeah, greasy.   My wife had the Crispy Chicken and I had the Two Piece Chicken and Waffle with a side of Tots.   We both really enjoyed the meals. Only thing off-putting is that grease is an artifact of frying chicken.   We'd come back to Bruxie for sure!

rESC-mI3xD6nE_NGEF4T3Q.text: I've been to Bruxie twice. The first time I had the Nashville hot sandwich and was thoroughly impressed. I liked it so much, I brought my relatives who came to town a couple weeks later. I was excited when I realized the breakfast sandwiches were available all day, and ordered the prosciutto and arugula one. Again, knocked it out if the park (no pun intended). . My mom and aunt were also really pleased with their selections. I really wish there was a location in the NW or Summerlin, since I would go way more often. The desserts look fabulous too, but I never have room for one :)  Reasonably priced, tasty food on the Strip is hard to find, but Bruxie does it right.

8TMUqv4Dc3eALgpHV0-Tpw.text: Great waffle sundae. It is just sad that it is easy too sweet and too commercial to be exceptional.  Good waffle.  Good custard. Dense but still light  Terrible whipped cream and caramel.   But fun to try

iuUdyqB83oIr6Rn7f9kf9A.text: I did a little bit of research on places that I can go with my husband when while I was in town. This popped up in it look absolutely delicious. The chicken and waffle was really good. Today they had a special for their barbecue chicken and waffle which was pretty much very similar to their original but what it up being about nine dollars rather than $12 for their classic. So we thought we would try that and it tasted pretty decent. However I got the waffle fries and those were pretty much cold. We thought fries would be especially when we got there right when the restaurant opened. You basically order your food here and go to your table and they bring you your food. It gets pretty messy with a sandwich and especially with syrup involves it can get sticky. They don't have a very convenient bathroom or sink that you can wash your hands right after eating. They have ice water near the napkins and condiments section which was nice. It took a little longer than I thought to get my order but I suppose when they cook the chicken when you order it it will take some time. If I am in town again I will probably visit again and hopefully my waffle fries will be hot next time!

Nlv3sm6mO8ml6Q8izuEqaQ.text: Bruxie is the best place to eat in and dine. Mercedes did fabulous job to serve us when its busy she had gpod customer service. I will encourage everyone who come to Las Vegas to go and check it out. -thanks Tony

pMcY6bID-ZkkmYtu8xalAA.text: The service was friendly, chicken and waffles were cooked very well. But the flavor was kind of bland. It wasn't sweet or spicy just crispy chicken really hard to taste much else. I had the original and it was ok but I think I've had better at chick filet. My wife felt the same way. But the location, people and ambience is nice.

6inUl3M8SpqpzM0xvvMiPw.text: My family and I visited Vegas from Tuesday June 7, 2016  thru Tuesday June 14, 2016. We had never heard of Bruxe Chicken and Waffles because we are from McKinney Texas, and Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.  We lucked upon this place because a restaurant further down the strip that we wanted to try had closed early. So we were headed back to our hotel at the Excalibur, when we saw Bruxie's; that was on Wednesday June 8th. We loved it sooooooo much, that we ate here everyday, including the morning that we boarded the plane.  This place is absolutely Freaking Amazing.  Shout out to Ms. Ann Marie and Mr. Andrea for providing exceptional customer service during our many visits.  We begged Ms. Ann Marie to pass the word to the powers that be, please come to Oklahoma and Texas; there is definitely markets waiting to be tapped!!!  We need you to send Ms. Ann Marie when you do open down here.  My nephew and I are going through Bruxie's withdrawals!! HELP!,,,,,  thanks for an awesome experience. Juanita J      Oklahoma City, OK

JLeH0MJeSV2ee9O92BtbLg.text: Great food and service!!! Chicken was tasty and moist; and more importantly was seasoned! Fries were good. Great strawberry lemonade-- and you can add a shot of liquor for $5 (which is a mini bottle like you get on flights).

XtBHVTR7BpdKmOjuxYMcaA.text: Food was good and priced well. The breakfast waffle was good but the chicken and waffle was amazing. Menu had plenty to offer.

Kxr3t08oFCE42lyne4vh9A.text: excellent first time experience. the Nashville style hot chicken met all of my high expectations coming from a food city Seattle. the service and kindness of the staff was exceptional. beer selection better than expected as well. great cincept.

WoZ_xMHjLHoy4EPWOSCZtA.text: Bad management. One register open with a line out the door on cinco de mayo weekend. Employees standing around talking.

6g9VDmH6Lesc-xYnMxZSsA.text: OH MY GOD!!!!!   this place is AMAZING... The burgers and chicken are cooked to perfection, not too dry and just the right amount of juiciness.  It's priced really well.. We ordered sandwich combos with drinks and waffle fries for 25 bucks for 2 people.   Definitely visiting this place every time I come to Vegas! 5 stars hands down.  P.S don't listen to Daniel P's review.. Clearly he's a little on the "booshie" side.. It's a waffles and fried chicken joint... Not a Ruth Chris. Ordering Chardonnay at a fast food place is like ordering a burger at a seafood place.

v_bgcMNm9B8dkvR7dnZdVQ.text: The creme brulee waffles were delicious and came with strawberries in it. I also tried the chicken strips and they were well seasoned and moist.

Up6NplonZtuoi6uLkCMQaA.text: So damn good. Came here for breakfast my first day in Vegas, was so good that I came back the next day for breakfast again. I had tried Bruxies sometime awhile back at their location in Irvine and I think I got a dessert waffle, but really it didn't leave any lasting impression. This time around I got the breakfast sandwich the first day (bacon, egg and Gouda I think??) and it was so damn amazing. My sister got the Nashville chicken waffle and said it was also delicious. Also had the strawberry lemonade which was too sweet for my taste, but if you water it down a bit its good. Also got the coffee, which was strong. Second day, I wanted to try their chicken waffle which is what they're known for, so I got the Nashville chicken waffle which was amazing- has a bit of spice to it. It's located at the park which is between New York New York and Monte Carlo. For Vegas, this place is a hit because the food is so damn amazing and it is insanely cheap for Vegas.

yeSr5-qc6UBJkrB2i6ncWg.text: Bruxie was an amazing experience. Not only was the service good. The food was delicious. I went here with my Girlfriend to just explore the new Park. We stumbled across Bruxie. Someone greeted us at the door and gave us a tour of the menu. She let us try some of their custard and I have to say. That was delicious too. We ordered the Buffalo Chicken Bleu Waffle Sandwich. I totally recommend this sandwich. The Buffalo Chicken does have a small kick to it but it's barely noticable. I'm not even a buffalo sauce fan but this sandwich rocked my world. I'm definately going back again to explore more of the menu!

QnUVnJ73F0r9oG2dGgyQnQ.text: Added crispy onions to buffalo chicken sandwich for breakfast and loved it. Service was amazing once we sat down. If I had to suggest room for improvement the cashier could smile more?

1Yrlg_qegY09Lpmr4pGYjw.text: Stumbled onto this place with a group that was in search of dinner and I was in search of a sweet. Thankfully I found that they had a Belgian chocolate sundae on the menu. To my surprise when I got my order the ice cream was white. I asked a waiter if this was chocolate and he stared at me like I had ten heads I actually ended up asking him if he even worked here when he was so surprised. He told me the ice cream was chocolate so I just agreed. A friend in the group saw how confused I was and brought my sundae up to the front where she was told that they don't even have chocolate ice cream..... Just wondering why it's even on the menu then ....  good thing their focus of the restaurant is not ice cream.

YES  It's a bit tight inside to be prepared to sit outside. But it's all good for most of the year i.e: spring summer. It has a nice central park feel being next to new york new york.  I got the Original fried chicken and waffle sammy and was so impressed that it wa not greasy and the crunchiness is so heavenly. v33ESITo6PMD8UFdgY51Lg.text: Cute affordable place just off the strip between Monte Carlo and New York New York.  This place has huge windows so you can see the view of the strip while you're eating. The chicken is really good and crispy. The waffles are nothing fancy but together it's really yummy. They make their own sodas so no name brand, but the coke tastes sweet like it did when they were in glass bottles. I liked it. Plus free refills. The strawberry lemonade was good too.  The staff were extra accomodating and friendly. Place was clean and trendy.

x6j8EZeJ0VRA15B_TxjXTg.text: Dishes tried: - 2 Piece fried chicken Nashville Hot style - Lemon and berry cream waffle - Frozen Custard  This is not my first experience at Bruxie as I've dined at their various locations in SoCal.   Instead of ordering a waffle sandwich this time I changed it up and ordered their fried chicken with waffles. The chicken came out piping hot glistening with the Nashville Hot sauce. The batter was perfectly crisp and the sauce had a pretty good kick. Close to bordering too hot for someone that doesn't like too spicy.   The waffle was burned as you can see in my photos. I chalked it up to the bacon and sugar that was in the batter. But I think it was way overdone and looked burned. Not sure how they could have plated this and brought it out. The waffle was also sweet with pockets of sugar, designed I believe to cut the spicy chicken.   The Savior was the lemon and berry cream waffle. The cream was tart with a nice hint of lemon to offset the crispy and not burned waffle. The raspberries were a perfect compliment to top it all off.   The custard was more icy than what I remember at the other Bruxie locations. I didn't get the rich and creamy taste that I remembered from my other times.   Skip the fried chicken and stick to the waffle sandwiches. I noticed that everyone else's waffles were perfectly cooked except mine.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Piece fried chicken - Nashville Hot

Sic3UuR4AHmPxZAOtEy3jA.text: This is by far the best chicken and waffles I've tasted. That's a pretty strong comment considering I absolutely adore Roscoes.   The chicken breast is so juicy and moist and it's fried to perfection. The fried chicken matches perfectly with the semi sweet syrup.  The cheddar waffle is crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. Not dense or mushy like some waffle can get. It's topped off with butter and sugar bits which is also in the batter.   Bruxie is located the The Park, connected to New York, New York on one side and the T-Mobile arena in the other. So good. This is a must try.

nI9eS7AzoLf2oMACETGaKg.text: Chicken and waffles? I can't complain. Please take me there now. This was the first place I've ever been to from chicken and waffles, and I'm so glad. The Hot Nashville Chicken is above all, my favorite of all time. What does it come with? Spicy & Smoky Chicken, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Romaine, and Pickles. This entree is down to the science. Spicy, savory, crunchy, yet soft and then sweet from the syrup. If there's anything better than this meal, please don't tell me about it because I'm pretty much adamant about this.   The service is fast despite the crazy long lines, and there's always a place to sit even when, again, it's busy. This is my happy place when I'm around the area, and I don't think that would ever change. Also, you should try their mac and cheese! It's like one of the best appetizers I've ever had.

ouhYlb5_wsjyyMa6xWyIrw.text: One of my favorite places to get chicken and waffles because you can get it all dressed up or plain. The waffle is perfectly crispy and not soggy. The chicken is seasoned well and moist on the inside. The original chicken and waffles is always a safe choice. Between the buffalo blue cheese and the Nashville, I prefer the buffalo blue cheese since the Nashville was too spicy for me. For sweets, I really enjoyed the s'mores waffle. I would pass on the liege waffle. Overall, great customer service!  *****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge***** 68/100

-AOKivNjKqYJWLgGruefgg.text: Came here because the line for Shake Shack was too long.  It was kind of a blessing in disguise because this place was really good.  I got chicken strips and cole slaw and they were some of the best I've had.  If I was craving chicken, I'd definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n9a5gPCi35eGpg8oWMcAuw.text: There is something about coming to Vegas and eating at restaurants that are located all over Los Angeles, but our first time dining there is in Vegas! ha! The same thing happened with EggSlut - last time I came to Vegas, I tried EggSlut for the first time even though there are a ton in LA!  Anywho, this time my family wanted a quick lunch and something we have not tried before, and I always wanted to try Bruxie and here we are! And here was one of the best meals of our trip or of any restaurant!  We had the $5 coupon for signing up online for their newsletter which was awesome, it's a great coupon, and although the prices are not too expensive, this makes it even cheaper!  We ordered two sandwiches - the Original and the Holy Chicken WOW these.are.dee.lish.ous!!!  The original has chili-honey, coleslaw, and their original seasoning. The chicken is so light, juicy, tender, while the batter is also so light and crispy, thin, and just so tasty with all the seasonings. The waffle is absolutely amazing - fluffy, crispy, and airy and oh so good, and together they make quite a good size sandwich! It isn't too spicy but the sweet-spicy honey-chili is amazing.  Now the Holy Chicken . . . my god this was amazing and almost puts Roscoe's to shame with the chicken and waffle combo!  Again, the delicious waffle, so fluffy and crispy and thin, but the chicken is glazed in maple syrup - seriously, what is better than maple syrup and fried chicken!? Thick, crispy applewood smoked bacon for some added savory-salty flavor. Thick slices of gooey cheddar cheese sticking to the waffle. A hint of sriracha for some kick, and the cherry-on-top, a fried egg cooked perfectly with the yolk running down the chicken and soaked up by the waffle!   Seriously, thank you Bruxie for this phenomenal lunch with the absolute best fried chicken, waffle, and combination of ingredients as well as the great service for something special and perfect in Las Vegas! I will be happy to return next time I am in Vegas and visit the LA locations!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Sandwich
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken Sandwich

_Yl6i2MIOkIWU9Pn4b_qtw.text: Was craving breakfast, looked on Yelp, and discovered that my hotel was just a few minutes away from a Bruxie. I went with a few other friends and ordered their buffalo bleu waffle sandwich. My friends tried the crispy chicken (I think that's what it's called), one of the breakfast sandwiches, and a caesar salad. The pricing was fair considering it's more of a "specialty" type of food. The sandwich was about $10. The food came out really fast in less than 10 minutes.   The portion size is huge, I had difficulty finishing the whole thing. The chicken was crispy and juicy, really really good. I love buffalo sauce and I really enjoyed the sauce on the buffalo bleu. The coleslaw was just okay, a bit flavorless. I was expecting a bit more creamyness from the slaw to balance out the tangyness from the buffalo sauce. The first half of my sandwich was really good, but when I got to my second half it got to be too much. All you could taste was the strong buffalo sauce. Maybe it would be a good idea to get the buffalo sauce on the side? Regardless, this chicken and waffle combo really hit the spot. The waffle was light and crispy and did not get soggy at all. The waffle held up pretty well, which I was surprised! We ordered a side of waffle fries, which were pretty basic. I would skip on these.   All in all, Bruxie lives up to its hype. It's good fast food that will fill you up. I wouldn't mind coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5iidbYqv88Nb6Ouasd_CeA.text: Life Changing!  OMG!  We stopped in to try it and we were blown away!  We had the The Original and it was amazing.  They need one of these on every corner.  If go here over Chick-fil-a.

rak68QTJmVB-VMOEAxicWA.text: If you are a fan of Fried Chicken & Waffles, Bruxie is the place to be! I've had my fair share of FC&W all around & this spot was so good, I went twice in the same day!  If you're in Vegas or planning a trip, make sure you eat here at least once for an awesome breakfast or a hungover brunch.   The line can get a bit long during peak hours but it's worthy of the wait. I recommend the FC&W sandwich & the Nutella/Banana/Sweet Cream. This food was so good, I'm seriously getting hungry again just writing my review.  Menu:  It's not a big menu, but you're here for the FC&W so look to order one of the variations for a crowd pleaser.   Decor: They have a wall made from waffle irons. The seating is plentiful, but the amount of space they allowed themselves for lines to form is far from adequate. Also, when they are ringing people up, it's hard to get a single file line setup as people tend to bunch up. A designated line 1 & 2 should be implemented with one of those retractable rope devices.  Location: It's tucked away down a side street bordering the outskirts of the NYNY Casino. It's near the waterwalls.  See my photos of the outside, inside, & food.

6DIq_5qAtR2xFirmYK9yFw.text: We stopped by for a late night snack following a show at T-Mobile and it was a treat!  The food portions are large, but very tasty.  Check it out.

XzjsG_NHjk7qdK6yUGPJPA.text: I come to Bruxie all the time and it's usually great but today I came in and ordered a kids meal. The cashier charged me for something triple the price that I did not order. That's fine, they were busy and mistakes happen, but they took several minutes to fix their mistake. I paid with a card and they refused to put my refund back on my card, instead they said the only option was to be refunded in cash (which is absolutely ridiculous and probably not even True). They still brought out the incorrect order and I had to wait another 15 minutes for what I actually ordered.

This place really hit the spot, wish I had more time to appreciate it. Also, their radio plays some straight up bangers. We were in here stuffing our faces and singing/rapping along to all the throwbacks playing. Such a great time

tKBlvW4-xwiRJXXGJmOQrg.text: This place was great for hangover food. Had a fantastic Friday night on the strip and then ate brunch here. The classic sandwich combo was all I needed, wasn't needed to stray to new tastes. Atmosphere is cool, not too busy either and got to order immediately.

AYV6SDRxzKJhz5d8JC2I2g.text: I went to this place twice during my first trip to Vegas. First and last place I ate at. It's totally worth trying out. I need you guys to come to Austin! Please!  I went there for my birthday, but casually mentioned it to my husband. And the cashier heard me and simply wished me happy birthday. While we were eating, another worker came and said they had made an extra shake on accident and was wondering if I wanted it. Of course! I had a feeling it was because of my birthday because we were in the back of the restaurant and it was packed in there. But it could've been an accident, however it was nicely coated with whipped cream and caramel. It was a sweet gesture nonetheless. Customer service there both times were phenomenal and they were all very friendly. If I ever come to Vegas, I'm definitely stopping here!

hkqhvfoBnaMqV3PWmnjeIQ.text: Wow!!! Thanx Bruxie. Tasty as heck. This is breakfast. Coming back for lunch. Waffles, chicken, bacon, eggs,  and cheese. What more do you need to know. Just wish they had a location in San Diego County California :(

We stopped in for an afternoon snack and had the Wisconsin frozen custard sundae. OMG. I was delicious! Wisconsin, you've been holding out on me!  All the meals that we saw go past smelled and looked out of this world. I'm looking forward to another trip where I can get a full Bruxie experience!

HQ698tsx_ByK3tpcYBQB6g.text: Yum Yum Yum!!! SO GOOD!! The fried chicken is so so good! I don't now how to say, just go and try!!! We had it twice within our 4-day trip in Vegas lol

sGGUFERYTVtIUT_iiGwS7g.text: This is hands down the best food I've ever consumed in my life. I swear I saw God himself smile down at me when I took a bite of the Angry Mac and Cheese and my depression was instantly cured. I would take a bullet for the fried chicken with a bacon and cheddar waffle. The portion sizes were generous and easily filled me up with some left over for breakfast the next day, which I ate while crouched on my hotel room floor like a Bruxie-entranced gremlin. I'm no expert on chicken and waffles, but I know good food when I eat it- this was not just good, it was phenomenal. It made me believe in the existence of a benevolent god. The restaurant itself was clean and had a fun ambience but honestly the food was so good that I'd eat it in a sketchy alleyway off of a trash can lid next to a curiously large rat.

lv3BYn1yCaxWMDj-3Qn87g.text: Read online that this was a must go if you are there on a Wednesday. They post on social media a $5 chicken and waffle meal for that week. I assume any way that meal is prepared is a Win. So not only are they driving business by bringing in folks for a very reasonable price, but their food is really good. The original chicken is very good, a good fry with some heat to bring. Definitely recommend

BYLPEDHtEjqayP5JcryCDQ.text: I went to bruxie for late lunch, it was really good . I had the holy chicken? John he said the B.A.M.F. Was fire. And it was , enjoyed every single bite. Thanks to Sabrina for asking me for a refill before I left .

bA46Gd0EK4XlLby-UO-A0g.text: Huge fried chicken sandwich between two waffles, what is not to like?! Add an egg and some spicy sauce and it makes for a great big lunch!

2bnU96zNG2F2QaKJHoyuUQ.text: Just go here. You won't regret it. The Mac n cheese is so good. I recommend splitting a sandwich and getting a side between two people. Good prices and good food.

R5A-S9J67HmCsUvc4KCs9w.text: The waffles are so crispy and juicy on the inside and the chicken is so good!!!!!! 10/10

_pDueBnX7vWhp5Cig3QMrQ.text: I got the Nashville Chicken on Waffle. Chicken was tender and juicy which you could tell was perfectly cooked. The spicy-ness was just perfect. Not too spicy but does have a small kick. Was a amazing start to the day for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b2qLRv1YQvL7fQmS3_sOZQ.text: This was the best meal that we had in Vegas! We stumbled upon this gem while browsing Yelp for a good breakfast/brunch spot. It was only about a 15 min walk from our hotel so we decided to give it a try. When we arrived the line was out the door and we contemplated going next door to Shake Shack instead but I'm so happy we decided to wait! My boyfriend and I both got the Holy Chicken! and shared an order of the Angry Mac & Cheese. The sandwiches were amazing! The chicken was seasoned well, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The combination of flavors from the sunny side egg, sriracha mayo, and saltiness from the bacon all meshed perfectly. I also added a little syrup which gave it a hint of sweetness. The waffle was also nice and crispy without being overdone. The mac & cheese was soooo good. There was a hint of spice from the buffalo sauce but nothing overwhelming. It was nice and creamy plus you can never go wrong anytime you add bacon to mac. For drinks we got the strawberry lemonade and added a shot of vodka for $5. Yes, I know it was breakfast but hey we were in Vegas....  The meal was so good that we thought about it our entire trip and wanted to go back before we left but ended up running out of time :( Hopefully we can visit another location during a future trip. This would be great in The Flats in Cleveland *hint hint*.

opoqB8ehL9qljQYuW-wzPQ.text: Holy cow this place blew us away.  I didn't expect this to be so good and I wasn't even hung over.   We ordered waaaay too much food but we ate it all.  We even got a show by watching a group fill up big water glasses with syrup and breaking the syrup pump.  Highly recommended.

Tg5ObUFqKkP9F0s1sVyfdw.text: Ive been a fan of Bruxie OC and their amazing waffle concoctions for some time now. I'm happy to report the brand new establishment at the Park Vegas is up to standards.  The guy working the door was kind of enough to entertain us with his enthusiasm for waffles, that's always a plus while waiting in line. I took one of his suggestions and rolled with the creme brulee and a house coffee to wash it down- so delicious but a tad on the soggy side. I digress.  My buddies took stabs at the Chicken & Waffles, one of them being the spicy Nashville specialties. Great as always, but that's expected. Welcome to Vegas, Bruxie.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah this was legit, just wish it was more crispy.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry, I forgot what this was. But it looked good.

9WpbOlCadwxrkqePjuy04w.text: Had my first Bruxie experience in Orange County and when I saw they had one in Vegas, it made my day! Any chicken and waffle combination is delicious. You would think the waffles would be sweet, but to me since they put some sort of cheese coat it compliments the chicken. Lines here move pretty fast so don't be discourage when it looks crowded.

zOxuOXFa_WpazP-ROc3_NA.text: Location: right next to Monte Carlo. Plenty of seating inside and outside for a nice brunch.  Food: slightly disappointed in the waffle, hence the 3/5. Was expecting a great waffle. It's a bit on the dry side and lacks in flavour. I do appreciate their idea of putting anything on the waffle like chicken, eggs, chorizo, avocado etc. That's what made the waffle taste much better. I ordered the Original Chicken & Waffle then substituted the chicken breast for a chicken thigh. Wanted a bit more flavour and a juicy tender piece of chicken. I've had chicken and waffles before, Roscoes still takes the cup.   Service: 3/5, not bad. There was not much of team work going on. Some were nice, some totally clueless to what was going on. Overall this was an OK experience.  If you're interested in Bruxie, try the LA location for more options.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front of the building.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Fried Chicken and Waffle. With an sunny side up egg on the side

w-yC23BSTZnUtOsHfiz_Rg.text: MY PRAYERS WERE ANSWERED! Back where I live, there is only one chicken 'n waffles place within reasonable driving distance of my apartment. Unfortunately...it isn't that great. Even more unfortunately, my boyfriend had never tried chicken and waffles together before that place, and despite all of my ranting and raving about the True culinary masterpiece that is a good plate of chicken and waffles, he wasn't buying it. Well, thanks to this place, he understands now.  You have your choice of savory, sweet, traditional, and non-traditional waffle sandwiches.  To play it safe, we just stuck with the original and Nashville sandwiches.  What this place gets right, and what is most important about chicken and waffle sandwiches, is that the waffle can't be too soggy or crisp, and the chicken can't be overly fried. The waffle here has just the right amount of moisture, while still firm. The chicken isn't overly breaded or fried...it's like eating a chick-fil-a chicken breast, with different seasoning, on a good waffle. A+ quality.  My boyfriend wanted to return but since we were limited to less than a week's worth of breakfast, we sadly could not. Unfortunately, this was the best breakfast we had that week by far and we definitely wasted our money trying to find good breakfast elsewhere.

He3ReLAf6kCI2bFFQfIyvw.text: On the first day of arriving in Vegas, we arrived just around lunch time. Since we were staying at the Monte Carlo, we decided to venture out to the Park and look around. This place was pretty crowded and looked promising so we decided to give it a try.  I've always been a fan of chicken and waffles so it started off on a good note. We ordered the original fried chicken and waffles and the original seasoned chicken tenders and fries. The staff was super friendly and the food came out rather quickly.   The chicken was seasoned superbly. Not too salty nor bland. The batter was super crispy and the chicken was perfect. Not dry at all. The chicken had a lot of flavor as well.   The waffles were thin and on the crispier side. They weren't dry at all however. They managed to be fluffy as well. Not too dense. It was pretty good.  The fries were not too special. Just regular fries. They were good.  If I ever come to Vegas again, I am definitely going to hit up this place.

eD_A-YK6AtDeMoYrmhhENA.text: Great place to grab and eat, we got there kind of early so the wait wasn't horrible.  So much food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2bDqWVQzmaEVgeQyy8uT9Q.text: Visited Bruxie's shortly after arriving on a before the break of dawn flight. It was around 1 by the time we arrived and there was a line of 5 to 8 people. Inside every table was occupied. Coming from NYC & the south I've had a wide variety of chicken & waffles. Well Bruxies set a new low. McD's could not have done it better...or worse. Deep fried boneless chicken breast & a tasting waffle that syrup made sweeter but not better.

-6baTp5ABql-vPHL9g4JIA.text: The prices are a bit high, but the accessibility factor makes it a great choice for guests staying on the strip.  Large windows all around make for a nice brunch/lunch atmosphere.  The food met our expectations and the staff kept all of the stations tidy.  Very pleased to have a new spot to take guests!

DGOLwIa6n5ANb-RHCFZzlQ.text: Food was COLD.. not what i thought it would be like. I was not feeling it.................

y4_ijGrOrOdLYFvb_p7zzA.text: Wacky and wonderful Bruxie!  On a recent friends trip to Vegas, our culinary needs collided beautifully - while I lust for fried chicken, they love all things waffle. In our pre-departure Yelping to find culinary delights, a friend happened upon Bruxie, where the two come together to make the ultimate brunch. We're so there!  Bruxie is a stand-alone joint on the strip (as in not connected with any of the giant hotels), so you'll have to brave Las Vegas Boulevard and the desert sunshine to reach it. Step away from the slots and tables, it's ok!  It's well worth it to support a business that hasn't been swallowed by a casino and is still a special treat away from home.   Inside Bruxie has the typical fast casual set-up: you peruse the menu from the line, order at the register, are handed a number, and then grab your table while the food is brought to you.  While there were many tempting treats, I figured on my first visit it was best to stick with their classic offering, the Fried Chicken and Waffle Sandwich.  Served up as the menu says with chili honey and cider slaw, you also have a choice of sides - I opted for the fresh fruit to keep it lighter.   When your food arrives, you will be visually dazzled! It's a mild misnomer to call what Bruxie serves a sandwich, let's face it - this is a decadent taco, bro!  A thin but sturdy and very tasty waffle comprises the taco shell, and your chicken and slaw is generously stuffed inside, with a healthy drizzle of the honey. Syrup is also available at a condiment bar if you want to go full brunch on this bad boy. The size and the various liquids can overall make the tacowich a little difficult to eat, 2 of the 3 of us were relegated to fork n' knife it as the waffle split under duress, but no biggie! What's important here is the flavor, and this is a tasty offering. My waffle-loving friends were overjoyed by the waffle, and I was so happy the chicken was juicy and seasoned perfectly!  All the other flavor elements added balance and variety, and still let the chicken be the star, as it should be. I was also happy the side cup of fruit was standard but luckily not canned - thank you for not cheaping out on fresh produce!    Bruxie is definitely recommended for indulgent brunchie needs at all hours, and whether you lust for waffles, fried bird, or the delightful marriage of the two, you will be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Chicken n waffle sandwich, with fresh fruit side

iPPihzpPywOsRGbe8YvJnQ.text: First thing i wanted to do after my first bite of the original chicken waffle sandwich was to cry. Second thing that came to mind after my first bite of the Irish nachos was "cant wait to comeback tomorrow". The strawberry lemonade was so fresh i just have to label this place as my favorite waffle, chicken, cheese sauce, and drink place in LV!!!  Must stop if your looking for a fresh breakfast with awesome flavors ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original!

585ARfngcqQVGQO5UWCeEg.text: We tried this place on our last visit to Vegas. My kids were hungry and I knew they would eat chicken fingers. It was so good, my daughter asked to make a special trip back when we were there this Memorial Day weekend. The chicken fingers are great!! Also their signature waffle sandwiches, both with chicken and more traditional breakfast versions. My daughter tried a buttermilk chicken salad this time and loved that too. I wish they would open up a franchise closer to home!

NdQ17vIVHeyz8y1HwVgWQA.text: I came across Bruxie while I was craving chicken n waffles in Vegas.  After we got here thank god they had self-serve water near the front because the heat was like hell outside.  You order first and then they give you a number and you go choose to sit wherever. I ordered the nashville hot chicken because I wanted something spicy.    The waffle itself was something I've never tasted before.  It was light and crispy but you have to put syrup on it or it'll taste like nothing.  I really liked how light the waffle tasted to it because all the other waffles I eat are thick. The chicken itself was delicious and it was the perfect amount of spiciness! The only thing that would have made it better was if it wasn't as oily... I know it was fried so its not brainer that the skin would be oily but this oil was on another level.   Overall I think if you want chicken and waffles in Vegas then you have better choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qNZywz7Xmh3inRS_BQ-FBg.text: Great waffle sandwich! I had the original and Michelle had the eggs and cheese with a side of bacon.  Kids had a huge portion of waffles which were amazing and made great leftover snacks.

8h8IvrTm27g76DdVoN5qnQ.text: Chicken and waffles for the win. This place is really good and well worth the walk or even a trip on it's own. It's on the side of new york new york and not easily seen from the strip.

BYQL58Lf4xdbe6c_rWT5bA.text: I ordered the waffle chicken sandwich, which comes with waffle fries. It is reasonable for being on the strip. The waffle fries and the waffle was a little bit over done. I am a fan of the Orange, CA location, which is the original location.  This location seems like the menu is limited. I didn't really love the food that I had, it was ok.  I know its a franchised location, but it should be living up to the standard of bruxie!

SCfSACJVBMxjdeVHMBVOYg.text: Chicken and waffle sandwich is delicious.  You order food at the counter and wait for your buzzer to go off and your food is delivered.  Be aware that you can NOT use express comps or charge food to your room, even though it's attached to NYNY and listed under Park MGM restaurants on the website.

65UrLjC4nQYSROz7uRONEA.text: So night and day from my experience at China Poblano last night! Thank you YELPers for steering me here. I am not a big chicken and waffles fan because the chicken is usually dry or bland and the waffle is usually basic. Thank you BRUXIE for showing me what True chicken and waffles are suppose to be. I got the chicken and waffle skillet after a recommendation from a food runner there (who took the time to discuss the menu with me :-))  DELICIOUS from the first to the last bite. The chicken was moist, fries well, and seasoned all the way through. The waffle was dense and flavorful. I don't do a lot of bacon infused foods, so I was hesitant but the bacon was not overpowering and real complemented all the flavors.   The service was great. Multiple people asked how the food was, which came out promptly despite the small rush they had. There were people constantly circling to clear plates, offer refills, and just saying hello with a welcome smile.  I have already told a few friends in Vegas to come here, I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle skillet---yummy!

Me0bxPUSjTf9tF15mm7qNA.text: I feel like this place can be great! It has potential. But as of now it could be better!  Astrid was very polite very cordial and knowledge of the menu!   The sodas are made with real sugar cane. The coke tasted like the Mexican coke!  We ordered chicken fingers it came with fries. The fries need to be cruncher they are blond in color.  Also ordered bacon cheddar waffle which was horrible.  it has sugar cane pearls large enough to not melt and I'm guessing to add extra crunch.  This is not pleasant to eat! Also the waffle is extremely doughy. I think they're sugar pearls cause it to not bake properly leaving a very doughy and dense waffle. not my favorite.   we also ordered the waffle chicken sandwich that was very delicious chicken is very tender juicy flavorful waffle could be slightly cruncher. it was on the blonde side, soft side. Not saying I wanted it dry and hard. But if serving with hot crunchy chicken sandwich it needs to hold.   For dessert we ordered  waffle sundae the custard ice cream that came with it was very creamy very delicious! We ask for the regular waffle. Not the one on the menu since the sundae waffle is a Liege, all the deserts uses this kind. Liege is the crystal pearl raw sugar waffle think undercooked dense.  they were more than happy to accommodate our order and change the waffle to the one served with the chix sandwich. It was very delicious has dark chocolate, not sweet to compliment all the other sugar in the sundae the peanuts were nice and roasted very crunchy, whipped cream was quality whipped cream.  Over-all maybe going back for just breakfast but as of now maybe next time.I not worth $50

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundae waffle with a different waffle. Custard nice creamy not to sweet! Peanuts nice and crunchy!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dough if under baked. Thus why it is transparent not solid yellow.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon cheddar waffle with maple. With hard crunchy sugar waffle is dense and doughy!

oa00xrSF8JhpaS2Ek55KXQ.text: Visited from Portland and I ordered the original bruxie. Nothing much to say, it speaks for it self. Worth every dollar.

bbOTv8sLZM1tQmpBHG-PKA.text: Heard about this from a fellow league bowler a few days prior, so decided to check it out on our way out of town.  Parking was a bit of a bear, due to street closing for whatever reason.  Line was out the door, but moved quickly, and there was inside seating available.  Guy taking order seemed a bit distracted, and made a small mistake on our order.  We each had a breakfast waffle sandwich; one sausage, one bacon.  Both were very good, with or without some maple syrup.  Bus person also gave us samples of their frozen custard; deelish!    We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg cheese breakfast waffle sandwich

f7HO5mZ_VO3X1eLyAMOYAw.text: Definitely worth your money.  I ordered the Nashville sandwich (spicy!!) and it was bigger than I thought!  - chicken was seasoned nicely  - waffle is flaky and tasty - sandwich is big!  Boyfriend got the buffalo chicken tenders and man can you smell that buffalo sauce!   I'd love to come back for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge sandwich! You need both hands!

0f68kc2JQIlzQ7W6Rgnrhg.text: I wasn't sure what I was expecting... good food, of course, but I walked in hoping for the best.  And Bruxie delivered.  VERY yummy. I had the Holy Chicken (sunny side up egg, cheese, maple syrup, sriracha sauce, bacon, and of course the fried chicken) - so that overall sounds good on a biscuit, bagel or something similar. And it was better on the waffle!  It's definitely worth the hype. 10-15 person line went pretty quick and when I ordered, I got my order within about 10 minutes.  The strawberry lemonade is pretty good too.

u1316t4fAfEUT_pAkggbrw.text: Came here for lunch after roaming around The Armory and then Adidas across the street. There was already a line (some being post EDC wakin up and probably getting a bite before leaving town) early in the afternoon. The line went by quick and we got our food fairly quick as well.   Restaurant wise, I has a decent amount of seating inside but there was seating outside too. Originally my friends and I wanted to sit outside but wind randomly picked up so we opt'ed to sit inside.   I've tried Bruxie in Cali at Huntington Beach in the past and I feel like that experience was much better than this one  I had ordered "The Original" which was a fried chicken & waffle sandwich with original seasoned breast, chili honey, and cider slaw, a side of waffle cut fries, and a strawberry lemonade.   I had recalled the sandwich I had gotten at Huntington Beach be MUCH larger. I remember getting my order and was like WOW... how am I putting this in my mouth (.... ssshhh....) but this time, I felt underwhelmed. Size of the waffle seems normal/reasonable/similar but the size/thickness of the chicken and the amount of slaw was definitely underwhelming. If anything, I'd say this was half the size of what I've experienced. Presentation was flat. Size was flat. Flavor was a bit one noted and the "skin" wasn't that crispy.   Even my friend's irish nachos that's waffle cut fries w/ cheese sauce, smoked bacon, chives, sour cream looked really sad. All the noted toppings were minimal...   I am happy I did get to try this location at least once but now I don't have to come back. It's quite a pain to come down here as a local Lol especially since everyones charging for parking nowadays. I know its a restaurant on the strip but dang... maybe that's why our food came out fairly quickly. Everything just sitting around waiting to be put together, not freshly made

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original w fries and strawberry lemonade

126yEMBtqpNumtEVsGc9dQ.text: Two of us ordered the Green Eggs and Ham and our other friend ordered the Sausage and Egg. Quick service which was great because it isnt a sit and order type place and we were getting ready for a busy day. Size was good. I expected the waffle to be like a typical waffle, fluffy and a little bit sweet...it wasnt. It tasted more like toasted sliced bread. Not bad, but just wasnt what I was thinking it would be. By it resembling more bread it is much easier to eat the entire thing. I liked the establishment, lots of natural light and a huge fan to keep you cool. Menu was small as far as offerings but I think very well rounded.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Eggs and Ham

MQiJsPl5cmTCpmBMXaGxDw.text: Bruxie has been on my must try list for a long time. Went to a concert at T Mobile Arena and decided to eat dinner there before the concert started.   It's a casual place where you order at the register and get a buzzer and grab a seat. I ordered the chicken strips but the cashier made a mistake and rang me up for the original chicken and waffle sandwich. When it came out it looked so good that I kept it and thought I'll try the chicken strips next time.   Our order was the sandwich, waffle fries, the country sausage breakfast waffle sandwich, angry mac and cheese, strawberry lemonade, and a ginger beer.   The sandwiches were a good size. The chicken was crispy and had a sweet and spicy taste. We could have shared a sandwich or took the rest home for leftovers if we weren't going to a concert. The waffle fries dipped in ranch were so good. The angry mac and cheese was super tasty and a large portion good for sharing.   The food was good. Service was good. Definitely will be back to try the fried chicken and waffle, chicken strips, and Irish nachos.

cX2cAE82uAAPibkLbQ_Zkw.text: 1st time here. Modernize chicken and waffles spot. Medium to high pricing. In great location near mgm Park. Portion size was fair. Drinks on point. I had the mule. Lots of vodka. 2 sips and I'm tipsy. I'd come back to this spot if I'm in the area again.

I'd give you individual recommendations of what to order, but I've never actually had anything that I didn't love.   This is gonna be short because Bruxies knows what they're doing. eHW4zZI5bjAF7JVnD_Y80g.text: I came to Bruxie for an order of seasoned fries and fried pickles because Shake Shack's fries suck.   4 stars for the fried pickles alone! In our 6 day Vegas trip, I tried fried pickles from three different places and Bruxie's were the best. First, they're cut thick, which is different than most (thinner slices/cut like spears). Second, they dredge in delicious seasoning (like their fried chicken). I loved that the seasoning had a bit of heat.   I was lucky that when I arrived, there was only 2 people in front of me. After, a huge line started forming out of the door.   I will say that they seem incredibly inefficient. I watched my pickles sit under the heat lamp for a solid 5 minutes until a worker came by to fulfill/bag my order.   81/365

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ate some but these fried pickles are solid!!

aNcz0Se8y9guEYecpwgU7g.text: Because of all the rave reviews you can see by the picture we had to try it all!!!  Nothing disappointed, it was all really good! The cafe was kept very clean and tables were cleared immediately. Overall great experience. I bet it's even better when it's warm enough to be open air.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LS9jOu2kRQ6PZoT71zm15A.text: I was in Las Vegas by myself for a conference and wanted something quick, convenient, and within walking distance from where I was staying. I decided to try Bruxie, and chances are good that I'll return the next time I'm in Vegas.   I arrived around 9 p.m. on a Sunday night, and the place was pretty empty. It's the kind of place where you place your order and then take a pager to your seat. I was able to order immediately upon arrival, and I had my food between five and ten minutes later.   I ordered the original fried chicken sandwich, and I thought it was really good. The waffle was mildly sweet, slightly crunchy on the outside, and soft and fluffy on the inside. The chicken was juicy with a crispy, flavorful breading. The slaw added the perfect amount of tangy acidity.   This is definitely one of the best places to get relatively inexpensive food when you're not looking for a high-end dining experience around the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original fried chicken sandwich

I59JegTz5rQ80emJP83ckQ.text: My expectations were extremely high and unfortunately they weren't met. I ordered the kickin chicken waffle sandwich and the product really didn't sit well with me. The sauce was fairly over powering and it wasn't spicy enough for me.   I think this was a classic case of ordering the wrong item because when I took apart my sandwich and tried the waffle and fried chicken separately, they were actually really good! I wish I had ordered a classic waffle and chicken sandwich with some syrup instead. After eating what I had ordered, it seems that chicken and waffles is a dish best left alone.   I will come back when I can to try something else on the menu.

RAuMxmiWXk_aMeqpJCO9ew.text: I knew about Bruxie from back in the day when they opened their first flagship store back in Old Towne Orange. I knew the owner because him and his father would eat at my mom's restaurant nearby. I never really tried their savory waffles until now. Wow. Now I know why they were so busy. You can't go wrong with fried chicken sandwiches in between waffles.   I ate at this location twice during my trip to Las Vegas. Original spicy chicken, waffle cut fries, strawberry lemonade and their Wisconsin frozen custard- everything was fresh and so good.   Very casual environment. You order at the counter, and they give you a gps tracker where your food gets dropped off at whichever table you choose. Inside and outside patio dining. They also have beer and wine options.  Self serve area for ketchup and waffle sauce (basically sweet syrup) and napkins.   Crispy chicken fried in clean oil and light fluffy waffles- what a combo!  Service is efficient. Nobody stood out in an extraordinary way. I did have one woman try to clear my plate when I was still eating- not cool. They have a spot to tip but actions like that get big fat zero dollars from me. I am a good tipper because of being part of the restaurant industry for many years, so mediocre and rushed service gets no love from me.   Come for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5W35ZDBEU1LjJ5_x7QTdpQ.text: "Mmm... Fried chicken, fly vixen. Give me heart disease, but need you in my kitchen." -Nasty Nas  Bruxie is amaze. It may not be the most traditional introduction to chicken waffles that I could have had, but it was such a good one. And it absolutely helps that I'm a sucker for breakfast food at all hours. That said, the breakfast thing isn't even that big a part of what they do at Bruxie.   Between the exquisite sides (Angry Mac & Cheese, Irish Nachos, and Fried Pickles) and delectable entrees (a Southern BBQ Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich and a Bacon-Cheddar Waffle), there wasn't one thing that I don't wish I could have eaten more of. Like, A LOT more of. I could easily eat like five servings of just the angry mac & cheese. The gooey cheddar cheese, succulent pieces of bacon, and slight kick of buffalo sauce is so delicious, it'll make you punch a baby right in its potato face. The fried pickles, while not exactly holding their breading as well as I would have liked and being extremely hot (albeit fresh), were still so yummy. The breading was well-seasoned and they were nice big chunks of goodness to be dunked in old faithful, Ranch dressing. The bacon-cheddar waffle was also so good. Imbued with little pearls of sugar and bacon, the waffle was just the right amount of crisp and airy in all the right places. With maple butter slathered on top of it, it was one decadent bite that I'm all about. And the Southern BBQ Fried Chicken & Waffle Sandwich. Oh man, what a mouthful. A mouthful of savory, warm, crunchy, cheesy heaven. Not only does the sandwich bring it in the taste and texture department, but it will absolutely fill you up. I swear, I felt as though I could barely move after finishing up. I could have sat there, sedentary listening to Ariana Grande and Bon Jovi play all day long. And the Irish Nachos, oh man. It's like they were tailor-made to be consumed after a night of drinks. The waffle fries covered in melty cheese, sour cream, bacon, and chives are such a perfect combination to soak up all that alcohol.  Basically, you can hit up Bruxie at literally any time of the day and find an amazing meal to suit your needs. I absolutely cannot wait to go back!

E2zpKkDX8Wrgq_8UAReA7w.text: I had walked by this place numerous times during my trip in Vegas. I was solo, had no one to confer with I decided to stop and check this place out. Staff was friendly, knowledgeable about the menu & offered suggestions when asked.  While I am normally one that goes for fine dining, every know & then a fast casual spot does the trick. So while heading down the strip i figured this was where i would stop for a quick bite before heading to ride the High Roller. I want feeling the waffle sandwich which they are known for, instead I tried the cheddar bacon waffle.. with kicker chicken (breast). I must admit, I was a little leery of a waffle with cheddar and bacon inside but it was delicious! The waffle was soft & tender and the cheddar blended perfectly. The chicken was crispy and a lil spicey.. the perfect combination for me.   The only drawback was the waffle seemed to have been pieces of actual sugar in the waffle. Guess that was the pearl sugar listed on the menu. I didn't like that at all. I figured that was the sugar used in the production of the waffle. Overall, it was a good experience but please... hold the sugar for being blended into t by e waffle as an ingredient... not pieces of a sugar cube cooked into the waffle. I don't prefer my waffles to crunch.

_SIFAn9a2Ag3DkRARAvKaw.text: Great service and quality food here. Chicken was moist and good. Waffle was light and fluffy. Menu looks fun.

u1kf0y_2nBzu53WV_Hx1pw.text: As I started to plot out where to eat for all of my meals while I was going to be in town, picking the last spot to go to before my flight home was by far the easiest. I mean, how could I not hit up Bruxie?! Considering how much I LOVED their Irvine location, this practically guaranteed a delicious ending to my trip. Which kind of explains why I did it again last month! Well, that and the fact that they're just that good! Located on the outside of New York New York, and right next to Shake Shack (also love!), it's great how this part of The Strip finally has some better food options (we wouldn't even bother before). Thankfully, everything about this Bruxie was just as amazing as the one in Irvine. In fact, if anything, the menu actually looked slightly better. The range of options was the same (fried chicken, waffle sandwiches, salads, etc.), but there seemed to be more variety now! -- HOLY CHICKEN - Maple Glazed Fried Chicken, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Cheddar Cheese, Sriracha Sauce, Sunny-side Up Egg...$11.95 (yelp.com/biz_photos/brux...) Aside from how the waffle fell apart after just a few bites (it needed to be crispier), I loved everything about this! The egg, cheese, and bacon were perfect complements and I liked the glaze's sweetness. The star was the chicken though - crispy, juicy, and super flavorful! -- KICKIN' CHICKEN - Spicy & Smokey, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Romaine, Pickles...$11.95 (yelp.com/biz_photos/brux...) Even though it wasn't as spicy (or kickin', if you will) as I thought'd be, I thought this was great! The chicken was moist, nicely battered, and still very tasty. What's more, the tangy sauce was awesome and the waffle was much better this time around! For all of their waffle sandwiches, you can make it a combo by adding a side of waffle fries and a drink (with free refills) for $3.95 more. Sure, the sandwiches are filling enough on their own, but this is well worth the money! The waffle fries are insanely good (perfectly crispy, lightly salted) and I LOVE their Strawberry Lemonade (a little sweet, but nothing a little more water won't fix). Despite having tried something different every time I've been to Bruxie (here and Irvine), I'm still disappointed in myself for not having tried their regular fried chicken yet! Fried chicken & waffles dishes have failed me before (a la Roscoe's), but I can't imagine I'd have to worry about that here. I guess I have even more reason to come back! Alhough, considering how much I love these guys, I never really needed another one.

0TIFFGQMgJw4E9qK7nHPIw.text: Hands down my favorite meal we had in Vegas and I would seek out other locations without a doubt. I had the "Kickin' Chicken" which has a really delicious level of spice to it but not too much that my weak self couldn't handle it. The waffle as the "bun" was fun and absolutely delicious. I prefer a more savory chicken and waffles experience so this really hit the spot for me. I love waffle fries and there's were delicious, but I wouldn't recommend the milkshake that I got.

DGiE9KFRaYxTvUtPJxjm8A.text: Ok.  Wow!  I did not believe my friend when he told me this was his favorite fried chicken.  That he thought it might be the best fried chicken in Vegas.  How could it be?  He's been trying to get me to come here with him for a year.  Yep, I should have come with him sooner because I think he might be right.  We got our items to-go which made me think that it wouldn't be tasty by the time we walked back to MGM, got in the car and drove back to Cosmopolitan.  Again, I was wrong.  Fried chicken that tastes good lukewarm?  That's still crunchy?!?!  Sign me up please!  I can only imagine how seriously delicious it is hot, fresh from the fryer.  I got the caramel custard as well.  This custard was delicious!  Not too sweet and had a great fluffy texture.  I cannot wait to come back here and try EVERYTHING else on the menu.  SOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOOOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken to go
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard.  Soooo good

p5rueicZO-NSld07X25p4Q.text: Delicious food! The line can get kind of long, but it moves quickly. The Holy Chicken was delicious. The chicken had a lot of flavor. The bacon and maple made a great sweet/savory combo. The Sriracha Mayo was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken

gyuq_RSPA_RCOeCNwiZ-zQ.text: I'm not quite sure what everyone was raving about with Bruxie- I mean it's trendy right now but to be honest I've had much better chicken and waffles.. but the mess for Bruxie unfortunately wasn't worth it. Pretty long wait for under-seasoned chicken and so much sauce the waffle gets soggy and starts to fall apart. I'm a texture gal and soggy food just doesn't cut it for me so even eating this mess with a fork was a no go. Maybe I didn't order the right thing and maybe it's just not my cup of tea but I wasn't that impressed. The service was so so, you got what you needed but the employees as a whole weren't very friendly.   I will say this - as long as they are milking this trend their decor was spot on and pretty cool. Not sure I would come back with all the other places to eat in Vegas.
