fYFPri2wg1oFrkJgT7o8cw.text: This place is AMAZING. We ordered 4 different things to share and were happy with all of them. I think everyone LOVED the pesto breakfast sandwich but I was so happy with the classic eggs, cheese and bacon.   I'd go here over and over again, but don't order a soda. Way too much $$$$ for an off brand soda .

jMb7AEmPaYCf5Njqi3hWNg.text: Location - near Shake shack in NyNy hotel. Opposite to the park MGM entrance. They had outside seating so we enjoyed a lot listening to the lovely music played by the Live band.  We went pretty late around 10 pm. Staff was great. You order the food and pay for it, then they will come and give it to you. We had the Oreo cookies and cream shake and a sandwich. Sandwich was awesome. Shake was nothing new, it's pretty regular. But try out the sandwiches

I had the waffle breakfast sandwich and my partner ordered a Bruxie burger.  Both tasted amazing!  Servers were friendly and very attentive, recommend if your looking for something different.

4xLOuNoyhMS_HrI9DBA_iQ.text: Absolutely loved everything about Bruxie.   Service - Fantastic; the cashier was helpful, kind & informative.   Decor/Venue - Sleek and modern. Lots of seating and very clean.   Food - Amazing! Try the chicken & waffles with the sriracha mayo. The waffles were so crunch and delicious. One of the best waffles I've ever tried.   Drinks - Mimosa was delicious. The champagne came in a separate bottle, super tasty!   Overall, I loved this restaurant.

Chp6dPF7SL9i9FRwULIWYQ.text: If only I could drool in writing....... The literal....BeSt! Chicken and waffles for breakfast and I get them in sandwich form....YES PLEASE! any how. I always get the same one when I go to Vegas with some Irish nachos of course! Perfect hangover food for the Vegas lifestyle!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8yHYxC-yykE-O5rszcY01w.text: I've had this spot bookmarked for ages and finally made it by after attending an event at the Park. I've heard great things about locations in SoCal and even joined their mailing list before this one opened. We have several great chicken sandwich spots in town and this one, after a long wait that probably overinflated my expectations, ranked just average.  Menu gets some seasonal additions and changes, and the item I came in for was no longer available (Cali Pesto Chick). I got the BAMF (fried chicken, 2 cheeses, macaroni, and peppers) and my pescatarian partner in crime got the roasted mushroom and goat cheese, both on waffles. The chicken was large with a thin, flavorful crust, but the toppings weren't so great- mac is premade with a sauce that includes bacon, angry cheese sauce tasted artificial. Mushroom and cheese combo was okay, the sundried tomatoes were an odd addition. We both liked the waffles more than expected, they were soft but held up surprisingly well. Portion size for both meals was fair for the price and location.  NOTE: only one vegetarian option, macaroni cannot be made vegetarian

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted mushroom and goat cheese
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior

x-A1StH_t_5CLduGLbj11A.text: Bruxie was probably my favorite meal that I had in Las Vegas! The restaurant is located right outside New York New York in the Park section. I showed up at a pretty off time, so I didn't have to wait in line. You place your order at the register and then they bring your meal to your table. I decided on the B.A.M.F with a Strawberry Lemonade and a side of fries.   The waffle was absolutely huge but perfectly cooked, soft but still had a nice crunch. The chicken was delicious and very moist, the angry mac and cheese and pepperoncinis definitely get the sandwich a kick, but it wasn't intolerable. The fries were nice and crispy, I also loved that they had spicy ketchup to dip them in which was pretty unique.  Overall, an awesome place to get breakfast/lunch/dinner! The staff was really friendly and even came to my table to offer me a refill and see if I needed anything else. My flight got changed or I would have come back for breakfast, I went to Eggslut at the Cosmo and thought this was way better! This will be my go-to spot for sure.

TvHJSipfF1KP53Bb-68rzQ.text: Pretty good stuff here! This is a quicker breakfast/brunch option if you don't want to spend an hour sitting down somewhere. It was relatively busy but we were in and out in about 30 minutes!   Spiced tots were more like "seasoned" tots - they were not spicy at all but just had some flavor to them. Not bad at all! Just not spicy like the name hints.  The baked waffles were SO FLUFFY! I've never had a waffle so airy and light. But don't let that fool you, they are big and I was full so quickly!   My husband had the Holy Chicken and he said it was full of flavor and also very filling. They serve large portions here!!

FzoIcBx-QGzm9pcpPcVlkg.text: We searched yelp one hungry morning and quickly settled on this place. It was close, affordable and looked delicious. We walked over from the Hilton and it was about a 10-15 minute walk. But once we got over there we saw it was worth it, they have a water area outside, a big chess game and some big plastic chairs. The teenager and the baby were both thrilled by the outside scenery (which is not a part of the restaurant).  The line goes out the door depending on the time but the service is fast. The seating is first come first serve.   We ordered the holy chicken and the fried chicken and waffle. Two of each and one milkshake. We all agreed the chicken was really yummy. My husband found the holy chicken overall a little too sweet, but I did not. I would say go in with the syrup conservatively.   My one complaint is the syrup is cold, for a place whose menu surrounds the waffle I would think they would offer warm syrup?!   We will be back for sure, just might try something else on the menu to see if it's just as good.

The chicken and waffle sandwiches were cooked perfectly, very crispy and the flavors are on point. It seems clean and priced reasonably for how big their sandwiches are.

YrXgxA-5B6aJEsmwpnBOtw.text: I have been holding off on this review because I am sad I cannot frequent here more often. I must say this place is amazing!  The perfect balance of crunchy, sweet, salty, and savory all packed into a nice sandwich. I was blown away. The chicken was cooked nicely and all of the flavors blend together amazingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AdK2kbAyWxwLJ74zyYMp0Q.text: Top quality ingredients, and real maple syrup trump the heavy, high fat, no apologies menu at Bruxie. The only light things on the menu are the holes in the waffle fries.   Come hungry.  I've seen a few waffle and waffle sandwich places fail. This one is very busy, mostly because of the meager breakfast and brunch offerings in the hangover capital of America.   It's certainly not the best chicken and waffles that I've ever had, but it was very good. They have a good staff that moves food, and keeps tables clean. They don't cut corners on the product or the condiments.  They have a Bloody Mary that is really good. So why 3 stars?  Was it worth the ten minute walk, and the $8 parking fee at the Park MGM garage?   No.   Aside from validation, which I know isn't happening, I had hoped for a restaurant with more comfort in its decor for a comfort food restaurant. Tables that felt more like a cool southern joint, and less like a third-rate Zaxby's fast-food McMeal kind of feel.    The service tried to offset it, but cheap tables make good food seem cheaper. Given their high prices, another fail, that isn't helping their case for "worth it."  If Wendy's is your idea of quality dining, this is your spot. Get 'er done!  Come soon, though, before the fad burns out. There is little here past various riffs on chicken and waffles, and fast food that you could get anywhere else for far less.

dPnW_qgEpMML-H_ERFLA6w.text: This is a waffle and fried chicken place , that mix's it up well! We stopped here for a light brunch bite and enjoyed! Not to much to boast, but the food was good!!!!    Their fried chicken was tasty and they have variations of the way the serve it!    For a fast bite, and flavor... not bad  TP

buo5l6xyspS1tmyUfjvv2w.text: Waffles everything at Bruxie Las Vegas, right outside New York New York and the meals here are to die for. I love waffles and the meals here are sooooooo good, definitely a must try when in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bri xie Waffle and drinks to start Vegas trip

U5U1CyUUd5eL6rhTd1VfVQ.text: Yikes! $42 later I ended up with the west coast interpretation of chicken and waffles. My expectations of chicken and waffles is high, I mean, I am from the South. The food was okay, staff awesome, decor cute, but price? Oh my effing god. If I didn't walk the half mile from the NYNY parking garage, starving, I wouldn't have even tried it at that price. It ain't worth the money y'all  Edit: I have lowered my review of Bruxie after the comment left by the owner/manager Melissa. Apprarently, they felt the need to comment that $42 is a fair price for fries in a paper carton and ketchup in a paper cup. You have now tarnished what little respect I had for you, and will not be returning.

JPjPj6ISUskCKxN3D1GtuQ.text: For this spot, I'd definitely break my rule about only coming to the strip when family is in town and for special occasions!!  It's ridiculously so damn good!!!  My brother in law found this spot on yelp, I decided to pass due to it being a Friday night and this place is on the strip, so I opted to stay home and have them bring me back something. They came home completely impressed and with a chicken strip combo for me.   I loved it!!! I was expecting for the food to arrive cold and soggy since it's a 15 min drive from my house to the strip, but that wasn't the case.   I had to try this place out in person!   We went yesterday (07/11) and it was packed! It's located outside the New York New York and it's in between MGM Park. There is an entrance to the casino right next to the restaurant, so no need to walk around the entire outside if you don't want to.  I do suggest that if you have multiple people in your group, send one of them to look for a table while you place the order.   My husband order the Holy Chicken it has Maple Glazed Chicken, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Cheddar Cheese, Sriracha Sauce, Sunny-Side Up Egg, served, of course in a waffle! I had to get the 6 tenders and fries with the Bruxie cheese sauce and the Angry Cheese Sauce, which I loved!   This placed nailed chicken and waffles!!! You definitely won't be disappointed! And you better believe that as I'm writing this, I'm trying to convince my husband to take me right now!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Mary! Their version of a Bloody Mary

3Ulm160EKH-V5q9_KH0jvQ.text: A nice clean restaurant in beautiful Las Vegas. If your in the mood for chicken and waffles this is a great choice for you. I decided to add a egg. I recommend the Bruxie for all.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles with a egg added.

hFmsbDgWYqRfBszCT4f_Tw.text: Solid chicken and waffle. You can get a waffle and chicken sandwich or just a regular chicken and waffle. I chose the regular option. My only complaint is that the waffle and chicken are sometimes so hard that the plastic forks break. The serving size is also medium - you won't walk away full but not hungry.  The location makes it tricky to get to during heavy traffic so I'd suggest getting dropped off on the strip and major a short walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

45w0fqw4pPLEmyFY94eYEA.text: Impressed with this place. I thought it was gonna be subpar quality food but actually the waffles were fresh,  crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. The chicken  although it was white meat was juicy, crispy and seasoned well.   I ordered the classic chicken and waffles. It came with a really cute bottle of pure maple syrup. Both were cooked just the way I liked it! What made the difference is that it was fresh. The majority of the menu items were variances on the fried chicken sandwich. They all looked delicious.  Clean interior, friendly staff and plenty of room to dine in. There's even ice water in a big pitcher ready for the guests. Helpful for those hot Vegas summers!   I would go back. If you're staying at any of the mgm properties and have food/beverage comps you can use it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks delish!

bBaAIKkPHyN-CLWEbaUDxw.text: These waffles.... y'all don't even understand... I'm from the south, (as given away by the "y'all") but I haven't had this good of a waffle, ever.   I got the original chicken and waffle.   At first sight the food looks delicious... large portion. Price reasonably I think for the quality and the location.  The waffle was so fluffy and light and perfectly cooked.  The chicken was very good too. But honestly, the waffle is the star of this meal.   I am the type of person that usually eats the protein and I don't care much about carbs... but this time, I was sad when I took the last bite of my waffle!   I also got an iced coffee and it was delicious and refreshing.

IBze9nH5UAtrifgja7jCZA.text: whatever you do, DO NOT ORDER A WAFFLE SANDWICH. The waffles are made crispy and do not hold up to be eaten like a sandwich. You will end up tearing it all apart and eating it separately. Do yourself a favor and just order Chicken and Waffles. However, the waffles are basic, no special seasoning in the batter. Just plain Waffle House; I wouldn't come back.

rvE2Z-JDU4smSwTvaolyYg.text: I wanted to get out the normal hotel food and try something different.  I have never understood the fried chicken+ waffle, but thought this place was highly reviewed and give it try.  It was ok, got the egg on it since it was brunch and I couldn't really eat it without using a fork.  It was ok, just not some awesome 5 star place. Also, it's very casual, order and they bring it to you.

stZNKzNmAV_XsOQMhgLjKw.text: So we passed this place on our way to the NY NY..we weren't hungry at the time, but as we came back around we decided to give it a shot..IT WAS SOOOOO GOOD I had to post it on fb for everybody who was in Vegas for the FFL games to see and try it out. I got the buffalo chicken waffle and a Hefeweizen. OMG I was in heaven! my bf got the syrup skillet. He loved his too. I wish we had one in Salt Lake! Will definitely be back when in Vegas! Oh and I hope you were able to get that flood in the kitchen controlled. You did an amazing job trying to maintain it, given your situation!

RGk4wz2E-R838YCdO7PEAg.text: Underwhelmed, my chicken on the waffle was lukewarm and not out of the fryer hot. The waffle was good. I might go back for just a virgin waffle. My BF got sick after he ate his club type sandwich, and no, he was not drunk as he does not drink alcohol.

rcI3Ac-9__K1cB6BClWqHA.text: Not as good as people make it out to be. The strawberry lemonade was the best thing we ended up ordering nobody finished their meals

djcd0yjpUyyIR4KLpWqleQ.text: This is a really good place. Unique concept. Don't go there if you are looking for a traditional breakfast, but we loved the waffle-based food!  We will be back!

EqcPy87pSJqcDx6_xp04JQ.text: Pretty freakin' good. Waffle sandwiches are unbelievable. There's really nothing healthy about this place but it's perfect for Vegas. Seems like the perfect way to start the day with a hangover or finish the night if you're on a bender.

gyGxB5YOqELmJHub4TB0jQ.text: Awesome concept and good waffles. I love the idea that I can pour syrup on my sandwich. Palmer was too bitter for me, but the servers switched it right our. Great service! Fun place!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool concept and awesome chicken.

DniZhu1fJMUqCzyJ8zuXCA.text: Wow, better than expected, great chicken waffle, also got the creme brulee waffle, chocolate shake and custard cone. All was good, this place just opened and it will be a huge succesa no doubt.

YTcZLHP-ENY9TJltWXlY1w.text: My toddler and I had breakfast at Bruxie during our visit to Vegas.  The naked waffle was amazing.  It wasn't busy so didn't take long which I appreciated being with a toddler.  Only thing was I didn't receive my coffee until after my food was gone.  I noticed everyone else received theirs before their food came out.  I had to ask the server for it and she replied casually that "oh they must be making it."  All in all, good experience.  Was probably a one time occurrence.

0VrT3W2bpQJvZhPMoLaq4Q.text: Omg!! I don't write reviews (although I check always). I stumbled upon this place while showing a friend the strip. AMAZING!!! 6 of us ate all different things, everything yum. Of course mine was the best, 2pc chicken and bacon cheddar waffle. The BOMB!! Nashville, original, and Holy were other faves. Customer service great. Go. Just Go!!!

NA2nKH09xcyMX2a16j5ILQ.text: This would have been a 5 star review if the AC worked inside the restaurant!  It was incredibly warm, but the food was delightful!  Tried the original (without slaw) and the tenders and fries and they were great.  Would definitely go back!.

UW0B7H7OwHRm1djNjQPjSw.text: This is a must eat here in Las Vegas food is fantastic and the price is perfect the service is second to none. The salad that I'm eating here is the best one I've ever had here in Las Vegas. If you want very nice place to eat and a great atmosphere come here.

VUXqQWwZAgaVA3c2IiJXQQ.text: Amazing...we had 8 people in our party and everyone loved it, so much we ate there the next day... great price for Vegas I had the Nutella sweet cream banana waffle and a large caramel latte and with tip it was less than $10... the girls all got free refills on their strawberry Iced tea... great service good price can't beat it;)

vj4NHRpbcmscJN6vhwCOog.text: Great food and shakes but the concept of Waffle sandwiches doesn't appeal to me. It is pretty neat when the crowd is less but one less star if there's a crowd on the plaza waiting for even a few minutes on summer is a hassle. Would certainly like to try it out again but service is a nice to have.

xsWS0YQquGY4z3xrEEQ66g.text: Had to wait a bit but it was totally worth it. We had the mushroom salad and regular chicken and waffle sandwich. Super yummy

Cf0Jt2Nz1t1FxecoA5VO1w.text: Wow!! I had a waffle pastrami and it was delicious. The waffle is super soft and a great replacement for bread. But the pastrami was also wonderful. Very lean and cut super thin and very flavorful. Very easy to eat and it was a great nighttime snack.

bJBfqXfl5NQgOHZMOb2r0g.text: Food here is just not worth it. It may look exotic but the burgers here are just plain bad. I would not recommend this place as a place to get food. They serve anything but food. Again go some where else. I'm not recommending this place at all!!

0OYZakDADjy1A7acGH-PSA.text: I went to this place for the first time today and the employees were really friendly, their menu didn't have a lot but it sure did have dishes i have never tried before. i decided to go with the Nashville Hot Chicken since I love hot and spicy food.  The food came quicker than expected, the food looked really tasty. There was one downside to this though, when ordering i specifically asked for no sauce at all, but when my food came there was mayonnaise on it. They replaced the waffle in no time but that is not the reason why this has a low rating.  The chicken had a very nice look to it, the texture of it was decent, and it could pass for real nashville hot chicken. But looks isn't what makes the food good. The chicken was indeed tender, and crispy. But, the chicken had no flavor what so ever, it tasted like as if it was overcooked or if they used old oil. The waffle just tasted like a wafer with no flavor and almost made me puke when I was eating the waffle by itself. The place itself has a very nice aesthetic to it and it could be a good hangout spot and if you're looking for something quick to eat, very outgoing and polite employees. But dinner wise, I wouldn't think twice about not going to this place again, everything but the food is good about this place. I feel like this is just an over-hyped place that you should just avoid.

h7wSVvZaWy5mbnu0nXwUtA.text: Awesome service- even though you order from the counter, they bring you your food and come around to give you unlimited drink refills. The batter is delicious, waffles fluffy. Textures and burst of flavors in every bite are delightful! Very heavy food though. We get the Nashville Style Spicy and Creme Brulee waffle desert.

enNpK7_qg0RTw_IP-W4DwQ.text: Nashville, smore waffle, ballast point. Outdoor seating, great views, very affordable and delicious

O2gzefVwAG0hiRl4qpri8g.text: In a town where you can literally have anything you want, Bruxie is an unexpected surprise--chicken and waffles in Vegas? get out of here, that's crazy! Whether you go with the original chicken and waffles, their spicy version, or the sweetness of lemon cream and berries you won't go away unsatisfied. The salads are also amazing and their waffle fries make the perfect pair with any sandwich. I've tried many places and haven't found anyone who gets this combination right....until now. Some places have soggy waffles, others make their waffles way too thick and drown out the chicken and yet others just can't get the chicken right. The location on the strip is perfect for people watching, it's clean, busy and definitely awesome. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we were being checked on quite often, our drinks were constantly topped off and our table remained clean and clutter free throughout our meal. I can see a drawback for locals though, there is very little parking nearby so that would definitely create a headache. Next time you're in Vegas, give Bruxie a try, it wil definitely surprise you how good it really is.

L9uiRWjQd-7i3Bu8A4ButQ.text: Wow! We had the roasted mushroom and goat cheese waffle sandwich and the buffalo bleu chicken waffle sandwich.  Both absolutely incredible! The buffalo sauce had a nice kick to it. The balsamic vinegar made the mushrooms taste great. The waffles are light and airy making it easy to enjoy all of the flavors of the sandwich and not be dominated by bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious! I would definitely get both again!!

UttQgcUPrhpm2lJ3G9kbbA.text: This place was great. The service is especially amazing as they open the door for you and your waiter always checks up on you every 5 minutes or so to see if you need anything. The sausage egg cheese waffle was delicious and cheap for only 7$. I would highly recommend to try it because it fills you up and the waffles are a million times better than regular ones.

YuYMw9O_z_CUuEAYnA_P5g.text: The Perfect Food Spot to hit up before going out on the Strip  My co-worker and I stumbled upon this place as we were walking the strip after our conference.  We were looking for something that was different and was not crowded.  Monday Night Football was on TV.  As we were walking from the MGM Grand to mid strip, I saw all the 4 and 5 stars on Yelp for Bruxie.  So we thought we give it a try, we were not disappointed!  I ordered the 2 piece with Mac and Cheese.  After I burnt the top of my mouth with the fresh out of the fryer fried chicken, I was in heaven.  The syrup adds an sweetness to the saltiness of the outer crust of the chicken.  The chicken was not dry inside and the crust was not too hard.  The mac and cheese was cheesy and they use more white chesses that added a bitter taste to the mac and cheese.  But that went perfect with the Chicken.    I could not even eat all of my food.  My only complaint is that beer prices are a bit high there.  Now, I would go into greater detail but you know, the adventures of Las Vegas kinda fogged my view up.  But when I did wake up my co-worker and I were talking about how that was some good fried chicken.  So if you are looking for a spot when you are in Vegas, Bruxie will be a good option.  Bruxie's gets a solid 7.5 on my "I judge Fried Chicken on the Yo' Granny's Fried Chicken Scale". Here is quick break down of my "Fried Chicken on Yo' Granny Fried Chicken Scale"  From Poppies/KFC (ugh nasty 1-4) to the midpoint (not bad, and yes this is where most fried chicken falls 4-9) to the cannot be topped Granny's Fried Chicken (a perfect 10).  I am very picky about my fried chicken if you can not tell.   So if you are looking for a spot when you are in Vegas, Bruxie will be a good option.

-tRE_W7-oK872KMfAweQuA.text: Bruxies is fantastic!!  Staff was very friendly, food came out really fast, and tasted amazing!  Great lunch spot on the strip.

Ph-Ccznjz-DxtM0JX1mX3A.text: The waffle was very greasy. The chicken was crispy, but a little dry and the breading was so heavily seasoned, it was too much. Perhaps they over fried it, cause it was not golden brown but rather a very dark color. Or maybe its all the over the top seasoning in the breading that gave it that unattractive color. The sauce is much too sweet and the tiny spoonful of coleslaw they give you with it, is hardly enough to cut through all that "carby" and greasy food. I desperately wanted something acidic to cut through the grease or at least more coleslaw to break that monotony of flavor.

zI_-v4ZYOBB_ipI1siBeHw.text: Came here with my fiance this morning for breakfast and we were pleasantly surprised. My fiance ordered the original seasoned chicken with bacon waffle. The chicken was so tender, boneless and had a wonderful peppery taste. I got the nutella banana dessert waffle which had a light crispy texture and sweet creme and of course nutella and sliced banana. I have to say I much prefer french toast and crepes to waffles but this waffle was to die for! After trying a piece of the original seasoned chicken though, I can't tell which one I prefer as both were excellent in such different ways. Truly a fusion of sweet and savoury at this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella and banana dessert waffle with sweet creme
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original seasoned fried chicken with bacon waffle

EA-mTMMMPEiTyPEoUuH_Vw.text: Absolutely delicious!!! I had the original chicken waffle sandwich and it was great. Chicken and waffle were both cooked perfectly and the sauce on the chicken was so good along with the maple syrup. The waffle fries and crisp on the outside but soft in the middle. Make sure you get their ranch dressing. One of the best ranches I've ever had. My Wife has the chicken strips, with the buffalo sauce. The strips are large in size and the buffalo sauce had a good amount of spice but a great flavor to go with the heat. She also had waffle fries with ranch on the side. To drink we both had the Strawberry Palmer, very refreshing! Can't wait to go back next time we are in town

qdoQC0R9CWbVgk32pU_IMw.text: Received a gift card from bruxie came back to try it out again. The food was good. Waffles are crispy outside soft inside.  Chicken was delicious. We also ordered the creme brule strawberry waffle, so flame! Good music, cool atmosphere. I definitely recommend you try.

rRchALvnaFvcGlbmVEGPag.text: I want to give it 4.5 stars, but the batter on the dark chocolate Leige was light and I missed out on a 1/3 deliciousness of a waffle.   Dessert waffles are outstanding, roasted turkey club on a waffle was really good. It's light on the stomach and service was quick. Chicken and waffles for the win, again.

4tsZilRSrGGexhdd0xh8cg.text: Such good food can't go wrong with chicken and waffles. There was a line out the door but after eating there I totally see why.. worth the wait! I had the Nashville style waffle sandwich which was spicier than I expected, glad I got a side of ranch with it or my mouth would've been on fire. So glad I decided to stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville style waffle sandwich

vJV1v8wjcBt6kAAr_NiQfg.text: A must try once in your life.  I'm not a chicken and waffles kind of girl, but a friend wanted to go there so I thought oh well.  I normally want to eat veggies or lighter fare, so it was not my first choice.   Expecting to feel like a fatty after (and probably tired), I was surprised how light and tasty it was.  First off, it's not chicken and waffles like soul food style, you won't eat it with a fork and knife.  You eat it like a taco and it's not humongous.  II had the Nashville style hot, but I took a few bites of the hamburger and the creme brulee.  They were all yummy.  This place is super cute and trendy.  You walk up and order and like panera or some of those other places, they will bring your food out to you.  It's good for a quick bite.  I would definite go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée

BDhc0pnWpkvGNDXdr-_M_g.text: Fantastic chicken and waffles.  Never had that combination before but now I'm a convert.  I got the Holy Chicken without the Sriracha.  It was so good.  My wife loved her waffles but wished the butter that was put on it wasn't rock hard.  That was our only complaint. I would definitely go there again.   Dessert waffles looked really good. Price is very reasonable especially considering the area. Update Tried the sundae waffle a few days later and it was delicious.

w-jhGOJqyKQjaFfw8Y0yTg.text: Ordered the original chicken and waffle sandwich and it was excellent! Chicken was fried to perfection and the honey chili sauce was delicious, I just wish there was a little more sauce. I also ordered one of their homemade sodas (Cola, and my boyfriend ordered a spiced cola which is similar to Dr. Pepper) and I really enjoyed those as well. The spiced cola is a little strong and bf didn't like it, so he gave it to me. It takes a little getting used to but I liked it! The service was excellent! We went on a Monday evening so it wasn't busy, and the staff approached us while we were eating to ask if we needed anything and even offered to give my brother a refill. Wasn't expecting it since it had a fast food style ordering system but I was pleasantly surprised. Overall, the food is a tad pricey for what you get, but I'm a fan of chicken and waffles. Staff and service were great and so was the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken and waffles and waffle fries

Ru5Kp5v8_DNV7Gh19Gd3hw.text: The waffle of your dreams is here.  I prefer the regular breakfast waffle which is crunchy on the outside and light and airy on the inside.  This is the waffle to compare to all others.   Great addition to the strip.  I'm a fan of the original location in OC but its very busy and difficult to get to.  I was very excited when I walked by and saw this location opened!!  Good price for the amount of food. We did not have the sandwich waffle which is denser but will be back.

8a1cVhVqj9qpzuNiKThhTA.text: Ever heard of the Baader-Meinhof phenomenon? It's where you hear about something for the first time or notice something you hadn't before and suddenly you hear and see that thing EVERYWHERE. In the case of Bruxie, it's not just in your head. Bruxies are popping up everywhere and for a good reason. The chicken and waffles here are simple, cheap and tasty.  Park at New York New York (on a night without an event at the T Mobile Arena so you can get free parking!) Walk toward the strip. Pass CPK, pass Beerhaus (I know, it's tempting to stop there). Stand in line. Order your food (I suggest the Original). Sit down. Wait for food. Consume everything. Order more to go while eating.  The Original: Fried chicken on a waffle (Only 250 kcal?!) Nothing fancy, nothing worth taking a picture of... But it's good. The waffle isn't sweet, just think of it as an alternative to bread. The maple syrup is on the self serve counter for you to drown your meal, if that's your thing. For me, the sandwich is a little bland without syrup.  California Pesto Chicken: Very light, very simple. I would order it again.  The Lemon Cream and Berries: The lemon custard was a little too overpowering for me and it made the waffles taste too bland in comparison. Save the dessert for someplace else.  The sodas are made from cane surgar, no caffeine (except from the cola) and are worth ordering. They also serve alcohol if that's what you're looking for!  Sit outside and enjoy the weather (before it gets too hot!) The street performers outside are all paid by The Park- you won't find "Mickey" and "Dora" here ;)

h1_BpvminhOCPCa2e2nesw.text: Perfect hangover cure after a night out on the town! Waffles and fried chicken, the perfect blend of sweet and savory.

Mr7eXwHB5zesRyLj46_-hA.text: All types of Waffle sandwich loved the idea! The food was served quick and was very good. Waffle had the perfect consistency not to hard or soft and has a very good flavor. I ordered the breakfast waffle and the creme brulee waffle which was delicious didn't even have to add syrup!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulee and breakfast waffle!!

Ps_3fb6b89enJZg8JqnQaA.text: It was good food but over priced for fast food.  We bought orginal fried chicken with the onion and bacon waffle.  The food is unique for fast food but for fries with some cheese and bacon bits to he 8 dollars was a bit much.  It was 10 dollars for the chicken that was not all white meat.  They get a mediocre grade from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cant wait to get some!

drPp6bUDTuiFMgSYtsN-2A.text: Waffles anytime of day are where it's at! We were looking for reasonably priced breakfast close by and Bruxie won out! I had been to the original in Orange, CA and knew it was gonna be good. Quick service and the prices can't be beat in Vegas! I ordered the naked Bruxie waffle with Vermont maple which was pretty good if not just a tad bit greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The naked Bruxie waffle with Vermont maple!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WXGSdsOt6O6NR_EfTNCY-g.text: While excited to come to Vegas for much of their nightlife and entertainment. I was even more excited for all the food I was going to be jamming down my throat. So Bruxie was definitely one of those places I was not going to miss out on especially after all the amazing reviews it has received. And it surely has not disappointed...I ordered the crispy chicken waffle which was completely phenomenal from the tenderness of the chicken all the way down to Bruxie sauce and crispy waffle. My girlfriend on the other hand decided to go with the nutella banana waffle and the combination of the three can not be any better!! Oh she loved it by the way too!! If your in Vegas this is a must come to restaurant...

McE6tecz07kkwODIbPKpnA.text: Fantastic breakfast/brunch place. We got the Elvis and the Chicken and waffles and it was extremely good. A little heavy but that expected.

DJECW7tf66go0Bjo7ltxiQ.text: This Place is Awesome. The food is amazing & they also serve alcohol. The atmosphere is very chill and has a brunch kinda vibe. This place is good with good service.

tyaGqNJMmEMW1nqNxWpdAg.text: Chicken is tender and the waffles are fluffy! Order on the line and you get a buzzer to tell you when your food is ready. Lots of seating inside and outside. Surprisingly the creme brulee waffle was really good despite a full stomach from regular chicken and waffles.   Making a stop here every time I come to Vegas!

qsF-eN_3x8a9OjSCGUowTQ.text: We wanted a lunch that wasn't huge but was filling and inexpensive. We go much more then we bargained for. The waffles are thin and the chicken is some of the best I've ever had. Such a wonderful find, will defiantly recommend to friends.

1rWLSUJhzWvQfusN-ZMOkA.text: Great place to try once at leave. I had the bruxie burger which I'd a burger but instead of hamburger buns they use two waffles. I added the avocado and bacon which made a big difference in the overall aesthetics of the burger. Drizzled some syrup on the waffle up top and ate it. Was not disappointed. If you feel like spending over 15 dollars an this burger, depending on the extra toppings, I would recommend you do. A bit of Louisiana hot sauce sealed the deal on the burger. Worth it. Nutella shake is good to share.

8ztjQgJo2-3vdHEDwH-f0w.text: Typically I don't do the "chain" reviews here, but oddly enough I wanted to recognize my trip to Bruxie on the recent Vegas outing. It was shockingly pleasant?!?  So outside of the walls of NYNY sits Bruxie in the blossoming Park area between it and Monte Carlo. Prime real estate indeed with this area flourishing, but the whole "don't eat what we have at home" theory plays in sometimes because rarely do I see this place packed.  I had a random craving for chicken fingers and totally overlooked this, but glad I didn't this time. The batter was crispy and flaky, but was not falling off the chicken so they certainly represented on that night. The chicken itself was very moist and not a bite over cooked as I've grown used to. It did come partnered with a Carolina BBQ sauce which took the meal to new heights and even the herb ranch dressing left me clucking with pleasure.  I didn't quite care much for the staff as they weren't all that friendly, but I focused on the food and tuned them out very easily once I dug into the chicken. I always knew them for good waffle sandwiches, but now I'd list them out as a go-to chicken tender spot. Well buck buck to that!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Tenders

4EipxRKIlTN97NRXjsP97w.text: Probably a 4.5 star review, but not 5.  Very strong lunch at Bruxie on a Friday afternoon around 1.  The line was almost out the door, but it goes pretty quickly.  I was with a group of friends, so we decided to share some items.  We went with the original sandwich, the Nashville hot chicken sandwich, the cheesy waffle fries, the mac and cheese, and the Irish nachos.  To drink, I got the strawberry lemonade.   The food took about 10 minutes to arrive.  Service is great, they bring the food out to you and were very quick to pick up clean dishes or offer refills.  Everyone was friendly as well, fantastic in that regard.  Of the sandwiches, I strongly preferred the Nashville hot chicken to the original.  The Nashville hot chicken is bade with a fried chicken thigh versus the chicken breast that the original contains.  The thigh was thicker and juicier than the breast, which wasn't dry but twas close to it.  Additionally, the sauce on the Nashville sandwich was strong.  It wasn't super hot but it had a bit of heat with it.  The sauce and shredded pickles went well with it.  This sandwich was far superior to the original.  The waffles are light, airy, with a slight crispiness to them.  The syrup was very good, thick with lots of maple flavor.  I may get just waffles with chicken strips next time rather than a sandwich, they were very good.  On the sides, the waffle fries are basic and lightly seasoned.  The cheese sauce is also pretty basic, but it's good.  The Irish nachos are large, imminently shareable.  They are LOADED with toppings:  bacon, cheese, sour cream, chives.  They were good, if not a little messy.  I preferred these to the cheesy fries.  The mac and cheese is made with bacon, and you can definitely taste the bacon.  The cheese sauce is largely cheddar-based.  It was a classic bacon and cheddar mac and cheese.  The noodles weren't overcooked as well, they retained some bite.  The strawberry lemonade is sweet, but not overly so.  You can taste both lemon and strawberries as well, all of us enjoyed it.  And, if you are so inclined you can get a shot or two added to it.  Bruxie is a nice addition for The Park, there's outdoor seating and plenty of indoor seating.  I would absolutely come back on future trips to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish nachos.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese with bacon.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville hot chicken sandwich.

jtgeGBbRY0DwitUHY4nIVQ.text: Went here for breakfast. There was a bit of a line, but I was not in a hurry. After ordering, you are given a table sensor and the food is brought to you. I ate outside as the inside was packed. I had the chicken and waffles with bacon and egg and an iced coffee. This came with butter and syrup. They also have a few different hot sauces available and free ice water. It took a little while for the food to make it to me, but like I said I was not in a hurry so it was not a problem. Everything was very tasty and hot. I would recommend this place for a casual meal.

vW08_cbLUaKrwE4W2vHj8w.text: I actually enjoyed my waffle sandwich and cocktail, and so did the boyfriend. BUT - I think $50 for breakfast for two (one cocktail each - half the bill) that didn't absolutely make me stuffed is a bit much. That being said, it was definitely tasty and a cool twist on food - something hard to find. Of course you'd find it (along with the jacked up pricing) in Las Vegas! We landed in Vegas early and needed breakfast before we wandered a bit while waiting on our room to be ready. The cab driver didn't know the place, and the cab drop off was fairly far considering we had luggage, but I'm glad we stopped. I'd definitely avoid the cocktails if you want to keep your bill down a bit (a cocktail is as much as your entree!), and don't count on this holding you all day - just enough for breakfast to get you to lunch.

JK5FuLzkCA7AvBEWoo9s7w.text: I gotta say, coming from the south, the Land of Chicken and Waffles, I had little expectation for Bruxie. I went there for brunch with my cousin who swears by it so I decided to give it a try. I had no interest in getting their waffle sandwiches and to truly gauge it, I went with fried chicken and waffles served the way I know it with an extra over easy egg on the side and some mac and cheese. Man oh man, I was blown away by their waffle!!! Theirs had caramelized edges that I've never had anywhere and it was divine. Their fried chicken cut wasn't what I would usually order but they only had one kind, the boneless, mostly white meat cut. Seasoning was pretty good and it was fried crispy but it was a little dry. If it were a piece of dark meat, it would have been juicier. The mac and cheese wasn't anything to rave about, of course I've had and make better ones but it did complete the whole Southern "cheat day" Brunch I was gunning for.   That waffle was so good I wanna get myself a waffle iron just to try to recreate it! More reason to come back to Vegas for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those waffles are TDF!

npxeU7TdHZnKZv1p8ofdIg.text: Quick and convenient centrally located breakfast option. Would have liked some sweet, like syrup, with the chicken, bacon waffle...skipped the fried egg today, wasn't feeling it. Had some champagne to wash it down. Tasty, but pricey...about $30 for one person, for the above, tip included.

tD5g4PkYxtYtf3-hNc_SgQ.text: This is the best I could ask for when hungry, hungover AF, and don't want to wait long. The portions are gigantic and you'll roll out of there feeling like Fat Bastard himself. I hope you weren't planning on wearing that bodycon dress tonight hon-ey!

WLGaFQvL-wfmNyY6SPgF_Q.text: Fast food kind of place.. which I wasn't expecting. With its great ratings I thought it was a nicer sit down brunch spot, but either way it was delicious. We got the bacon egg and cheddar cheese. The maple syrup to dunk the sand which in makes all the difference. Definitely recommend it as a fast and good breakfast spot on the strip.

g1VeqP3xEC4hoeXwvs1-JA.text: We had breakfast there. There was a line but the waiting time is okay. We ordered a salad, a sandwich, nachos, a lemonade and a blueberry smoothie. All of them are delicious. The portions are too big for two people. The blueberry smoothie is the best.

Qalec3AjMn6h3wEKxWwftA.text: Great place for chicken and waffles! On the strip next to New York NewYork, this place serves up some juicy fried chicken!  We ordered the 'Original' and the 'Nashville Hot' 2-pc which comes with waffle.  Both tasted great, with the Nashville having some spicy kick to it.  The only reason why this place missed the 5-star mark is their waffles.  Though they were hot and crispy, they put in some kind of sugar pellets in the batter.  After the first few bites, it just became too sweet for me.  Would've been nice if they put it on top (or on the side) so it can be scraped off for those who don't want it that sweet.  All in all, Bruxie serves up some mean chicken! A must try if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville Hot Chicken &amp; Waffles!

_SEIvC1I3Yr7D3V8GB58iQ.text: Absolutely RIDICULOUS how AMAZING  this food is.. I can't even begin to explain how much New York needs a  Bruxie... if Your reading this just go eat here. Fast service clean fresh (free refills) delicious succulent food. A++

NM2F-TtAma9WbTGlBpOwpg.text: It was hot and this was the first place I walked up to. I absolutely don't regret it either! I was not expecting much but was blown out of the water with their chicken n waffles. The waffle was so light and crispy and the chicken was so thick and juicy.   I keep thinking of their chicken n waffles, but tampa does not have anything like it! This is definitely a place to visit if you're in Vegas. It was so delicious and I found out that syrup and fries are delicious together... oh boy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jntyEN9qt27FUFICkNdGVw.text: Awesome food! Loved the waffle with goat cheese and roasted mushrooms. Found great reviews on yelp and had to try it out. Didn't disappoint.

p5qsu4NWhGI8XH5WSPYmNg.text: OMG best chicken n waffles me and my husband have ever had!!!! Was there on 03/01!!! Loved it and will recommend and go back when in NV again!!!

bfh4m_0QT5o8t6qgxu67JA.text: Although I am not usually too wild about eating chicken and waffles, I can recognize that this is one of the better chicken and waffle places. The waffle is crispy and appears fried, allowing it to serve effectively as slices of a sandwich. I bought the crispy chicken sandwich, which was quite delicious and crispy. My friend tried the buffalo chicken, which was not as crispy and enjoyable. The sandwich is pretty heavy; you will not go hungry for a while after eating one.   Lines can get long, so this might not be a good option if you are in a hurry to get somewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle irish fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken

fry4rQM3q9RllDHQGFPTuQ.text: We had a choice between Bruxie's or Yardbird for chicken and waffles that I had bookmarked. We ended up just wanting something quick instead of having to sit down so we chose Bruxie's.  We parked in the garage at New York, New York and walked down to where they call "The Park" area. Since we just had something with eggs, we decided to get the original chicken and waffle instead of the breakfast chicken and waffle. We ordered it as a meal with the waffle fries and orange soda.   When the employee brought out the sandwich she also brought out an extra pan for us since we were splitting it and she also had it cut in half to make it easier for us. The sandwich, oh my freaking goodness! It was amazing. The waffle wasn't too thick or too thin and it had the perfect crisp even with the slaw and sauce. It didn't get all soggy. There was a crunch in every bite. The chicken inside again, oh my freaking goodness! So flavorful and so moist. Usually chicken breast can be a little dry but this chicken breast was the best of all breast. How do they get it that moist and juicy?! I want one right now just writing about it. The waffle fries were good but could use a little bit of salt. They were just plain waffle fries but had the perfect crisp to it. The orange soda, it was delicious. It was sugar cane orange soda. I've seen a couple different places have that brand of soda. It was different but very tasty. I would definitely recommend this place. GO NOW! Well, if you're in Vegas. You won't be disappointed, I promise!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MdONlzMvtWeBOElfVAWisA.text: Parking can be a little tricky. I would suggest parking Monte Carlo. It's the closest walk and the first hour is free!    Came here on a Saturday night and there's not that many people there. We weren't that hungry so we decided to share the Nashville chicken bruxie sandwich. Thank god we did because the serving size is huge!!  It can definitely feed two people. Unless you're very hungry, I would suggest sharing. The workers are very nice. And extra star given for the great customer service.   We got our sandwich shortly. It looked amazing. However I would give the sandwich 3 stars. For me it was very salty!  The chicken is fried to perfection. But the amount of actual meat you get is very little because the breading is very thick. The waffle is delicious. Crispy and slightly sweet to balance the salty chicken. I also loved the pickle and slaw inside it. Basically everything cut the saltiness of the chicken. I had to put a lot of syrup on it to balance the taste... Which is very unhealthy. I'm basically using a ton of sugar to cover a ton of salt. Also, it doesn't have that Nashville sweet and spicy flavor. Just salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Nashville chicken sandwich

GxtUGMDLi6gfAIl21568aQ.text: For someone who doesn't usually order waffles anywhere else, I love the variety of offerings at Bruxie.  Not everything on the menu has to do with breakfast, either. This Sin City location is very nice and spacious with some huge windows overlooking the Park Vegas, great for people-watching.  The lines were not really long when I've gone and service is quick and friendly.    What I've Had: Fried Chicken Poutine:  just yum!  Treat yo'self to this item for the combo of waffle fries, buttermilk fried chicken, cheese curds, and gravy.  It's worth the cheat.   The Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken sandwich is basically like eating buffalo wings on a waffle and if you like those, you'll like this item.  And, it's not really too spicy which I appreciate.   The Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar waffle is nice for breakfast; you can add another egg and prosciutto to make it even nicer.   Ask for the Fluffernutter from the secret menu for a sweet little treat.  I still haven't tried the Lemon Cream and Berries, but it's on my list. If you're in the area, try Bruxie out for a fast, casual, and fun meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Turkey Club

u3UQNQEJ_aX9THOVXa77fQ.text: I came here after the Pac12 tournament last night. The line was long but I had wanted to try this place for a while. I got The Original which is essentially a chicken and waffle sandwhich. I thought the waffle was crispy but a bit bland, the chicken had some seasoning. The syrup that comes with it is a more a light-spicy sweet taste, I thought it was good. For what I got I just thought it was just ok. I'd really give the food 3 stars because there wasn't anything special about it, however customer service was awesome.

ah741Mn83mnYYxeezQUW0w.text: At first I was very skeptical of this restaurant just based on the chicken and waffle idea. I'm not a fan of this particular combo. However I was pleasantly surprised when I received my meal. My tastebuds were over joyed to have experience this food. Everything was seasoned well. And despite any condiments you try with the sandwich all the different layers of flavors are evident! Me and my party of 3 literally spent the whole time eating and talking about how delicious our meals were. It is a lil pricey but it worth every penny. I had the SOUTHERN BBQ sandwich. Speechless! And it keeps you full. I'm definitely going back before I leave!

oUHKHgx8JfjtM5NbKHcqww.text: It was ok. Something different definitely. The chicken was good.  The waffle could have been a little crisper, especially because of the juices from the sauce. I had the "Original".

I had the green eggs and ham which ham , egg and pesto also on a waffle. Very good as well.

n5Rxp3hdHOoyiLDIGz5HxA.text: So the food is amazing. It's so hard to figure out what to order your first time, so go with the original cheddar bacon waffles and chicken. The waffle is sweet and the chicken is moist and crispy. Do much flavor in each and ever bite your taste buds will go into overload.   However, the food isn't really hot. Seems like it was sitting for a while after cooked.   The bathroom was really dirty. The sign on the back of the door wasn't updated from the previous day. This needs to be fixed.

vLl56QpB9K7JpcgTxd7bkA.text: Was in Vegas with the wife doing a long foodie weekend, and the only meal we ate that wasn't some kind of fancy was a lunch at Bruxie's. While it wasn't a Michelin-starred experience, I think this was the best food for the money we had all weekend.  Holy Chicken - Fried chicken on a waffle, with bacon, cheddar, sunnyside-up egg, and sriracha. Perfectly fried chicken, juicy with a crunchy crust. Bold salty flavors and a crispy waffle that just barely manages to hold it all together. Luckily, the wonderful flavors and textures of breakfast make this a sandwich that you won't put down.  Roasted Mushroom & Goat Cheese - Waffle sandwich with mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, arugula, and goat cheese. I assume this was designed for the vegetarians, but we added a piece of fried chicken breast and made an astoundingly good sandwich. This is everything wonderful about an arugula and goat cheese salad, but with a perfect piece of fried chicken on a crispy waffle.   We didn't order any sides because these are big sandwiches, and that turned out to be the right call.  I am SO going back here next time I get the opportunity.

IYdNcOWhSrBxePS4gxHakw.text: Food was alright pretty decent but nothing too special... the batter on the chicken was pretty crispy and the chicken is tender. Line was quick and everything else is self served. Food is not bad..but nothing wow. One of those places u would die to try but maybe not a second time imo.

H07yT-yeYCh1uKHv_sWgcQ.text: Chicken and waffles done right!  Warning, their servings are huge!  The hot and spicy isn't that hot and spicy.  When in Vegas, we usually come here for brunch.  Be sure to get dessert!

pasEyCujuKysEm0JFPNSaQ.text: Now, fact is, I've been to the original Bruce in the O.C. so I was wondering if this one would stand up to their high standards. I'm happy to say that it did. Really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Great for a meal and great for dessert. Waffles are the new burgers!

qvR7Be__6vY46CWQr5d_Aw.text: Absolutely amazing.  No other words then that. You must go.  The line is worth the wait there is plenty of pretty tables to sit outside.  The nacho fries were amazing and the fried pickles were huge chunks of pickles. All very reasonable pricing but if u order alot like we did it does add up. I got the Tito's pink lemonade which was delicious

D6HSgXxjaU79G8d0sd_EVQ.text: First time here and I will say best chicken and waffles I've had   Chicken is tender and seasoned very well the waffle with bacon OMG  wonderful   Great portion size I highly recommend this place. Nice music comfortable atmosphere

8cYEzfHVfZpFVio79vPMVw.text: Was so pleased and grateful to the staff at Bruxie this week. I accompanied my boyfriend who was attending CES. I'm able to work remotely but the idea of staying in my hotel room all day just because I knew there was reliable wifi was a bit of a drag. I ventured out to Bruxie for lunch and brought my laptop along in case I found a good internet-enabled spot. Bruxie to the rescue! The restaurant is adjacent to a small park that provides free wifi ("TheParkWiFi"). I camped out at my table for 4 hours and the staff was nothing but lovely to me. As a server in a previous life I know that campers can be obnoxious, so I tried to keep any requests to a minimum. But a server at Bruxie went above and beyond by consistently checking in with me, bringing me endless refills, and even letting me sample some ice cream (delicious, definitely coming back for the ice cream).  Beyond that, my lunch was moan-as-you-chew good. I got The Original fried chicken and waffle sandwich and was so impressed with the juiciness of the chicken, fresh and crispiness of the waffle, and overall flavor profile. For a fast casual restaurant, Bruxie is now on my list of favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original. So delicious!!

5d-5k3GUFIK4rJ-6S0Htxw.text: This is the best waffles I've ever had, some very good fried chicken too, great service, food came out very fast, definitely get the Holy Chicken!

PkooixsxQ4WlRrJV2XmdEw.text: Hands down, Some of the best chicken that I have even had. It was so good, the flavor was amazing and the hot sauce was a perfect combo. The waffles fries were also really good. Can't wait to have more and try everything else on the menu. It's located on the outside of the Ny Ny hotel next to the outdoor area of,The Park. You can eat inside or in the outside area of the restaurant or if your hanging out in The Park, you can order and they will bring the food to you. The service was fast and staff were very helpful and friendly. It's a must try!!

CCizha43dbg1fwq2yG7HeQ.text: I had crispy waffle sandwich. The waffles are light and crispy. Add a little syrup to take ur taste buds on a sweet and savory ride!  He had 2 pc chicken with the bacon waffle. He loved it!! This place is a must try!!

GhYsbrySDYqc-njCE5Y_6Q.text: With so many great spots around the orange circle, Bruxie stands out. Ordered a crispy chicken waffle sandwich which was amazing. Also got a Bloody Mary which was nice and strong. A+

QznZF2guBL2Lm1qGgDLERQ.text: Bruxie has a nice spin on the chicken and waffle.  As a newbie it's hard to tell how the waffles come.  I ordered the two piece chicken with the waffles but didn't want the cheddar bacon version.  Instead I had seen a delicious looking rendition with strawberries.  Instead of getting that version I could only get a plain waffle with strawberries on the side.     However all is well with a little syrup and dab of butter.

M5Xe-A3UCfGXwXVmllpMOw.text: First off, portions here are huuuge. The chicken sandwich alone would've been more than enough. I ordered the fries too, which was unnecessary and not very good. It was extremely salty. The sandwich was also salty but it wasn't as ridiculous as the fries. The chicken was very nice and big but I couldn't help but think that it would've tasted better between buns rather than waffles but I guess that's their thing. All in all a good place but if you're not a fan of salty food then you probably wouldn't like this place.

41OadHZcc9D1nFGBYpsgxA.text: We ate here one the first morning in Vegas. So delicious and clean place to eat. Environment is fun and definitely walking distance from the strip. I don't think it is hangover worthy. Waffles were crisp and flavorful and the chicken was super juicy and delicious!! I regret not getting a sweet waffle.

OO85qzXYYf6MLaTOK-fKQg.text: I have never understood the combination of waffles and fried chicken, until a coworker and I stopped here for lunch and were hooked. I got the Nashville chicken and custard and wondered where this has been all my life. It was flavored perfectly and the lemonade was delicious. Customer service was great. I can't wait to go back, thanks for a great time!

oy2vsU9JaGNX9Vkqdfemcg.text: Love! Wish they had a location in SF. Everything on the menu is fantastic. However, although the fried pickles are really good I do wish they weren't cut as thick. Highly recommend for a tasty and quick meal that doesn't leave you feeling gross like McDonald's.

NfOC80hsob_CAvx358u1Lw.text: I have to say I have been here twice and the first time was great. The second time was bad. The first time made to order. Fresh and delicious. The second round of going here they got my order wrong. Ordered the Tennessee hot and I got original and the chicken strips were not made to order. They were old and so disappointing. I want to love this place because of my first experience but if they can't be consistent I can't spend the extra money on something I could have gone to churches or Popeyes for for the 5 bucks!!!

ZJgi9mV6lEp-iuJJiOlLfg.text: Bruxie is like a hybrid cross of a sandwich shop and a chicken and waffles joint...and it works well. It's got a fast food type of ordering style with sit-down dinner food quality. The interior design is unique and inviting. The staff walks around to ensure you have everything you need. The food is delicious!!! The chicken is perfectly fired and juicy and paired with the taco-shaped waffles make an interesting but yummy combo. Try their in house made soda's...so good.

Ldf5wlLe4hzTPjBtBDzhGA.text: Hands down a must visit on the strip! Extraordinary chicken waffles that you'll savor down to the last bite. The chili honey seals the deal.

bdqIRkIbiK7yJPrpabUNvg.text: Do yourself a favor and eat the fried chicken poutine! Seriously so amazing. I could eat here every day for the rest of my life.

iQwHXK0dEUfgHZq2lp0nkQ.text: Wow, so delicious! If I could eat this breakfast, lunch and dinner I would. Great customer service and atmosphere. I'll be going back!   * personal fav -  pesto chicken.  - worth trying to custard if you still have room!

_vN8WFZgMHsr5cqgzwJPTQ.text: YOU WANT TO TRY SOMETHING DIFFERENT?  JUST DO IT!  Okay, never thought I'd be down to try chicken and waffles, but heh, this place makes the combo taste natural.  Kinda like cheese on a burger.  I tried the Holy Chicken and it was delicious.  The hint of maple with the sriracha really worked!  I wanted to try the Nashville Hot, but heard from colleagues it was on the spicy side.  I chickened out.  Next time I won't be so scared, I'm doing it.    Was it a little pricey?  Maybe.  But walk in to a Panda Express on Las Vegas Blvd and your gonna pay more than you do on Mayberry Street.  Totally worth it!

E6aRGT6JoUHtjAFb3izX-g.text: Omg! Waffle and chicken, ok, but egg?!!! It was delicious! My hubby and I enjoyed it!!

OOJXspAbxnz85dqq-mR8zQ.text: I've been to nearly all the locations in SoCal so this wasn't a new experience.. But we found that this location is new!   The staff was patient with the people in front of us, which was nice. For being new, they were extremely knowledgable and kind. After ordering, the tables were self seating, but staff members would walk around and ask if everything was alright or if we needed anything. Which was great. I got the Irish nachos (super amazing) and the classic chicken and waffles (even more amazing). The chicken was good, I just wish they added more coleslaw because I barely had any in my waffle sandwich. Other than that, yum.

rYc3NXybi3AMIuxUOmZYiw.text: Sandwich with waffle bread?! This is a handheld chicken and waffles delight. I had the buffalo bleu and it was delicious. A gem on the Las Vegas strip.

MjyZQWKDzh7QsR6hUAkS4Q.text: So good we went back for another round on our last day! The holy chicken was a great way to fuel up for a day in Vegas. Friendly staff. Waited in line about 20 min. Seemed pretty consistent in the time we were there from about 10:30 on.

Q1MQgNQ6jPQ3fruKP6grJA.text: I go to school in the south, where I've had some of the best chicken and waffles. This place is alright - I got the Nashville-style hot chicken and waffles and found the fried chicken to be unbelievably greasy and the waffles to be bland. I'd give it 3 stars for taste, but bump it up for the awesome location, the fast serving time, and the nice ambience. This place gets crowded but people move in and out pretty quickly.

IoFt2OeksTEf7i9eC3bGqA.text: My mom and I went here after reading the reviews on Yelp. If you are looking for a thick, fluffy, waffle, that is not what you will get here. The waffles are very light and airy and almost too thin for the sandwiches. They broke in half when trying to bend it and eat the entree like a sandwich. I ordered the breakfast sausage sandwich and it was pretty dry. The only thing I liked about it was the sausage and the syrup which were very good. It was okay to try, but I won't be coming back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sandwich on the left is the breakfast sausage sandwich and the one on the right is the classic chicken.

SvyZC8h46is_VVhuVNnzCA.text: Was in Las Vegas for the weekend and was craving for chicken and waffles I was not disappointed. Got the holy chicken and it was amazing. I've also had their original before too and it was just as amazing. Customer service is great, they're right on the strip and prices are great! Highly recommend

zEqLtOhDAZ3AuzdMnZtZnA.text: So good! The waffles are not sweet so it compliments the chicken. It's folded up like a taco so it's easy to eat. Service was good and place was clean. Will come back if I'm going to the T-Mobile Arena.

C7Gc6FvR5_V7P7HJdTSkmg.text: Sooooo yummy. Awesome concept and executed perfectly!! Saying you've had Waffle Sandwich before so no biggie is like saying the DD croissant donut is the same as a Dominique Ansel Cronut. Fast service, didnt have to wait long for my food. Everyone was polite and the facility was clean and not sticky which I imagine is no easy task with a syrup dispenser on site. Wish I had spotted them earlier in my trip! Good portions for the price and excellent brunch food for those of us who had a fun boozy night before and needs some good old hardy food after to soak up some of the day before.

5iMw8e6nqqibkDca3IkuQg.text: Pretty good and reasonable prices. The waffle itself was fried, which made it very light and crunchy. The piece of chicken was of decent size and crispy but not too greasy. The only unfortunate thing was it was hard to eat like a sandwich because the waffle easily broke apart. I'd probably get the chicken tenders instead next time due to more protein. The cane sugar drinks didn't disappoint, but I wished they had the regular sodas instead.

TPTE5sJOt6cezwtDbhwg7A.text: Came here for the 1st time because I read all the reviews and decided to give this place a try with my family in town. Have to say I was not impressed and place is way over rated. The staff got my kids order wrong twice! Told them the 1st time, they retake the order and still brought back the wrong order. After the second time we just said forget It and just had my son eat It because everyone at the table already got their order and was already finished. It was just a basic chicken and waffle sandwich with fries and couldn't get it right! We went around 4o'clock and the place was not even busy but it was quiet dirty. Trash bins was full to the brim. I had the original and it was too messy to eat and waffle was dry. This place is definitely not a come back place for us. There's much better place to dine!

p45Ml7zkkqAuZVZTwfNrnQ.text: By far the best chicken and waffle place I've been to, waffle could be "denser" but it was actually perfect for the sandwich I got. I got the original and the chicken was amazing! It wasn't dry whatsoever and the seasoning was perfection. I also got the creme brulee sweet waffles which were good! A little pricey for my tastes and portion size but still somewhere to try

6zMKIrfGlFX4puq7MnQyJw.text: Delicious poutine...waffle dessert was amazing as well. Will definitely be back soon. The prices were surprisingly reasonable. Tip: this doesnt apply to the Voss water, which was $7.

-TVW_3-IC1ZklNMYuPc-ZQ.text: Was walking out of t-mobile arena and we decided to stop in because the pictures looked good. we tried the creme brulee  , Nutella banana, and lemon cream& berry waffles. My favorite was the creme brulee  and my gf preferred the lemon one. Everything was good and lighter than expected. Perfect for a quick sweet bite. Service was ok maybe a little bit slow

-LNmnXvfLqApXrvUIk5aMA.text: A bit pricey but waffles are good. Chicken was ok. I like the waffle with butter and syrup.

YOFYHi_Q176Z6avV_qmK2w.text: So I have only been here one time since they have opened this location, I've been to the ones in Cali a couple of times.  I really don't like the Bruxies in Cali , but for this location I was pleasantly surprised! For some reason I think it tastes much better than ones in Cali.   I ordered the chicken waffle sandwich with fries.  Im giving this 4 stars because the food was good, although the fries were heavily over salted. The staff was kind of awkward to me.   No one seemed to have real restaurant experience, as they looked to be wandering aimlessly not even looking at what trays needed to be taken or if anyone needed anything.   Then what I thought was funny was they give you number trackers so they know what numbers are sitting where so they can just drop the food off directly to you. But they were like yelling what they had on the trays trying to hope whoever ordered the food heard them and would go table to table "did you order this?" Lol  Would I come here again? Sure, the food is good.

ovrGGB-gMMPdO-8-fOrX0Q.text: Late night post concert deliciousness! So great to have an affordable quick food option so close to the new T-Mobile arena. We had the Nashville and it was sooo good! Pickles, chicken waffle, slaw just the right amount of spice on the chicken and cool from the slaw

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nashville! Huge

Osldi4cB5_PkPimbR_W_Ew.text: Huge pieces of chicken. Loved the Nashville spicy sandwich. One of the best lunch spots on the strip -- and way more affordable than the hotels. Would easily eat here again the next time we're out in Vegas.

DO8w6nIT7hKNsL5ZL9Mtww.text: This specialty restaurant has done a great job with the chicken and waffles niche they are known for!!! Boy was I surprised!!! I'm not a particularly huge fan for chicken and waffles but this place certainly blind sided me! I LOVE LOVE LOVE  breakfast so I had to try the green eggs and ham waffle...Now this one didn't have chicken but it had ham, egg, cheese, and pesto....And of course put into a waffle sandwhich! Wow it was bursting with flavor!!! It was a good portion/size I could almost finish it! As an appetizer we also got the fried pickles wow wow wow! These aren't your little pitiful baby soggy  fried pickles you may get elsewhere. They were huge chunks!!! They exploded in your mouth but be careful they come out pipin hot! Oh and if you aren't in the mood for savory, salty they also have dessert waffles!!!! Next time I come back, because I will be back I am gunna try one of the chicken and dessert sandwiches, not together of course lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders and fries

d7DZ4Om-HWfVwtCzq4CBrw.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and use yelp religiously as a way to pick good spots to eat. They were not wrong on this one! We fell in love with the space and food. I ordered the latest thing on the menu... I forget what it was called but it was a waffle, egg, and bacon. Super delicious. My partner loved his too. The servers were incredibly nice and they had tobacco sauce which we love because we tend to like everything with a little kick. If you're in Las Vegas for a mini vacation, make this one of your stops. You won't regret it. Best brunch I've ever had.

ErqrKDYhSGJx96jCGqxFeg.text: I ordered the arugula sun dried tomatoes with goat cheese waffle sammich and it was the bomb diggity.

GEY8HWgLa89TdlssLyvGNw.text: Over all good,  good concept, chicken is not dry.  I just prefer bone in than boneless for fried chicken.  My son ordered mushroom and cheese sandwich which actually look good.  Will certainly try again.

mNHjR23KJB-okkjngl-QYw.text: Five stars for an awesome menu and they delivered with delicious food! The chicken is a thin piece of breast that is perfectly fried and still very juicy but perfectly crispy on the outside. The slaw was light and not drenched in mayo with a little honey drizzle. Def try this place!
