PraS7a-SLJWTtu83omwuhQ.text: Wow, best buffalo tenders and fried pickles ever. Pickles are thick and coated in cruchy batter. Chicken is thick and real chicken. Don't pass it up.

o3Qv7l6LK-33CQRRuM318w.text: Stopped in here for breakfast while checking out the new Park. I had the lemony fruit version of the waffle sandwich and it was delicious. Super tasty and very refreshing. I will be stopping in again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great breakfast at a good price delicious!

ksUsAigoh1GernEvBaymTQ.text: It's quick and it's easy! The service is excellent, waiters came around to check for refills and the turnover is great. Though it's pretty much order at the counter and sit where you please, I loved how the employees still came around to check how everything is!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Pesto w/ sun dried tomatoes, goat cheese &amp; arugula

NK1ftj6dsi-WkwXuTRnCfg.text: Food was NOT as good as the pics look. I had the Nashville Hot waffle sandwich. I was not impressed at all ! The waffle sandwich scratched the roof of mouth, so after that I was just basically eating the chicken plain .

xSn6ULCrku2gc8sAES_6Kw.text: What a gem of a place. Reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. Ordered a kickin chicken waffle sandwich and it was, how should I say this, Amazeballs!!!!! What a concept, am I right? Come early, as this place starts to get lines out the door after 9am. As Gordon Ramsey would say, that's when you know a place is good. My wife got the country sausage and egg waffle sandwich, which was great as well. She said it could have used a little salt, but overall she loved it. This is a definite must to try, especially if your hungry and just lost a bunch of money on craps, roulette, or whatever else your in too. Have fun in Vegas!!

H2p2HfNyU-jmiOjoT9z2vQ.text: I was excited to try this place. It was very good but not amazing. My husband and I ordered separate things. His was hot and mine was cold but they made it right. Service was okay, also not great. I would give it another try because the concept is great and flavors were bomb.

_QAwnImvVpSZKyUpvS6USw.text: Orange juice was Amazing!!!! Not to mention the holy chicken waffle was out of this WORLD!!!!!

F5uobnsRRSmgZ5ZOHfqY2g.text: Absolutely adored this restaurant and the whole concept!! We love chicken and waffles, and this place takes it one step further and makes a taco out of the waffle!! Absolutely delicious and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H9aQ0DxZLpjreIkwwxKp5g.text: #sandwichgoals #bestsandwichinvegas #hangovercure If there is one sandwich to eat while in Vegas, it should be this one, the Original. The waffle was thin and had the perfect crisp and the fried chicken breast had such glorious crunchy breading drizzled with a honey chili sauce and topped with a slaw.  I'm dreaming of this sandwich right now.     We ordered a side of waffle fries which were not really necessary, as my dreams were already fulfilled by the sandwich.  The homemade strawberry lemonade paired well with the sandwich (I'm acting like it's fine wine).  Plus free refills.    Don't sleep on Bruxie!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original

5-XIeL4xIg2Ks_-9VFFNJw.text: Decided to stop in here for lunch today and we weren't disappointed at all! The food was amazing and staff was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vDygjt6VoKWm0jrfhCJIeQ.text: Came here with my fam because they are big fans of chicken and waffles. Disappointed cause they messed up on our order two times. By the time they fixed my food, my family was already done eating. Mistakes happen but twice in one order come on. Too long of a wait for this place too, if they used 2 cashier's instead of one maybe the line wouldnt be so ridiculously long. Or maybe they just want the illusion of long lines out the door meaning this is a desirable place. But like I said not worth it.

lngi3-6Ikpx-8mBw9En64Q.text: I am not a standard chicken and waffles fan.  From where I came, chicken and waffles did not have fried chicken.  Rather, the chicken was stewed and the meat was added to the gravy made from the stew juice.  I generally avoid chicken and waffles because of that cultural divide.  I read about Bruxie when the Park was being built and I read about their menu.  It's been bookmarked for almost a year now.  Before the Cirque show at the T-Mobile Arena, I decided to give Bruxie a try.  I looked at the menu and ended up ordering the Nashville style hot chicken waffle.  The menu describes the sandwich this way--Spicy & Smoky Fried Chicken Thigh, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Lettuce, Pickles.  I also ordered an iced tea.  I was given a buzzer and told to sit anywhere I wanted.  They'd bring the food to me when it was ready.  I put the buzzer on the table and went to the area where you get napkins, cutlery, and sweetener.  One of the women brought my tea and said I could have a refill if I wanted.  Shortly after, the woman brought me the metal mini-tray with a cardboard in the bottom for liquids.  I cut the waffle in half and then proceeded to enjoy it.  The waffle was soft with just a small amount of crust.  As I was finishing the second part of the sandwich, the waffle had lost all firmness and it just melted into the food.  As long as I was here, I decided to do it all.  I ordered a dessert waffle and it was a toss up between two but I decided on the Nutella and banana.  It was a bit smaller than the sandwich waffle.  The Nutella was spread on the waffle and then sliced banana was added.  This was good.  Bruxie gives you a fast food option in the area that's different.  I enjoyed my food there.  I would recommend they turn the music down about 20 decibels.  It would have been difficult to carry on a conversation with the loudness of the music.  I might come back and try something else here.  I like the concept.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance on the Park.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordering area and kitchen.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buzzer for table.

Z3QKv_NGQcXWfxbaAsRDEg.text: If you come all the way out here and do not eat at Bruxie, you basically wasted a trip!!!! It's cooked to perfection

RVzvAqxwCOKVsaCLQIcLYw.text: First time trying out this place and was in the mood for brunch. Location is very nice and service was good. But I was expecting more variety of menu then just a bunch of waffle sandwiches, they taste good but it was very simple. For the price you're paying I could've found something different and better along the strip for brunch with more variety.

NMTDkxBAXQGZAzIZNEeTHg.text: Good effort!  The Holy Chicken had a spicy bite to it which was a very pleasant surprise. Not fiery hot but good flavor spicy and crunchy. The slaw was a great touch as it compliments it well. The least favorite part was, ironically, the waffle itself. A tad under done and lacking in flavor - maybe the spice from the chicken was overwhelming the taste of the waffle? NO!  I aslo ate half of my wife's waffle, fried egg (cooked to perfection), and sausage. Good egg and sausage flavor complimented by the waffle but again a bit underdone and tasteless. The coffee was quite good as well. The service was meh, with the creamer not being refilled and a lack of forks -- urg.....and a lack of urgency for any of the front end employees willing to rectify it.  So, in parting, good bruch, with the waffles being the weakest part of the offering, but overall still 4/5. For a place on The Strip the price wasnt bad either. It is Vegas baby....

lFy1Oa7P9w-pTS5CWf4rDw.text: Love how this place is super close to the t mobile arena and the food was delicious. My husband and I came here for lunch one day because our friends kept talking about it and it had great reviews on yelp.   We parked in the garage near by and walked along the little area of shops, restaurants, and bars. I thought it was cool how clean it was and how it didn't really make me feel like I was in Vegas.   When we got to the restaurant there was no line so we were able to ask all the questions we wanted to ask. The cashier wasn't rushing us and was very friendly.   We ended up getting the chicken and waffles, chicken sandwich, and Nutella banana (suggestion of the cashier). Everything was delicious. We both loved how tender and juicy the chicken was and the Nutella didn't disappoint.   Overall, the service was great and the food was delicious. Will be coming here in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella banana
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken and waffles

L2sgofgji-AfwDxe1fKcXg.text: Interesting take on breakfast food. They also have lunch items but the waffles seem to be the go to. It is an interesting contrast between the sweet and the salty depending on the selection you make. The food was good though and not just the normal waffle and eggs.

NS5NufdavuPS7TM7AjBGXw.text: I actually saw this place while eating with some friends at Shake Shack. It's a little building tucked away a little past New York New York on the strip.   I ordered the Green Eggs and Ham breakfast sandwich. It was very good. The pesto is has A LOT of basil. I would describe it as tasting earthy because of this. The food came out relatively quickly. My friend and I split the sandwich (which they cut in half for us) and were full. Granted, we'd both already eaten Shake Shack burgers beforehand. Still, I think two could comfortably share an entree here.   The prices are reasonable. They have a lot of seating and were not too crowded. You gotta love the reusable cutlery.   There's one of these where I live and I can't believe it took me coming to Vegas to finally try it. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They use these trackers to know where to deliver your food.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken and waffle fries.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green eggs and ham breakfast sandwich. (Egg, ham, waffle, pesto.)

58wKHcgU2sRodq6XTrnhkw.text: Bruxie was a friend's suggestion - she had found it while doing food research on Yelp for Vegas. It was a relatively close walk to the MGM and very highly rated. We strolled over on our first full day for breakfast/brunch at about 11am. It was pretty full on the inside, but since it was so hot inside, we opted to sit outside instead.   Bruxie specializes in waffles - specifically waffles with chicken (although there are plenty of options without chicken as well). You order at the counter and they bring your food to your table later. I had the Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken Waffle Sandwich, which features fried chicken coated in buffalo sauce and served with crisp vegetable slaw, bleu cheese crumbles, chives, and ranch dressing.   The chicken was very moist and tender on the inside and super crunchy on the outside. Surprisingly, the "structural integrity" (words that get thrown around when you travel with 3 engineers) of the waffle was very strong. You can hold it up and eat it like a real sandwich without it falling apart.   I enjoyed my sandwich, but it's not something that I would go out of my way to have again. The chicken was good and the waffle was good - but I think I would've liked it better separated.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EW3F5m1U3DY-DLgxLcjeRg.text: Outstanding meal. Loved the flavor of the chicken waffle sandwich. Also had the waffle fries which were hot & crispy. Will definitely return.

T9FBReUXplL-f2M_sFOrvw.text: Loved this place so much went twice while we were in Vegas.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are a good amount.  I loved the taste of the waffles.  They were thin with the right amount of crispiness. The strawberry lemonade was delicious!

94AGVWj2VSzSM98q85dThg.text: Decided to go here because I love this chain from back home and figured I have to try it while I'm here as well.  I ordered the crispy chicken waffle sandwich, Southern bbq waffle sandwich, and the original waffle sandwich. Out of the three my favorite was the southern bbq one because it had the most flavor. The chicken was decent and had some crisp to it. What made the dish delicious was bbq sauce and the crispy onion straws. The original sandwich was too bland for me and didn't have an interesting flavor profile. Crispy chicken was also good, but ironically wasn't super crispy lol. The chicken itself was dry, but I think it was more apparent since I didn't get much sauce in this sandwich.  Overall this place was decent. I think I like the location back at home because their sandwich quality is a bit more consistent and cheaper because I'm not paying tourist prices for food. If you do end up going here I'd recommend making your meal or combo or ordering 2 sandwiches if you want to be full. Their portions are not that big and eating one can leave you a bit hungry still.

4qV8Zy5kwLcDgGt86t6iJw.text: Came here during lunch with a few co-workers and this place was a great choice! Of course, I was indecisive on whether or not to get chicken & waffles or a chicken sandwich..but the cashier suggested the 2 mini slider option. This allows you to try a mini version of the chicken & waffle AND a mini version of the chicken sandwich, so I totally opted for that. I'm soooo glad I did because I got the best of both worlds. They were so satisfying and the little bit of syrup I added just topped it off! I cannot get over the fact that they were so miniature and cute, but so savory! Bruxie, you have clearly heightened my love for chicken & waffles. I will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle and the El Jefe sliders
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Iron Wall

bB-DRusp9xIxWlYHyAHUjw.text: I came here because I saw this place on yelp and I love waffles and this was definitely not a disappointment. I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE NOW!!!!! I wanted a bit of everything so I got the Mac and cheese and two mini waffles. It was AMAZING. I recommend this to everyone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dD0j7V0aZ1Tub0ZSE_5PaQ.text: Looking for a quick bit after a rough Vegas night? Bruxie is the place when you're a couple hundred bucks down and looking to maximize your in pocket cash for the tables. Oh, about the actual taste of the food. I had the chicken and waffle sandwich, pretty good, but not much chicken. It's mostly breading.  $14 for a sandwich, which it's grab and go. I'm sure they can afford another 2ozs of chicken.  There are many high ratings, but there is no way this can be a 4 star+ place. It's too basic, although the concept is solid, waffle, chicken, egg and cheese. Yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DSemHNGQN5ftPCaoKpajBg.text: Bruxie violated two of my pet peeves and still gets 4 Stars, so you know I was pretty impressed by the food.  Pet Peeve #1- It's an order at the counter type place. These places always make me feel rushed and uncomfortable. Even though I was the first customer of the day, I felt like I was holding things up, so I just ordered an Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich and a Belgian Mocha.  Pet Peeve #2- Why do restaurants that work so hard to get things Crispy and/or Crunchy put sauces and wet condiments directly on them? It always turns the crispiness and crunchiness to sogginess.  Now onto the food itself. The Original has Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chili Honey and Cider Cole Slaw. The Chicken was perfectly seasoned and the parts that weren't turned soggy by the slaw had a wonderful crunch. The Waffles were the absolute lightest, crispiest, best I've ever had. Again, except for the parts that had contact with the slaw. Even the slaw itself was very good and the Chili Honey added a really nice sweet heat to the sandwich. My Mocha was the best coffee I had this Vegas trip.  Bruxie is wheelchair accessible and the food is fantastic, so I will definitely be back. I'll just order the Cole Slaw on the side!

nk2KJfMoGipdvSYJ4Niqjg.text: Bruxie introduced me to savory waffles in the best way possible! I love how crispy and yet still fluffy their waffles are. My favorite is the mushroom and goat cheese waffle! The classic is also delicious.

oDxCf-Un24QsDJ389cZLWQ.text: We were on our way to see a show on the strip with our visiting grandchildren and stopped at bruxie for a light dinner. The service was a little slow however the food was delicious. We all enjoyed the very crispy waffle and  spicy fried chicken sandwiches. We also split an order of fried pickles which were delicious. If you're looking for something a little different and less expensive on the strip this is The place for You especially if you're going to a hockey game.

RWwlVYhiOijghDycKqfXCQ.text: I am not a fan of chicken and waffles but I really enjoyed this meal!  I ordered the kickin chicken with Mac and cheese. I ate most of the sandwich without syrup but then when I finished the chicken I ate the waffle with syrup and it was good.  Good fried chicken, good waffle, good lemonade, decent Mac and cheese!

OSNshMxuwuCXF7MYagh-_w.text: Loved the food. Great little restaurant locates right off the strip. Food was great and loved the taste of the chicken. Food was fresh and delicious. Great place to eat if your in the mood for a quick bite.

Vvjr-yOVoVuJExkv9Of7oQ.text: The food is good, and I love the concept. Only thing is, my waffle was barely crispy/toasted. Toasting it longer would have set the sandwich OFF.  Waffle fries are bomb.

aBfmQX2u8SCxq0AfbTWzKw.text: The tastiest, crispiest, most delicious waffle I have ever had. I like to get their naked waffle with cinnamon sugar which is just a basic waffle served with butter and syrup. Their sandwiches are great too. They put a really great spin on chicken and waffles.

tcNBzCyGkeNx990dc_2IUw.text: Have you ever wanted epic food coma while in Vegas? Yes, you do. It IS Vegas after all.  Yes, there are buffets. Or you can come here for carb overload amazingness. There are other locations in SoCal, but this is a convenient option at The Park, where there is a variety restaurants and bars by the new stadium.  Since this is the home of the original **Chicken Waffle Sandwich**, someone had to order it. It's exactly what you're imagining, except way more massive. The waffle is super thick and the chicken has a nice crisp breading.  We also shared the **Poutine Waffle Fries.** Good lord, the portion was way huger than we expected. We thought it would be a small appetizer size. Nope. The delicious waffle fries are topped with cheese curds and pieces of fried chicken (yes, more fried chicken).   However appetizing that sounds, I enjoyed the dish Frau C. and I shared the most. The **Original Chicken & Waffle Skillet** arrived and I couldn't stop drooling. It's surprising I was even able to get a photo of it before devouring it! The chicken is breaded in a super thin crispy batter, the waffle infused with cheddar and bacon, and the whole thing completely doused in maple syrup. To die for! I literally think I died a little bit eating this.  TIP: Food coma will immediately commence, so be prepared. Maybe bring your pillow so you can take a nap! (Okay, probably not.)  DATE TIP: Nap time!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Chicken &amp; Waffle Skillet covered in maple syrup. Waffle is bacon-cheddar infused.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poutine &amp; Chicken Waffle Fries.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Waffle Sandwich.

6jLhG5mjeZzbvEqqDfSk2Q.text: So I was super excited to try this place given how well it was rated on yelp. It's super casual, and we were able to order within 10 minutes or so of standing in line. However, it took FIFTY minutes for the food to get to our table. The table next us to us and my fiance went to check on our food multiple times-what a crazy wait once the order has been put in!   Now the food- Nashville chicken and waffle - the fiance and I split this and I'm glad we did. It tasted amazing but it was REALLY greasy, I definitely wouldn't have been able to eat the entire thing. Nutella and banana waffle. OMG I would return for this but it's not worth a 50 minute wait... Lemon cream and berries waffle-way too tart and the lemon cream was not good Strawberry lemonade- a good choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FrFqxvXMrOuahPueiAlSzQ.text: So good! Crowded, but worth standing in line and waiting for! We have been to several locations, and all are fabulous.

5ufbE_0DNqmopaiISUIgtA.text: I got the Holy Chicken and it was delicious. Terribly messy though! Wife got the naked waffles and she loved them. They were the perfect crispy amount.  I also got the hot chocolate- perfect temp but no flavor whatsoever.

eiR8p9LTV-k2zYOmKk2S3A.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant walking the strip looking for a breakfast spot and OMG so happy we found this place! Luckily there was no line when we got there (went around 9:30 am) so we were able to order right away, no wait.  The sandwich was delish with lots of favors in each bite.  The Angry Mac n Cheese was amazing too, the buffalo sauce on it wasn't too over powering. Definitely would recommend and when I'm back in Vegas again will for sure come back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bmj-9IpTxoYxwINzVPxHdw.text: My friends and I went searching for a breakfast place that wasn't a buffet and really loved this place! The price is great and portion is perfect! It felt a bit like a fast food chain walking in because of the order up front and is serve/seat yourself, but the food was so good and definitely made to order! The staff was awesome and attentive.   We went on a Saturday morning and it was definitely busy and line was just about out the door. However, the wait to order, get your food and seating for 4 of us didn't take long enough for us to notice. Definitely worth the try if you want to skip the buffets.

71AOAB6OKZbcZC912_IU4g.text: The chicken waffle was wonderful!!! This is the best ever. Don't be scared by the long queue, the line runs fast and it's worth the wait. I had the original chicken waffle. The waffle was super thin and crispy! The chicken was huge, crispy, and well seasoned, a bit swear. I would recommend you try it first before adding syrup, I believe it goes well without additional syrup. I also tried the holy chicken waffle, it wasn't that spicy, but got a stronger flavor than the original, still good by all means!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The holy chicken waffle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original chicken waffle

-C302ii1t4_4UOxgwDiKww.text: I order the two piece fried chicken with a bacon-cheddar Waffle.  The service was quick and didn't have to wait too long for the food.  That's only good thing I can say about this meal. The chicken was fried so hard it was hard to eat. The fact that skin came right off as I was cutting it, although annoying, ended up being a good thing. The season of the skin was too salty with a slight spicy flavor. I finally scrapped the skin off. The bacon-cheddar was as gross as it sounded. Plus it was overly sweet as well. I would not recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross food all around.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is ridiculous.
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I order fried chicken not skinless.

g2bBF6T0QG7g1mWfztqByg.text: Great waffles, the wife had the buttermilk chicken salad and it held its own also.  The chicken is a bit too deep fried for me, but the overall experience was good. This was a good option compared to the high priced foods the local nearby hotels.

NB8yqp6Or8dK14okkHhg0g.text: Absolutely fantastic! Do expect to wait a bit, there was no line and we still waited about 15 minutes or more for food. However, I did not see this as a problem because they are clearly making food to order. We thoroughly enjoyed the Holy Chicken with  bacon, fried chicken, sriracha mayo, and fried egg. Everything melded perfectly together with the crispy waffle! Will definitely be headed back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken!

3UQYYGjE48SkuHKZ4YRL9w.text: My husband and I tried this place right after a Justin Timberlake concert this past Saturday night. It was amazing! My husband got the Holy Chicken and he loved it. I got the Angry Mac and Cheese (w/o bacon) and I asked for a side of their Chili Honey to taste- it was delicious. We will definitely be going back.

sYUBLPwlj06m0v0fEbLDXw.text: The chicken is so juicy !!   Even though its fried chicken it's not to oily.. it's yummy  And the waffles amazing with a hint is chives and with pearl sugar.  I can't wait to go back !!!

gFX9K-XxCjduuaYMubZ7Vg.text: Nashville Hot Chicken Waffle is the BEST! Better than the original if you like a little kick. You must order some Chicken Poutine fries too! Must have in Vegas, a must have!

8Zsc_oSrIfTczBRGV2qplw.text: I got the chicken tenders and the waffle sandwich with berries and lemon cream. Both were delicious, the chicken tenders were especially juicy and tender. The price was pretty good and very affordable for Vegas. Customer service was great.

dJU3tGlPziABtINdiPor9w.text: The food was what you expect if you have eaten at Bruxie before but what made this experience excellent was Andre. This young man was everywhere making sure that everything was to the customer's liking. This guy hustled. We even asked him if he was the owner because that was how much he cared that we were happy. So nice to see an employee who takes such pride in his work. Thank you Andre!

qipMpoIzpDCC9nyCKidFxg.text: I went there last week and it wasn't even busy. But the food took forever to come. All I saw was the staff walking slowly back and forth in the kitchen doing nothing. Finally when the food came, my disappointment grew even further. I ordered the chicken waffle. The chicken was thin, dry, and small, and it didn't even looked fried at all, just one piece of chicken, brown on the outside (no batter) with barely any seasoning. The waffle was weirdly crunchy but had no taste at all.

JGr9BHVTlOMa0rmuL_euwg.text: New favourite place to eat on the strip hands down no questions. I only wish it was open for more hours! Really affordable as well, surprised it got two dollar signs instead of one.

tx_N2YpkXUgyv-mtllU6fw.text: The cure for your Las Vegas hangover. Tasty fried chicken and crunchy waffles. Breakfast sandwiches are delicious. Customer service from Dre was great. Very attentive and welcoming.

m5pNiF3AHV-scOX-QPaRJw.text: Everything I read was True. This is a great place to eat at a reasonable price. Coffee was strong and smooth. Sandwich was just right. Wish there was there was one located by me.

ONd0lgMHwzdlhiYQQkdTBg.text: Restaurant looks great as you walk in. The line can get a bit long and that's probably because the food has a one of a kind delicious taste. Cashier was very friendly and helpful when we asked about some of the items on the menu. Not too pricey. Now the reason I'm giving it 3 stars is as we were eating, my wife noticed the kitchen has a window on the side wall where you can pretty much peek in as see the cooks preparing the food. At first sight, the room looks clean and well organized except for 2 things. One, the cook was not wearing a hair cover or net and 2, we were surprised to see flies in the room. Yes flies. My stomach turned a bit but like I said the food is very delicious. So, if I ever go again I think I'll check the cooks room first before ordering.

DIwr8FbrZZg88CwV8hXqnQ.text: Went there 3x during a 4 day stay last week. Our new go-to place for lunch and breakfast. Hubby and I split the Nashville hot chicken and waffle skillet for a late lunch. Was good. Hot but not too powerful. It was just half of a Belgian waffle and 3-4 tenders. I could've definitely ate it all myself but we didn't want too much to eat since it was late afternoon and we had dinner reservations at 7. Went for breakfast twice and had the country sausage and egg sandwich one day. Was very good. Then we went back on our last day before the airport and I had the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. Good size piece of chicken and very tender and moist. Prices are very reasonable for the size portions you get. Wish there were some in the Midwest!

bWwHrseCG34JLpCrT9pp0Q.text: Absolutely delicious!!! We ordered the original chicken & waffle sandwich and it was to die for!

zUELL_5wT2IrIv4-ggeqVw.text: delicious food and great service!! i would totally recommend this to anyone coming to vegas

qT5IwWne2Y8jTZeJRgIJhg.text: Food is good but could not wait to get out of this place. The music is obscenely loud.  And what kind of person designs a place to have lighting fixtures dangling right in front of televisions.

hO9hW70a8eruWPtTLXQjeg.text: The first problem with the service. As we arrived the line was slightly out the door. Not a big deal it's a new place definitely okay with that. The problem I seen was they had an employee asking customers if they have any questions about the menu. My opinion is it's mostly Chicken and Waffles so I don't think they'll  be too many questions. But that is the problem she could be helping the girls at the register because they were going pretty slow. My party ordered two meals. One was the Nashville it seemed pretty greasy at the bottom and soaked up the cardboard waffle holder. Not sure it's supposed to be like that but it wasn't very appetizing to look at. Second meal the Carolina BBQ pulled pork I liked it but the pork was cold. We liked the waffle fries. We decided to share the side Caesar salad, it's served in a paper soup cup size. That item was the worst item that we had. the salad was a little old showing rust throughout almost every piece. The parmesan cheese that was on it, was old tough to bite into and turning colors. The dressing was not bad and they don't put croutons in that salad. All in all the waffles are tasty but but they should be that's what you're going for it's just the idiosyncrasy of the other items on their menu.

nJizUq1TyPSed3RV9VhnuQ.text: Great location in The Park to serve future hockey fans visiting the arena. The concept of serving mainly chicken and waffle sandwiches is unique and well executed. Service with a smile and very fast turn times on the food. The buffalo bleu and chicken waffle sandwich might be the best thing I've ever tasted. Will be back again soon!

jPqszXxOIm3nsBE3bL-xXg.text: I loved it so much I ate 5 sandwiches. Makes me hungry just thinking about it. Really great place and a solid price.

rMqF7vyk6ogJXo8o4pVxtQ.text: Bruxie - gourmet waffles and more...The first time ever stepping in to a Bruxie was in Vegas! The line was out the door, but it moved quickly and the variety of music playing, made the time pass pleasurable. I was with a group of 5. We ordered: 2 chicken tenders with fries, chicken cobb salad, chicken ceasar salad, bacon and egg waffle, and lemon and berries sweet waffle. I enjoyed the chicken tenders and waffle cut fries. But the lemon and berries sweet waffle took the cake for me! It was amazing! Highly recommend! The service was also above else! Thank you Bruxie!

remsT3pp8wAg5Kvz_xUGYQ.text: Ordered the original chicken and waffles for my boyfriend and the Nashville chicken and waffles for myself. The waffles are crispy and not fluffy, but it's a nice change. The original chicken and waffles were better in both our opinions. Got strawberry lemonade. Keep in mind, you're not to serve yourself the strawberry lemonade!!! My mistake. The chicken was perfectly cooked in both. The fries that we added were perfect. The best fries in a while. Nice atmosphere. There's a huge fan in the dining area which kept the room cool during the hot summer.

gViMtvk171tRgvSyuMPglg.text: The best breakfast you could ask for in Las Vegas!!! I had the country sausage egg with avocado waffle and hubby had prosciutto and arugula waffle, wrapping it up with lemon berry sweet waffle! breakfast heaven coupled with fantastic weather! will come back and bring our friends!!!

bJL0BJ77dXFCl9JdBZCvFQ.text: Great place to try. I was in Vegas for 2 nights and ate at Bruxies both days. Their Chicken Strips are delicious along with their Turkey Club sandwich. Strawberry lemonade is good as well. And their staff is AMAZING! Very friendly and informative if you need some help picking out something from their menu. Will definitely try them again on my next visit.

do9K-NmYmDksrKRdEpCdqg.text: I'm visiting Vegas this weekend and like any good type A personality I like to plan my trip to a 'T.' This means I do my due diligence when it comes to where I'm going to eat, and I do a lot of menu reading and review scouting. Bruxie had some pretty solid reviews so it was on the agenda for yesterday (Saturday). Nice crowd, no wait for a table, really clean and open restaurant. I ordered the Holy Chicken. Waffle with cheddar, fried chicken, bacon, and over easy egg. I told them to hold the Sriracha. They also gave a generous pour of a thin maple syrup over the whole thing. Best ever. I loved the thin crispy waffle; it was just enough so as not to overpower everything else that was going on with the meal. The chicken itself was cooked and seasoned PERFECTLY. Waffle fries were nice and fresh, and the strawberry lemonade Palmer was very refreshing. 10/10 will always visit this place when I'm in Vegas.

EsAfv-CS0fz90uRXITUoRg.text: The original waffle chicken sandwich was  excellent, I got the raspberry lemon cream waffle. Took two bites, and decided to pass, totally not my cup of tea.. One of the server notice I didn't touch my dessert. I had told him I didn't like and that he can toss it. He offered to let me pick something else, which I kind of didn't want to. But he insisted and recommend the banana Nutella, he definitely made my experience better!! Thankyou!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original with raspberry lemon cream waffle

EO0yd5x7jDKSIFXUW4QTRQ.text: The food was tasty. The wait was longer than I expected, but everything seemed fresh and we were not in a hurry so I didn't mind the wait too much. I like the different concepts. I had a waffle with goat cheese, sundried tomatoes, and arugula! SO GOOD! I appreciate having a different concept of food in Vegas. I get sick of the same old steak or fast food   The ambiance is nice - modern, however, It was super cold in there and the heat did not seem to be on so our waffles cooled off pretty quick.

nRdkvmlXIatVE4wllNJwLw.text: Great little breakfast spot specializing in chicken and waffle sandwiches on the side of NYNY right off the strip. The ordering is setup so you order from a counter and wait at your table with a number. Our food took significantly longer than expected to show up but it was well worth it. The chicken was fried to perfection and super flavorful. The waffles were sturdy enough to create a well made sandwich and had a nice crunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GJZJAr5Z-OhrKWhPZICjVg.text: Yes, this place is pretty darn good. I'm not going to lie, this place is fun to visit and has good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BLtZU2mE78zD1O5g7y_YIQ.text: Awesome chicken and waffles. The syrup is really good. It's a must try. Only thing I don't like is no table service.

tpfmsrC9CkKVWvGIwy31Zg.text: How in the world did this place get it's rating???  OK for those who were fooled like we were, they do not serve actual pieces of chicken!   They pound their white meat chicken into what they call chicken tenders (aka a big fat piece of chicken filet pattie) and they make it look like pieces of actual fried chicken.  This place sucked!

F7UkY0WD2bTJ7F6DladZfw.text: The best chicken and waffles!!!! I'm from LA and have had Roscoes...this is so much better. And the buffalo chicken tenders are amazing as well!!  Also try the strawberry lemonade...it's phenomenal

60TDv-HzI49ibkSCVjSUYg.text: Went with a group of 5 and we all enjoyed our meal. The waffle is delish. I had the chicken waffle sandwich. Service was so fast and the price is right for Vegas. Chicken was tender and sauce was perfect. Staff were friendly and they got our entire order right. I had the cross track fries with my combo and they were crispy and tasty. Highly recommend.

h8e_1Gfz8R2U2geQdhoOgA.text: My wife and I came here after some walking around the new T Mobile Arena. We had the following:  Original Buttermilk Chicken Waffle Sandwich Combo  Turkey Pesto Waffle Sandwich Combo  I got waffle fries for my combo while my wife got tomato basil soup. Everything tasted great! I loved eating my sandwich..taking turns dipping it in sriracha and then maple syrup. The waffle was very crispy and light while the chicken was very moist and seasoned well. My wife said her sandwich and soup was great too. I thought the ambience was great with its open air atmosphere.

netodKX5PjAD0o0qNnlNzQ.text: this restaurant is fantastic! The portions are absolutely perfect and everything tastes great! I got the Holy Chicken Sandwich and I was so excited to eat it I didn't snap a picture before! Perfect amount of food before our day trip to the Red Rock Canyon. Definitely recommend this place for breakfast/brunch!

im-I_gT43yUJFchCIaJuMw.text: Oh my god waffles. Waffle this, waffle that, fried chicken in the best of ways. Their fried chicken and waffle is the best I've ever had. I just can't speak well enough about this place. I came with my girlfriend and we both ordered two entrees because we were so excited and they were so affordable. So good.

ERZd0S4kbjDCEFECxIHQcg.text: This is my first time trying Bruxie. When my bf and I walked in, there was a line, but it went along quickly. There were so many options to choose from and the employees display great customer service! I love how the workers walk around each table from time to time to see if everything is ok. They even take your cup and refill it for you ! My BF and I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Total for everything was around $30
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Meal from Bruxie

UECGFhsI-6SbrusfKX_tuQ.text: This place is okay, nothing different. The employees are really friendly and welcoming. The only down side is the chicken was super salty it almost made me throw up.

bybUllBCJlkye61KEHouLQ.text: Cheerful, friendly greetings by all, a brief, enticing explanation of the menu items, smiles and aromas! Seriously, great, attentive service-even as we walked out the door. The waffle wow light toasty and crispy without being heavy. Ordered the Original chicken and waffle, that kick of honey, oh man! very pleased but I will ask for extra slaw and jalapenos if they have it from now on! My daughter had the creme brule waffle with whipped creme n strawberries, Awesome! Lemonade has that perfect balance of tart, fruity sweetnes and refillable. Everyone was very nice, helpful. A !

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey, hot sauce, chicken slaw &#39;n waffle oh my!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie Las Vegas! Creme Brulee

jx9XeKfctt4Rpoww_egg5w.text: Came here for brunch and went for the original chicken and waffle sandwich with waffle fries and their own diet cola.  Line up at the counter to order and they'll bring your food to you.  Everything was brand new.  The dining room was very casual and featured pounding dance music.  By the time I got my sandwich, the cole slaw had pretty much dripped off the chicken and on to the tray.  The syrup wasn't maple, and it had a sweet and very slight hot kick to it.  I must say that the waffle sandwich was pretty tasty.  The fries were good.  The original diet cola wasn't all that tasty.  You can also get a serving of fruit as a side and that was very tasty.    The guy working the dining room was constantly going from table to table asking if we needed anything and getting it for us.  More soda, forks, knives, napkins?  No problem.  He was constantly in motion and gave us the best service we had on this Vegas trip.

e31wUaLY1DyHxSApiAVesA.text: Awesome!!  We are in Vegas every year for business but just stumbled on this place while in Vegas for a short vacation. I ordered the salad with chicken and mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes and it was one of the best salads I've ever had!  Everyone else ordered the chicken waffle sandwiches and they loved them!!  Even the coffee was great :))

U3zZcMYoFfm0vIRUz4lEEg.text: Holy waffle sandwich.  Or something like that.  Place is awesome.  Waffles are light and airy.

FBGvWKoVf3cXm_KxkmyZkA.text: I was not at all impressed with the food. Most of the food on the strip is bland, ok at best. I had the chicken and waffles and I wasn't happy with it at all. No flavor and the chicken was fries too hard. Nice staff tho.

VsHDonngdZnmYIKuiygHHg.text: I came here a couple of days ago with pure excitement, but left disappointed.   From the moment I walked in I was kindly greeted by the employees, but they seemed more interested in their conversation talking about the tips they made in the day than in taking my order. Once I ordered and got my hamburger waffle I was disappointed with the fact that the waffle was soggy/tasteless and the fact that I got no bacon after I paid $1.50 for it. The waffle wasn't even cooked all the way and immediately broke down with the first bite I gave it. Waffles aren't supposed to easily break if they are cooked or prepared right. The only thing I cannot complain about it the delicious meat they put on this meal.  I could say that one day I'll come back and give Bruxie another chance, but I'd be lying.

_GE9UubLq_f0lMOKqqyctQ.text: The best chicken ever! If you want a taste explosion in your mouth this is the place! Great quality food in a great atmosphere ., come get some!!

v9e17FYAvbxgOiWgUJ5W8Q.text: First time in vegas and found this place because of yelp, the reviews were at almost 5 stars. Right on the money, the servuce was fast (as fast as they could be, they were super busy) the staff was very helpful, andre made sure our table was not cluttered and even refilled my drink for me. Excellent service, exceeded my expectations and the food was amazing (sausage eg and cheese waffle with avocado was on fire!) Will definetly come back

bNK08lNKdPS6w6qt_c50KA.text: Friendly staff good music playing but they did take a bit long to make my food and it was kind of dead kind of expensive too but overall it was aight

TMAhCcncy7BrOBFNB3grmg.text: Walking by and just happened to glance over and wasn't going to wait in line, but the staff assured me it would be quick and it was. I don't know how it's possible to whip something as delicious as my "Green eggs and Ham" in such a timely fashion. I absolutely loved my meal and I will defiantly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e-x9PcKqqPIKKKSApUbVgw.text: Everyone here is so kind!! From the guy outside to everyone inside. Actually sitting here right now lol felt compelled to write about them so I don't forget. Service like this deserves to be recognized. You can tell everyone is happy to work here. The food is tasty and the strawberry lemonade is life!! (Lol) thank you guys!

OQamlSzFHsmjTOXxv-lgbQ.text: The hot chicken is so good and the waffle fries are just as good. Only complaint is the beverage option

A-NQNtFuzoqRLkj1HCVL4A.text: Tasty and crispy waffles! The food is pretty good and the service is excellent. Good, quick and relatively cheap eat on the strip.  Try the legit strawberry lemonade. Free refills!

tE_5CSgrn0KeXF8KDlW7oQ.text: Was around the area with my wife. Decided to go in late night. Wasn't busy at all. Unfortunately we weren't greeted, and the layout is a little weird, so since we didn't see a cashier we had no idea what to do. After 2 min. Someone asked if we where ready, we said yes! But he couldn't help us, he called for someone from the back to come out. After we ordered. Things got slightly better. Cheese fries are good. Mac and cheese was eh. Average. My wife got the chicken and cheese potato skins, and she left half. I would definitely be back to explore better options on this lengthy menu.

fcpmeUro3ufskbM18kO8zA.text: Bruxie no joke is giving Roscoe's a run for their money. If you into chicken and Waffle combos this place is the spot! I tried the original chicken and waffle combo with the irish nachos and caught a food coma...It was that good..Waffles were crispy and light just like I like em, and the chicken was flavored well..Real cream soda to top off the meal had me super satisfied..I would recommend this place to anyone looking to try a alternative to Roscoes

H-2QeP4XF24YoCAxP23frg.text: The employees were very sweet and checked in on our meals often. We ordered a whole bunch of food because we wanted to try everything. The fried chicken poutine was amazing!! But it was a lot with the sandwich I got so I was unable to finish it because it was very rich. It's tough to choose whether you want something sweet or savory so we got both. Although we were unable to finish our food, all of it still tasted great later that night when we enjoyed the leftovers. Loved it!

IUrjTepICbr9pFdrnZHN9w.text: Incredible! The best chicken and waffles ever! Service was excellent as well! Thanks Guys! Will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tt2lB8T9HUi4t1Q2pmJ_Q.text: First stop we chose on our first day in Vegas! I ordered the Nashville Hot and my boyfriend ordered the BBQ waffle sandwich. The cashier was very friendly in recommending options to us, and there are free refills on drinks! FYI STRAWBERRY LEMONADE! My boyfriend went for the Arnold palmer and had instant regrets about not getting the lemonade but you can switch them out. Food took a little bit to come, but there are constantly people checking on you and asking to refill your drinks. I was disappointed with my sandwich as I'm all for spicy (which given the name I was told it was going to be) but it was far from anything hot. Halfway through our sandwiches, the flavor for both of us got boring and bland which we ended up not finishing. The BBQ sandwich was packed with sweet BBQ flavor and I kind of wished I got that one instead. The waffle fries ended up getting hard as we finished and by the end of it we didn't even finish those either. For the price and it being in Vegas, pretty average for us. We would really come back only to try the original sandwich.

gnCV6HNtT1meABLoZBwDGg.text: This is my first time having Chicken and Waffles. What a treat! The place was clean and well ran. Service was great. There's a service person there by the name Andre. He made me and others feel welcomed. Keep this person here, it would serve this company well. Everything was good!

rCCvwkvPNPJdravZyxAvOg.text: Amazing, amazing place! The Nashville chicken and waffle in a cute skillet was heaven! It came with a perfect, not too salty pickle too. The service is incredible as well! Very kind, attentive staff. Also, they play a lot of Cure, which is awesome.

wW2IeoUMnzaz7KqoJ3RMbg.text: Bruxie was excellent! The food and service were so good it motivated me to write my first Yelp review (after using Yelp frequently for 3 years.)  I had a bacon egg cheddar breakfast sandwich and my husband had a pastrami and Swiss sandwich. He really liked his too. The cashier answered my menu questions with patience and kindness. Our food and drinks were brought to our table and removed as we finished by friendly staff. Even brought me a free refill on my soda. Highly recommend. Wish we had a Bruxie near us in Chicago.

PEenkyFhsoqAw1Xnox628w.text: This was a surprising change of pace from  the Vegas food scene. Not ridiculously foofoo and accordingly expensive but also not a fast food joint. The original chicken and waffle sandwich was well seasoned and perfectly cooked though as is often the case with chicken and waffles, it was dry and the waffle itself could've been better. Overall impression: would go again.

7NfQ3qmiJ2NWoZIiFzXmhg.text: love this place i will go here every time i go to vegas ( wish y'all would open one up in the bay area ) the chicken is amazing and the waffle with the bacon and sugar stuff in it is to die for

t7nLmMovA6oCVmBi5cFMdg.text: Definitely not worth the money!  Waffles were soggy and chicken was too crisp with no flavor ... disappointed!

huGbCFOiIvxXz5ULTEbv1w.text: Great food and amazing service!! Highly recommend this place for brunch. The chicken was nice and crisp and the waffles were amazing.

ygKiXqtxwx5BhxLRArBPQA.text: My first time and I just learned there is one in Santa Monica.  There was a line but the wait was not to bad. I got to try the Buffalo chicken tenders and were very tender inside and slight crispy on the outside. I also took a bite of my boyfriend's original chicken waffle which was awesome!! Add some hot sauce and you'll be good! And we both shared the creme Brule waffle which was perfect not too sweet but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. I will definitely be visiting the Santa Monica location

F8LcZiNgbECMOZEtz818Mg.text: Wow! This place is Amazing..my first time here. Great service great food. We will be back  thanks Nicholas and Arlesia for your help.

ruy6t4DpL06gTN8tmCPqMQ.text: I like it!  They like it!  We like it!  The waffles are perfect!  The chicken breast are fried perfectly.    The sandwiches with the waffles are the perfect touch.  If you come to Vegas, try this!  Here's a tip.  Some entrees are served with boneless thighs.  You can just ask for a boneless breast with no extra charge.

5t2vjEYZF2_UiX0YU4Kbuw.text: Top 3 places for chicken and waffles for me . HANDS DOWN !!! The first time here I ordered the Holy Chicken and it was soooooo yummy . I ordered the egg on the side. The waffle was so crispy and the flavor of the chicken soaked in the maple was heavenly. The second time I came I got the El HEFE and that was also AMAZING ! We also ordered the Angry Mac and cheese and I couldn't help but eat it ALL . Soooooo good ! This place keeps getting better. Definitely consider this place if you're looking for something fast and good on the strip .

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RwZhNIsFfxsKjXfYQe1ipA.text: Definitely the hype it deserves the chicken is boneless and has this nice crunchy, soft seasoned breading.  It comes with a side of syrup but they have more on the side if you need more. The waffle has this crisp outside and a soft inside.  Then then sides have different options and you can get a desert slider which is waffle sandwich with banana, cream cheese and Nutella.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

0871lRPOAgBlUfwY5gaesQ.text: I personally thought the waffle could be crispier.  The fries were a-ok, nothing mind-blowing about it.  However, the flavors of our breakfast waffle sandwich was what a breakfast meal should taste like! You got the crispiness and saltiness from the bacon and the sweet flavors of lightly drizzled syrup all in one plate, nothing could be more perfect!   Also, the location is easy to find and located in a nice developing area near the T-Mobile Arena with a nice manicured public plaza and shaded outdoor seating.

L_gdGyxcmwAd0Hh3-Qb97Q.text: Always great, my family enjoy the ambiance and food. And their customer drinks are great.

9qRw1q2ZVctIK8-qscNiSw.text: Hands down best hangover food, ever.  I was on the verge of throwing up after a looooong night out in Vegas and I was able to scarf this down.  Its that good.  Not good for you, but scrumptious.   HOLY CHICKEN! waffle sandwich.  Maple glazed chicken, applewood smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, Sriracha sauce, Sunny-side up Egg.  It was more of knife and fork situation that a sandwich but it was bomb.  One waffle had baked on melted cheddar.  The bacon was crispy and salty.  The maple glaze on the chicken with the made the it taste like breakfast. The sunny-side up egg oozing its goodness all over errythang made this dish.    I couldn't resist the angry mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese was made with a creamy bechamel cheese sauce rather than just melted cheese.  Then to add a kick they threw in bacon and buffalo hot sauce.    The atmosphere had a modern/hipster vibe going on.  They were busy but cranked through the orders.  We only had to wait 15 min tops to get our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry Mac and cheese (buffalo spiced with bacon)
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry Mac and cheese (buffalo spiced with bacon)
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken! Sandwich. Maple chicken, apple wood smoke bacon, cheddar, Sriracha sauce, sunny side up egg

5TQLPJgYBFXhnSa7xNfizw.text: The only reason I venture to this location is because Huntington Beach and Orange, CA aren't around the corner like when I lived in OC. So I will settle for the one located at the Park. It is convenitnelty located by the CPK, Sake Rok and the famous TMobile Arena is within walking distance. It is the perfect spot to visit after a Golden Knights game. I love to come here on Wednesday's as they have $5 specials if you sign up for their email program.   I love the original chicken and waffle, I usually sub out the coleslaw but if I forget it doesn't make a big difference to the meal but I prefer not to have it.   They have some amazing waffle fries that accompany the meal nicely. If you're daring, they also have Irish nachos with is like loaded with all sorts of yummy goodness!   They have a nice selection of craft sodas and a killer strawberry lemonade. I find myself getting like 3 refills before my plate is finished.   If you're looking for a bangin' deal and a bangin' meal, I will see you here on Wednesday's!

qpT2ZC_VSbpWDz91zdg0Tw.text: Best find in the Vegas area. Affordable prices, amazing food that's unique compared to the usual brunch spot. We tried the breakfast sandwiches and a milkshake and were very satisfied. Would've loved to try lunch selections. Definitely our first stop on our next visit to Vegas

1Ctz9lR17e9t1wrtryAw8Q.text: Perfect heart clogger of a meal. I got the meal and of course being a waffle place they had waffle fries. The sandwich was messiness with no respectable way to eat it.... but it was deliciousness. Egg done perfectly. Buttery waffle. Great fried chicken with plenty of crunch and seasoning. Fries were tasty too!

E44xJtfgszvjy6SMIRsHcA.text: Waffle egg sandwich? Say no more! The waffle, fried egg, bacon and syrup is the perfect combination. This place gets busy, so get there early!

2G6Mmjf4_l0RNbSd7gqxGw.text: Bruxie has some delicious Chicken and Waffles.   It's more of a fast food style place.  We tried 2 different waffle sandwiches, both were awesome.  The Original is delicious, chicken with coleslaw and chili honey, a great choice.  I tried the Holy Chicken, maple chicken, bacon, cheese, sriracha, and an egg , my kind of sandwich.  They have some beers and other beverage options here.  It's kinda pricey for a fast food style place, but it's Vegas and it's delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruxie
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Holy Chicken!

b5p55wrg07Yztm5DkicsNw.text: Last stop before catching a flight back home and was craving some chicken and waffles.   Ordered 'The Original' chicken and waffle sandwich, Mac & Cheese, and a side of fries  -the original: great flavor!! Crispy chicken, nicely cooked waffles, with some syrup   -Mac & Cheese: it was okay, the buffalo sauce flavor was a little weird imo, but their portion were generous  -crisscross fries were a nice balance with everything else  Would choose this chicken and waffles spot over roscoes ANY. DAY!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTx1rbqPPcEzGy3XjFkJUQ.text: Great spot!! We lucked out- no line! When I called on the phone to inquire about children's menu options they were so very nice and helpful. In person, the gal taking our order was also a friendly and knowledgeable employee and had great recommendations. I ended up going with a sweet entree, Nutella waffle, and the hubby got a savory option with the holy chicken and waffles. I also got the strawberry mimosa - I loved that they give you the mini bottle of champagne with a healthy serving of juice. Definitely recommend trying it!

tH0ZrdeYLDzdIedqpGEcCA.text: On the strip, good sandwiches, long lines in the morning during breakfast hours.  If you are looking for a sit down meal this isn't it.  Order off the menu and they bring you your food...it's quick but extremely overpriced.

7XIwpGW6rWt8HPqpIFkmRw.text: Chicken and Waffles done right. The line can be a tad long, but if you want some good brunch food to start your day this is the place.

Z58JM0AUmc-3-xwAtscXcw.text: The fried chicken was seasoned perfectly. The waffles lived short of my expectation. I expected nice Belgium style waffles. Instead, they're kinda like cold Eggo waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Sandwich

xrXicXilwDvigYdwe8K_9w.text: I loved this place. When you come in you immediately order your food and then they bring it to you at the table. They play well no music, and it's very loud. So this is not a quaint, quiet breakfast but by any means. But that's not a bad thing. It wakes you up! Lol! The food came out quick. The cashier was polite. I wasn't sure about cheese on my waffle or sarachi May so skipped the cheese and had the mail put on the side. I did test it with the mail and it was actually quite good with the hot and the sweet together. My husband tried the cheese and he liked it. It's melted on, not like a slice of cheese. The chicken was crispy and very good. It was a chicken thigh. It wasn't too flavorful that it took over the entire combination of the dish. You could taste everything, the waffle, the eggs, chicken,the bacon. Oh the bacon! The bacon was thick and crispy and delicious on my sandwich, but not on my husbands, his could've been cooked longer. There is already syrup on the bottom waffle piece, so you don't need a lot of syrup watch out for that. The waffle state crispy until the very end of my breakfast. It was quite odd, because I'm used to him getting a little soggy or just not being goodbye the time you finish breakfast. These were very light and crispy. Overall I would definitely recommend this place. There was a line out the door consistently from the time we walked in. The line though, it moves pretty fast. Definitely try it if you're in Vegas. We paid about $39 For our breakfast I added a strawberry lemonade he added a coffee and an extra egg. Enjoy! (The only reasonI did not write these guys a five is because I asked for my eggs to be fried over hard and I had to send it back.to If I could do 4.5 I would have)

iwqdL2caqzxAZUjkd7tbsA.text: Went to Bruxie for the first time last week and I'm so glad that we decided to come back for it! Initially, we went on a Thursday morning around 10:45am. The line was out the door and we were starving so we ended up settling for Shake Shack next door. Saturday morning we wanted to try again but this time we were smart and went right before it opened. They open at 9, but they started letting people in about 10-15 minutes early!! We almost had to wait in a long line again because we didn't realize they opened early!   Ambience (5/5) - I really like the sort of hipster feel to the place. They have really large windows that lets in sunlight and really brightens up the place. It's a very clean environment and I love that.   Holy chicken! (5/5) - If you're a person that likes the sweet and salty combination, I would definitely recommend this! I am very picky about chicken because a lot of places make chicken extremely dry but Bruxie's chicken is definitely not dry. It was a juicy and savory piece of chicken that was maple glazed and TASTED SO WELL TOGETHER!   Fried chicken w/ bacon cheddar waffle and maple butter (5/5) - I'm not sure if we got the original seasoned or the kickin chicken but whatever we got was amazing. Then again I am really biased because I love pairing little big of sweetness and savory.   Bruxie Burger (3/5) - Don't get it. If you're really craving a burger then go get a burger next door at shake shack or any other places that actually makes burgers. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad! It's just that Bruxie is known for their chicken.. SO GET THE CHICKEN.. promise you won't regret getting the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original seasoned fried chicken with chili honey drizzle
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken with bacon cheddar waffle and maple butter

1OvMmcdcErkeoHibXtyB6A.text: Found this place last time in Vegas, and wow! I had the Elvis which was chicken, bacon, peanut butter, banana and maple syrup on a waffle. Holy smokes it was delicious! My husband had the traditional one with coleslaw and his was also amazing. This place is definitely worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis! Was a special and delicious.

xCwFvkMwb4ceVwqP_f0bfw.text: It definitely is a different kind of breakfast and a pretty decent deal for Vegas. I really enjoyed my waffel with spicy chicken. The atmosphere is more of a fast food restaurant, but all in all it was a good experience and good food.

euQUQMxLrZcohhh0IqrsPQ.text: After walking all over the strip and finally arriving at the New York New York hotel, I was excited that I was THIS close to finally getting the Bruxie waffle i have sooooo wanted to try. I was glad they opened one in Vegas since I haven't been able to make it to the LA location. It is a little hard to find as its on the side of the hotel and not inside or on the Las Vegas blvd side. It's around the corner from shake shack.  At 10pm at night, I was stoked to see there was NO line! I ordered the original chicken and waffle and a water. And then I almost fainted at how much my total was bc my water was almost as much as my chicken and waffle!!!!!!!! It was my bad for not noticing there was a "meal deal" (adding a drink/side to your waffle for a couple bucks more) but I wish the girl who was ringing me up would've mentioned something. Like "hey you wanna add a drink and a side to that for $3.95?". Because paying $7 bucks for smart water?! I already felt like a idiot for buying it but I was thirsty from speed walking all over the strip so I just sucked it up handed over my money.   The chicken tho, was deeeeelicious. It was so freaking good. But the waffle was just ok. But the chicken. I could eat a plate of just that chicken alone! It was just perfect. Perfectly seasoned and fried, the right amount of crispness. It was just delicious. Def 5 stars for the chicken. But I had to give this place 4 stars for just the ok waffle and the Louis Vuitton priced water.   I would still go back and give this place another try, there are a lot of good looking things on the menu that look worth trying.

HFzxeZEb298ViF6BWeYmOA.text: I arrived in Las Vegas yesterday and I was recommended this place!!!! I was very hungry for I got the chicken and waffles.  That was the best chicken and waffle meal I've ever had!!!! I liked it so much I went back the next day and got a salad!!!! The strawberry lemonade is made fresh everyday and it's awesome and very fresh!!!

ybRbKxC8ABD8jhbKH-FgPA.text: The chicken is fried perfectly and don't forget to get the waffle fries and mac&cheese. They have  beer wine and liquor too

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome chicken and waffles at Bruxie

zj8v4sF-wYD8IXBS2W7GlQ.text: So, I had found Bruxie on Yelp before I left for Vegas & had it bookmarked. I knew I really wanted to try it. We were staying at NYNY so it was a quick 5 minute walk to get to. I loved the decor and the open air feel of the restaurant. Perfect for a lunch. Great window seats for people watching.   The service was super friendly & gave me some great suggestions for my first time. I ordered the classic Chicken & Waffle, my husband ordered a Sausage/Egg/Cheese waffle, and we ordered the Lemon Cream with Berries to share. Because, why not?!?! (also get the strawberry lemonade, it's amazing!)   My chicken and waffle was a new experience for me! It was SO GOOD. It had cabbage and a really yummy sauce on it. The berries with the lemon cream was pretty much unbelievable. Even my husband wanted to go back the next day for another one! haha!   When we were getting ready to leave they offered free refills on the lemonade so that was nice! I will definitely be back here! I want to try pretty much everything on the menu!   Great work Bruxie, you are one of my new Vegas favs!

9ZSdLuCt-pYBurWxG9SX4w.text: I totally loved this.  I don't eat full plates BUT..I did that day.   So the concept of this Chicken Waffle Taco was foreign to me.  And the fact it had "stuff" inside I was not sure I wanted it.  I always try new things so why not.  So after my first bite, I don't think I tasted much more because I inhaled the rest of it.  This invention was super yummy.  And it is so wonderful to know there is a location in Los Angeles.  I need to stay away from it because I will have this more often than I need.    The lemonade was good too, and don't forget...it's Vegas so you can add a punch to your lemonade.    The service here was VERY good.  Everyone was friendly and attentive.     This place ROCKS!

2ZSWEOerz0tnTDPpLPme-Q.text: Tried this place while visiting Las Vegas and staying on the strip. Very good sandwiches, full of flavor and a big enough portion to keep you full. The price is definitely inflated for being on the strip. What would normally cost $13 anywhere else is around $20 here. I made the mistake of ordering a smart water bottle, not realizing it was $7 until after I paid. All in all it was a very good meal and I would eat here again next time I'm in Vegas. Just don't buy a water bottle here.

Their chicken tenders have a nice herbal breaded exterior and is quite juicy on the inside. Overall if you don't mind spending the extra money to try this place out, then I recommend it.

kZr32JPWtaMWLbBhmDBJiQ.text: We came here on a Saturday around noon. There was a line out the door but the wait was really short. It's a casual quick-serve restaurant (where you order in line and then they bring the food to your table). The service was great and it took about 10 min for us to get our food.   We ordered the 2 pieces of fried chicken (which includes a bacon-cheddar waffle), Holy Chicken sandwich, Angry Mac & Cheese, Waffle Fries, and Strawberry Lemonade. The Bacon-Cheddar Waffle was the highlight of the meal! It had a crispy exterior with a fluffy interior. The 2 piece fried chicken (we got one of each flavor) is a MUST ORDER. The Holy Chicken sandwich was delicious too but not as good as the waffle that came with the sandwich is much thinner. We were so full from these two dishes that we should've skipped the other three side dishes. The waffle fries and the Mac & Cheese aren't particularly tasty enough to warrant special attention. The strawberry lemonade was also extremely sweet.   Overall, this place is really good! We would come back but mainly for the bacon cheddar waffle.

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Pieces of Fried Chicken with Bacon Cheddar Waffle - must order item!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Lemonade - it&#39;s really sweet

mwChhrWe2mhWTTFng06Z-g.text: Who knew fried chicken, bacon, and eggs, wrapped around a nice crispy waffle could taste so good? Place is bright with huge windows - great for seeing the strip. Next Vegas trip, this place will be a must stop, for me. 10/10 will eat here again!

IhLRwnpM67EEEjGN0xtrVg.text: My friends and I were looking for a place to eat and stumbled upon Bruxie. My god.... was it the best decision in Vegas. I went 3 days in a row and tried something different each time. This place is no joke, one of the best places to eat in Vegas that won't kill your wallet. Each item will run you about $10. The line can get long at times, but it moves very quickly. The food is brought out to you too, so grab a cup of iced water while you're waiting or try their strawberry lemonade (the best I've ever had!).  Day 1- Buttermilk Fried Chicken Cobb and I tried my girlfriend's Grilled California Pesto Chicken Day 2- Nashville Hot Chicken Day 3- Hot Pastrami and Swiss and I tried Green Eggs and Ham  All 3 days I was impressed by the food. Every item I tried was amazing, so you can't go wrng with anything. They're known for their chicken, but the breakfast waffles were good too. I'm sure the sweet waffles would be good too but I didnt get to try them. The chicken is really juicy and tender, regardless of which item you choose. The salad was fresh too. If you're visiting, definitely try out Bruxie!

2wusfkugZpKBfu8MaSgYgg.text: This was my first time at Bruxie and i feel in love!!!! The chicken was super moist and i do want everyone to try this place when the do visit Vegas, the only bad thing was the line was long and out the door.

m88hjKYeRgqrgCKX6Y6Pdg.text: Saw this place on our way to to shake shack and decided to try it. No one inside, thought it was actually closed cuz it was so dead at around 5pm. Younger man took our order. Wasn't really good at recommending anything just stood there till we figured it out, seemed like he was more interested at playing with his friends, making sure their phone was charged, etc. I get it was dead, but shit. Decided to order the fried chicken w/ the bacon waffle and the holy chicken waffle sandwich.   Asked for the siracha sauce on the side and of course didn't get that. Though bf liked it.   My fried chicken and waffle was good but geez, I'm a lover of sweets ok, but damn all those sugar crystals or rocks were way toooooo much! It was like rock candy in the waffle! I picked most of it out then it was tasty! I think just the bacon in the waffle with syrup would of did the job. Chicken was good though. Just that waffle! Ughhhh! Please less sugar crack!!

Q_UANufz9ilghIb9bZTesg.text: Imagine the hunger you have after a night of gambling, drinking a debauchery. Satisfying this hunger is often a quest that leads you to over priced buffets that barely deliver. Enter Bruxie, a hip low key spot near plenty of hotels on The Strip. Seems like you are entering s simple fast food order at the counter spot, and then you read the menu. Holy Cow, I mean Holy Chicken! This waffle wrapped fried chicken sandwich is one for the books. This place is must try, and while you are indulging, do yourself a favor and get the waffle fries.

vzNWa0rTBc0j8Ps3WbJf2w.text: Amazing breakfast sandwich. Perfectly crisp waffle wrapped around fresh cooked bacon, egg with melted cheese. Perfectly delicious! And top it off with house made colas? Both were delicious but i prefer the kicking chicken. Add the strawberry lemonade is so fresh and you can tell the ingredients are real Not processed

3cKsGFib0-OAI8ar6Sf-5g.text: This is a unique concept from your traditional sandwiches.  Waffle sandwiches as you please.   Located at The Park around the corner from the restaurants in front of New York New York.    There's a name to describe the atmosphere.  Not sure if hipster, trendy, or sustainable is the word, but the interior is similar to Skinny Fats.  Since the weather was nice, the large windows were open, and the Big Ass Fans (that is what they are called) were in motion.        You must go in line to order, and they bring the food to you.  The line was long when I went, but it went by fast.    I got the buffalo bleu fried chicken waffle sandwich with a side of waffle fries.  Also ordered the Liege waffle.  Buffalo bleu was mediocre in flavor.  The waffle fries are like Chic-Fil-A waffle fries.  The Liege waffle was my favorite:  fried on the outside, and heavy and doughy on the inside.  Top was lightly coated with powdered sugar.  So much hype because it's new and something you don't see everyday.  Good experience, but the taste was just mediocre.

-G7Tg3ilkdIvEBDeCsVYaQ.text: Delicious food, super nice and friendly staff, and a buffalo cheese sauce that I could eat for the rest of my life! Since I made the trip down to the strip I knew I had to make it worth it, so I ordered the buffalo mac and cheese (minus bacon)!! And wow! Everything cost around $22 total which I was cool with because it was the Strip. I was so impressed, all the food was delicious. It was Sunday around 2 and there was only like 10-15 people there, so we got in and out no problem! Tip: dip your fries in the buffalo cheese sauce! It is to die for!

uHG2jiCmmz4IZ98sOEOY_g.text: The bomb.com!!!!! Sunday December 11th, 2016, it was about 7pm and I took a Lyft and visited this place for the first time yesterday for lunch. I was at Caesars and just heard about this place. I ordered for me and a friend and took it to go. I got the regular Chicken and Waffles, and by no means is this food 'regular'. I got chicken tenders and waffle fries for the friend. We had a field day it was so darn good and flavorful! She had whore mean which was moist and soft and I had the dark meat. I also for the the Nutella and Banana waffle dessert treat. Boy oh boy! I'm still licking my fingers!!! The service was good and the boy at the register was suuuuuper duper helpful and really nice! I was completely confident ordering the food I did just by the way motioned and said that was great choice. I got back to work to enjoy my meal and it was everrrrrrything!!!!! My friend and I were very happy campers! Will be going back soon!

Y_E9M9oq0JYEfKmHGgUCNA.text: If you want to get out of the buffet routine while in Vegas, this is a good fast, simple and quite tasty place to go. Price is very decent, nice ambiance, and location is very convenient.

9FFwvmEEOUIQEbXrA7O4Mg.text: Fried #Chicken #Waffle sandwich from Bruxie #LasVegas . This place is total hype. But I can see why people dig it. Crispy #friedchicken with sweet slaw and a light crisp waffle for bread. The texture and flavor combinations are all there. But when you produce certain foods for mass consumption, it's way too hard to keep quality standards #high . And then it's only tasty if your high. If this dish was made to order it would have probably been #phenomenal . But you get what you pay for. I can't hate on them for fulfilling the masses.

fbGQaN9er4H-t9V7mbREDg.text: Food was cold. Bacon under cooked. Over easy egg was solid in the middle. Chicken was greasy and fatty. Not a fan. Won't be back.

fY_4i4HcWUOs3CTjgTpBZA.text: We decided to try something new to eat before getting our day started , did some searching and Bruxie came up. It looked amazing reviews were great so this was the place for us. Walking in it's just set up really nice (really cold) , we were helped in a timely manner and with all smiles The FOOD WAS ABSOLUTELY MAGNIFICENT . I love this place l. I'd recommend it to everyone.

L8Vrc8WgGz2L1xBdJfW1mw.text: Wow. The infusion of savory and sweet is perfect. We had an original chicken skillet and a Nashville skillet. It was perfect. The chicken itself was juicy and flavorful.   Then the waffle biscuit?! Oh man. I don't even have the vocabulary to describe it. It had bacon, onions and chives (as far as I could tell) in the batter and just a light splash of syrup on the outside. Yum.   The staff was super friendly and helpful. An awesome spot for breakfast and I'm guessing we'll be there again before our stay is over.   The coffee is mediocre but I didn't even care once the food came out. Win.

8o_5LZOKw8mFuL7h1xWReA.text: The best chicken and waffles sandwich I've ever had! The chicken tasted amazing and perfectly cooked. The waffle and maple syrup complimented the chicken very well. The service is also great and the workers are very attentive to your needs and questions. This place is connected to New York New York, but you will need to walk outside since it's not directly accessible from the casino/hotel.

EO_y_TZQXZTSFYsNdM8WtQ.text: I came here with the expectation of "the best fried chicken I've ever had" and left the restaurant completely disappointed and utterly speechless. IT WAS THE WORST CHICKEN AND WAFFLES I'VE EVER HAD. Maybe the main chef was sick on the day I went? I have no idea as my chicken was neither tasty nor crispy! Hello Bruxie... the chicken from a chicken and waffle is suppose to be crispy, not soggy af and tasteless. But oh.. the waffle was super hard and dry and crunchy though...a cost of $10 a waffle is not enough for you guys to buy milk and put a sufficient amount of it into your waffle batter? Seriously... if you want better chicken and waffles.... walk down to hash house a go go, this place is NOT worth your $$, your time, nor your stomach space.

Creme brulee waffle was filled with strawberries and the original waffle sandwich with apple cider slaw was also excellent.  We ordered a side of bacon for $1.25 and received 1 piece of bacon, FYI.  Two ojs, one coffee, two waffle sandwiches, side of bacon and side of fruit for around $30 was a steal! We will definitely return!!!

FnZrVWi6E2KeYm-kBj6hDg.text: Two words: BOMB DIGGITY.  Me and my girlfriend needed some desperate food after drinking all night and we tried the original fried chicken and waffle and it sure did the job!!! Nothing like the egg running through your fingers and crunching on that crispy chicken wrapped with bacon and cheese... this is a must have!!!!

qdWbulnbX1RQG1XvgXg2PA.text: By far the best chicken spot I've had at this point in Vegas, it was packed with flavor, the Mac n cheese was very smooth and delicious. Would highly recommend trying 5/5.
