mqh8uIonRv-fdyxIM5qNXw.text: YUM YUM YUM!!  So bomb that I'm making this my 100th review. Shock!   I was surprised on how delicious this place was! I ordered the Original Chicken and Waffle. It was prepared like a waffle taco. Large thin, crispy, yet airy waffle that had a hint of syrup in the taste, a very large, super meaty, not overly battered chicken breast that was seasoned to perfection and had a tad of coleslaw. I got mine with waffle fries too, and that was even fresh. Simple yet satisfying.   My friend got the Nashville chicken and waffles and he fell in love once he took a bite. His had the right spices to it with super large pickles in his order. I took a bite, of course and it was deflectable! He also ordered the mac and cheese but we weren't too impressed by it. Still ate it all though!! lol.   At the end, we finished our meals with a Waffle Sundae. The waffle underneath the ice cream wasn't something to be excited about. No taste to it, sadly and it was super thick. I was hoping for some more airy, crispy waffles like what my chicken and waffle came with. That and for some reason I thought of a cinnamon waffle? Was that another option? I don't remember. The ice cream, however, was thick and creamy and you can eat it on its own. Very good!!   FYI. If you decide to order ice cream, put it on hold so your meal can come out first. The cashier didn't tell us about that so our dessert came out first. Luckily we inhaled our food and still enjoyed the not so melted ice cream we shared. the girl who took the sundae out told us we can do that. She even offered to take it back and give us a new batch, but there was no need. NOTED!   It did get stupid busy when we were there, but its because its on the strip. There was seats inside and a ton outside. Ordering was also quick and easy as a girl was standing outside giving people menu's.   ANYWAY, JUST GET HERE AND TRY IT. It's Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H_jbaoTPD8WaimKehPLdFA.text: Perfectly light, fluffy and crispy waffles with a menagerie of toppings. Calm but refreshingly energetic ambiance on The Strip. Happy cashiers greeting you. The high praise for this place is not wrong-I can attest to that, sitting in it right now with Mom. We're thrilled we chose Bruxie for our lunch time getaway.  Whether you're in the mood for something sweet or hearty, this Bruxie and its cheerful staff will fix you right up.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brule waffle: light, crispy, perfectly sweet and magical. Not overwhelmingly heavy or insanely sweet. Just right.

veAbLSe7sXugSXmoQ3tFgQ.text: Really like this place! Was skeptical at first thinking its one of those placess where people hype it up but it is overrated but it was a nice surprise to find out how good it was. The place is pretty spacious with inside and outside seatings, pretty friendly staff and decent service for a walk up and order kind of place.   The sandwiches we tried were pretty good and not very expensive for being on The Strip. We got Buffalo Blue Cheese, Carolina BBQ Pulled Pork, and the Buttermilk Fried Chicken. All three were really good, the chicken was fried perfectly crispy, the lettuce and pickle cooled the tastebuds against the chili honey and the hot fried chicken.   The idea of chicken and waffle is nothing new, but the ingredients they use tasted fresh and the various options to choose from are very nice, you can get a sandwich, a salad, or sweet waffle treats. Fun place to check out!

SIzkTTxObt2D532qbX6pTQ.text: I had high expectations of the best chicken and waffles but was a bit disappointed. For some reason almost all of the food came a bit cold or lukewarm. The waffles didn't have much flavor and reminded me of bland Leggo waffles. The chicken was decent.

_Tf71Ly4kUqaPivRdNeDFw.text: It was good because the chicken was crispy and hot!It was also good because waffle tased like no other waffle I liked it!So this why I love this place

fzz4RKbJnOnJrXlQL7sIIQ.text: We stopped in on the second day the park opened. It was on a Tuesday morning, so there was not much of a crowd. Be ready for all the construction if you go during the day. They are still constructing a theater directly across from the park.  We tried the original Chicken & Waffle sandwich and the Roasted Mushroom & Grilled Chicken Salad. Both were excellent.  You walk in and you order at a counter, as you would at any fast food establishment. Once you order you are given a pager that will vibrate when your order is ready. The server brings your food to you. The servers looked like they were having trouble finding the customers when their orders were ready. They might want to fine tune the order delivery system. I would suggest having the customers pick up their order when the pager is activated.  The salad was very good. It had roasted crimini mushrooms, grilled chicken breast, sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese, romaine, and arugula. The dressing was a lemon and balsamic vinaigrette.  The waffle was very light and crispy and it was folded in half with a good sized piece of fried boneless chicken breast on top of cider slaw. The chicken was seasoned well and I think I liked it with the slaw instead of with syrup. It was a nice change from the sweet syrup you usually get on chicken and waffles. Very tasty!!!  I will definitely be back if I am in the area. I recommend you stop in. You won't be disappointed.

6d-giJozLmF0YspBUE75rA.text: This was my first time trying Bruxie (is that the correct spelling?) Waffle sandwiches with savory fillings aren't as appealing when you can eat a fresh Liege waffle covered in frozen custard, whipped cream, fudge, caramel, and whole roasted peanuts, so I ordered the sundae! It's a good size for sharing and at $6.95, you're unlikely to find a more satisfying dessert in The Park. This is the perfect sweet stop after watching a concert at T-Mobile arena.  There are a few similar waffle sandwich concepts already in Las Vegas, but Bruxie serves it up at a comparable price point with higher quality ingredients. I didn't feel like I was being overcharged to compensate for the Strip location. Service was engaged and excellent, starting with a young man in front of the restaurant who ran to get me a sample cup of their creamy frozen custard when I asked about the product. I also ordered a side of cheesy waffle fries and I'll stick with the specialty waffles in the future. The fries were standard but over salted. Rumors point to a secret menu and I think I'll be back for the Fluffernutter waffle!

Eoi6D_MmuNkGkBB8NqPm8g.text: While on our last day of a bachelor party, my friends wanted to get a "pre-meal" before the Shake Shack opened up at 11 am next door.  They grabbed a little of everything: the tenders, waffle fries, chicken & waffle sandwich, and chicken/eggs & waffles sandwich.  I took a bite of everything, and every bite was delicious.  Their tenders had kind of a Nashville hot chicken flavor.  The waffles were fairly thin like an Eggo, but way better than an Eggo could ever be.   If you are not eating healthy and want some delicious, quick comfort food this side of the Strip, definitely check this place out!

Got a small bottle of syrup for two brick like waffles. Syrup wasn't good. Didn't even get the correct waffles(but the guy ringing up with new so that's ok) just wasn't a good experience.

esDQzy3KHnFD9h13KNcq4A.text: Great little place to stop and eat while walking the strip. Never had waffles as the bread for a sandwich but was definitely worth it. The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly. The free water cups and condiment bar was also a plus.

HrKJqT89XsONR2TbaqRT_A.text: When in New York, oh wait, I guess it is fake Vegas style New York!    I was in town for work meetings and had my wife tag along.  Decided that we needed to eat something so off we went on "walk-a-bout!"  We ended up here after reading a few reviews.  I have to say that most of them were spot on.  The food was fantastic.  I couldn't have been more happy with the choice I made.  I am all about a good waffle......and to have fried chicken paired with it, makes for a great meal.    Now as to why I knocked off a star.  When we got there it didn't seem to terrible busy, but we stood in line for 20 minutes before ordering.  There were a lot of empty tables inside and out.  I just couldn't understand what was taking so long at the counter.  Even when we got there to order, it only took a few seconds to place our order.  Oh well, live and let live.  Still a great meal.   Roggen......out!

LeqgcRlywX-i-RK-Y0xCYQ.text: Bruxie: home of the original chicken waffle sandwiches and much more (frozen custard, waffle fries & waffle nachos).  After our first trip to this place when my family and I visited Vegas last year, my family instantly knew that we wanted to come back for more. Located in The Park Plaza by New York New York and Shake Shack, Bruxie is surrounded by eateries but is the only place that holds the famous chicken waffle sandwich. The have seating available in the three black tables outside and plenty to fit large groups or a couple inside. When it gets busy, they give you trackers that can only go as far as the black tables near the entrance so be careful where you choose to sit. The service is bomb and are welcome to assist you with your needs right away (extra utensils), despite the fact they have a water station complete with sauces (syrup, ketchup, hot sauce) for your use.   We came by 2-3 times (Thurs, Fri, Sat) during our trip, which seems like we wildin a bit too much but hey! Bay Area sadly doesn't have a Bruxie so gotta take the chance ): Although we mostly came back for their delicious frozen custard, we also got their original chicken waffle sandwich and chicken tenders with their signature waffle fries.   Their waffle fries are lightly fried yet still remain to maintain that crispness you desire in a regular fry. Their servings are pretty huge so sharing is definitely recommended if you're ordering a waffle sandwich. The original chicken waffle sandwich includes a crunchy honey glazed chicken, a thin/soft yet crispy on the edges waffle, and cole slaw. You can make it a combo with their waffle fries for extra couple bucks more if you're feeling it. Their chicken tenders were large and seemed a bit too overly fried, but that's what gave it its crunchy appearance and taste. Most importantly, the chicken tenders weren't dry! For dessert, we chose their Wisconsin Frozen Custard which is beyond amazeballs. Their frozen custard has the option to be served in a waffle cone or a regular cup (which is actually a whole lot, don't underestimate the size since they fill it to the top). It's definitely mouthwatering and heavenly. I'm disappointed that the bay hasn't matched up to this greatness yet :/   Bruxie is absolutely worth the hype of chicken waffle sandwiches. With a open & clean atmosphere, I'd come back again (:

OSKIWq3_C8NE7ucA-5xapA.text: Great lunch and dinner spot in the Park. You place your order and then find a seat.  There are a lot of options and we enjoyed this much better than Hattie B's in the Cosmo. The Halo chicken and waffle sandwich was very good and we love the fries!

kM6fYfHqIJijzq3pd120pA.text: Bruxie's started out in Southern California; however, the first time I ever tried one was on our regular jaunt to Vegas.  Particularly, we stopped by at about 8pm on Saturday, April 15th.  Overall, this place gets 5 stars; however, I would recommend when there are more than a few people in line it would be awesome if you could take orders from both stations.   Anyway, we were the fourth in line and had to wait about 7 minutes to place our order.  We don't mind waiting for the food at the table; however, it would have been nice to place the order just a bit faster.  We both had a sandwich.  I had the buffalo chicken waffle sandwich and the other person in our party had the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich.  We also shared an order of the Irish Nachos/Fries.    Everything we had was cooked perfectly and it just had so many amazing flavor profiles.  Man oh man  -- if this wasn't so bad for you -- I would eat it nearly everyday.  The waffle was perfect and fluffy and the chicken was tender, cooked to perfection and so delicious.    The fries were equally as good.    I cannot wait to come back to Bruxie's again!!

J1w3LIKrK8NZiVPbYecdlA.text: I first saw Bruxie walking by and there was a line way out the door. So we decided to try it out the next morning for brunch. Again the was a line out the door but it moved quickly. My husband ordered the B.A.M.F and I the holy chicken. Both were good and Instagram worthy. The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy inside. The waffles were crunchy and fluffy the way they should be. And the flavors balanced well on both sandwiches. I do recommend the B.A.M.F more of the two waffle sandwiches.  We also ordered the fried pickles. Try these! They have a lot of flavor and are sliced thickly.  The only thing I didn't like was the strawberry lemonade. It was waaaaaaay too sweet. Once I added water to it I could rock with it.  Service was great there were about 10 people working but one lady stood out. She outworked everyone. She was taking orders, refilling drinks, filling the water, cleaning tables and delivering food.  The only thing she didn't do was cook.

OYjjg08gsxdYMiPhBKqaDw.text: I dragged my in-laws here, in the heat, walking from Treasure Island (they have free parking, what can I say), all the way over to Bruxie's - which wound up being an hour long walk. Was it worth it, yes. Would I do it again, I don't know, since the in-laws are from LA and the original Bruxie's originated in LA,  so I think I'll just stop by next time we visit but...oh well.   The waffles for the sandwiches were kind of plain but the chicken itself was phenomenal. We had the Southern BBQ and the Nashiville Hot. Both were good in their own right and I honestly couldn't pick a favorite. The in-laws shared some chicken strips with waffles that rivaled a pretty damn fine dessert. I honestly wished my waffle in the waffle sandwich was a little sweeter, but they were still good nonetheless.   All in all, totally worth the a hour we spent walking though I do wish the items I saw photographed on Yelp were on the menu. Oh well, I guess.

tTJfvDvVrNCmjQ553SRGRA.text: I can't speak any more highly of this place. My boys and I went to eat here tonight and we ordered the baked waffle that is 5 stars in itself but the reason I am writing this post is because of the customer service. My waffles came just a little later than normal because one of their waffle makers were having problems but it was just a couple minute wait. Nevertheless they went above and beyond and did something none of us expected. They made 4 extra waffles with whipped cream and strawberries for the 4 of us. Exemplary customer service and I hope they never waver from their kind ways. I applaud you all, shouts out to the chefs and the crew. I recommend this place to everyone and anyone.

S_8dpl_-VJT8syXXRYzDNQ.text: Very disappointed. Got a to-go order and specifically requested nashville style chicken tenders. Get back to the hotel room and not only is there no ranch or any sort of dipping sauce, the chicken is just plain old chicken tenders. Checked the receipt as well and it properly states, "Nash style". I guess they just don't care enough to check the tickets to make sure customers receive what they actually ordered.  Also ordered a pb&j waffle and the jam tastes burnt and is a dark brown color. Da fuq? Won't be making this mistake of ordering overpriced fast food again. If I wanted plain tenders and a messed up order I could've saved $10 and went to McDonald's instead.

ip1WIJe6QxWwRX2i5VZAzQ.text: This place did not disappoint like most like most out the Yelpers have pointed out but I gave it a 4 star due to the level of spiciness I was promised.   I ordered a Kickin chicken waffle with a side of waffle fries and I wish i had more of the "kickin" sauce. When I was ordering, I asked for extra sauce but was told that I was already too spicy and should stay away. I asked for some on the side and she pointed me to the hot sauce placed on the coffee/water station. The sauce was good but there was barley on there.   Waffle fries could be crispier but no major complains.   I would recommend this place but to those who eat spicy, let this serve as a public service announcement, spicy is not really spicy, so if you would like to have that kick, order or ask for extra sauce.

My third time visiting this establishment, waffles always cold, not made fresh and the waffle is self is bland.   The chicken is surprisingly very good, applewood smoked bacon is delicious and again the waffle very disappointing.   Nothing special but worth checking out and to be honest I'd recommend going straight for the chicken.

Ordered the 2 piece original with waffle and it was soooo good. Nice lil kick to the chicken.   Definitely a good place to eat for a quick bite and chill. The outside has good seating and games for adults and kids to play.

3TguWKC9nUzF8eh9p_rHCA.text: Bruxie is just half a block of the strip and a great place to have breakfast/lunch especially if you are craving all things waffles!  My SO and I had chicken and mushroom waffles set (came with waffles fries) and we really like them. Though the waffles were not mind-blowing delicious, they made quite a tasty and satisfying breakfast for us. My mushroom waffles weren't too heavy and I still felt refreshed and not sluggish after eating all that carb.  P.S. they may seem to have a line out the door sometimes...but the place is big enough that people would finish their meals and you can probably find your own place to sit while waiting in line or for your order.

I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich that had lettuce, tomatoes, pickles and sauce, which was nice bc it wasn't too heavy. My friend got the chicken fingers w/ waffle fries which were pretty bomb. grDfcFzPAkB073IzpCZoZg.text: This place is a must. I got the Holy Chicken waffle sandwich, mac and cheese and a Holy Mary (bloody Mary). Ok the sandwich was delicious!!! You must get it. Everything blended well and I added maple syrup on it which was definitely a must. The mac and cheese was under-whelming. Cheese was not creamy and very loose. Took 2 bites and it was enough for me to be like - it's not worth the calories. Their Bloody Mary was not good either. I liked the bacon in it but other than that it wasn't that great. Would pass on this as well. I am giving it a 5 star because the main dish was delicious! Stop in and get that - only that. My friend got the chicken and waffles and she loved it! Chicken seasoned very well. So if you like chicken and waffles only this could be a good option. Enjoy!

_8lffzUe0-8wNAhhmYJl5w.text: It was a hangover Tuesday for us and we were ready for some brunch. A quick search resulted in Bruxie which offered chicken & waffles which got us instantly excited. Now, I know that chicken and waffles isn't a new concept anymore. It got really big about 5 years ago and now almost every other restaurant offers this option. However, if done right, a meal of chicken & waffles can hit the ball out of the park when it comes to recovering from a very late night in Vegas.   Here are my ratings based on different criteria:  Quality of food: Really good. We split an order of the original Chicken & Waffles, a side of waffle fries, and a strawberry lemonade. The original comes with Seasoned Breast, Chili Honey, all topped with Cider Slaw. The waffles are thin but go really well with the thick pieces of juicy crispy chicken breast. The syrup on the waffles was done just right and wasn't overly sweet. The waffle fries were very crispy. I recommend getting a side of the Bruxie sauce and dipping your waffle fries in them. The strawberry lemonade was on the tart side which I did not like.  Decor: Bright and Trendy! They have huge LED TVs with menus on them. The thing that I liked about the TVs was that the menu stayed on constantly instead of changing screens while you're trying to read the menu...don't you just hate that?!? One thing that I wish they had was a story on how Bruxie got started.  Cleanliness: No complaints. The tables, floor, and bathrooms were clean.  Service: Both the cashier and the person that brought us food to our table did it with a smile. However, they really blew it when it comes to forgetting part of our order. We had ordered a side of waffle fries and after the server acknowledged that she forgot them, it took her a solid 10 minutes to bring us just the fries. She kept bringing and filling other people's orders but I had to walk over and remind her again about the fries.  Speed of food preparation: Fast...except when it comes to bringing something they forgot. Like I said above, they need to figure out how to be fast on bringing something they missed in the original order.  Price: Expensive. We paid $12 for just one order of Waffle & Fries which seemed a little steep. A side of fries was $4. The quality is pretty good but the price can be a little bit lower.  I recommend Bruxie for some really tasty Chicken & Waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wait...

mactlaNobnbJm1Ee9J88NA.text: Oh Bruxie, how I wish you were located closer to me.    Wait, second thought scratch that, I would become fat and my legs riddled with waffley looking cellulite... speaking of waffles... UGH I miss this place.    We found Bruxie by accident in Vegas since we were trying to avoid the rush of people leaving their TVs as the superbowl was coming to an end.  They were totally quiet so we got a spicy chicken sandwich to share.  WHAT A MISTAKE!  I should NEVER have shared this sandwich.  IT was SOOOO good, but we had eaten so much junk earlier while watching the game I couldn't justify ordering another sandwich.    So.... with that many places to eat, we went back a couple of days later to have lunch at Bruxie.  I orderd the crispy chicken waffle sandwich and hubby had the spicy chicken sandwich again.  I even ordered some Irish nachos which he had never heard of before.  Can I say?  NOM, NOM, NOM!   SO yummy and tasty.  I would have gone there again had I had the chance but my wasteline is thanking me  for not doing so.  TRY IT OUT!!! Definitely well priced for such a tasty meal in Vegas.

2iQ8bOZLl1A-dmVHBOzJqw.text: If you're in Cali or Las Vegas you need to find this place. Now. I read a lot of positive reviews but I'm picky about chicken and waffles so I wasn't a believer until I tried it for myself. I ordered the holy chicken waffle sandwich and instantly fell in love. The chicken was crispy, the waffle was fluffy, the fried egg was runny, and the sriracha sauce added the perfect kick. Dip it all in syrup and you have your hands full of messy, blissful deliciousness. Or you can opt for the fork method but that's just not as fun! This breakfast easily makes my top 10 best breakfasts ever list. I'm happy to be heading home from the west coast, but so, so sad to be thousands of miles away from Bruxie.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy chicken sandwich!

aL5UFYRpOjW4GUh_HD7SlA.text: Let me start by saying, YASSSSSSS! I was just walking around trying to find something good to eat to take back with me to my room. At first I was going to try the pizza place across from the park I think it's called California kitchen but I decided to walk down a little bit further and saw this place. I am so glad that I walked in and gave it a try. I had the two piece chicken with the regular waffle. When I say it was amazing I am not kidding it was just that. The chicken was seasoned, crispy, and hot. The waffle was perfect and the sauce gave it just that extra kick I was looking for. If you are looking for a place to get some great food and some good service this is the place!!!

And the breakfast sandwich I assume was good as my girlfriend didn't offer me any of hers.    Check it out and enjoy an opportunity to people watch as well.

rg8HGEMRNURaQSUxmSlJVA.text: First time here, not disappointed but not satisfied as well. Location is good. Took my family here (2 small kids) location wise it's Kid friendly but the menu is not that kid friendly at all. I ordered Mac and cheese for my kids and OMG it was so spicy that I could not even eat it myself. If u like spicy then order this but it doesn't go well with the bacon and flavor of the sauce. Chicken Caesar salad, looks good but taste bad. My husband said there's a fishy taste in it and it's True, dnt know why! The original Chicken waffles was ok. Again not kid friendly, the chicken was spicy and the waffles are thin that the veggies inside it and the chicken soaked the waffles so after 3 mins not crispy soft crunchy waffles ur gonna eat but a saggy one.. The chicken taste better than the rest but it's still a little spicy and kinda sweet.. I'm not a fan of spicy food and so r my kids... The waffles the looked good on their menu pics is totally different and like I said its saggy and soaked after few minutes.. My husbands ordered the Caroline pulled pork waffles, same thing, spicy and it was messy to eat so be prepared. It was a little dry too. It didn't go very well with the thin soaked waffles again. Anyways, maybe that's their theme, spicy food but I wish I was told that when I was orderin or at least ask me what level of spiciness I want! Especially the saw my kids Coz the place was kinda empty when we got there. So they have all the time to explain their menu. And it wasn't included in their menu description as well. So there u go! Decide. I mean if u like spicy and ur kids like spicy too then go for it but then again I should be informed of what ur eating or the level Of it before confirming the order. Their strawberry Palmer drink was also not good.. It taste plain. And  old... I drank my water in my hydroflask!! Kids didn't like it either, almost no flavoring! No wonder it's free refill!! So for 4 items plus 2 drinks  we paid 52$ including tax and tip... Is it worth it? Not really Coz my kids didn't get to eat. I ended up taking them to eat real kids Mac and cheese at CPK after ... So much better food  will I go back there on the future? Prob not.. Thank you!

cyVcYFvh5ul-2AljDLqoDQ.text: Came here for breakfast during our vacay on the strip, and it was awesome! I got the mushroom and goat cheese waffle sandwich and my boyfriend got the fried chicken waffle sandwich. We were both super happy with our meals! The waffles aren't your dense hearty variety of waffle- they're more light, airy, and crispy- perfect for us since we were hitting a day club later that day and needed to be bikini ready! The flavors on my waffle were rich and savory, and the chicken sandwich had nice crispy chicken and came with a yummy honey sauce that tied the whole thing together! After we ate those, we ended up splitting the Nutella banana waffle to end with something sweet. I didn't expect it to be anything too special, but it was awesome! In addition to the fresh banana, there's a banana custard that's sandwiched with the Nutella as well. Not only was the food great, but the price was right, since we ended up paying $30 for all of our food! Overall, great food and great value, and we'lol definitely be back!

I've found a couple, but I was looking for something specifically in Vegas as I was going to be on vacation there. I found bruxie in one of many extensive searches I do and was intrigued. They were not only chicken and waffles, they were sandwiches. Totally got me. And for good reason. I got the holy chicken, and when you bite into it, the name makes all the more sense. It's the perfect combination of sweet and savory in every single bite. I also got waffle fries and a strawberry lemonade and everything just seemed to pair so well. I was in waffle chicken heaven. As for service and crowd, I went at a fairly quiet time, around 2 or 3. It's more towards the beginning of the strip so you don't get that crazy crowd. GO TREAT YOURSELF!

ac5SSLlsW84zlVmm9sBilA.text: If you're looking for a quick spot to eat on the Strip, check out Bruxie! Probably the best chicken and waffle sandwich I've had. The chicken breast was so good and drenched in maple syrup! Oh em gee! They also had a delicious caramel latte. And I sipped some of my husband's strawberry lemonade. It was tasty too. Can't go wrong at this spot and it's not at all pricey. Enjoy!

td8AAqA5kFC_dq2ablpdCQ.text: Bomb.com! I specifically chose this place because they have thin waffles just like Roscoes in LA! Hubby ordered the Nashville hot with fries and I (liking to keep it simple) got the waffle with chicken tenders. Really great meals for both of us, but honestly everything coming out of the kitchen looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xb-5idAB_kBeta18ZMteKQ.text: I went to Vegas for two days and I wanted to give this place a try as it came highly recommended by a few friends. I ordered the chicken and waffles that came with egg and bacon and my husband ordered the original. We also ordered the Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious. I gave it four starts because it was a little sweet but otherwise it was really good and the location was ideal as well. They were quick in bringing out our food and we went to eat at roughly 11:30am so it wasn't full yet. When we left we noticed most of the tables were taken and there was a line at the counter to order. I definitely recommend everyone gives this place a try. The chicken was nice and crispy and the taste was amazing.

4lkXJNftFazDaIIrqrX43w.text: Yesterday was my daughter's 21st birthday, and she decided she wanted Bruxie for breakfast. What the birthday girl wants, the birthday girl gets!   This place sits out front of the T Mobile arena and the New York New York. Kind of difficult to decide where to park. You can pay the $7 at NYNY, the $5 at Monte Carlo, or head over to the Tropicana for free, but walk for a while. We opted for NYNY.  I assumed this was a sit down place. Sort of. You stand in line to order what you want, then they bring it over to you. We went about 11am, and the lunch rush was going on. The line was out the door. We did manage to snag two tables next to each other though. We had 6 people.   The food is a little pricey for what you get. I ordered the Naked Waffles, with cinnamon sugar. It's literally 2 waffles, butter, cinnamon, and syrup. Yep, naked lol.  My husband and son both ordered the Holy Moly sandwich. My husband said his was really good. My son said the siracha flavor was a little over powering. My daughter (bday girl) was a little sad. She wanted the blue cheese sandwich,  which they no longer serve. She got the bbq instead. Hers was alright. We got two orders of Irish nachos, and a fingers kids meal. The Irish nachos were yum! They also brew their own soda, which is really original. 3 of us has the spiced cola. My daughter had strawberry lemonade, spiked with vodka.   Waffles, 3 sandwiches, a kids meal, fries, and drinks came out to almost $90. Yowza!   I definitely want to go back to order a chicken sandwich. I'm a ding dong and thought naked meant not breaded, so I want to go back to get something with chicken. I ma

0ysUJoJgDijM0ZVFY7aVuw.text: Coming from someone who doesn't care for fried foods... I'd have to say this place was surprisingly good! Chicken wasn't overly fried, waffle fries were crispy, and the sriracha sauce.. bomb.com. Lastly, order a fried egg, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1mTT__l5mQ-pzNHRv-kXgQ.text: So I am a fanatic for a good burger, and with Shake shack right next door, you probably wouldn't think twice about coming to Bruxie for a burger. Well I've eaten at Shake shack, and the burger here was hands down up there with my top favorites. The waffle bun was for lack of a better term, perfect. I ordered mine with all the extras (avocado, bacon, fried egg). The burger was cooked to a medium rare And it was not a greasy mess like the aforementioned neighboring burger joint. My son had the tenders and tots which were awesome and came with some great sauces, good for dripping on your burger. Food came out super quick and gets dropped at your table. Good for kids, and reasonably priced for Vegas strip. I'm coming back to try the chix and waffles because if the burger is that good, gotta try the main event next.

9zlowt9pKspNvDjH0Q55Pg.text: First time here i got the kitchen chicken sandwich and i was skeptical because chicken at restaurants is never fried hard enough for me BUT THIS CHICKEN SANDWICH IS DOUBLE FRIED TO PERFECTION!!!!!!!!!!!! I got the kicken chicken sandwich and my husband got the holy chicken and both were amazing! The line was out the door but it moved fast and our food came out fast! So good i can't wait to come back to Vegas to get more

NSnhEFOa6qK34VGsfX2Meg.text: Well we bumped into this place because we were being indecisive of where to eat.  Overall had a good experience, but it is quite pricey though as we spent $35 dollars on just a salad, nacho fries and their special chicken sandwich.  It does get busy during lunch as we waited 20 minutes for our food.  The chicken was not too dry and crispy considering for white meat.  But if you prefer dark meat, I am not so sure if this place offers it or not.  The salad was good as you got a lot of salad though and enough chicken with bacon and avocado.  Oh yes, I love the nacho queso cheese it was quite good too and very filling. I would go back again.

CqoHLFbSrAZTFrRfU-wbLw.text: Some food I tried:  1. Killer chicken waffle sandwich: amazing amazing amazing! Crispy chicken tender came wrapped in an unsweetened waffle.  2. Bucket chicken: it's not so great but I love the fact that I can just peel off the fried skins and eat the meat. (I'm kinda into fitness and trying to watch what I eat) I really like their sweet custard sauce 3. Fried pickles: hmmmm, not a great idea. I only like pickles inside.  4. Root beer: we got it in a weird and funny way because I said "for here" and the waiter thought I said "root beer". I usually do not order drinks and just drink water. I will probably try their milkshake.   5. Bacon & cheese waffle: I like this one. This is a sweet waffle buried with bacon and cheese in it.

i_1SeXGKB-P2qsFXuw46XA.text: As a California native and a long-time regular at both the original Bruxie in Orange and Bruxie in Irvine, I've come to be familiar with their food, because honestly, it's quite good. But as Ellen L. mentioned yesterday, this location seems to be lacking the consistency that the California Bruxie's have.   A nearby restaurant had a considerably long line, so we decided to eat at Bruxie, having noticed earlier that there was no line at this location. The ambiance of the restaurant is much like the other locations, and that is important in capturing the essence of the original location, which was and is a small shack on an intersection in Orange. I decided to order the Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar; something I've come to love and is one of my two favorite waffles at Bruxie. In addition to that, I ordered the seasonal Eggnog Shake, just for kicks. The whole ordering process was pretty smooth, except I was expecting them to ask whether I wanted the Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar with a light spread of mayo but she didn't ask.   The food came out quickly; drinks first, followed by all of the entrees shortly thereafter. When I bit into the BEC, it didn't taste right and seemed to be missing a bit of flavor. It didn't take me long to realize they didn't put mayo in it. Now this was easily remedied by asking for some mayo from the staff and it did taste good afterwards, but the issue again comes down to consistency.   I have been, am, and will be a fan of Bruxie, but I think this location needs to step it up. Overall, the staff was nice and the food for the most part was good; if not for a seemingly regular pattern of mistakes and oversights, I'd definitely be comfortable with a 4 star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar; one of my favorites!
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Creme Brulee waffle, great for dessert!

VRqf7yjIyYlDUGAHWFUBpQ.text: I find the waffle is too thin for a sandwich, it could be better. But the chicken was tasty and definitely one of the better price to eat in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w6ySIA0ejQBLoaRH7TgvTw.text: Got the breakfast sandwich that was so good.  They had a good selection of breakfast foods for the kids. My wife got the chicken sandwich and said it was excellent. Mine had the egg on top and that the Fried Chicken was so moist between the waffles.

onR8Ct_xX4q5IcmR2OJ0sg.text: Bruxie is the perfect lunch destination. They took a piece of crispy fried chicken and mixed it with lettuce, tomatoes and pickles.... then sandwiched in between two tasty waffles and the result was absolutely delicious!     I truly wish I had more time to come back here and eat here again. The sandwich was top notch, the fries were perfectly cooked and the service was good. A must if you are on the LV strip,

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UKw-wfbOKbdiKaGPJCHldA.text: This is a fantastic place if you want a good, filling, and not expensive breakfast. Located near New York New York, if you are staying in the middle of the strip it's a little bit of a walk, but it truly is worth it.   It's a walk up and order place, and then they bring you your food when it's ready. There is a lot of seating inside but they also have outside tables everywhere, which is really nice when it's a beautiful day.   I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheddar breakfast sandwich. It, of course, came on a waffle and there was plenty of melted cheese on it, but what really made this so delicious , was the bacon ! I Love bacon and I find it very hard to get really good bacon out at restaurants and this bacon I could not get enough of. I was so happy with the sandwich choice, I wasn't sure if i was going to be sad not getting one with chicken , but it was delicious  and I was so full at the end. Will definitely order again.  My boyfriend got the Holy Chicken which looked just gorgeous.  It was a waffle with friend chicken and an over easy egg on top! Also is topped off with some type of spicy sauce. We made it a combo and it comes with a drink and waffle fries, which were tasty also. He loved his chicken and waffles !  Little detail that I love at this place is they have pitchers of ice water sitting out (where the napkins and utensils are). So you are able to get as much water as you need, which I appreciate this so much.   I have already told people about this great breakfast place, and we certainly will be back whenever we visit Vegas again !

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Chicken combo with waffle fries
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar Breakfast Sandwich - Get this out of all the breakfast sandwich choices, the bacon is to die for! and super cheesy

gJE6vNZhxP-gH2HlpLom1g.text: Waffles are so good..any combo with chicken or the regular breakfast is a hit! First time there and it hit the spot!!! Definitely worth the hype

Qiyq5Pc66lb-rhbFiAkjoA.text: There's two types of fried chicken...original which is sweet in taste and the kicking chicken which is spicy. I ordered the latter with waffles...the fluffy belgian one (or half of one) with pieces of bacon in it. I liked the kick of the chicken and it was crispy yet not dry. The thigh was actually quite juicy. I'm not a syrup person, but the syrup was light so i even enjoyed that. Bonus, had a nice piece of bacon in my waffle to chew on.   The bf had the chicken waffle sandwich with the original chicken flavor. The waffle was a thinner (think Eggo but larger) crispy waffle. He liked it. After taking a bite of his, i decided i like my choice better though.

3i6BTNcyUhK-1laqe14IhA.text: Located right beside the shake shack.   Tried the original chicken and waffle sandwich. Fast, friendly service, very crispy batter, moist chicken. Good amount of syrup and balanced with slaw. Definitely worth a try!  Only con is limited seating.

vYg9s-XmAZuqd93QXs0glg.text: Living in Northern California I never heard of Bruxie before, didn't realize it was a So Cal chain. But being hungry sometime between 11 and noon, and craving brunch during the week, we settled for the next best thing.   Side note thought - why doesn't Vegas have brunch every day, it's not like anyone can tell the difference between weekday and weekend when over indulging in Vegas. But I digress...   This place was busy AF, but the lines moved fast. They couldn't refill the silverware fast enough. Ordered the Holy Chicken and it was amazing! Just the right level of heat. The chicken was crispy and juicy. And the waffle was great. Then with the runny yolk (I love runny yolks!) every bite was just about perfect. Couldn't finish it, it was huge. Didn't order sides because we didn't need one, but next time I might split one sandwich and a side of fried pickles.   Too many people left messy tables, which annoyed me - and they were so busy they were left that way until the next people who wanted that table did it for them. Don't be an ass - it's pretty easy to tell you're in a place where you bus your table yourself. The garbage cans with a place to put the tray is a huge give away.   It was great, we'll be back, but will try to avoid peak times.

vztm4E7MI9TgPw0HgSp_yQ.text: We were killing time around T-Mobile killing time before an event and decided we better grab a bite since we weren't sure if our event was going to have any food offerings. We walked by and our gluttony kicked in. We rubbed our eyes to make sure it wasn't a mirage. Could it be True? A chicken and waffle sandwich? We decided we had to at least try! We decided to split the B.A.M.F. which is fried chicken, bacon, mac and cheese, pepporcinis with buffalo sauce on a fresh waffle. I think whoever came up with this had probably just left a dispensary! Well... it seemed like a good idea in theory but the flavors just weren't balanced. It was salt in salt on salt. The reason why chicken and waffles are generally so tasty is because of that sweet savory contrast. The pepporcinis gave a little punch of acidity but just not enough to cut through all that salty richness. Perhaps we just didn't order well. I would try it again and order something different if the occasion arises out of convenience but I won't specifically try to seek it out again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KPT6O9J6BTD7AAlpLD6QNQ.text: YUM!!! I was craving chicken and waffles, and this place hit the spot. I visited on a weekday, so there wasn't really a line, but in reviews I've read, it looks like the wait can get pretty long on the weekends. I decided to get the original, which was a waffle sandwich with chicken and coleslaw. The waffle is unreal. It's light, airy, buttery, and sweet all at the same time. I really liked that the waffle part was light, because the middle is dense. The chicken was a little spicy, with a hint of sweet, and was perfectly balanced with the waffle and the coleslaw. I ate every single bit of this sandwich, and if I lived in Vegas, I would visit more often.   Definitely recommend if you haven't yet had a waffle sandwich or have a craving for chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original

9taPZTpBC7Ph84aGMGHoGQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!! It's reviewed highly overall by everyone else on Yelp, so if that doesn't confirm it's greatness, I don't know what does! They're chicken is so well fried. It's incredibly crispy and one piece has A LOT of meat in it. The waffles are just as amazing. They're crunchy in just the right places, and soft in the others. The combinations of these two ingredients are so well thought of with all of the items on their menu, there isn't one that will leave you with regret. I also tried a sweet waffle this time and it was just as good as I thought it would be. We tried the creme brulee waffle and the whole things just melts in your mouth. As for their signature chicken and waffle combos, it has the perfect balance between sweet and savory.   I HIGHLY recommend eating here at least once during your time at Vegas, cause you will never regret it and it's so worth the price!! I for sure will crave this place until my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée waffle, The Original Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle, and Classic Crispy Chicken Tenders

3lPF5ghwHDlsQwl3TFru8w.text: Love this place! They put my favorite a waffle as a  wrap for sandwiches! Ughhhh so good. The liege waffle is a super must get for waffle lovers. I'm vegetarian so I got the mushroom and sundries tomatoe waffle sandwich without the goat cheese though it was amazing and my bf got the crispy chicken sandwich and he ate the whole thing so you can only imagine lol. The seating is spacious and well air conditioned. I highly recommend this place if you are staying at New York New York or if you happen to walk by

Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken salad

OMlsr7pyoh4v2tUND_QKLQ.text: This restaurant is great for a quick bite or sit-down, whichever is your preference. For me, I was in a hurry (and I really wanted to try the chicken and waffles here), so ordering to-go was the best option.   The fried chicken is sandwiched between a waffle with cole slaw on the side. They have a house syrup sauce that tastes incredible. I recommend adding the syrup and cole slaw into the "sandwich" to experience max flavors. The chicken was super crispy -- they way they should be! Overall, decent prices, quick, and delicious.

3ss6HXWvxyUe6n3OFfxxDg.text: Bomb.com lol best place we had in Vegas! Fast service Great Food! Love love love! Coming back soon!

SXzsAdmSz2UwMaFCcpAOGQ.text: This place is sooo yum! Loved the bruxerita, the nacho fries and their waffle sandwiches. Service is fast and curtious. Be ready to eat. Their fruit cups looked fresh and tasty.  The fried chicken was crisp and juicy and we'll spiced with a slight sweetness.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequila - Bruxerita

Q4bQMTWA6tTVDhJ-YXqViA.text: This place is one of the best treats on the strip. I love it for two reasons. It is one of the most reasonably priced places on the strip.  While it's still expensiveTheir food is also delicious. I've had both the sandwiches and the strips and while I prefer the strips they are both good. The fries are also on point. I would eat them more often than Chick-fil-A if I could, which says a lot.  I wish there were more locations throughout Vegas.

3emZew1XukwgwuYk9L0PVA.text: We really didn't know what to expect when we came in the restaurant but we had Bruxie on our list of places to eat at on our vacation. LOVE EVERYTHING! The chicken was definitely my favorite and next is their orange soda. We're heading to LA today and I'll definitely go and dine at their branch down there.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ssJIWUR6BF6c-GfWElUubA.text: Looking for brunch on a budget?  Try this place.    This place is located at The Park and is next door to the New York, New York hotel & casino.   Was looking for breakfast and ran into this place.  The chicken & waffle w the egg on top hit the spot (I held back on the sriracha sauce). Oh and did I mention there was also bacon & cheese?!  It was delicious.  Got the combo which included waffle fries (must say they're better than Chick-fil-A fries) & unlimited refills on either soft drink, lemonade or tea.   I loved their strawberry lemonade (free refills!).   They also had great music! #80s #90s  Ask for some syrup on the side to soak it up w the waffle you'll have left.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5DHtkCD1-CtIjY83VqIx6A.text: Came here after reading raving reviews, only to be semi-satisifed with the meal. Although the service was quick, the food seemed to be put together haphazardly, and it was pretty difficult to eat.   We ordered the Waffle Sandwich and Crispy Chicken tenders, and the waffle on both were pretty thin and lackluster. The chicken was pretty flavorful and tender, but my excitement to eat at this place resided in the combination of both, not both independently.   The tables were also not that clean and the floor was extremely sticky (likely from syrup). For the price point, I'd probably eat somewhere else next time!

fnED3_hY9u0goI5NI9N0pQ.text: Solid 4 stars. Good but it seems to be lacking the excitement from the original Bruxie I used to go to in Orange California when the owner used to be in the kitchen making the waffles.  but still good food but on the strip it's pretty pricey $36 and change for 2 combos and the waffle fries were awesome and the staff was all nice and helpful which we appreciate. They were very busy as there was a hockey game at T-Mobile arena that evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Bruxie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
